Blood sugar control in individuals with type 2 diabetes It is taken orally, with or without food, as directed by the healthcare professional. Linagliptin is a DPP-4 inhibitor that works by increasing the levels of incretin hormones in the body. These hormones help stimulate the release of insulin from the pancreas and reduce the production of glucose by the liver, leading to lower blood sugar levels. If you miss a dose of Linagliptin, take it as soon as you remember, unless it is close to the time of your next scheduled dose. In that case, skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to catch up. It's generally best to avoid excessive alcohol consumption when taking diabetes medications, including Linagliptin, as it can affect blood sugar levels. Linagliptin is associated with a low risk of hypoglycemia when used alone. However, if taken in combination with other medications that can cause hypoglycemia (such as insulin or sulfonylureas), the risk of low blood sugar may increase. Linagliptin is specifically indicated for the management of type 2 diabetes mellitus. It is not suitable for the treatment of type 1 diabetes, which typically requires insulin therapy. Weight gain is not a common side effect of Linagliptin. In fact, some individuals may experience slight weight loss due to improved blood sugar control. However, the effect on weight may vary among individuals. Linagliptin can be taken at any time of the day, with or without food. It does not need to be taken with meals.

Sustanon 250 mg is a blend of four different testosterone esters: testosterone propionate, testosterone phenylpropionate, testosterone isocaproate, and testosterone decanoate. Each of these esters has a different half-life, which determines how long the testosterone stays active in the body. Once Sustanon 250 mg is injected, the testosterone esters are slowly released into the bloodstream. Once in the bloodstream, the testosterone binds to androgen receptors in various tissues throughout the body. This binding triggers a number of cellular changes, including protein synthesis, which leads to an increase in muscle mass and strength. Testosterone also plays a role in red blood cell production, bone density, and sex drive. In men with low testosterone levels, Sustanon 250 mg can help restore normal testosterone levels and improve symptoms associated with low testosterone, such as decreased libido, erectile dysfunction, fatigue, loss of muscle mass and strength, and depression. In non-medical use, Sustanon 250 mg is often used for performance enhancement in bodybuilding and athletics. It is believed to increase muscle mass, strength, and endurance, and to enhance athletic performance. "E-CON Pills, also known as  Emergency contraceptive pills or birth control pills, are oral medications used to prevent pregnancy. These pills contain synthetic versions of estrogen and/or progestin hormones, which work together to inhibit ovulation, thicken cervical mucus to impede sperm movement, and thin the uterine lining to discourage implantation. It's important to note that contraceptive pills do not offer protection against sexually transmitted infections (STIs) and should be used under the guidance of a healthcare professional."

Duphaston 10mg Tablet is used to treat female infertility, various menstrual problems including painful, or irregular periods, Premenstrual syndrome (PMS) and endometriosis. It helps to restart periods that have stopped before the menopause and to prevent unusually heavy period. Duphaston 10mg is a medication that contains the active ingredient dydrogesterone. Dydrogesterone is a synthetic progestogen, which means it has similar effects to the hormone progesterone. Here is some information about Duphaston and its uses: Indications: Duphaston is primarily prescribed in women's health to address various hormonal imbalances and conditions. It is commonly used for the following: Menstrual disorders: Duphaston can help regulate irregular menstrual cycles, including conditions such as dysmenorrhea (painful periods), oligomenorrhea (infrequent periods), and irregular menstrual bleeding. Threatened or recurrent miscarriage: Duphaston may be prescribed to support the early stages of pregnancy and reduce the risk of miscarriage in women with a history of recurrent miscarriages or certain hormonal imbalances. Endometriosis: Duphaston can be used as part of the management of endometriosis, a condition in which the tissue that normally lines the uterus grows outside the uterus, leading to pain and fertility issues. Assisted reproductive techniques: In some cases, Duphaston may be used as part of fertility treatment or in assisted reproductive techniques, such as in vitro fertilization (IVF), to support the uterus and hormonal balance. Other conditions: Duphaston may also be prescribed in certain cases of premenstrual syndrome (PMS), premenstrual dysphoric disorder (PMDD), and as part of hormone replacement therapy (HRT) in postmenopausal women. Mechanism of action: Dydrogesterone in Duphaston acts similarly to progesterone, providing progestogenic activity in the body. It helps prepare the lining of the uterus for implantation and supports the maintenance of pregnancy when needed. It has selective effects on the endometrium (lining of the uterus) and does not exert androgenic, estrogenic, or corticoid activity. Dosage: The dosage of Duphaston can vary depending on the specific condition being treated and the guidance of your healthcare professional. It is typically taken orally in the form of tablets. Always follow the instructions provided by your healthcare professional and do not exceed the prescribed dosage. Side effects: Common side effects of Duphaston may include mild gastrointestinal disturbances (such as nausea, vomiting, and abdominal discomfort), headache, breast tenderness, and changes in menstrual bleeding pattern. Serious side effects are rare but may include allergic reactions or signs of liver dysfunction. If you experience any concerning side effects, it's important to seek medical attention. In general, if it is close to the time of your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for the missed one. : Yes, it's important to use Duphaston under medical supervision and follow your healthcare professional's guidance. Inform your healthcare professional about your medical history, pregnancy or breastfeeding status, and any ongoing medications. Attend regular check-ups and be aware of potential side effects. Always store Duphaston as directed and seek immediate medical attention for any severe or persistent side effects.
Side Effects: Menstrual disorders: Duphaston can help regulate irregular menstrual cycles, including conditions such as dysmenorrhea (painful periods), oligomenorrhea (infrequent periods), and irregular menstrual bleeding. | Threatened or recurrent miscarriage: Duphaston may be prescribed to support the early stages of pregnancy and reduce the risk of miscarriage in women with a history of recurrent miscarriages or certain hormonal imbalances. | Endometriosis: Duphaston can be used as part of the management of endometriosis, a condition in which the tissue that normally lines the uterus grows outside the uterus, leading to pain and fertility issues. | Assisted reproductive techniques: In some cases, Duphaston may be used as part of fertility treatment or in assisted reproductive techniques, such as in vitro fertilization (IVF), to support the uterus and hormonal balance. | Other conditions: Duphaston may also be prescribed in certain cases of premenstrual syndrome (PMS), premenstrual dysphoric disorder (PMDD), and as part of hormone replacement therapy (HRT) in postmenopausal women. |

Uses: Duoluton L is a type of hormonal contraceptive pill that contains two active ingredients: ethinyl estradiol and levonorgestrel. It is used for birth control and may also be used to regulate menstrual cycles and treat conditions such as endometriosis and polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS). Ethinyl estradiol is a synthetic form of the hormone estrogen, while levonorgestrel is a synthetic form of the hormone progesterone. These hormones work together to prevent ovulation and thicken cervical mucus to make it harder for sperm to reach the uterus. Duoluton L should be taken at the same time every day for 21 days, followed by a 7-day break during which a withdrawal bleed typically occurs. It is important to start the next pack on time, even if you are still bleeding. Like all medications, Duoluton L may cause side effects, including headaches, nausea, breast tenderness, weight changes, mood changes, and changes in menstrual bleeding. It is important to discuss any potential risks or concerns with your healthcare provider before starting Duoluton L.

Composition :  Danazol (50mg)  DANOGEN 50MG CAPSULE contains Danazol which belongs to the group of medicines called Androgens. It is used to treat endometriosis, severe cyclical mastalgia (breast pain associated with hormonal variations), breast cysts, dysfunctional uterine bleeding (bleeding from vagina other than that of menstrual cycle), symptomatic gynecomastia, preoperative thinning of endometrium and hereditary angioneurotic edema (painless swelling under the skin). Danogen 50 Capsule can be taken with or without food, but take it at the same time to get the most benefit. It should be taken as your doctor's advice. The dose and how often you take it depends on what you are taking it for. Your doctor will decide how much you need to improve your symptoms. Swallow the tablets whole with a glass of water. You should take this medicine for as long as it is prescribed for you.

IVER DT (Ivermectin) It is an antiparasitic medication used to treat various parasitic infections in humans, including certain types of roundworm, threadworm, and other conditions like scabies and head lice infestations. Ivermectin is effective against a range of parasitic infections caused by nematodes (roundworms) and arthropods (insects and mites). It is commonly used to treat infections such as: Onchocerciasis (river blindness): A parasitic infection caused by the nematode Onchocerca volvulus, which is transmitted through the bites of black flies. Strongyloidiasis: An intestinal infection caused by the nematode Strongyloides stercoralis. Threadworm infection: Ivermectin can be used to treat threadworm infections caused by Strongyloides stercoralis and other nematodes. Scabies: A skin infestation caused by the Sarcoptes scabiei mite. Head lice infestation: Ivermectin can be used as a topical treatment for head lice. Common side effects of Ivermectin may include dizziness, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, abdominal pain, and itching. Serious side effects are rare but may include allergic reactions. If you experience any unusual or severe side effects, seek medical attention immediately. Take Ivermectin with a full glass of water and dissolve the tablet. Take it as directed to ensure proper absorption and effectiveness. Ivermectin works by paralyzing and killing the parasites or worms, preventing them from reproducing and causing harm to the host. Alcohol consumption should be avoided or limited during treatment with Ivermectin, as it may increase the risk of certain side effects. Pregnant and breastfeeding women should consult their healthcare provider before using Ivermectin to assess potential risks and benefits. The use of Ivermectin in children should be determined by a qualified healthcare professional, taking into account the child's weight, age, and medical history. Ivermectin is generally considered safe when used as prescribed and under the guidance of a healthcare professional. However, like all medications, it may have side effects or interactions with other drugs. It is crucial to discuss your medical history and any other medications you are taking with your doctor before starting Ivermectin.
Side Effects: Onchocerciasis (river blindness): A parasitic infection caused by the nematode Onchocerca volvulus, which is transmitted through the bites of black flies. | Strongyloidiasis: An intestinal infection caused by the nematode Strongyloides stercoralis. | Threadworm infection: Ivermectin can be used to treat threadworm infections caused by Strongyloides stercoralis and other nematodes. | Scabies: A skin infestation caused by the Sarcoptes scabiei mite. | Head lice infestation: Ivermectin can be used as a topical treatment for head lice. |

Uses: Itac 100mg belongs to a group of antifungal class that is used in to treat infections caused by fungus. It includes mouth, throat, vagina, and other parts of the body like fingernails and toenails. This medicine works by inhibiting the growth of fungus present in the cell membrane. The dose and duration of medication should be taken as prescribed by doctor.  Take ITAC 100MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of ITAC 100MG CAPSULE for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. ITAC 100MG CAPSULE works by preventing the fungal growth by blocking the production of enzymes responsible for the growth of fungal cell. This inhibition results in breakage of cell membranes and fungal cell abnormalities, finally leading to alterations in membrane-based activity of fungus. These leads to fungal cell death and prevention of further fungal growth.  If you miss a dose of Itac 100 Capsule, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. ITAC 100MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women unless advised by the doctor. You should use contraception to make sure that you do not become pregnant during treatment with this medicine. Consult your doctor before taking ITAC 100MG CAPSULE. ITAC 100MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast-feeding women as small amount of this medicine passes into breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking ITAC 100MG CAPSULE. Consumption of alcohol is not recommended during treatment with ITAC 100MG CAPSULE. The most common side effect of ITAC 100MG CAPSULE is stomach pain. To manage this effect, try to rest and relax. Eat and drink slowly or try to have smaller meals more frequently. Keep a heat pad on your stomach. If the symptom does not improve, consult your doctor. ITAC 100MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in children less than 12 years of age. However, your child’s doctor may advise them in special cases. Consult your child’s doctor for advice.
Side Effects: Infections of the mouth or vagina (causing thrush) | Skin infections and infections affecting other parts of the body | Stomach pain, nausea | Headache | Irregular menstrual cycle | Sinusitis, runny nose, coughs, sneezing | Constipation, diarrhoea, flatulence | Vomiting, indigestion |

Uses: Frusemide 40mg tablets are used to treat conditions where excess fluid retention in the body needs to be reduced, such as edema (fluid accumulation) and certain types of hypertension (high blood pressure). Common side effects of Frusemide may include frequent urination, dehydration, dizziness, low blood pressure, and electrolyte imbalances. Take with water as directed by the physician. Frusemide is a loop diuretic that works by blocking the reabsorption of sodium and chloride ions in the kidneys. This action increases the excretion of water and electrolytes through urine, leading to diuresis (increased urine production) and reducing fluid accumulation. Alcohol consumption should be stopped while using this medication, as it can harm kidneys and also dehydrate the body. Don't drive if you feel dizzy or uncoordinated. Frusemide is a diuretic, and excessive fluid loss through increased urination can lead to dehydration. Drink plenty of fluids while taking Frusemide and consult your healthcare provider if you experience signs of dehydration.

-To manage hypertension -To treat edema Common side effects of Frusemide may include frequent urination, dehydration, dizziness, low blood pressure, and electrolyte imbalances. Take it with water as directed by the physician. Frusemide works by blocking the reabsorption of sodium and chloride ions in the kidneys. This action increases the excretion of water and electrolytes through urine, leading to diuresis (increased urine production). As a result, excess fluid in the body is eliminated, reducing edema and helping to lower blood pressure. Alcohol intake may worsen certain side effects of Frusemide, such as dizziness or dehydration. It's best to limit alcohol consumption while using Frusemide. Frusemide is a diuretic, and excessive fluid loss through increased urination can lead to dehydration. Drink plenty of fluids while taking Frusemide and consult your healthcare provider if you experience signs of dehydration. Frusemide can be taken with or without food. However, taking it with food may help reduce stomach upset or discomfort. Do not stop taking Frusemide without consulting your healthcare provider, even if your symptoms improve. Abruptly discontinuing the medication may lead to a rebound effect or worsened fluid retention.

People with type 2 diabetes mellitus are treated with Glucar 50mg Tablets. After meals, it lowers blood sugar levels. It is a member of the class of drugs known as alpha-glucosidase inhibitors. This medication is typically taken along with other diabetes drugs. The first few pieces of the meal should be consumed with or right after taking a Glucar 50mg Tablet. Your doctor will determine the dosage and frequency of administration so that you receive the proper quantity to control your blood sugar levels. It could be gradually raised. Without first consulting your doctor, do not discontinue taking it. If you do, your blood sugar levels might rise and you'd be more likely to get severe side effects including kidney damage or blindness. In the management of type 2 diabetes,When taken alongside other anti-diabetics, the medication Glucar 50mg Tablet helps to regulate high blood glucose (sugar) levels. It functions by delaying the breakdown and absorption of glucose (carbohydrates) in your digestive tract, which lessens the spike in blood sugar levels that occurs right after eating. The chance of developing major consequences of diabetes, such as damage to the kidneys or eyes, nerve issues, and amputation of limbs, is decreased when blood glucose levels are lowered. If you have type 2 diabetes and a history of cardiovascular disease, this medication will also lower your risk of dying from the condition. You will benefit from taking this medication consistently combined with a healthy diet and exercise. Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Glucar 50mg Tablet is to be taken with food.  Glucar 50mg Tablet is an anti-diabetic medicine. It inhibits the intestinal enzymes responsible for breaking complex sugars into simple sugars such as glucose. This prevents blood glucose levels from rising very high immediately after meals. If you miss a dose of Glucar 50mg Tablet, skip it and continue with your normal schedule. Do not double the dose. Q. When should Glucar 50mg Tablet be taken?
Glucar 50mg Tablet should be taken with your meals and should be swallowed whole with water or chewed with the first mouthful of food. The initial dose of Glucar 50mg Tablet is generally twice daily. The dose is then gradually increased to thrice daily. Yes, diarrhea is a common side effect of Glucar 50mg Tablet. However, this does not affect everybody. Any food containing carbohydrates, such as household sugar (cane sugar) can cause diarrhea and severe abdominal pain. If diarrhea persists or becomes severe, then contact your doctor immediately.
Side Effects: Treatment of Type 2 diabetes mellitus | Flatulence | Abdominal pain | Diarrhea |

Uses: Sertraline is an antidepressant medication commonly prescribed to treat a variety of mental health conditions, primarily depression, and anxiety disorders Some individuals may need to pay attention to their diet, especially if they are on a low-sodium diet. Consult your healthcare provider for dietary recommendations if necessary. Yes, Sertraline can interact with other medications, so it's important to inform your healthcare provider about all drugs and supplements you are taking to avoid potential interactions. It may take several weeks of consistent use for Sertraline to reach its full therapeutic effect. Continue taking it as prescribed, even if you don't notice immediate improvement. If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, discuss the use of Sertraline with your healthcare provider. It may not be suitable for all stages of pregnancy or while breastfeeding
Side Effects: Depression | Anxiety Disorders (GAD, social anxiety, panic disorder, OCD) | Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) | Premenstrual Dysphoric Disorder (PMDD) | Treats depression. | Manages various anxiety disorders. | Alleviates symptoms of PTSD. | Relieves severe premenstrual symptoms (PMDD). | Nausea | Diarrhea | Dry Mouth | Insomnia | Sexual Side Effects (e.g., reduced libido) | Nervousness or Restlessness | Dizziness | Headache | Weight Changes | Sweating | Tremor (Shaking) | Upset Stomach | Take Sertraline exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. | Typically taken orally with or without food. | Follow the prescribed dosage and schedule. | Do not stop taking it abruptly without consulting your healthcare provider. | Sertraline is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI). | Increases serotonin levels in the brain, improving mood. | Helps reduce symptoms of depression, anxiety, and related disorders. | If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember (unless it's close to the next scheduled dose). | If it's near the time for your next dose, skip the missed dose. | Do not double up on doses to make up for a missed one. | Consult your healthcare provider if you have concerns about missed doses or dosage adjustments. |

Uses: Composition: Aspirin 75mg CASPY 75 is brand name of Aspirin 75mg. It is an antiplatelet medicine used to treat and prevent heart attacks, strokes, and heart-related chest pain (angina). It helps to prevent the formation of blood clots in your blood vessels. It is a very widely used medicine for heart protection. It is a Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) with anti-platelet action. Common side effects: Swallow the tablet whole by mouth. You can take it with food at a fixed time. Don't crush, chew or break the tablet. Follow the dose and duration as prescribed by the doctor. It works by preventing platelets from sticking together which decreases the formation of harmful blood clots. This lowers the chance of heart attack or stroke.  Don't use this medicine if you have Hypersensitivity to this medicine. Consult with your doctor if you are pregnant or breast feeding woman before taking this medicine to understand the risk and benefit ratio.
Side Effects: Prevention of Angina (heart-related chest pain) | Treatment and prevention of Heart attack and stroke | Gastrointestinal irritation | Nausea | Vomiting | Dyspepsia | Gastritis | Bleeding disorder | Low blood platelets | Gastric erosion | Gastric ulcer. |

Uses: It is used in the treatment of hypertension (high blood pressure) in patients whose blood pressure is not adequately controlled with either Losartan alone or Hydrochlorothiazide alone. Common side effects of Losanorm 50-H may include dizziness, headache, tiredness, and increased urination. The tablets are usually taken orally, with or without food earlier in the day, or as directed by a healthcare professional. Losartan is an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB) that relaxes and widens blood vessels, while Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that reduces fluid volume in the blood vessels. The combined action of these two drugs helps lower blood pressure. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it is almost time for your next scheduled dose. In that case, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. Avoid excessive alcohol consumption, as it may interact with the medication and affect your blood pressure. Don't drive if you feel dizzy or uncoordinated after taking this medication. Do not stop taking the medication or change the dosage without consulting your healthcare provider. High blood pressure often has no symptoms, and stopping the medication abruptly may cause your blood pressure to rise again.

"Biflac" is a brand name that is associated with various probiotic supplements. Probiotics are dietary supplements that contain live beneficial bacteria and/or yeasts, which are intended to support a healthy balance of microorganisms in the gut (intestinal microbiota). These supplements are often used to promote digestive health and may have other potential health benefits. Digestive Health:Probiotics can help maintain a healthy balance of beneficial bacteria in the gut, which may aid in digestion and alleviate symptoms of digestive discomfort, such as bloating, gas, and diarrhea. Prevention of Diarrhea:Probiotics, especially certain strains like Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG and Saccharomyces boulardii, have been studied for their potential to prevent or reduce the severity of diarrhea, including antibiotic-associated diarrhea and traveler's diarrhea. Immune System Support:Some probiotic strains may help support the immune system by promoting the growth of beneficial bacteria in the gut, which can have a positive impact on overall immune function. Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS):Probiotics are sometimes used as a complementary approach for managing symptoms of irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), such as abdominal pain and irregular bowel habits. Constipation:Certain probiotic strains may help regulate bowel movements and relieve constipation in some individuals. Allergies and Atopic Conditions:Some research suggests that early probiotic supplementation may reduce the risk of allergic conditions like eczema and asthma in children. Vaginal Health:Probiotics containing specific strains like Lactobacillus rhamnosus GR-1 and Lactobacillus reuteri RC-14 are sometimes used to support vaginal health and prevent or manage vaginal infections. Mental Health:Emerging research is exploring the potential connection between gut health and mental health. Probiotics may play a role in promoting mental well-being, but more studies are needed in this area. Oral Health:Certain probiotics are being investigated for their potential to promote oral health and reduce the risk of dental issues. 1. Digestive Health:Probiotics can help maintain a balanced and healthy gut microbiota, which may improve overall digestive function and alleviate symptoms such as bloating, gas, and diarrhea. 2. Immune System Support:A well-balanced gut microbiota can contribute to a robust immune system. Probiotics may help support immune function by promoting the growth of beneficial bacteria in the gut. 3. Prevention of Diarrhea:Probiotics, particularly specific strains like Lactobacillus rhamnosus GG and Saccharomyces boulardii, have been studied for their potential to prevent or reduce the severity of diarrhea, including diarrhea associated with antibiotic use or travel. 4. Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS):Some individuals with IBS find relief from symptoms such as abdominal pain and irregular bowel habits when taking probiotics. 5. Vaginal Health:Probiotics containing certain strains like Lactobacillus rhamnosus GR-1 and Lactobacillus reuteri RC-14 may support vaginal health and help prevent or manage vaginal infections. 6. Mental Health:Emerging research suggests a potential connection between gut health and mental well-being. Probiotics may have a role in promoting positive mood and reducing symptoms of anxiety and depression, but more research is needed in this area. 7. Allergies and Atopic Conditions:Probiotic supplementation during pregnancy or infancy may reduce the risk of allergic conditions like eczema and asthma in children. 8. Oral Health:Certain probiotics are being studied for their potential to promote oral health and reduce the risk of dental issues. 9. Overall Well-Being:A balanced gut microbiota may have wide-ranging effects on overall health, and probiotics can play a role in maintaining that balance Probiotics are generally considered safe for most people when taken as directed. However, some individuals may experience mild side effects, which can include: The usage instructions for "Biflac" capsules should be provided on the product label or packaging. It's essential to follow these instructions and any guidance from the manufacturer or your healthcare provider. In general: Balancing Gut Microbiota:The human gastrointestinal tract is home to trillions of microorganisms, including bacteria. These microorganisms play a crucial role in digestion, nutrient absorption, and overall gut health. Probiotics contain strains of beneficial bacteria that can help restore and maintain a balanced gut microbiota. Competing with Harmful Bacteria:Probiotic bacteria compete with harmful or pathogenic bacteria for space and nutrients in the gut. By doing so, they can reduce the overgrowth of harmful bacteria and potentially inhibit their ability to cause infections or digestive disturbances. Supporting Digestive Health:Probiotics may improve overall digestive health by aiding in the breakdown and absorption of nutrients, reducing symptoms of digestive discomfort (such as bloating and gas), and maintaining regular bowel habits. Enhancing Immune Function:A significant portion of the body's immune system resides in the gut. Probiotics can help support the immune system by influencing the gut's immune response and promoting the growth of immune-supportive bacteria. Other Potential Mechanisms:Some probiotic strains may produce bioactive compounds, such as short-chain fatty acids, that can have additional health benefits. Research is ongoing to explore these mechanisms Take the Missed Dose When You Remember:If you realize that you missed a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do Not Double Up:Do not take a double dose to make up for the missed one. Taking more probiotics than recommended will not provide additional benefits and may not be necessary. Maintain Consistency:Consistency in taking probiotics is essential for achieving and maintaining their potential benefits. Try to take "Biflac" at the same time each day. Notify Your Healthcare Provider:If you frequently forget to take your probiotic supplement or have concerns about missed doses, inform your healthcare provider. They can provide guidance on how to manage missed doses and may offer strategies to help you remember your supplements. Follow Your Healthcare Provider's Recommendations:Always follow your healthcare provider's prescribed dosage and schedule for "Biflac" or any probiotic supplement. They can provide personalized recommendations based on your specific health needs Before starting any probiotic supplement, consult with your healthcare provider, especially if you have underlying health conditions, are pregnant, breastfeeding, or taking other medications. They can provide personalized recommendations and ensure that probiotics are suitable for your specific situation.

Uses: Domadol capsules are a form of medication that contains the active ingredient tramadol hydrochloride. Tramadol is a centrally acting opioid analgesic that is primarily used to relieve moderate to moderately severe pain. It works by binding to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord, thereby reducing the sensation of pain. Tramadol capsules are used to relieve moderate to moderately severe pain. Tramadol may cause side effects, including drowsiness, dizziness, constipation, nausea, and headache. Tramadol works by binding to opioid receptors in the brain and spinal cord, reducing the sensation of pain. Consult with a doctor for next dose. Inform your doctor about all other medications, supplements, or herbal products you are taking, as tramadol can interact with certain drugs, including other opioids, sedatives, antidepressants, and medications that affect serotonin levels. Avoid consuming alcohol or using other depressant substances while taking tramadol, as it can increase the risk of drowsiness, respiratory depression, and other side effects. Consult your doctor before using tramadol if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. Tramadol can pass into breast milk and may harm the baby. Tramadol can be habit-forming, and long-term use or misuse of the medication can lead to physical and psychological dependence. It is important to use tramadol exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider and to follow their instructions for gradually reducing the dosage if you need to stop taking it.

You'll probably take this medication for at least six months, if not much longer. For it to be effective, it must be taken often. If your doctor doesn't tell you to stop taking it, don't. To lessen bipolar illness symptoms, you should keep up with your healthy eating and exercise routines. Uses: SUPIROCIN B PLUS OINTMENT is a combination of Beclomethasone and Mupirocin, which belong to the groups of medicines called Anti-inflammatory and Antibiotic, respectively. It is used to treat bacterial skin infections like impetigo. Bacterial skin infections develop when bacteria enter through hair follicles or through small breaks in the skin that result from scrapes, surgery, punctures, sunburn, burns, animal or insect bites, wounds, and preexisting skin disorders. Before using SUPIROCIN B PLUS OINTMENT, inform your doctor if you have psoriasis. SUPIROCIN B PLUS OINTMENT is not recommended for use in pregnant or breastfeeding women. Caution should be taken while using SUPIROCIN B PLUS OINTMENT unless considered necessary. SUPIROCIN B PLUS OINTMENT is not recommended for children under the age of one. The most common side effects of this medicine are application site reactions such as burning, irritation, itching, and redness. Contact your physician if any of the above symptoms worsen.

Supirocin has the active ingredient Mupirocin,an antibiotic used for the local treatment of skin infections and for the prevention of infections at the site of catheter removal or after skin surgery. Mupirocin is an antibiotic produced by Pseudomonas fluorescens and is structurally different from other antibiotics. Supirocin Ointment is an antibiotic that works by stopping the growth of infection-causing bacteria on your skin. It prevents the synthesis of essential proteins necessary for the survival of bacteria. It is effective against skin infections such as boils, impetigo, and infected hair follicles. It may also be used to treat infections in small cuts or wounds on your skin. This treatment has few common side effects and should clear up infections within a few days, but you should keep using it for as long as it is prescribed.
Side Effects: Treatment of Bacterial skin infections | Itching | Burning sensation | Stinging sensation | Pain |

Uses: Scaboma Lotion is an anti-parasite medicine. It is used to treat scabies, a condition where tiny insects infest and irritate your skin. You should apply it on dry and clean skin and do not cover the affected area with clothes. You should not use it if you have an open wound on the skin. If any of these effects bother you then it is better to consult the doctor.

This ointment is formulated to provide relief from muscular aches, pains, or discomfort. Uses: FRUMIL TABLET is a combination of Amiloride and Furosemide which belongs to the group of medicines called Diuretics. It is used in the treatment of extra build-up of water in the body. Symptoms include swollen ankles, feeling more tired than usual and shortness of breath. Take FRUMIL TABLET as advised by your doctor. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. FRUMIL TABLET effectively stops extra build-up of water in the body by acting on different parts of the kidney and promoting water excretion. It inhibits certain system (sodium-potassium-chloride cotransporters) which results in increased excretion of water with some salts. FRUMIL TABLET also has a potassium-sparring effect and reduces the amount of potassium excretion from the body. FRUMIL TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it may pass through the breast milk. Consult your doctor for advice. FRUMIL TAB is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor for advice. FRUMIL TABLET is not recommended for use in patients having severe kidney disease. It should be used with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking FRUMIL TABLET. FRUMIL TABLET should be used with caution in elderly patients (aged 65 years and above) particularly those with dementia or other conditions which may increase the risk of low blood pressure. Consult your doctor before taking FRUMIL TABLET.

Uses: GESICA GEL contains diclofenac as a main component which helps in management of pain and inflammation. Diclofenac gel is a topical medication used to treat pain and inflammation caused by various musculoskeletal conditions. It is commonly used for conditions such as osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, and other forms of arthritis, as well as sprains, strains, and sports injuries. Some individuals may experience skin irritation, itching, or redness at the application site. If you experience any severe or persistent side effects, such as skin rash, blistering, or difficulty breathing, seek medical attention promptly. Diclofenac gel should be applied to clean, dry skin over the affected area. The amount of gel used depends on the size of the painful or swollen area, as well as the specific strength of the gel. Typically, a thin layer of gel is applied and gently massaged into the skin. It is essential to wash hands after applying the gel to avoid inadvertently transferring it to other parts of the body. Diclofenac is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that works by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins, which are chemicals in the body that cause pain and inflammation. When applied topically as a gel, diclofenac is absorbed through the skin and targets the affected area, providing localized pain relief and reducing inflammation. Pregnant or breastfeeding women should consult with their healthcare provider before using diclofenac gel. It is essential to weigh the potential risks and benefits, as some NSAIDs may have certain precautions during pregnancy or lactation. Diclofenac gel can interact with other medications, both topical and oral, so it is essential to inform your healthcare provider about all medications you are using, including over-the-counter drugs and supplements. This information will help avoid potential drug interactions or complications. The frequency of use depends on the specific product and your healthcare provider's instructions. Generally, diclofenac gel is applied two to four times a day, with at least four hours between applications. However, it is important to follow the instructions provided with the product or as directed by your healthcare professional to ensure safe and effective use.

Uses: Rozavel 40 is a medication that contains the active ingredient Rosuvastatin. It is commonly prescribed to lower high cholesterol levels in the blood and reduce the risk of cardiovascular events, such as heart attacks and strokes Lowering LDL Cholesterol: Rosuvastatin is highly effective at reducing low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels in the blood. Lowering LDL cholesterol is crucial for reducing the risk of atherosclerosis (narrowing of the arteries) and related cardiovascular diseases.  Lowering Triglycerides: It can also lower triglyceride levels, which are another type of fat in the blood. Elevated triglyceride levels are associated with an increased risk of heart disease.  Increasing HDL Cholesterol: While its primary effect is on LDL cholesterol, Rosuvastatin may also increase high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, often referred to as "good" cholesterol. Higher HDL levels can have a protective effect on the cardiovascular system.  Cardiovascular Risk Reduction: By effectively reducing LDL cholesterol and managing other lipid levels, Rosuvastatin significantly lowers the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular events in individuals at risk.  Prevention: It is often prescribed as a preventive measure for individuals who have a high risk of cardiovascular disease due to factors such as family history, age, or other medical conditions. Hypertriglyceridemia: In cases of elevated triglyceride levels, Rozavel 40 may be prescribed as part of a treatment plan. Lowering LDL Cholesterol: Rosuvastatin is highly effective at reducing low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol levels in the blood. Lowering LDL cholesterol is essential for reducing the risk of atherosclerosis (narrowing of the arteries) and related cardiovascular diseases.  Reducing Cardiovascular Risk: By lowering LDL cholesterol and improving other lipid profiles, Rozavel 40 significantly reduces the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular events. It is particularly beneficial for individuals with a high risk of heart disease.  Triglyceride Reduction: Rosuvastatin can also lower triglyceride levels, another type of fat in the blood. High triglyceride levels are associated with an increased risk of heart disease, and reducing them can be beneficial for cardiovascular health.  Increasing HDL Cholesterol: While its primary effect is on LDL cholesterol, Rosuvastatin may also increase high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, often referred to as "good" cholesterol. Higher HDL levels are associated with a lower risk of heart disease. Common side effects of Rosuvastatin, including Rozavel 40, may include: Serious side effects are rare but can include: Rozavel 40 is typically taken orally as a tablet, usually once daily, with or without food. Rosuvastatin belongs to a class of medications known as statins. Its primary mechanism of action is to lower cholesterol levels in the blood. Here's how it works: By reducing LDL cholesterol and improving overall lipid profiles, Rosuvastatin helps lower the risk of atherosclerosis and related cardiovascular events such as heart attacks and strokes. If you realize you missed a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Uses: Astat 40mg is a dosage of the medication Atorvastatin. It's used to help manage cholesterol levels in the blood and reduce the risk of cardiovascular events. Here's what you should know about Atorvastatin 40mg: Dosage Strength:"40mg" indicates that each tablet or dose of Atorvastatin contains 40 milligrams of the active ingredient. Cholesterol Management:Atorvastatin 40mg is often prescribed for individuals with higher cholesterol levels or those at increased risk of cardiovascular diseases. Benefits: Cholesterol Reduction:Atorvastatin 40mg effectively lowers LDL cholesterol levels, which helps reduce the risk of cholesterol-related heart diseases. Cardiovascular Risk Reduction:By lowering LDL cholesterol levels, Atorvastatin helps lower the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular events. Atherosclerosis Prevention:Lowering cholesterol buildup in arteries helps prevent atherosclerosis and related complications. How to Use Astat 40mg: Prescription Instructions:Take Atorvastatin 40mg exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. Do not change the dosage without consulting your doctor. Timing:Atorvastatin 40mg is usually taken once daily. Your healthcare provider will specify the best time for you, which may be in the evening. Food:Atorvastatin 40mg can be taken with or without food. Avoid consuming large amounts of grapefruit or grapefruit juice. Consistency:Take it at the same time each day for consistent levels in your bloodstream. Compliance:If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it's close to the time for your next dose. Never double up on doses. Lifestyle Changes:Continue healthy lifestyle habits, including a balanced diet, exercise, and not smoking. These complement the benefits of Atorvastatin. Follow-Up:Attend all scheduled follow-up appointments with your healthcare provider for cholesterol level monitoring and health assessment. Side Effects:Be aware of potential side effects. Report any unusual symptoms to your healthcare provider. Some side effects, like muscle pain or weakness, should be reported immediately. Interaction with Other Medications:Inform your healthcare provider about all medications, supplements, and over-the-counter drugs you're taking. Pregnancy and Breastfeeding:Discuss the use of Atorvastatin with your healthcare provider if you're pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. 1. Lowering Cholesterol:Atorvastatin 40mg is primarily prescribed to lower cholesterol levels in the blood, particularly low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, which is commonly known as "bad" cholesterol. 2. Cardiovascular Disease Prevention:By reducing LDL cholesterol levels, Atorvastatin helps lower the risk of cardiovascular events such as heart attacks, strokes, and other complications related to high cholesterol. 3. Atherosclerosis Prevention:Atorvastatin 40mg helps prevent the buildup of cholesterol plaque in arteries, which can lead to atherosclerosis, a condition that narrows and hardens the arteries, increasing the risk of heart disease. 4. Hyperlipidemia Management:Hyperlipidemia refers to high levels of lipids (fats) in the blood, including cholesterol and triglycerides. Atorvastatin is used to manage this condition by reducing cholesterol levels. 5. Coronary Artery Disease (CAD):People with CAD, a condition where the coronary arteries are narrowed or blocked, can benefit from Atorvastatin to manage their cholesterol levels and reduce the risk of complications. 6. Stroke Prevention:Atorvastatin may be prescribed to reduce the risk of strokes, especially in individuals at higher risk due to factors like hypertension and previous cardiovascular events. 7. Diabetes Management:Some individuals with diabetes are prescribed Atorvastatin to manage their cholesterol levels and lower cardiovascular risk. 8. Familial Hypercholesterolemia:This genetic condition leads to extremely high cholesterol levels. Atorvastatin can help manage cholesterol levels in individuals with this condition. 9. Preventive Measure:Atorvastatin may be prescribed as a preventive measure for those at risk of developing cardiovascular diseases due to high cholesterol levels, hypertension, or other risk factors. Benefits of Atorvastatin 40mg: Cholesterol Reduction:Atorvastatin effectively lowers LDL cholesterol levels in the blood, which is a major contributor to atherosclerosis and cardiovascular diseases. Cardiovascular Risk Reduction:Lowering LDL cholesterol with Atorvastatin helps reduce the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular events. Atherosclerosis Prevention:By reducing cholesterol plaque buildup in arteries, Atorvastatin helps prevent atherosclerosis and its associated complications. Potential Anti-Inflammatory Effects:Some research suggests that statins like Atorvastatin might have anti-inflammatory properties, contributing to their cardiovascular benefits. Muscle Pain or Weakness:Some individuals may experience muscle discomfort or weakness. Rarely, this can progress to a condition called rhabdomyolysis. Digestive Issues:Common digestive side effects include constipation, diarrhea, and stomach discomfort. Headache:Headaches can occur as a side effect. Increased Blood Sugar Levels:Atorvastatin may lead to slightly increased blood sugar levels. Liver Enzyme Elevations:In rare cases, Atorvastatin can cause mild elevations in liver enzymes. Regular liver function monitoring is recommended. Memory and Cognitive Effects:Some individuals have reported memory loss or cognitive changes while taking statins. Allergic Reactions:Allergic reactions such as rash, itching, or swelling are rare but possible. Interaction with Other Medications:Atorvastatin can interact with certain medications, including those affecting liver enzymes. Rare Side Effects:Very rarely, serious side effects like myopathy (muscle disease), liver problems, and rhabdomyolysis can occur. Atorvastatin is typically taken once daily. Your healthcare provider will advise you on the best time to take it, which may be in the evening. Atorvastatin is a type of medication known as a statin, which works to lower cholesterol levels by targeting a specific enzyme involved in cholesterol production. Here's how it works: Cholesterol Production Inhibition:Atorvastatin inhibits an enzyme called HMG-CoA reductase in the liver. This enzyme is critical for the production of cholesterol in the body. Cholesterol Decrease:By inhibiting HMG-CoA reductase, Atorvastatin reduces the liver's ability to produce cholesterol. This leads to a decrease in the levels of cholesterol, particularly low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol, in the bloodstream. LDL Receptor Activity:Atorvastatin also increases the activity of LDL receptors on liver cells. These receptors help remove LDL cholesterol from the blood and transport it into the liver for breakdown and removal. Benefits:The combined effects of reducing cholesterol production and increasing LDL receptor activity help lower LDL cholesterol levels, reducing the risk of cholesterol-related heart diseases. Never stop taking any medication without consulting your healthcare provider. They will guide you on when and how to adjust your medication regimen based on your progress. Common side effects can include muscle pain, digestive issues, headache, and mild liver enzyme elevations. Serious side effects are rare but can include severe muscle pain and liver problems. Atorvastatin is generally not recommended during pregnancy or breastfeeding. Consult your healthcare provider for guidance. No, never alter your medication dosage without consulting your healthcare provider. Changes should be made under medical guidance.

Uses: Glocal is used to prevent or treat lowbloodcalciumlevels in people who do not get enoughcalciumfrom their diets. It may be used to treat conditions caused by lowcalciumlevels such asbone loss(osteoporosis), weak bones (osteomalacia/rickets), decreased activity of the parathyroid gland (hypoparathyroidism), and a certain muscle disease (latenttetany).  It may also be used in certain patients to make sure they are getting enough calcium (e.g., women who arepregnant, nursing, or postmenopausal, people taking certainmedicationssuch as phenytoin,phenobarbital, orprednisone). Calciumplays a very important role in the body. It is necessary for normal functioning of nerves, cells, muscle, and bone. If there is not enough calcium in the blood, then the body will take calcium from bones, thereby weakening bones. Having the right amount of calcium is important for building and keeping strong bones.

Uses: Composition:Minocycline (100mg) MINOLOX 100MG TABLET contains Minocycline, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used to treat certain forms of bacterial infections that affect the ears, eyes, throat, nose, and respiratory system (chest infections), gonorrhoea or pelvic, skin infections (acne), urinary tract infections and prostate infections. It also helps in the treatment of meningitis carriers. It is also used in the prevention of infections before and after an operation. Before taking MINOLOX 100MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you have or ever had liver or kidney problems. Avoid consumption of alcohol, milk or milk products while taking MINOLOX 100MG TABLET, as it may lead to unwanted side effects.   Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Minolox 100 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Minolox 100 Tablet is an antibiotic. It stops bacterial growth by preventing synthesis of essential proteins required by bacteria to carry out vital functions. If you miss a dose of Minolox 100 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Caution is advised when consuming alcohol with Minolox 100 Tablet. Please consult your doctor. Minolox 100 Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Minolox 100 Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.

Uses: INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET contains Indapamide which belongs to the group of medicines called Thiazide like diuretics. It is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension). It can also be used alone or in combination with other medicines to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) in adults. Hypertension is a condition in which the force of the blood against the blood vessel wall is too high, resulting in early morning headaches, nosebleeds, irregular heartbeat, changes in vision, and buzzing in the ears. Your doctor may advise to have a test to check how well your parathyroid gland is working and blood tests to check for low sodium or potassium levels or high calcium levels before taking INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET. Take INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew. Your doctor will determine the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET lowers blood pressure by removing the extra water and salt from the body through acting on kidney. It also widens the blood vessel and makes the blood flow easy through blood vessels. This combined effect lowers blood pressure more effectively. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET because it might make you dizzier. Do not drive or operate any machines if you feel dizzy or tired after taking INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET. INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before taking this medicine. Patients taking INDAPA 2.5MG TABLET must inform their doctor about their pre-existing disease conditions like severe liver disease, kidney disease, heart problems, diabetes, gout, muscle weakness and problems in the vision. You can control your blood pressure by making some key lifestyle changes such as quitting smoking, cutting down on alcohol intake, making exercise a regular habit and consuming a healthy diet with less salt intake. Apart from these changes, staying away from stress is also important for maintaining blood pressure.
Side Effects: Used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) | Skin rash | Allergic reactions in the form of skin rashes (especially patients who are more prone to allergic and asthmatic reactions) | Signs of low potassium in blood (constipation, skipped heartbeat feeling, muscle weakness or spasms) | Vomiting | Red pinpoints on skin (purpura) | Signs of low sodium in blood (headache, confusion, irritability, muscle weakness or cramps) | Impotence |

Uses:
Lorvas 2.5mg is a medication that contains the active ingredient called Amlodipine. It is primarily used for the treatment of high blood pressure (hypertension) and certain types of chest pain known as angina. Amlodipine belongs to a class of medications called calcium channel blockers. It works by relaxing and widening the blood vessels, allowing for improved blood flow. By reducing the resistance in the blood vessels, it helps to lower blood pressure and relieve symptoms of angina. Lorvas 2.5mg is available in tablet form and is typically taken orally once daily. The dosage and duration of treatment will be determined by your healthcare professional based on your individual condition and response to the medication. Lorvas 2.5mg (amlodipine) is primarily used for the following purposes: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure): Lorvas 2.5mg is commonly prescribed to treat high blood pressure. It helps relax and widen the blood vessels, making it easier for blood to flow through them. By lowering blood pressure, Lorvas 2.5mg helps reduce the risk of complications associated with high blood pressure, such as heart attacks, strokes, and kidney problems. Angina: Lorvas 2.5mg may also be prescribed for the treatment of certain types of chest pain called angina. It helps improve blood flow to the heart muscles, relieving chest pain and reducing the frequency and severity of angina attacks. It's important to note that Lorvas 2.5mg is a prescription medication, and the specific use and dosage will be determined by your healthcare professional based on your individual condition and medical history. The benefits of using Lorvas 2.5mg (amlodipine) include: Lowering Blood Pressure:Lorvas 2.5mg is effective in reducing high blood pressure. By relaxing and widening the blood vessels, it helps to decrease the resistance against blood flow, making it easier for the heart to pump blood throughout the body. Lowering blood pressure helps to reduce the strain on the heart and blood vessels, reducing the risk of cardiovascular complications. Managing Hypertension: By effectively controlling blood pressure, Lorvas 2.5mg helps to manage hypertension. Maintaining a healthy blood pressure range can reduce the risk of heart disease, stroke, kidney problems, and other associated health conditions. Relieving Angina Symptoms: For individuals with angina, Lorvas 2.5mg can help alleviate chest pain by improving blood flow to the heart muscles. By dilating the coronary arteries and increasing blood supply to the heart, it can reduce the frequency and severity of angina attacks, allowing individuals to engage in physical activities with less discomfort. Cardiovascular Protection:By lowering blood pressure and improving blood flow, Lorvas 2.5mg provides cardiovascular protection. It can help prevent or reduce the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular events in individuals with hypertension or angina. Lorvas 2.5mg (amlodipine) may cause certain side effects. Not everyone experiences these side effects, and their severity can vary among individuals. However, if any side effects persist, become bothersome, or worsen over time, it is important to inform your healthcare professional. Serious but rare side effects may occur with amlodipine. Seek immediate medical attention if you experience any of the following: These serious side effects require immediate medical attention, as they may indicate a potentially serious condition. When using Lorvas 2.5mg (amlodipine), it's important to follow the instructions provided by your healthcare professional. Here are general guidelines for the use of Lorvas 2.5mg: Dosage: Take Lorvas 2.5mg exactly as prescribed by your healthcare professional. The usual starting dose for hypertension is 2.5mg once daily, which can be adjusted based on your blood pressure response. The dosage for angina may vary and will be determined by your healthcare professional. Timing:Take Lorvas 2.5mg at the same time each day to maintain a consistent level of the medication in your body. You can take it with or without food, but try to take it consistently with regard to meals. Swallowing: Take the tablet whole with a glass of water. Do not crush, chew, or break the tablet unless instructed by your healthcare professional. Compliance: It's important to take Lorvas 2.5mg regularly and as prescribed. Do not skip doses or stop taking the medication without consulting your healthcare professional. Even if you feel well, continuing the medication helps to maintain blood pressure control and manage your condition effectively. Missed Dose:If you forget to take a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Do not double up on doses to make up for a missed one. Follow-up Appointments: Attend regular follow-up appointments with your healthcare professional to monitor your blood pressure and assess your response to the medication. They may need to adjust your dosage or make other treatment recommendations based on your progress. Lorvas 2.5mg (amlodipine) belongs to a class of medications called calcium channel blockers. It works by blocking the entry of calcium into the muscle cells of the blood vessels and heart. This leads to relaxation and widening (dilation) of the blood vessels, resulting in improved blood flow and reduced resistance against blood flow. Here's how Lorvas 2.5mg works: Blood Vessels: Amlodipine specifically targets the smooth muscle cells in the walls of the blood vessels. By blocking the influx of calcium into these cells, it prevents the contraction of the blood vessel walls. As a result, the blood vessels relax and widen, allowing blood to flow more easily through them. This action helps to lower blood pressure by reducing the resistance that the heart must pump against. Heart: Amlodipine also affects the heart by reducing the workload and oxygen demand. It dilates the coronary arteries that supply blood to the heart muscles, improving blood flow to the heart. This can help relieve chest pain (angina) and reduce the frequency and severity of angina attacks. By dilating blood vessels and improving blood flow, Lorvas 2.5mg helps lower blood pressure and alleviate the symptoms associated with high blood pressure and angina. If you forget to take a dose of Lorvas 2.5mg (amlodipine), here's what you should do: If you remember within a few hours: Take the missed dose as soon as you remember. If it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. If you remember close to the next dose: Do not double up on doses to make up for the missed one. Simply skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. If you're unsure or have missed multiple doses: Consult your healthcare professional for guidance. They will provide specific instructions based on your situation and advise you on the best course of action. Pregnancy and Breastfeeding: If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, discuss the use of Lorvas 2.5mg with your healthcare professional. They will weigh the potential benefits against any potential risks to determine if the medication is appropriate for you. Driving and Machinery: Lorvas 2.5mg may cause dizziness or drowsiness in some individuals. If you experience these effects, avoid driving or operating machinery until you know how the medication affects you. Emergency Situations: In emergency situations, such as severe allergic reactions or chest pain, seek immediate medical attention or call emergency services. Other Medications and Supplements: Inform your healthcare professional about all medications, including over-the-counter drugs, supplements, and herbal products, that you are taking. Some medications and supplements may interact with Lorvas 2.5mg and affect its effectiveness or increase the risk of side effects. The recommended starting dose for Lorvas 2.5mg is usually 2.5mg once daily. However, the dosage may vary depending on your condition and your healthcare professional's recommendation. GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION contains Gemcitabine which belongs to the group of medicines called Antimetabolites. GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION is used in the treatment of non-small cell lung cancer (alone or combined with cisplatin), pancreatic cancer, breast cancer (with paclitaxel), ovarian cancer (with carboplatin) and bladder cancer (with cisplatin). Cancer is a disease in which there is uncontrollable growth of some of the body’s cells that spread to other parts of the body. During GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION treatment, your doctor might ask you to take certain blood tests to check your blood cell count, kidney function or liver function. Used in the treatment of: GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION will be given to you only by a doctor or a nurse into a vein as an intravenous infusion. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and surface area and disease condition. GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION kills the dividing cancer cells by inhibition of their DNA (hereditary material) synthesis. GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION is not recommended for use in pregnancy. Consult your doctor before receiving it. GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before receiving it. Do not consume alcohol during the treatment with GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION as it can make you feel sleepy. According to some studies, GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION is ototoxic, which means it can cause hearing or balance problems. Consult your doctor if you experience any problems with hearing during this treatment. You usually have GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION as a course of several cycles of treatment. This means that you receive the medicine and then rest to allow your body to recover. Usually, a cycle of GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION is over 3 to 4 weeks (21 to 28 days), but your doctor will determine the duration of treatment according to your condition. Before receiving GEMCITE 1000MG INJECTION, inform your doctor if you recently got vaccinated as it can affect the number of blood cells that are tested during this treatment. Consult your doctor for advice.

Lamivir 150 Tablet is not a cure for HIV or AIDS and only helps to decrease the amount of HIV in your body. This helps to lower your risk of getting HIV-related complications and improves your lifespan. It is prescribed in combination with other HIV medicines. Your doctor will recommend the best medicines for you and will decide the doses that you need. Follow carefully the instructions for all the medicines that you are given. It can be taken with or without food. Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Lamivir 150 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. LAMIVIR 150MG TABLET inhibits the activity of enzyme (HIV-1 reverse transcriptase) which is responsible for virus replication. Thus, it helps to prevent HIV from replication in the body. If you miss a dose of Lamivir 150 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Caution is advised when consuming alcohol with Lamivir 150 Tablet. Please consult your doctor. LAMIVIR 150MG TABLET is not recommended for use in pregnant women unless it is considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before taking it. Women who are HIV-positive must not breast-feed, because HIV infection can be passed on to the baby in breast milk. A small amount of the ingredients in LAMIVIR 150MG TABLET can also pass into your breast milk. Hence, nursing mothers must not breastfeed their infants while taking LAMIVIR 150MG TABLET. Contact your doctor immediately if you’re breast-feeding or thinking about breast-feeding.
Side Effects: To treat HIV infection | Headache | Nausea | Diarrhea | Vomiting | Fatigue | Stomach pain | Rash |

Uses: Composition: Trifluoperazine  + Benzhexol PARKIN PLUS TABLET is a combination of Trifluoperazine and Benzhexol which belongs to the group of medicines called Phenothiazine antipsychotics and Antimuscarinics respectively. PARKIN PLUS TABLET is used to treat symptoms and prevent relapse in schizophrenia (disorder that affects a person's ability to think, feel and behave clearly) and in other psychoses, especially paranoid type which is also used as an adjunct in the short-term management of severe psychomotor agitation and of dangerously impulsive behavior such as mental sub-normality. It is also used for the symptomatic control of all forms of Parkinsonism (disorder of the central nervous system that affects movement) including the postencephalitic arteriosclerotic and idiopathic types which favorably influences rigidity and akinesia in the majority of patients with reduction of salivation.  Schizophrenia Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Parkin-Plus Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. PARKIN PLUS TABLET helps to treat and prevents the symptoms of schizophrenia with symptomatic control of Parkinson’s disease, where trifluoperazine blocks the action of a chemical messenger (dopamine) in the brain that affects thoughts and mood. Benzhexol acts by blocking a certain natural substance (acetylcholine) which helps to reduce muscle stiffness, sweating and the production of saliva thereby improving walking ability in people with Parkinson's disease. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking PARKIN PLUS TABLET since it tends to weaken blood vessels and can raise blood pressure. PARKIN PLUS TABLET is not recommended for use during pregnancy unless it is considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before taking PARKIN PLUS TABLET. PARKIN PLUS TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women unless it is considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before taking PARKIN PLUS TABLET.
Side Effects: Nausea | Constipation | Dryness in mouth | Sedation | Weight gain | Orthostatic hypotension (sudden lowering of blood pressure on standing) | Urinary retention | Increased prolactin level in blood | Dizziness | Blurred vision | Nervousness |

Uses: Oxetol 600 Tablet is prescribed for the management of epilepsy and is effective in both treating and preventing seizures. However, it's important to understand that while the medication can help control seizures, it does not offer a cure for epilepsy. Continuous use of Oxetol 600 Tablet is necessary to maintain seizure prevention. It is essential to follow your doctor's instructions regarding dosage and duration of treatment to effectively manage your epilepsy condition. If you have any concerns or questions about the medication or your epilepsy management, it is advisable to consult with your healthcare provider for personalized guidance. Epilepsy/Seizures Oxetol 600 Tablet is an anticonvulsant medication that helps reduce seizures by decreasing abnormal nerve impulses. By regulating the frequency of seizures, it enables individuals to confidently carry out their daily activities. This medication effectively alleviates symptoms such as confusion, uncontrolled movements, loss of consciousness, and feelings of anxiety or fear that are associated with seizures. It is important to note that Oxetol 600 Tablet does not cause physical or psychological dependence or addiction. However, it is essential to follow the prescribed dosage and not abruptly discontinue the medication. Consistent and regular use is necessary for its effectiveness. Missing doses may increase the risk of experiencing a seizure. HeadacheNauseaVomitingFatigueDizzinessNystagmus (unintentional eye movement)TremorsVertigoDrowsinessVoluntary movement abnormalityAtypical gaitDisturbance of vision Take Oxetol 600 Tablet exactly as prescribed by your doctor. Do not alter the dosage unless instructed to do so.Take the tablet at the same time(s) each day to maintain a consistent level of medication in your body. This helps ensure its effectiveness. Swallow the tablet whole with a glass of water. Do not crush, break, or chew the tablet unless your doctor specifically advises you to do so. You can take Oxetol 600 Tablet with or without food. However, it may be helpful to take it with food if you experience any stomach upset. It's important to take Oxetol 600 Tablet regularly and without skipping doses. Skipping doses can decrease the effectiveness of the medication and increase the risk of seizures. Your doctor may provide specific instructions based on your individual needs. It's essential to follow their guidance and address any concerns or questions you may have. Oxetol 600 Tablet contains the active ingredient oxcarbazepine, which is an anticonvulsant medication. It works by stabilizing the electrical activity in the brain, specifically by blocking voltage-gated sodium channels.By controlling and stabilizing the electrical activity in the brain, Oxetol 600 Tablet helps to prevent or reduce the occurrence of seizures in people with epilepsy. If you remember shortly after the missed dose, you can take it right away. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, it is generally advised to skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Taking a double dose to make up for the missed dose is not recommended, as it can increase the risk of side effects. Consuming alcohol while taking Oxetol 600 Tablet can intensify the drowsiness caused by the medication. Oxetol 600 Tablet can cause side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, blurred vision, and reduced muscle coordination, which may affect your ability to drive safely. If you experience any of these side effects, it is advised to avoid driving until you feel fully alert and capable of operating a vehicle without impairment. Oxetol 600 Tablet is not recommended for use during pregnancy due to limited human studies and potential harmful effects observed in animal studies.  It is essential to consult with your doctor for personalized advice and guidance before taking Oxetol 600 Tablet if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. Oxetol 600 Tablet is not recommended while breastfeeding. Limited data from human studies suggests that the medication can pass into breast milk and potentially harm the baby. It is important to exercise caution and consult with your doctor before taking Oxetol 600 Tablet if you are breastfeeding. Monitoring the baby for signs of excessive sleepiness and weight gain is advised. In patients with kidney disease, it is important to use Oxetol 600 Tablet with caution. Dose adjustment of the medication may be necessary to ensure its safe and effective use. Patients with severe liver disease should exercise caution when using Oxetol 600 Tablet. Dose adjustment of the medication may be necessary in these cases, and it is important to consult with your doctor for guidance. Oxetol 600 Tablet is used for the treatment and prevention of seizures in individuals with epilepsy. It helps in reducing the frequency and severity of seizures. No, Oxetol 600 Tablet does not cure epilepsy. It is a long-term medication that helps in managing and controlling seizures. It needs to be taken regularly as prescribed by a doctor to maintain its effectiveness. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. The use of Oxetol 600 Tablet during pregnancy and breastfeeding should be discussed with a doctor. The potential risks and benefits will be evaluated to determine the appropriate course of action.
