Diana 0.025 cream is a form of vitamin A that is used to treat acne which appears as spots or pimples on your face, chest or back. It also helps to smooth rough facial skin and to reduce fine wrinkles on the skin. This cream usually works by reducing the excessive production of oil from the skin. It is used once a day at bedtime or as directed by a doctor. Some of the common side-effects like irritation, dryness, and redness of the skin may occur. Don't forget to apply moisturizer during applying this gel as it causes dryness in the skin. This medicine may make you more sensitive to sunlight so you should limit exposure to the sun if possible.

FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE contains Fluoxetine which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-depressants. It is used to treat major depressive episodes, obsessive-compulsive disorder (mental disorder) and bulimia nervosa (eating disorder). Treats: Take FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your physician will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE without consulting your doctor. FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE works by increasing the levels of serotonin, a chemical messenger in the brain. This improves mood and physical symptoms of depression and relieves symptoms of panic and obsessive disorders. CONSULT with your physician for next dose. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE. Consult your doctor before taking. FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use especially in the last 3 months of pregnancy as it harms the unborn baby. It should be used with caution during late pregnancy or just before giving birth. Consult your doctor before taking FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE. FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE will be excreted through breast milk., hence it should be used with caution if it is clearly necessary. Your doctor will lower the dose accordingly. Consult your doctor before taking FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE. Yes. FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE may cause increased pressure in the eye in patients having glaucoma. Consult your doctor before taking FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE. Yes. FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE should be taken with caution in patients with diabetes as it might fluctuate blood glucose levels. Monitor blood sugar levels frequently. Consult your doctor before taking FAXTIN 10MG CAPSULE.
Side Effects: Major depressive episodes | Obsessive-compulsive disorder (mental disorder) | Bulimia nervosa (eating disorder) | Insomnia | Headache | Diarrhea | Nausea | Fatigue | Not feeling hungry, weight loss | Nervousness, anxiety | Poor concentration | Sleepiness, unusual dreams, tiredness | Dizziness | Change in taste | Uncontrollable shaking movements | Blurred vision | Rapid and irregular heartbeat sensation | Flushing | Yawning |

Uses: EPTOIN INJECTION contains phenytoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-epileptic drugs. It is used to treat certain forms of epilepsy (fits or seizures) like grand mal fits, status epilepticus (seizures continue for hours or days) and to prevent fits during or after neurosurgery. EPTOIN INJECTION is used to: EPTOIN INJECTION will be given to you only by a doctor or a nurse into a vein as an intravenous infusion. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop receiving EPTOIN INJECTION unless your doctor advises you to stop. EPTOIN INJECTION reduces or prevents fits by controlling the hyperactivity in the brain that can cause epilepsy or fits. EPTOIN INJECTION should be used with caution in pregnant women as it may cause harm to the unborn baby. Women of childbearing capability should use a suitable non-hormonal contraceptive method to avoid getting pregnant while receiving EPTOIN INJECTION. Consult your doctor before receiving it. Inform your doctor if you become pregnant during treatment with EPTOIN INJECTION. Avoid consumption of alcohol while receiving EPTOIN INJECTION because it may reduce the effectiveness of treatment or increase the side effects. EPTOIN INJECTION should be used with caution if the patient has consumed a large amount of alcohol recently or if they drink large amounts of alcohol regularly or if they have alcohol dependence. Consult your doctor before receiving it. EPTOIN INJECTION is not recommended in patients having abnormal heart rhythm and heart block, a slow heartbeat, heart problems that affect your heart rate or Adams-Stokes syndrome (suddenly passing out due to change in your heart rate). EPTOIN INJECTION should be used with caution in patients having low blood pressure, heart failure or heart rhythm problems. Consult your doctor before receiving it. Do not drive or operate any machines if you feel dizzy or drowsy after receiving EPTOIN INJECTION. Patients receiving EPTOIN INJECTION must inform their doctor about pre-existing conditions like kidney, liver, heart problems or diabetes. Patients should also tell if they are pregnant, breastfeeding or allergic to anything. Consult your doctor if you experience anything different. Before taking EPTOIN INJECTION, inform your doctor if you are taking, have taken or might take any other medicine, including prescription, over the counter or any herbal medicine, as these might cause serious side effects by interacting with each other.
Side Effects: Treat grand mal fits and status epilepticus | Prevent fits during or after neurosurgery | Rectify some heart rhythm abnormalities | Nystagmus (rapid involuntary eye movements) | Slurred speech | Impaired or decreased coordination | Sleepiness | Mental confusion |

Uses: JASOCAINE (LIDOCAINE) Lidocaine 2% jelly is a topical anesthetic medication that contains 2% lidocaine as the active ingredient. It is a local anesthetic used to numb the skin or mucous membranes for various medical procedures or to provide temporary pain relief. Lidocaine 2% jelly is used for various medical procedures to reduce pain and discomfort, including the insertion of catheters, endoscopic procedures, wound cleaning, and minor surgical interventions. It may also be used to provide relief from conditions such as mouth ulcers or sore throat. Common side effects may include skin redness, itching, or burning at the application site. Serious side effects are rare but may include severe allergic reactions. If you experience any unusual or severe reactions, seek medical attention immediately. The jelly is typically applied directly to the skin or mucous membranes in the area where the numbing effect is needed. It is usually left on for a short period before the medical procedure or as directed by a healthcare professional. The MOA (Mechanism of Action) of Lidocaine involves its ability to block nerve signals, which leads to local anesthesia and temporary loss of sensation in the area where it is applied. Inform your healthcare provider if you have a history of allergies to medications or local anesthetics. If you experience signs of an allergic reaction, such as rash, itching, swelling, dizziness, or difficulty breathing, seek medical attention immediately. Yes, Lidocaine 2% jelly is commonly used for dental procedures, such as providing local anesthesia for tooth extractions or other minor oral surgeries. Lidocaine 2% jelly can be used in children, but it should be used with caution and under the guidance of a healthcare professional, especially in younger children and infants.

Composition:  Salbutamol (5mg) ASTHALIN RESPIRATORY SOLUTION contains Salbutamol which belongs to the group of medicines called Bronchodilators. It is used to treat severe asthma attacks. It can also be used in the management of chronic bronchospasm (long-term breathing difficulties caused due to narrowing of airways) unresponsive to conventional therapies. Asthalin Respirator Solution is called "reliever" inhalers because they give you quick relief from breathing problems when you need it. In most cases, you will be given another inhaler to prevent your symptoms (a “preventer”) and you should use this regularly every day. Asthalin Respirator Solution works quickly and the effects can last several hours. You can use it at any time of day, but only use it when you notice symptoms, such as coughing, wheezing, shortness of breath, tightness in the chest or you know that you are going to do an activity that can cause breathlessness Common side effects: Use it as advised by your doctor or check the label for directions before use. Asthalin Respirator Solution is a bronchodilator. It works by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widens airways. This makes breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Asthalin Respirator Solution, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. You are recommended not to consume alcohol along with Asthalin Respiratory Solution 15 ml to avoid unpleasant side-effects like drowsiness, dizziness, or sleepiness. Asthalin Respirator Solution may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Asthalin Respirator Solution is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.
Side Effects: Severe asthma attacks | Breathing difficulties (emphysema) | Tachycardia | Tremors | Headache | Palpitations | Increased heart rate | Muscle cramp |

Uses:
Dilzem 30mg is a medication that contains the active ingredient diltiazem. It belongs to a class of drugs known as calcium channel blockers. Dilzem is primarily used to treat certain heart conditions, including: Hypertension (high blood pressure): Dilzem helps to relax and widen the blood vessels, reducing the resistance to blood flow and lowering blood pressure. Angina pectoris: Dilzem can be used to prevent and treat episodes of chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart. It helps to relax and widen the coronary arteries, allowing more blood to reach the heart muscle. Supraventricular tachycardia: Dilzem may be used to control rapid heart rhythms that originate above the ventricles (supraventricular tachycardia). It works by slowing down the electrical signals in the heart and reducing the heart rate. The specific uses and dosage of Dilzem 30mg may vary depending on the individual and the condition being treated. It is important to follow your healthcare provider's instructions and take the medication as prescribed. It's worth noting that Dilzem 30mg is a specific formulation and dosage of diltiazem. The availability of different strengths and formulations may vary by country. If you have been prescribed Dilzem 30mg, it is recommended to consult with your healthcare provider or refer to the medication label for detailed information on its specific use, dosage, and any precautions or potential side effects. Dilzem 30mg (diltiazem) is a medication that is primarily used to treat various cardiovascular conditions. Here are some common uses of Dilzem 30mg: Hypertension (High Blood Pressure): Dilzem 30mg is used to treat high blood pressure. It helps relax and widen the blood vessels, reducing the resistance to blood flow and lowering blood pressure. Angina Pectoris: Dilzem 30mg is prescribed to treat angina pectoris, a condition characterized by chest pain or discomfort caused by reduced blood flow to the heart. It helps relax and widen the coronary arteries, increasing blood flow to the heart muscle and relieving chest pain. Supraventricular Tachycardia: Dilzem 30mg may be used to manage certain abnormal heart rhythms, specifically supraventricular tachycardia. It helps to slow down the electrical signals in the heart and lower the heart rate, restoring a normal rhythm. Heart Rate Control: Dilzem 30mg can be used to control rapid heart rates associated with certain heart conditions, such as atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter. It helps slow down the heart rate and stabilize the heart rhythm. It's important to note that the specific use of Dilzem 30mg may vary depending on individual patient factors and the guidance of the prescribing healthcare provider. The medication should always be taken as prescribed, and any questions or concerns about its use should be discussed with a healthcare professional. They can provide personalized information and guidance based on your specific condition and needs. Dilzem 30mg (diltiazem) provides several benefits in the treatment of cardiovascular conditions. Here are some of the potential benefits: Blood Pressure Control: Dilzem 30mg helps lower high blood pressure (hypertension) by relaxing and widening the blood vessels. By reducing the resistance to blood flow, it helps to normalize blood pressure levels, reducing the strain on the heart and decreasing the risk of complications associated with hypertension, such as heart attack, stroke, and kidney problems. Angina Relief: Dilzem 30mg is effective in managing angina pectoris, a condition characterized by chest pain or discomfort due to reduced blood flow to the heart. By relaxing and widening the coronary arteries, Dilzem improves blood flow to the heart muscle, providing relief from angina symptoms. This can improve exercise tolerance and quality of life for individuals with angina. Heart Rate Management: Dilzem 30mg helps control heart rate in certain heart rhythm disorders like supraventricular tachycardia, atrial fibrillation, or atrial flutter. By slowing down the electrical signals in the heart, Dilzem can help restore a normal heart rhythm and reduce the heart rate to a more optimal range. Prevention of Cardiovascular Events: By controlling blood pressure, Dilzem can help reduce the risk of cardiovascular events such as heart attack and stroke. It also helps to reduce the workload on the heart, improving overall heart function and reducing the risk of complications in individuals with certain heart conditions. It's important to note that the specific benefits of Dilzem 30mg may vary depending on the individual and the cardiovascular condition being treated. The medication's effectiveness and the extent of its benefits will be determined by factors such as the severity of the condition, overall health, and individual response. It's crucial to follow your healthcare provider's guidance and take the medication as prescribed to maximize the potential benefits. Dilzem 30mg (diltiazem) may cause certain side effects in some individuals. While not everyone experiences these side effects, it's important to be aware of potential adverse reactions. Common side effects associated with Dilzem 30mg include: These side effects are usually mild and temporary. However, if they persist or become bothersome, it's recommended to inform your healthcare provider. They can provide guidance on managing these side effects or adjust the medication if necessary. In some cases, Dilzem 30mg may cause more serious side effects. Although less common, these side effects require immediate medical attention: If you experience any of these severe side effects, seek medical assistance right away. It's important to note that this list of side effects is not exhaustive. Other side effects may occur. It's recommended to consult your healthcare provider or refer to the medication leaflet for a complete list of possible side effects associated with Dilzem 30mg. They can provide personalized information and guidance based on your medical history and individual circumstances. Dilzem 30mg (diltiazem) should be taken exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. It's important to follow the instructions provided and not exceed the recommended dosage. Here are some general guidelines for using Dilzem 30mg: Dosage: The recommended dosage and frequency of Dilzem 30mg will be determined by your healthcare provider based on your specific condition and individual needs. Always follow their instructions regarding the dosage and schedule of administration. Timing: Dilzem 30mg is typically taken orally, with or without food. Follow the specific instructions provided by your healthcare provider. It's important to take the medication at the same time(s) each day to maintain consistent levels in your bloodstream. Swallowing: Take the tablet whole with a glass of water. Do not crush, chew, or break the tablet, as it is designed to release the medication slowly over time. Compliance: It's important to take Dilzem 30mg regularly and consistently as prescribed. Do not skip doses or stop taking the medication without consulting your healthcare provider. Even if you start feeling better, continue taking the medication as directed. Interactions: Inform your healthcare provider about all other medications you are taking, including prescription drugs, over-the-counter medications, and supplements. Some medications may interact with Dilzem 30mg, potentially affecting its effectiveness or increasing the risk of side effects. Your healthcare provider can advise you on any necessary adjustments or precautions. Follow-up appointments: Attend regular follow-up appointments with your healthcare provider to monitor your response to the medication and make any necessary adjustments to your treatment plan. They may order tests or assessments to evaluate your heart function and adjust the dosage if needed. Do not share medication: Dilzem 30mg is prescribed specifically for you. Do not share it with others, even if they have similar symptoms or conditions. It's important to note that these are general guidelines, and specific instructions may vary depending on individual circumstances. Always consult your healthcare provider or refer to the medication label for precise instructions on how to use Dilzem 30mg. They can provide personalized advice based on your specific condition and needs. Dilzem 30mg (diltiazem) belongs to a class of medications called calcium channel blockers. It works by affecting the movement of calcium ions in the smooth muscle cells of blood vessels and the heart. Here's how Dilzem 30mg works: Blood Vessels: Dilzem 30mg helps relax and widen the blood vessels (arteries and veins). It does this by blocking calcium channels in the smooth muscle cells that line the blood vessel walls. By inhibiting the entry of calcium ions into these cells, Dilzem reduces their contraction and promotes their relaxation. This results in the widening (dilation) of blood vessels, which reduces resistance to blood flow and helps lower blood pressure. Heart: Dilzem 30mg also affects the heart's electrical conduction system and cardiac muscle cells. It works by blocking calcium channels in the heart muscle cells, particularly in the sinoatrial (SA) and atrioventricular (AV) nodes. By doing so, Dilzem slows down the electrical signals within the heart, which helps regulate the heart rate and rhythm. It can be particularly effective in controlling rapid heart rates associated with certain heart rhythm disorders. Overall, by relaxing blood vessels and regulating heart rate and rhythm, Dilzem 30mg helps improve blood flow, reduce blood pressure, and manage certain cardiovascular conditions such as hypertension, angina pectoris, and abnormal heart rhythms. It's important to note that the specific mechanism of action and effects of Dilzem may vary depending on the individual, the dose, and the condition being treated. It's always best to consult with your healthcare provider for a thorough understanding of how Dilzem 30mg works in your specific situation. They can provide detailed explanations and address any specific concerns you may have. If you forget to take a dose of Dilzem 30mg (diltiazem), it's important to follow these general guidelines: Take it as soon as you remember: If you realize you missed a dose close to the scheduled time for your next dose, take the missed dose as soon as you remember. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. Set reminders: To help you remember to take your medication on time, consider setting reminders on your phone or using other tools such as pill organizers. This can help ensure you take Dilzem consistently and as prescribed. Follow healthcare provider's instructions: If you frequently forget to take your medication or have concerns about your ability to adhere to the prescribed schedule, it's important to discuss this with your healthcare provider. They may be able to provide strategies or alternative dosing options to improve adherence. Do not take extra doses: It's crucial not to take a double dose to compensate for the missed one. Taking more than the prescribed dosage can increase the risk of side effects and complications. Always stick to the recommended dosage as instructed by your healthcare provider. If you have concerns or questions about what to do if you miss a dose of Dilzem 30mg, it's best to consult with your healthcare provider. They can provide specific advice based on your individual circumstances and provide guidance on how to proceed. Follow the prescribed dosage: Take Dilzem 30mg exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. Do not exceed the recommended dosage or change the dosing schedule without consulting your healthcare provider. Taking more than the prescribed dose can increase the risk of side effects and complications. Avoid grapefruit juice: Grapefruit juice can interact with Dilzem and increase the concentration of the medication in your bloodstream, potentially leading to an increased risk of side effects. It's recommended to avoid consuming grapefruit or grapefruit juice while taking Dilzem. Inform your healthcare provider: Make sure to inform your healthcare provider about any pre-existing medical conditions, including heart problems, liver or kidney disease, or any allergies you may have. Also, inform them about all other medications you are taking, including prescription drugs, over-the-counter medications, and herbal supplements. Some medications and substances may interact with Dilzem and can affect its effectiveness or increase the risk of side effects. Regularly monitor blood pressure: If Dilzem 30mg is prescribed for hypertension, monitor your blood pressure regularly as directed by your healthcare provider. This will help ensure that the medication is effectively controlling your blood pressure and allow for any necessary adjustments in your treatment plan.

If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, it's important to discuss the use of Dilzem 30mg with your healthcare provider. It is used as a dietary supplement to provide additional L-Lysine and B-vitamins to individuals with specific nutritional needs or deficiencies. Uses: Composition: Metformin HCl 1000 mg FORMIN OD 1000 is brand name of Metformin HCl 1000 mg. It helps control blood sugar levels and thus prevent serious complications of diabetes. This medication is  prescribed for the condition of type 2 diabetes when diet and exercise alone cannot control their blood sugar levels. It is the first-line therapy for patients with type 2 diabetes. Formin-SR 1000 mg Tabblets 15's restores the body's response to insulin, decreases the amount of blood sugar produced by the liver, and delays the absorption of sugar by the stomach or intestines. Type 2 diabetes mellitus Common side effects: Swallow the tablet whole by mouth with food. Don't crush, chew or break the tablet. Follow the dose and duration as prescribed by the doctor. Formin OD-1000m Tabblets 15's belongs to a group of anti-diabetic medicines called biguanides used in the treatment of diabetes. T It is advisable not to consume alcohol along with Formin-SR 1000 mg Tabblets 15's to avoid unpleasant side-effects like lactic acidosis. Not recommended during pregnancy. Uses: FORMET SR 1GM TABLET contains Metformin which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-diabetic agents. It is used to treat Type II diabetes mellitus when diet and exercise alone does not result in adequate blood sugar control. Type II diabetes mellitus is a chronic disease characterized by abnormally high levels of glucose in the blood. It is caused due to inadequate production of a hormone called insulin (produced by pancreas to metabolize glucose) in the body or due to inadequate sensitivity of body cells to the actions of insulin. It is used in adults and in children (aged 10 years or older) to treat: Take FORMET SR 1GM TABLET preferably after meals or as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking FORMET SR 1GM TABLET unless your doctor advice you to stop. FORMET SR 1GM TABLET is an antidiabetic medicine. It makes the body more sensitive to insulin (a hormone involved in glucose metabolism). This helps our body cells to utilize more amount of the circulating blood glucose, thereby reducing blood sugar levels. Additionally, it also prevents glucose production by the liver and reduces its absoprtion in the body. If you forgot to take a dose of FORMET SR 1GM TABLET, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next dose of FORMET SR 1GM TABLET, skip the missed dose and take the next one regularly. Do not take a double dose of FORMET SR 1GM TABLET to compensate the missed ones. FORMET SR 1GM TABLET should be used during pregnancy only if it is considered necessary by the physician. Therefore, inform your doctor before taking FORMET SR 1GM TABLET if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. FORMET SR 1GM TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women. However, consult your doctor before taking it. FORMET SR 1GM TABLET is not recommended for use in patients with severe kidney problems (including kidney infections). Therefore, consult your doctor before taking it. FORMET SR 1GM TABLET must be taken with meals to avoid gastrointestinal side effects. You need to take FORMET SR 1GM TABLET as long as your doctor or physician prescribes you the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition.
Side Effects: Type II diabetes mellitus | Nausea, vomiting | Diarrhea, stomach pain, loss of appetite | Changes in taste, metallic taste |

Uses: Type 2 Diabetes:Metformin is used to lower blood sugar levels in individuals with type 2 diabetes. It helps improve the body's response to insulin and decreases the amount of sugar produced by the liver. Common side effects can include stomach upset, diarrhea, and nausea. These side effects might be less common with the sustained-release (SR) formulation. Metformin SR tablets should be taken orally, with a meal, to reduce the likelihood of stomach upset. Metformin improves the body's sensitivity to insulin, allowing better utilization of glucose by the cells. It also reduces the liver's production of glucose and helps control blood sugar levels. Take it with the next meal. Skip the dose if it is already time for next dose. Do not adjust the dosage of Metformin or stop taking it without consulting your doctor. Abrupt discontinuation can lead to adverse effects. If you're pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, inform your doctor, as the medication might need adjustments. Metformin itself is unlikely to cause dizziness or drowsiness. However, if you experience any side effects that affect your alertness, avoid such activities. Metformin SR tablets are formulated for sustained release. Do not crush, split, or chew them, as it can affect the medication's effectiveness. Your doctor might recommend lifestyle changes before considering medication for prediabetes. Consult your healthcare provider for personalized advice. Weight loss might occur as a result of improved blood sugar control with Metformin. However, individual responses can vary.

Composition: Ambroxol (30mg/5ml) + Guaifenesin (100mg/5ml) + Terbutaline (2.5mg/5ml) VENTRYL EXPECTORANT is a combination of Ambroxol, Guaiphenesin and Terbutaline which belongs to the group of medicines called Mucolytics, Expectorant and Beta agonists respectively. VENTRYL EXPECTORANT is used in the relief of cough associated with bronchitis, bronchial asthma, emphysema, and other bronchopulmonary disorders where bronchospasm, mucous plugging and problems of expectoration co-exist (lung and airway diseases that have excessive and thick mucus formation, swelling and inflammation of airways, making it difficult to breath). Before taking VENTRYL EXPECTORANT, inform your doctor if you have or have ever had a stomach ulcer, pre-existing ischaemic heart disease or those patients with significant risk factors for ischaemic heart disease, thyrotoxicosis (condition in which you have too much thyroid hormone in your body), diabetes mellitus or hypertension. Used to relieve cough associated with bronchitis, bronchial asthma, emphysema, and other bronchopulmonary disorders where bronchospasm, mucous plugging and problems of expectoration co-exist Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Measure it with a measuring cup and take it by mouth. Shake well before use. Ventryl Expectorant may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Ventryl Expectorant is a combination of three medicines: Ambroxol, Guaifenesin and Terbutaline, which relieves cough with mucus. Ambroxol is a mucolytic which thins and loosens mucus (phlegm), making it easier to cough out. Guaifenesin is an expectorant which decreases the stickiness of mucus (phlegm) and helps in its removal from the airways. Terbutaline is a bronchodilator. It works by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widens the airways. Together, they make breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Ventryl Expectorant, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is not known whether it is safe to consume alcohol with Ventryl Expectorant. Please consult your doctor. Ventryl Expectorant may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor Information regarding the use of Ventryl Expectorant during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.
Side Effects: Nausea | Vomiting | Diarrhea | Dizziness | Headache | Rash | Tremors | Increased heart rate | Indigestion | Bloating |

Uses: Composition: AMBROXOL-30MG + GUAIPHENESIN-100MG + TERBUTALINE-2.5MG Ventryl Expectorant 60 ml belongs to the class of medicines called expectorants primarily used to treat cough associated with mucus. Coughing (dry or productive) is a body's way of clearing irritants (like allergens, mucus or smoke) from airways and preventing infection. There are two types of coughs, namely: Dry cough and chesty cough. A dry cough is tickly and doesn't produce any vicious or thick mucus, while a chesty cough (wet cough) produces mucous or sputum. Consult your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding. Ventryl Expectorant 60 ml should be used with caution in children if prescribed by a doctor. Used to relieve cough associated with bronchitis, bronchial asthma, emphysema, and other bronchopulmonary disorders where bronchospasm, mucous plugging and problems of expectoration co-exist Common side effects: Take VENTRYL EXPECTORANT as advised by your physician. Shake well before use. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. VENTRYL EXPECTORANT is a combination of Ambroxol, Guaiphenesin and Terbutaline. Ambroxol thins and loosens mucus making it easier to cough out. Guaiphenesin belongs to expectorant which decreases the stickiness of mucus and helps in its removal from the airways. Terbutaline works by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widens the airways. There are no adequate and well-controlled studies of VENTRYL EXPECTORANT in pregnant women. It should be administered with caution in pregnancy. Consult your doctor for advice. VENTRYL EXPECTORANT should be used with caution during breastfeeding. Consult your doctor for advice.

Caution is advised when consuming alcohol with Micropime T 250 mg/31.25 mg Injection. Please consult your doctor. Uses:

It is also effective in typhoid fever and some sexually transmitted diseases like gonorrhea. Azilide 250 Tablet is taken orally, preferably one hour before or 2 hours after a meal. It should be used regularly at evenly spaced time intervals as prescribed by your doctor. Do not skip any doses and finish the full course of treatment even if you feel better. Stopping the medicine too early may lead to the return or worsening of the infection. Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Uses: Composition: Diclofenac (50mg) DIVON 50MG TABLET contains Diclofenac which belongs to the group of medicines called Nonsteroidal Anti-Inflammatory Drugs (NSAIDs). It is used to treat pain and inflammation related to sprains, strains and other injuries, post-surgery, gout (excessive uric acid accumulation in joints), backache, rheumatoid arthritis (immune system attack on healthy cells by mistake, causing inflammation), osteoarthritis (flexible tissue at the ends of bones wears down), ankylosing spondylitis (spine inflammation) and pyrophosphate arthropathy (crystals of a calcium salt causing joint problems). DIVON 50MG TABLET can also be used in adults to treat symptoms associated with migraine attacks (one sided headache that can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation), frozen shoulder, fractures, dislocations, and conditions affecting tendons (Ex. tendonitis, tenosynovitis, bursitis). During DIVON 50MG TABLET treatment, your doctor may want to give you a check-up regularly.  Pain relief Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Divon 50mg Tablet is to be taken with food. Divon 50mg Tablet is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAID). It works by blocking the release of certain chemical messengers that cause pain and inflammation (redness and swelling) It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Divon 50mg Tablet. Divon 50mg Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Divon 50mg Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Edema (swelling) | Nausea | Headache | Dizziness | Vomiting | Itching | Flatulence | Indigestion | Pain in extremities |

Uses: This gel is commonly used for pain relief and reduction of inflammation in conditions such as arthritis, strains, sprains, and musculoskeletal injuries. Common side effects may include skin irritation, redness, or rash at the application site. Apply a thin layer of the gel to the affected area and gently massage it into the skin. Wash hands after application. Follow the specific instructions on the product label or as directed by a healthcare professional. The combination of diclofenac, an NSAID, with linseed oil, methanol, and methylsalicylate provides a multi-modal approach to pain relief. Diclofenac reduces pain and inflammation by inhibiting prostaglandin synthesis, while linseed oil and methylsalicylate contribute to anti-inflammatory effects and provide a cooling and soothing sensation. Pregnant or breastfeeding individuals should consult with a healthcare professional before using the gel to assess potential risks and benefits. The frequency of application may vary depending on the severity of pain and the specific condition being treated. Follow the dosing instructions provided on the product label or as advised by a healthcare professional. Yes, the gel can be used to relieve joint pain associated with conditions like arthritis or joint injuries.

Composition:  DICLOFENAC-1.16%W/W + LINSEED OIL-3%W/W + MENTHOL-5%W/W + METHYL SALICYLATE-10%W/W  Divon Gel 30 gm belongs to the class of medications called topical analgesics primarily used to relieve acute musculoskeletal pain and osteoarthritis. It effectively reduces pain, swelling, and joint stiffness, thereby improving your ability to move and flex the joint. Osteoarthritis is a long term musculoskeletal joint disorder that causes damage to the cartilage and surrounding tissues characterized by pain, swelling, stiffness, and loss of function. Divon Gel 30 gm contains diclofenac, linseed oil, methyl salicylate, and menthol. Diclofenac and methyl salicylate work by lowering hormones in the body that cause inflammation and pain. It is used to treat: Common side effects: For external use only.Should be applied only on unbroken skin and not on open woundsOcclusive dressing is not recommended after applicationCare should be taken to avoid contact with the eyes and mucous membranes  Divon Gel 30 gm contains Diclofenac, Linseed Oil, Methyl Salicylate, and Menthol. Diclofenac and Methyl Salicylate work by blocking the release of certain chemical messengers that cause pain and inflammation. Linseed oil inhibits inflammatory mediators like leukotrienes, thereby reducing inflammation. Menthol provides a cooling sensation by dilating the blood vessels. Together, Divon Gel 30 gm helps provide relief from mild to moderate pain in musculoskeletal and joint conditions. Divon Gel 30 gm should only be used under medical advice during the first six months of pregnancy. Divon Gel 30 gm must not be used during the last three months of pregnancy, as it could harm the unborn child or cause problems at delivery. Uses: Composition: Torasemide (10mg) TORSINEX 10MG INJECTION contains Torsemide which belongs to the group of medicines called Diuretics. It is indicated for the treatment of oedema associated with congestive heart failure, renal or hepatic disease and essential hypertension. Oedema is a build-up of fluid in the body which causes the affected tissue to become swollen. The swelling can occur in one particular part of the body or may be more general, depending on the cause.Prior to the treatment, your doctor may want you to take several blood tests to understand your existing condition.TORSINEX 10MG INJECTION is not recommended for use if you have anuria (failure of kidney to produce urine), hepatic coma (loss of brain function due to liver damage).  Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Torsinex 10mg Injection is a diuretic. It removes extra water and certain electrolytes from the body by increasing the amount of urine produced. Torsinex 10mg Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Torsinex 10mg Injection is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.

Uses: Encorate 500 injection belongs to a class of medications known as anti-epileptics. It's used to treat disorders like epilepsy and bipolar disorder. It prevents seizures (fits) by reducing excessive mood swings and aberrant brain signals. It is also beneficial in the prevention of migraines. .Encorate 500mg injection are injected by a medical professional and should not be administered by the patient. Even if you feel better, you should never skip a dosage and complete the entire course of treatment since discontinuing the drug without consulting a doctor can result in nonstop seizures that risk your life. If you are on contraceptive pills, be cautious as this medication may interfere with their effectiveness.. Headache, nausea, dizziness, tiredness, constipation, diarrhea, double vision, and weight gain are some of the most common side effects of this medication. Most side effects will go away on their own, but if they worry you or do not go away, consult your doctor. There could be techniques to prevent or mitigate such effects. Long-term treatment might develop bone weakness (osteoporosis), which increases your chances of breaking a bone. Inform your doctor if you have kidney or liver disease, meningitis, depression, or suicidal thoughts before using this medication. Inform your healthcare team about any other medications you are taking, as some may interfere with or be interfered with by this medication, including contraception pills.You might need to alter the dose if you're pregnant or breastfeeding. If this medication makes you drowsy or dizzy, avoid operating a vehicle or riding a bicycle. In order to track your reaction to this medication, you might require frequent blood tests.

Composition: Hydrocortisone (1% w/w) Lycor 1% Cream is a topical steroid used for treatment of mild to moderate inflammatory skin disorders such as eczema. It prevents the release of substances that cause inflammation and provides relief from swelling, redness, and itching in the affected area. Lycor 1% Cream is meant only for external use and should be used as advised by your doctor. You should normally clean and dry the affected area before applying a thin layer of the medicine evenly on the affected skin. You should not apply it on open wounds or damaged skin. It is usually well tolerated with little or no side effects. However it may cause application site reactions such as burning, irritation, itching, and redness in some people. These side effects are temporary and usually go away with time. However, if they persist or worsen, let your doctor know. It is important for pregnant and breastfeeding mothers to consult their doctors before using this medicine. Common side effects: Application site reactions (burning, irritation, itching and redness) This medicine is for external use only. Use it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Clean and dry the affected area and apply the cream. Wash your hands after applying, unless hands are the affected area. Lycor 1% Cream is a steroid medicine which blocks the production of certain chemical messengers that make the skin red, swollen and itchy. Lycor 1% Cream may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Lycor 1% Cream is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.

Uses: Shelcal Syrup is a calcium and vitamin D3 supplement available in syrup form. It is primarily used to prevent or treat calcium and vitamin D deficiencies in individuals, especially children who may have difficulty swallowing tablets. Here is some information about Shelcal Syrup: Uses: Shelcal Syrup is commonly prescribed to individuals who have low calcium and vitamin D levels. It helps in maintaining adequate calcium and vitamin D levels in the body, which are essential for healthy bones and teeth. Benefits: Shelcal Syrup provides calcium and vitamin D, which play crucial roles in bone health. Calcium is necessary for bone mineralization and strength, while vitamin D aids in calcium absorption from the intestines. Together, they help prevent and treat conditions such as rickets in children and osteoporosis in adults. Side Effects: Shelcal Syrup is generally safe and well-tolerated when taken as recommended. However, some individuals may experience side effects such as gastrointestinal discomfort, constipation, or allergic reactions. These effects are usually mild and temporary. How to Use: The dosage of Shelcal Syrup should be determined by your healthcare professional based on your individual needs and calcium levels. It is typically taken orally, usually after meals. Follow the instructions provided by your healthcare professional or as mentioned on the product packaging. How it Works: Shelcal Syrup provides the body with additional calcium and vitamin D. Calcium is absorbed in the intestines and utilized by the body for bone mineralization and other functions. Vitamin D helps in the absorption of calcium from the intestines and promotes its incorporation into the bones. Safety Advice: Before using Shelcal Syrup, it is important to consult with your healthcare professional, especially if you have underlying health conditions or are taking other medications. They can assess if Shelcal Syrup is suitable for you and provide appropriate dosage instructions.

Shelcal HD is a calcium and vitamin D3 supplement that contains a combination of calcium carbonate, vitamin D3 (cholecalciferol), and elemental zinc. It is commonly used to support bone health and to provide the body with essential nutrients for maintaining healthy bones and teeth. Here's some information about Shelcal HD: Calcium Carbonate: Calcium carbonate is a form of calcium commonly used in supplements. Calcium is an essential mineral that plays a vital role in maintaining strong bones and teeth. It also supports proper muscle function, nerve transmission, and blood clotting. Vitamin D3 (Cholecalciferol): Vitamin D3 is a fat-soluble vitamin that helps the body absorb and utilize calcium efficiently. It is primarily synthesized in the skin when exposed to sunlight, but it can also be obtained from dietary sources and supplements. Vitamin D3 plays a crucial role in calcium absorption, bone mineralization, and overall bone health. Zinc: Zinc is a trace mineral that is involved in various cellular processes in the body. It plays a role in supporting the immune system, promoting wound healing, and maintaining normal growth and development. Zinc also contributes to bone health by participating in the process of bone formation and remodeling. The combination of calcium carbonate, vitamin D3, and zinc in Shelcal HD helps ensure optimal calcium absorption and utilization by the body. It supports bone mineralization, helps prevent calcium and vitamin D deficiencies, and promotes overall bone health. Shelcal HD is often prescribed for individuals with low calcium levels, osteoporosis, osteopenia, or as a supplement during pregnancy and lactation. As with any medication or supplement, it is important to follow the dosage instructions provided by your healthcare professional or as mentioned on the product packaging. If you have any specific concerns or questions about using Shelcal HD, it is best to consult with your healthcare professional for personalized advice based on your individual needs and medical history. GLANVEC 4mg Injection belongs to a group of medicines called muscle relaxants. It is used along with general anesthesia or sedatives to provide skeletal muscle relaxation during surgical procedures. It is also used to facilitate emergency airway management in patients in intensive care. GLANVEC 4mg Injection is used to relax muscles during anesthesia and surgical procedures. It works by blocking chemical messengers in the brain that are responsible for rigidity, inflammation or swelling. It effectively relieves muscle stiffness or spasm, thereby improving muscle movement.It is given as an injection by a doctor or nurse and should not be self-administered. The dose and duration will be decided by the doctor depending on the condition you are being treated for. This will help you to go about your daily activities more easily and have a better, more active, quality of life.  Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer.  GLANVEC 4mg Injection relaxes the muscles by blocking the impulses from the nerves. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with GLANVEC 4mg Injection. GLANVEC 4mg Injection may cause side effects which could affect your ability to drive.
As GLANVEC 4mg Injection is given as part of a general anesthetic, you may feel tired, weak or dizzy for some time afterward and this affects your ability to drive. GLANVEC 4mg Injection is a muscle relaxant and not a sedative. However it can be used as additional agent to anesthesia or sedation These effects are rare or of unknown frequency with GLANVEC 4mg Injection use. Stop taking GLANVEC 4mg Injection and consult your doctor immediately if you experience one or more such symptoms
Side Effects: Skeletal muscle relaxation during surgery | Skin rash | Increased saliva production | Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness) | High blood pressure |

Uses: Propofolis used to induce general anesthesia quickly and smoothly, allowing the patient to fall asleep before a surgical procedure or medical intervention. Once anesthesia is induced, propofol may also be used for maintaining a controlled level of anesthesia during the procedure. Propofol is a potent medication that should only be administered by trained medical professionals, such as anesthesiologists or experienced healthcare providers. It is given through an intravenous line and requires close monitoring of the patient's vital signs during administration. Propofol works by the suppression of nerve impulses, leading to sedation and loss of consciousness, which is essential during anesthesia. Propofol can be used in children under the supervision of healthcare professionals. The dosage and administration in pediatric patients may differ from adults. Propofol causes temporary impairment of mental and physical abilities. It is essential to avoid activities that require alertness, such as driving, until fully recovered. Propofol may interact with other medications. Inform your healthcare provider about all medications you are taking to avoid potential drug interactions. Propofol is generally avoided during pregnancy and breastfeeding unless deemed necessary by a healthcare provider. Pregnant or breastfeeding women should discuss the risks and benefits with their healthcare provider. Yes, some individuals may be allergic to Propofol. If you experience signs of an allergic reaction, such as rash, itching, swelling, severe dizziness, or difficulty breathing, seek immediate medical attention. Propofol is administered intravenously (IV) by healthcare professionals. The dosage and rate of administration are carefully adjusted based on the individual's weight, age, and medical condition.
Side Effects: -Pain at the injection site | -Nausea and vomiting | -Changes in blood pressure and heart rate | -Respiratory depression |

Uses: -Angina:Nitroglycerin can quickly relieve angina (chest pain) by relaxing coronary arteries and increasing blood flow to the heart muscle. -Congestive Heart Failure (CHF):In cases of acute congestive heart failure, nitroglycerin injection can help reduce fluid buildup and ease the strain on the heart. Common side effects of nitroglycerin injection may include headache, dizziness, flushing, low blood pressure (hypotension), and a rapid heartbeat. These side effects are usually transient and may diminish with continued use. Nitroglycerin injection is administered intravenously (IV) by a healthcare professional. It works by relaxing and dilating blood vessels, which improves blood flow and reduces the workload on the heart. This can help relieve chest pain and improve symptoms of heart conditions. Nitroglycerin should be used with caution in patients with severe anemia, increased intracranial pressure, or those at risk for hypotension. Inform your healthcare provider of any medical conditions you have, especially low blood pressure, recent heart attack, or head injury. Be cautious when standing up quickly and avoid doing work such as driving and operating machineries due to dizziness caused by low blood pressure. Prolonged use of nitroglycerin, particularly in high doses, can lead to the development of tolerance. This means that over time, the medication may become less effective in relieving angina symptoms. Your healthcare provider will monitor your condition and adjust the treatment as needed. Nitroglycerin injection may not be suitable for individuals with certain medical conditions, such as hypotension (low blood pressure) or increased intracranial pressure. Be careful not to get Flucort-H Skin Cream into your eyes or mouth. If you happen to get it in your eyes, rinse off with plenty of water immediately and contact your doctor. You must not use Flucort-H Skin Cream if you are allergic to it or any of its ingredients. Tell your doctor if you notice any allergic reaction while using it for the first time. Inform your doctor if you are taking any medicines regularly to prevent any allergic reaction with other medicines. Do not cover the area being treated with Flucort-H Skin Cream with a bandage, as this may increase absorption of this medicine and increase the side effects. Do not use more than what is recommended to relieve your symptoms faster. Using more than what is advised will only increase the side effects. Also, let your doctor know if you are planning to conceive. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should use Flucort-H Skin Cream only if prescribed by the doctor.
Side Effects: Skin conditions with inflammation & itching |

Uses: Flucort Forte Lotion is a type of drug known as a steroid. It is used to treat skin diseases characterized by irritation and itching. It alleviates edema, redness, and itching in the affected area. Flucort Forte Lotion should only be used externally and only as directed by your doctor. Normally, you should wash and dry the affected region before applying a thin layer of medicine. Any contact with your eyes, nose, or mouth should be avoided. In case of accidental contact, thoroughly rinse it with water. Unless otherwise ordered by a doctor, avoid covering the treated area with airtight coverings such as bandages. Unless otherwise ordered by a doctor, avoid covering the treated area with airtight coverings such as bandages. Flucort Forte Lotion is effective in treating skin conditions with inflammation and itching such as eczema, psoriasis, and dermatitis. It works by reducing the actions of chemicals in the body that cause inflammation of the skin. When used correctly it is a safe and effective treatment. In treating psoriasis, it reduces the scaly, itchy patches which may develop on the elbows, knees, scalp, and other parts of the body. In treating eczema and dermatitis, it reduces the redness, rash, pain, or itchiness caused by your skin’s reaction to an irritant. It thus improves your self-esteem and confidence as your appearance changes.You should always use the cream or ointment as prescribed and only apply the amount you have been told to. Keep using it for as long as it is prescribed to get the full benefits. This medicine is for external use only. Use this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Shake it well and apply to the area evenly.
Side Effects: Skin conditions with inflammation & itching | Application site reactions (burning, irritation, itching and redness) |

Uses: Flucort Skin Cream belongs to a group of medicine called steroids. It is used in the treatment of skin conditions associated with inflammation and itching. It provides relief from swelling, redness, and itching in the affected area.Flucort Skin Cream is only meant for external use and should be used as advised by your doctor. You should normally wash and dry the affected area before applying a thin layer of the medicine. Avoid any contact with your eyes, nose, or mouth. Rinse it off with plenty of water in case of accidental contact. Avoid covering the treated area with airtight dressings such as bandages unless directed by a doctor.Using the medicine may cause burning sensation, irritation, redness, and swelling at the site of application. These are temporary and usually go away with time. However, if they persist or worsen, let your doctor know. The medicine is not recommended for pregnant women. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should consult their doctors before using this medicine. Flucort Skin Cream is effective in treating skin conditions with inflammation and itching such as eczema, psoriasis, and dermatitis. It works by reducing the actions of chemicals in the body that cause inflammation of the skin. When used correctly it is a safe and effective treatment. In treating psoriasis, it reduces the scaly, itchy patches which may develop on the elbows, knees, scalp, and other parts of the body. In treating eczema and dermatitis, it reduces the redness, rash, pain, or itchiness caused by your skin’s reaction to an irritant. It thus improves your self-esteem and confidence as your appearance changes.You should always use the cream or ointment as prescribed and only apply the amount you have been told to. Keep using it for as long as it is prescribed to get the full benefits. This medicine is for external use only. Use it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Clean and dry the affected area and apply the cream. Wash your hands after applying, unless hands are the affected area.  Flucort Skin Cream is a steroid. It works by blocking the production of certain chemical messengers (prostaglandins) that make the skin red, swollen, and itchy. Be careful not to get Flucort Skin Cream into your eyes or mouth. If you happen to get it in your eyes, rinse off with plenty of water immediately and contact your doctor. You must not use Flucort Skin Cream if you are allergic to it or any of its ingredients. Tell your doctor if you notice any allergic reaction while using it for the first time. Inform your doctor if you are taking any medicines regularly to prevent any allergic reaction with other medicines. Do not cover the area being treated with Flucort Skin Cream with a bandage, as this may increase absorption of this medicine and increase the side effects. Do not use more than what is recommended to relieve your symptoms faster. Using more than what is advised will only increase the side effects. Also, let your doctor know if you are planning to conceive. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should use Flucort Skin Cream only if prescribed by the doctor. No, Flucort Skin Cream should never be applied in those areas of the skin that have burns, cuts, or scrapes. If Flucort Skin Cream accidentally gets onto such areas, rinse the area thoroughly with water. You should use this medicine only as directed by your doctor to avoid any adverse effects and worsening of your condition. Before using Flucort Skin Cream, clean and dry the affected area. Gently and thoroughly massage it into the skin. Be careful not to get the medication in your eyes or mouth. If Flucort Skin Cream gets in your eyes accidentally, wash with plenty of water and call your doctor if your eyes are irritated
Side Effects: Skin conditions with inflammation & itching | Application site reactions (burning, irritation, itching and redness) |

Uses: Integrilin Injection is a blood thinner which prevents formation of harmful blood clots. It is used in the treatment of a heart attack and also prevents the clotting of blood in the heart during an angioplasty (procedure to improve blood flow to the heart). Integrilin Injection prevents new blood clots from forming and prevents the existing ones from getting bigger. It works by blocking a substance in the body which is involved in blood clotting. Thus it helps your blood flow smoothly throughout the body. This can help reduce damage caused by clots in your lungs (pulmonary embolism), brain (stroke), heart (heart attack) or other blood vessels (thrombosis). It prevents blood from clotting inside the veins and arteries. This helps the blood flow freely around your body thereby preventing a heart attack or stroke (or deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism). Follow your doctor’s instructions carefully and make appropriate lifestyle changes (such as eating healthy and staying active) to maximize the effectiveness of this medicine.  Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self-administer.  Integrilin Injection is an antiplatelet medication. It works by preventing the platelets from sticking together, thereby decreasing the formation of harmful blood clots. Integrilin Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Integrilin Injection should be used with caution during breastfeeding. Breastfeeding should be held until the treatment of the mother is completed and the drug is eliminated from her body. Integrilin Injection should be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. Dose adjustment of Integrilin Injection may be needed. Please consult your doctor.Use of Integrilin Injection is not recommended in patients with severe kidney disease. Yes, Integrilin Injection increases the risk of bleeding. Always be careful while doing activities that may cause an injury or bleeding. Tell your doctor immediately if you notice any abnormal bruising or bleeding.
Side Effects: Prevention of Blood clots | Prevention of Heart attack | Bleeding | Decreased blood pressure |

Uses: Composition: SALMETEROL-25MCG  Serobid Inhaler 120 MDI is a respiratory medication primarily used to treat and prevent asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary diseases (COPD) like bronchitis (inflammation of the lining of your bronchial tubes) and emphysema (shortness of breath). Asthma is a chronic (long-term) respiratory condition in which airways narrow, swell and produce extra mucus, leading to difficulty breathing. COPD is a group of lung diseases that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs. Serobid Inhaler 120 MDI is for inhalation only. Your doctor will recommend how often you need to take Serobid Inhaler 120 MDI based on your medical condition. Common side effects: Always use SEROBID INHALER as prescribed by your doctor. It is for inhalation use only. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you based upon your age, body weight and disease condition. SEROBID  INHALER helps in relaxing the smooth muscles of the air passages by widening it (bronchodilation), thus improving airflow and making it easier to breathe. It also inhibits mast cell mediators which decreases inflammation. Avoid drinking alcohol while taking this medicine as it can worsen your side effects. Safety data of SEROBID INHALER in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby has not been established yet so it should be given only if the expected benefit to the mother is greater than any possible risk to the foetus. Consult your doctor before using. Please consult your doctor before using Serobid Inhaler 120 MDI if you are breastfeeding.
Side Effects: Treatment of asthma including nocturnal asthma and exercise-induced asthma as concomitant therapy with inhaled corticosteroid | Maintenance treatment of bronchospasm associated with COPD including emphysema and chronic bronchitis | Flu symptoms | Joint or muscle pain | Throat irritation, cough | Stuffy or runny nose | Headache |

Uses:
Composition: Montelukast (4mg)  Montair 4mg Chewable Tablet is used to prevent asthma attacks in children. It may also be used to ease breathing difficulties caused by strenuous physical activities. This medicine also helps treat symptoms of skin and seasonal allergies such as runny nose, sneezing, itching, swelling, congestion, and watery eyes. Montair 4 MG Tablet is used to prevent and control the symptoms of asthma (narrowing of the airways). It is also used to prevent breathing difficulty during exercise. It also provides relief from the symptoms of allergy such as watery eyes, sneezing, difficulty in breathing, chest tightness, etc. It works by preventing the narrowing of the windpipe and provides relief from allergic symptoms.  Common side effects: Use it as advised by your doctor or check the label for directions before use. Take this medication by mouth. Chew it completely before swallowing, or as directed by your doctor. Montair 4mg Chewable Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Montair 4mg Chewable Tablet is a leukotriene antagonist that works by blocking a chemical messenger (leukotriene). This reduces inflammation (swelling) in the airways and nose and improves symptoms Do not panic. Unless your child’s doctor has advised a specific regime for your child, give the missed dose as soon as you remember it. Skip the missed dose if it is almost the time for the next dose. Do not give a double dose to catch up and follow the prescribed dosing schedule. Montair 4mg Chewable Tablet is safe to use in patients with liver disease. No dose adjustment of Montair 4mg Chewable Tablet is recommended.
However, consult your child’s doctor in case of severe liver disease.
Side Effects: Treatment of Allergic skin conditions | Treatment of Sneezing and runny nose due to allergies | Dizziness | Nausea | Vomiting | Headache | Diarrhea | Abdominal pain |

Uses: Composition: Formoterol (6mcg) + Budesonide (100mcg)  FORACORT 100MCG INHALER contains Budesonide and Formoterol, which belong to the group of medicines called Inhaled corticosteroids, long-acting beta-adrenergic agonists. FORACORT 100MCG INHALER is used in adults and children above 6 years for the regular treatment of asthma and moderate to severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) with frequent symptoms and a history of recurrent exacerbations. Your doctor will regularly monitor the growth pattern of your child using FORACORT 100MCG INHALER. Before using this medicine, your doctor might advise you to perform certain respiratory tests to assess the severity of respiratory disorder and flow in the lungs. Treatment of Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) Asthma Common side effects: Check the label for directions before use. Shake the inhaler. While you are breathing in from mouth, press down on the inhaler one time to release the medication and hold your breath for 10 seconds. Repeat until you have inhaled the number of puffs as suggested by the doctor.Afterwards, rinse your mouth thoroughly with water and spit it out. Foracort 100 Inhaler is a combination of two medicines: Formoterol and Budesonide. Formoterol is a long-acting bronchodilator which works by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widens the airways. Budesonide is a steroid. It works by stopping the release of certain chemical messengers that cause inflammation (swelling) of the airways. Together, they make breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Foracort 100 Inhaler, use it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Foracort 100 Inhaler. Foracort 100 Inhaler is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Foracort 100 Inhaler is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Headache | Nausea | Vomiting | Stomach discomfort | Dizziness | Cough | Nasopharyngitis (inflammation of the throat and nasal passages) | Upper respiratory tract infection | Sinus inflammation | Fungal infection of oropharynx | Tremors | Palpitations | Voice change |

Uses:
Composition: Formoterol (12mcg) + Tiotropium (18mcg)  Duova Rotacaps is a combination medicine composed of Tiotropium and Formoterol. It is used to relieve symptoms of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (a group of lung problems that makes breathing difficult) such as wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, breathing difficulties, coughing, etc.Duova Rotacap is used for the treatment of chronic obstructive pulmonary disorder (a lung disorder in which the flow of air to the lungs is blocked). It helps in relaxing the muscles of the air passages and making it easier to breathe. It relieves coughing, wheezing and feeling short of breath. Duova Rotacaps is not recommended if you are allergic to it and in children below 18 years of age. Inform your doctor about your current medications and medical conditions before taking this medicine. This will help your doctor to adjust your dose for avoiding any side effects. If you are pregnant or breastfeeding, consult your doctor before taking this medicine.  Common side effects: Rotacaps must not be swallowed. Check the label for directions before use. Place the capsule at the base of rotahaler, not in the mouthpiece. Twist the mouthpiece completely until your hear a click and breathe in deeply through the mouthpiece. Hold your breath for up to 10 seconds. If some powder remains in the rotahaler repeat the process. Duova Rotacap is a combination of two medicines: Formoterol and Tiotropium. Formoterol is a bronchodilator while Tiotropium is an anticholinergic. They work by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widen the airways. Together, they make breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Duova Rotacap, use it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Duova Rotacap. Duova Rotacap may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Duova Rotacap is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Monitor the baby for dry mouth, constipation, and urinary problems.
Side Effects: Asthma | Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) | Nausea | Diarrhea | Dryness in mouth | Vomiting | Dizziness | Nasopharyngitis (inflammation of the throat and nasal passages) | Insomnia (difficulty in sleeping) |

Composition:  Bosentan (62.5mg)  BOSENTAS 62.5MG TABLET contains Bosentan which belongs to the group of medicines called Endothelin receptor antagonists. BOSENTAS 62.5MG TABLET is used to treat pulmonary arterial hypertension in affected individuals which is a disease that occurs due to high blood pressure in blood vessels that carry blood from heart to the lungs. Bosentas 62.5 Tablet should be taken with or without food. This medicine should be used regularly to get the most benefit from it. The dose and how often you take it depends on what you are taking it for. Your doctor will decide how much you need to improve your symptoms. You should take this medicine for as long as it is prescribed for you.  Before taking this medicine, let your doctor know if you have liver dysfunctioning. Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding.  Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Bosentas 62.5 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Bosentas 62.5 Tablet is an endothelin receptor blocker. It blocks the action of endothelin (a natural substance) that causes blood vessels to narrow (constrict). This narrowing increases the pressure in the blood vessels of the lungs. Bosentas 62.5 Tablet helps relax these blood vessels and increases the supply of blood to the lungs. If you miss a dose of Bosentas 62.5 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Bosentas 62.5 Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Bosentas 62.5 Tablet is highly unsafe to use during pregnancy. Seek your doctor's advice as studies on pregnant women and animals have shown significant harmful effects to the developing baby. Bosentas 62.5 Tablet is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.
Side Effects: Treats pulmonary artery hypertension | Treats digital ulcers (that occurs due to scleroderma) in affected individuals | Headache | Ankle swelling | Edema (swelling) | Diarrhea | Anemia (low number of red blood cells) | Respiratory tract infection |

Composition:  Beclometasone (400mcg)  BECLATE 400 ROTACAP contains Beclomethasone which belongs to the group of medicines called Corticosteroids. It is used prophylactically to prevent asthma in patients who need regular treatment. When inhaled, it suppresses the inflammation in the lungs and airway passage, widening the airway to make breathing easier. Before using BECLATE 400 ROTACAP inform your doctor if you have any lung infections (tuberculosis), liver problems or kidney problems. You must also inform your doctor if you have weak bones, weak immune system or any systemic infections as a precaution. Beclate 400mcg Rotacap should be taken in the dose and duration as directed by your doctor. The effect of this medicine may be noticeable after a few days but will only reach its maximum after a few weeks. This medicine must be used regularly to be effective, so you should continue taking it even if you do not have any symptoms .  Treatment of Asthma​​​ Common side effects: Rotacaps must not be swallowed. Check the label for directions before use. Place the capsule at the base of rotahaler, not in the mouthpiece. Twist the mouthpiece completely until your hear a click and breathe in deeply through the mouthpiece. Hold your breath for up to 10 seconds. If some powder remains in the rotahaler repeat the process. Beclate 400mcg Rotacap is a steroid. It prevents the cells in the lungs and breathing passages from releasing chemical messengers that cause inflammation (swelling) of the airways. This widens the airways and makes breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Beclate 400mcg Rotacap, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Interaction with alcohol is unknown. It is advisable to consult your doctor before consumption. BECLATE 400 ROTACAP should be used in pregnant women only if it is considered necessary by the doctor. Your doctor may prescribe this medicine after outweighing the risk and benefits to you and your baby. Therefore, inform your doctor before using it. Beclate 400mcg Rotacap is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.

Uses: Composition:  Beclometasone (200mcg)  BECLATE 200 ROTACAP contains Beclomethasone which belongs to the group of medicines called Corticosteroids. It is used prophylactically to prevent asthma in patients who need regular treatment.  When inhaled, it suppresses the inflammation in the lungs and airway passage, widening the airway to make breathing easier.  Before using BECLATE 200 ROTACAP inform your doctor if you have any lung infections (tuberculosis), liver problems or kidney problems. You must also inform your doctor if you have weak bones, weak immune system or any systemic infections as a precaution. Beclate 200 Rotacaps should be taken in the dose and duration as directed by your doctor. The effect of this medicine may be noticeable after a few days but will only reach its maximum after a few weeks. This medicine must be used regularly to be effective, so you should continue taking it even if you do not have any symptoms.  Treatment of Asthma Common side effects: Throat irritationSore tongueHoarseness of voiceThrushPharyngitisAbnormal tasteNasopharyngeal irritationApplication site irritationApplication site burning Use BECLATE 200 ROTACAP every day until your doctor tells you to stop. It is meant for inhalation use only. Inhale the medicine only through your mouth into the lungs and not via nose.  Closely follow the instructions given by your doctor regarding the number of inhalations and dosing intervals.  Do not start using this medicine unless your doctor or health care provider has taught you how to use and you understand how to use it correctly. BECLATE 200 ROTACAP is an inhalational corticosteroid. It blocks the release of certain chemical messengers in the airways (such as histamines, prostaglandins, leukotrienes) that cause allergic reaction, inflammation and swelling. It also reduces the over activity of the certain immune cells (such as mast cells, eosinophils) in the airway tract. As a result, it reduces airway inflammation, allows the air to pass through more freely through the airways and makes breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Beclate 200 Rotacaps, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Consuming alcohol with Beclate 200 Rotacaps does not cause any harmful side effects. Beclate 200 Rotacaps may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Beclate 200 Rotacaps is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.

Breath in through your mouth deeply and rapidly | Hold your breath for 10 seconds or for as long as is comfortable and then breathe out normally. Repeat the same steps for further inhalations as well | Once inhalation is over, rinse your mouth with water and spit it out or brush your teeth. |

Uses: Composition: Beclometasone (100mcg)  BECLATE 100MG ROTACAP contains Beclomethasone which belongs to the group of medicines called Corticosteroids. It is used prophylactically to prevent asthma in patients who need regular treatment. BECLATE 100MG ROTACAP is for inhalation use only, therefore do not swallow the medicine. Beclate 100 Rotacap should be taken in the dose and duration as directed by your doctor. It also reduces the over activity of the certain immune cells (such as mast cells, eosinophils) in the airway tract. As a result, it reduces airway inflammation, allows the air to pass through more freely through the airways and makes breathing easier.
