Uses: Composition: Beclometasone (50mcg)  Beclate aquanase is a steroid. It relieves the symptoms of allergic rhinitis such as runny nose, sneezing and sinus discomfort. It works by blocking the production of certain chemical messengers that cause inflammation (swelling) and allergies, thus relieving the discomfort and irritation in your nose. Beclate aquanase should be used as advised by your doctor. Normally you should blow your nose gently before using it, keep one nostril closed while applying the medicine into the other, and then sniff hard to make sure it reaches deep into the nose.       Common side effects: Use this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Insert the bottle tip into one nostril and close the other nostril. Direct the spray towards the sides of your nostril, away from the cartilage dividing the two sides of your nose. As you spray, breath gently and keep the head upright. Repeat the same process for the other nostrils. BECLATE 100MCG AQUANASE is an inhalational corticosteroid. It blocks the release of certain chemical messengers in the airways (such as histamines, prostaglandins, leukotrienes) that cause allergic reaction, inflammation and swelling. It also reduces the over activity of the certain immune cells (such as mast cells, eosinophils) in the airway tract. As a result, it reduces airway inflammation, allows the air to pass through more freely through the airways and makes breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Beclate aquanase, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Do not use BECLATE 100MCG AQUANASE if you are allergic to beclomethasone. BECLATE 100MCG AQUANASE should be used in breastfeeding women only if it is considered necessary by the doctor. Therefore, consult your doctor for advice before using it. BECLATE 100MCG AQUANASE should be used in pregnant women only if it is considered necessary by the doctor. Your doctor may prescribe this medicine after outweighing the risk and benefits to you and your baby. Therefore, inform your doctor before using it.

Uses: Composition: Salbutamol (2.5mg)  ASTHALIN RESPULE contains Salbutamol which belongs to the group of medicines called Bronchodilators. It is used to treat severe asthma attacks. It can also be used in the management of chronic bronchospasm (long-term breathing difficulties caused due to narrowing of airways) unresponsive to conventional therapies. ASTHALIN RESPULE is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 4 years or above). Before using ASTHALIN RESPULE inform your doctor if you have diabetes, overactive thyroid functions, low blood potassium levels, high blood pressure or any heart problems (such as angina or irregular heartbeat) as a precaution.   Common side effects: Use this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Twist off the top of the respule/transpule and squeeze all the liquid into the nebulizer. It should be used right away after opening. ASTHALIN RESPULE is a bronchodilator. It relaxes the smooth muscles of the airways and widens them. It also blocks the release of certain chemical messengers in the airways (such as mast cells) that cause inflammation and swelling. As a result, it reduces airway inflammation, prevents the airways from becoming narrow and allows the air to pass through more freely which makes breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Asthalin Respules, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is not known whether it is safe to consume alcohol with Asthalin Respules. Please consult your doctor. Asthalin Respules may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. ASTHALIN RESPULE should be used in breastfeeding women only if it is considered necessary by the doctor. Therefore, consult your doctor for advice before using it.
Side Effects: Severe asthma attacks | Breathing difficulties (emphysema) | Tachycardia | Tremors | Headache | Palpitations | Increased heart rate | Muscle cramp |

Uses: Composition: Ambroxol (15mg/5ml) + Levosalbutamol (0.5mg/5ml) + Guaifenesin (50mg/5ml)   ASTHALIN PLUS EXPECTORANT contains Ambroxol, Levosalbutamol and Guaifenesin which belong to the group of medicines known as Mucolytics, Bronchodilators, and Expectorants. It is indicated for the treatment of productive cough with mucous for children (1-12years of age) associated with bronchospasm (spasm of lung muscle causing breathing difficulty).  Asthalin Plus Expectorant is a combination medicine used in the treatment of cough with mucus. It thins mucus in the nose, windpipe, and lungs, making it easier to cough out. It also provides relief from runny nose, sneezing, itching, and watery eyes.   Asthalin Plus Expectorant is taken with or without food in a dose and duration as advised by the doctor. The dose you are given will depend on your condition and how you respond to the medicine. You should keep taking this medicine for as long as your doctor recommends.

Composition: Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (300mg)  Tenvir Tablet is used to treat HIV infection and chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection in combination with other anti-HIV medicines. It prevents the multiplication of viruses in human cells. This stops the virus from producing new viruses and clears up your infection. Tenvir Tablet is not a cure for HIV/AIDS and only helps to decrease the amount of HIV in your body. This helps to lower your risk of getting HIV-related complications and improves your lifespan. It may also be used to prevent HIV infection in some people at high risk. This medicine is best taken with food. It is used in combination with other anti-HIV medicines. Taking these medicines regularly at the right time greatly increases their effectiveness and reduces the chances of HIV becoming resistant to them  Treatment of Chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection Common side effects: DiarrheaNauseaRashWeaknessVomitingFatigueAbdominal painIncreased transaminase level in bloodDecreased phosphate level in blood Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Tenvir Tablet is to be taken with food. Tenvir Tablet is an antiviral medication. It prevents the multiplication of virus in human cells. This stops the virus from producing new viruses and clears up your infection. If you miss a dose of Tenvir Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is not known whether it is safe to consume alcohol with Tenvir Tablet. Please consult your doctor. Tenvir Tablet is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Tenvir Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.

Composition:  Simvastatin (20mg)  SIMCARD 20MG TABLET contains Simvastatin which belongs to the group of medicines called HMG-CoA reductase inhibitors (statins). It is used in the treatment of primary hypercholesterolaemia (high amounts of cholesterol in the blood), mixed dyslipidaemia (increased level of fat in the blood) or homozygous familial hypercholesterolaemia (a hereditary cholesterol disease) along with other medicines. Simcard 20mg Tablet is usually taken in the evening, either with or without food. However, taking it with food may reduce the chances of nausea. Take it regularly for maximum benefit. Most people with high cholesterol do not feel ill, but stopping your medicine may increase your cholesterol levels, making your condition worse and increasing your risk of heart disease and stroke.  Primary hypercholesterolaemiaMixed dyslipidaemiaHomozygous familial hypercholesterolaemiaCoronary heart disease or are at high risk of coronary heart disease Common side effects: ConstipationHeadacheUpper respiratory tract infectionAbdominal painNausea Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Simcard 20mg Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Simcard 20mg Tablet is a lipid-lowering medication (statin). It works by blocking an enzyme (HMG-CoA-reductase) that is required in the body to make cholesterol. It thus lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides, raising the level of "good" cholesterol (HDL). If you miss a dose of Simcard 20mg Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Simcard 20mg Tablet. SIMCARD 20MG TABLET is not recommended in pregnant women or are planning for pregnancy. If you get pregnant while taking SIMCARD 20MG TABLET, stop taking it immediately and contact your doctor. SIMCARD 20MG TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it is not known whether this medicine is passed into breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking SIMCARD 20MG TABLET.

Simvotin 5 Tablet is considered to be part of the statin drug group. It lowers cholesterol and lowers the chance of developing heart disease. A fatty substance called cholesterol causes the blood's blood vessels narrow as it develops, which can result in a heart attack or stroke.

Composition: Simvastatin (10mg)  Simcard 10mg Tablet belongs to a group of medicines called statins. It is used to lower cholesterol and reduce the risk of heart disease. Cholesterol is a fatty substance that builds up in your blood vessels and causes narrowing, which may lead to a heart attack or stroke. SIMCARD 10MG TABLET is not recommended for use in patients currently having liver disease. Before taking SIMCARD 10MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you have severe lung disease, kidney disease, history of liver disease, diabetes high blood pressure and thyroid problems.  SIMCARD 10MG TABLET is not recommended for use in pregnant and breastfeeding women. SIMCARD 10MG TABLET should be used with caution in children and adolescents (between 10-17 years of age) and in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before taking it.  Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Simcard 10mg Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Simcard 10mg Tablet is a lipid-lowering medication (statin). It works by blocking an enzyme (HMG-CoA-reductase) that is required in the body to make cholesterol. It thus lowers "bad" cholesterol (LDL) and triglycerides, raising the level of "good" cholesterol (HDL). If you miss a dose of Simcard 10mg Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Simcard 10mg Tablet. SIMCARD 10MG TABLET is not recommended in pregnant women or are planning for pregnancy. If you get pregnant while taking SIMCARD 10MG TABLET, stop taking it immediately and contact your doctor. SIMCARD 10MG TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it is not known whether this medicine is passed into breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking SIMCARD 10MG TABLET.
Side Effects: High cholesterol | Prevention of heart attack and stroke | Constipation | Headache | Upper respiratory tract infection | Abdominal pain | Nausea |

Uses: Composition:  Amlodipine (5mg)  Amlopres 5 Tablet belongs to a class of medicines known as calcium channel blockers. It is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and prevent angina (heart-related chest pain). It lowers blood pressure and reduces the heart's workload, which helps prevent heart attacks and strokes. Amlopres 5 Tablet may be prescribed alone or along with other medicines. The dose depends on what you are taking it for and the severity of your condition. You can take it at any time of the day, with or without food, but it is best to take it at about the same time each day.  Take AMLOPRES 5MG TABLET as advised by your physician. Avoid drinking grapefruit juice while taking AMLOPRES 5MG TABLET, as it could lead to unpredictable increase in the blood pressure lowering effects of AMLOPRES 5MG TABLET.  Before taking AMLOPRES 5MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you have any liver problems. You must also inform your doctor if you have severe uncontrollable increase in blood pressure or recently had heart attack.    Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Amlopres 5 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Amlopres 5 Tablet is a calcium channel blocker. In high blood pressure, it normalizes the blood pressure by relaxing the blood vessels to reduce the pressure on them, thereby improving the blood flow in the body. In heart-related chest pain (angina), the enhanced blood flow in the body relaxes the heart muscles by reducing the workload on the heart. It also improves the oxygen flow in the body, thereby, preventing any heart-related chest pain. If you miss a dose of Amlopres 5 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking AMLOPRES 5MG TABLET as it could make you feel dizzier. AMLOPRES 5MG TABLET should be used in pregnant women only if it is considered necessary by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before taking it. AMLOPRES 5MG TABLET should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it may pass through the breast milk to the nursing infant. Therefore, consult your doctor before taking it.
Side Effects: Treatment of Hypertension (high blood pressure) | Prevention of Angina (heart-related chest pain) | Headache | Fatigue | Nausea | Abdominal pain | Sleepiness |

Uses: Composition: Amlodipine (5mg) + Atenolol (50mg)  AMLOPRES AT 50MG TABLET is a combination of Amlodipine and Atenolol which belongs to the group of medicine called Antihypertensive agents. It is used to treat hypertension (also known as high blood pressure) and angina pectoris (chest pain caused due to lack of oxygen supply to the heart). It can also be used to reduce the risk of heart attack (myocardial infarction) among heart patients.  You can take Amlopres-AT Tablet at any time of day, on empty stomach, but it is best to take it at the same time each day. Keep taking it for as long as advised by your doctor.Before taking AMLOPRES AT 50MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you have any liver or kidney problems. You must also inform your doctor if you have asthma, diabetes, overactive thyroid gland or low blood volume as a precaution.   Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Amlopres-AT Tablet is to be taken empty stomach. Amlopres-AT Tablet is a combination of two medicines: Amlodipine and Atenolol, which lowers blood pressure effectively. Amlodipine is a calcium channel blocker which works by relaxing blood vessels while atenolol is a beta blocker which works specifically on the heart to slow down the heart rate. Together, they make the heart more efficient at pumping blood throughout the body. If you miss a dose of Amlopres-AT Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking AMLOPRES AT 50MG TABLET as it could make you feel dizzier. AMLOPRES AT 50MG TABLET should be used in pregnant women only if it is considered necessary by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before taking it. Uses: Eziderma (Azelaic acid) cream is a topical medication that contains azelaic acid as the active ingredient. It is used to treat various skin conditions, including acne and rosacea. Azelaic acid cream is primarily used for the treatment of mild to moderate acne vulgaris. It can also be prescribed for the treatment of rosacea, a chronic skin condition characterized by facial redness, bumps, and sometimes pimples. Azelaic acid cream is generally well-tolerated, but it can cause some side effects in certain individuals. Common side effects may include mild skin irritation, redness, dryness, or burning sensation at the application site. These side effects are usually temporary and diminish over time. If you experience severe or persistent side effects, discontinue use and consult your healthcare provider. Azelaic acid cream is usually applied to the affected areas of the skin twice daily, in the morning and evening. It is important to clean and dry the skin before applying the cream. Follow the instructions provided by your healthcare provider or the product label. The exact mechanism of action of azelaic acid is not fully understood. However, it is believed to work by reducing the production of keratin, a protein that can contribute to the formation of acne. It also has antimicrobial properties that can help to control the growth of bacteria associated with acne. it is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. However, it's always best to consult with your healthcare provider before using any medications during pregnancy or while breastfeeding to ensure they are appropriate for your specific situation. Azelaic acid cream is generally well-tolerated, even by individuals with sensitive skin. However, it's always advisable to do a patch test on a small area of skin before applying it to larger areas. If you experience excessive irritation or discomfort, discontinue use and consult your healthcare provider. Azelaic acid cream can be used as a spot treatment for individual acne lesions. However, it is typically recommended for use on the entire affected area rather than just spot treating, to help prevent the formation of new acne lesions.

Composition: Salmeterol (25mcg) + Fluticasone Propionate (50mcg)  Seroflo 50 Inhaler is a combination of two medicines that opens the airways and makes it easier to breathe. It is used in the treatment of asthma (wheezing and shortness of breath) and chronic obstructive pulmonary disorder (a lung disorder in which the flow of air to the lungs is blocked). Use SEROFLO 50 INHALER every day until your doctor tells you to stop. It is meant for inhalation use only. Do not stop using this medicine once your symptoms subside without consulting your doctor.  Before using SEROFLO 50 INHALER inform your doctor if you have any lung infections, liver problems or heart problems. You must also inform your doctor if you have diabetes, hypertension, fits, overactive thyroid functions, osteoporosis, adrenal gland problems or a weak immune system as a precaution.  Check the label for directions before use. Shake the inhaler. While you are breathing in from mouth, press down on the inhaler one time to release the medication and hold your breath for 10 seconds. Repeat until you have inhaled the number of puffs as suggested by the doctor.Afterwards, rinse your mouth thoroughly with water and spit it out. Seroflo 50 Inhaler is a combination of two medicines: Salmeterol and Fluticasone Propionate. Salmeterol is a long-acting bronchodilator which works by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widens the airways. Fluticasone Propionate is a steroid. It works by stopping the release of certain chemical messengers that cause inflammation (swelling) of the airways. Together, they make breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Seroflo 50 Inhaler, use it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Interaction with alcohol is unknown. It is advisable to consult your doctor before consumption. SEROFLO 50 INHALER should be used in pregnant women only if it is considered necessary by the doctor. Your doctor may prescribe this medicine after outweighing the risk and benefits to you and your baby. Therefore, inform your doctor before using it. SEROFLO 50 INHALER should be used in breastfeeding women only if it is considered necessary by the doctor. Therefore, consult your doctor for advice before using it. Do not use SEROFLO 50 INHALER if you are allergic to Salmeterol or Fluticasone.

Uses: Esiflow 250 is a medication used for the treatment of respiratory conditions, particularly asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It helps improve breathing by relaxing the muscles in the airways. Esiflow 250 is typically an inhalation medication delivered through an inhaler device. Esiflow 250 improves breathing and can alleviate symptoms like wheezing, shortness of breath, and coughing associated with asthma and COPD. Common side effects may include nausea, vomiting, respiratory tract infections, fungal infections in the mouth, headache, hoarseness of voice, sore throat, cough, musculoskeletal (bone, muscle, or joint) pain, and an increased heart rate. Esiflow 250 is a bronchodilator that relaxes the muscles in the airways, making them wider and allowing for easier airflow into the lungs. If you forget a dose, take it as soon as you remember. with water or brush your teeth after using the inhaler to reduce the risk of some side effects. Avoid smoking and situations that worsen your asthma or COPD symptoms. Consult your doctor if you experience severe or persistent side effects or have concerns about the medication. It's advisable to avoid alcohol as it may interact with the medication and increase the risk of side effects. Contact your doctor if you experience severe or persistent side effects. Consult your healthcare provider if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding to assess the benefits and risks.

It relaxes the smooth muscles of the airways and widens them. Collectively, they reduce airway inflammation, allows the air to pass through more freely and makes breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Seroflo 100 Rotacaps, use it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Uses: It should be applied as a thin layer to the affected area(s) of the skin. The cream should be gently massaged in until it is fully absorbed. It's important to wash your hands before and after applying the cream to prevent the spread of the medication. Mometasone furoate cream suppresses the release of inflammatory mediators (such as cytokines and prostaglandins) that contribute to the redness, swelling, and itching associated with inflammatory skin conditions like eczema and psoriasis.The cream's anti-inflammatory effects also contribute to its ability to alleviate itching, a common symptom in many skin disorders. It's essential to consult your healthcare provider before using this cream during pregnancy or while breastfeeding. They can weigh the potential benefits against any risks to you and your baby. If you experience severe irritation, allergic reactions, or worsening symptoms, discontinue use. It's generally advised not to use the cream on open wounds or cuts, as it may increase the risk of absorption into the bloodstream and potential side effects. Consult your doctor for specific guidance. To avoid interactions or reduced effectiveness, it's generally recommended to wait a short while after applying the cream before using other skincare products or makeup. However, follow your doctor's advice regarding product use alongside the cream.
Side Effects: -Eczema (atopic dermatitis) | -Psoriasis | -Contact dermatitis | -Allergic reactions | -Skin irritation | -Rash | -Skin thinning or fragility | -Burning or stinging sensation | -Itching | -Redness | -Dryness | -Stretch marks | -Skin discoloration |

Uses: -Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis):A chronic inflammatory skin condition characterized by redness, itching, and sometimes oozing or crusting. -Psoriasis:A skin disorder marked by red, scaly patches on the skin. -Contact Dermatitis:Inflammation of the skin caused by contact with an irritant or allergen. -Allergic Reactions:It can help alleviate itching and inflammation associated with certain allergic skin reactions. Common side effects of mometasone furoate 0.1% cream can include skin thinning, skin irritation, burning or stinging at the application site, and changes in skin color. Prolonged use or excessive application can lead to more serious side effects, so it's important to follow your healthcare provider's instructions. This cream is applied directly to the affected area of the skin. It should be used sparingly and only on the areas instructed by your healthcare provider. Wash your hands before and after application, and avoid applying the cream to broken or infected skin. Mometasone Furoate is a corticosteroid that works by reducing inflammation and suppressing the immune response in the skin. It helps alleviate the symptoms associated with skin conditions, such as redness, itching, and swelling. If you miss a dose, apply it as soon as you remember. If it's close to the time for your next application, skip the missed dose and resume your regular schedule. Do not apply a double dose to make up for a missed one. Pregnant or breastfeeding individuals should consult their healthcare provider before using mometasone furoate 0.1% cream. The cream should only be used if the potential benefits outweigh the risks. Topical corticosteroids can make the skin more sensitive to sunlight. It's advisable to avoid excessive sun exposure and to use sun protection measures while using the cream. It's generally not recommended to use Mometasone Furoate Cream on the face, especially around the eyes, unless specifically directed by your healthcare provider. Facial skin is more sensitive, and prolonged use of potent corticosteroids on the face can lead to adverse effects. The use of Mometasone Furoate Cream on children should be done under the guidance of a healthcare provider. Children's skin is more sensitive and can absorb medications differently. A doctor's recommendation is important.

Composition:  Cefepime (500mg) MAXICEF 500MD INJECTION contains Cefepime which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used to treat bacterial infections of the respiratory tract, urinary tract, genital tract, skin and soft tissues, stomach, biliary tract, blood and the brain. It can also be used in combination with other antibiotics to treat fever among patients who have low white blood cells in the body.  Before receiving MAXICEF 500MD INJECTION inform your doctor if you have a history of asthma or allergic conditions (such as hay fever). You must also inform your doctor if you have any kidney problems as a precaution. Talk to your before receiving MAXICEF 500MD INJECTION if you are pregnant or breastfeeding.     Treatment of Severe bacterial infections Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Maxicef 500mg Injection is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Talk to your doctor before receiving MAXICEF 500MD INJECTION if you are allergic to cefepime or to any other beta-lactam antibiotics (Ex. amoxicillin). MAXICEF 500MD INJECTION should be used in pregnant women only if it is considered necessary by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor for advice before receiving it. MAXICEF 500MD INJECTION should be used with caution among breastfeeding women. Therefore, consult your doctor before receiving it.
Side Effects: Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness) | Diarrhea | Increased white blood cell count (eosinophils) | Injection site phlebitis | Skin rash | Increased liver enzymes | Positive Coombs test | Increased prothrombin time | Decreased phosphate level in blood | Increased partial thromboplastin time (PTT) |

Uses: Composition:  Amikacin (250mg) MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION contains Amikacin which belongs to a group of medicines called Aminoglycoside Antibiotic. It is used in the treatment of serious infections caused by the bacteria that are sensitive to amikacin such as respiratory tract and lung infections, gastrointestinal infections, inflammation of the inner lining of the heart, infected burns, or bacterial infections of the blood.  MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION should be used with caution in pregnant and breast-feeding women only if considered necessary. Contact your doctor before receiving it. Caution must be exercised while using MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION in premature or new-born infants. MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION should be used with caution in elderly patients above the age of 60 years. Consult your doctor before receiving it It is used in the treatment of serious infections caused by the bacteria that are sensitive to amikacin Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Mikacin 250mg Injection is an antibiotic. It stops bacterial growth by preventing synthesis of essential proteins required by bacteria to carry out vital functions Do not receive MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to amikacin or any other aminoglycoside or allergic to sulphites or to other ingredients of this medicine. MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION should be used with caution in pregnant women only if considered necessary. Contact your doctor before receiving MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION. MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION should be used with caution in breast feeding women only if considered necessary as it is not known if it is excreted into breast milk. Contact your doctor before receiving MIKACIN 250MG INJECTION.
Side Effects: Increased blood urea | Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness) |

Uses: Levocetirizine syrup is commonly used to relieve the following allergy symptoms: Common side effects of Levocetirizine syrup may include drowsiness, headache, dry mouth, and fatigue. The dosage of Levocetirizine syrup may vary based on the age, weight, and severity of symptoms of the patient. It is typically taken orally, and the dosing instructions are provided by the healthcare professional. Levocetirizine works by blocking the H1 histamine receptors on cells throughout the body.By binding to the H1 receptors, Levocetirizine prevents histamine from attaching to these receptors. As a result, it inhibits the effects of histamine, leading to a reduction in allergy symptoms. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it's close to the time of the next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to catch up. Levocetirizine is considered a non-sedating antihistamine. While it is less likely to cause drowsiness compared to older antihistamines, some individuals may still experience mild drowsiness. Levocetirizine syrup typically starts working within one to three hours after ingestion, depending on individual metabolism and the severity of allergy symptoms.
Side Effects: -Seasonal Allergic Rhinitis | -Perennial Allergic Rhinitis | -Itching and hives |

Uses: Composition:  Granisetron (1mg/5ml) GRANDEM SYRUP contains a medicine Granisetron which belongs to a group of medicines called Anti-emetics. It is used to prevent or treat nausea (feeling sick) and vomiting (being sick) caused by other medical treatments such as chemotherapy or radiation treatment for cancer and after surgery.  Before taking GRANDEM SYRUP inform your doctor if you have heart diseases, blockage in your stomach or intestines, electrolyte abnormalities, galactose intolerance, lactase deficiency or glucose-galactose malabsorption. GRANDEM SYRUP is not recommended for use in pregnant and breast-feeding women. Consult with your doctor before taking. GRANDEM SYRUP should not be used in children below 2 years of age. GRANDEM SYRUP can be used in elderly people (65 years and older). However, consult with your doctor before taking.    Nausea and vomiting due to chemotherapy Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Measure it with a measuring cup and take it by mouth. Shake well before use. Grandem Syrup may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Grandem Syrup is an antiemetic medication. It works by blocking the action of a chemical messenger (serotonin) in the brain that may cause nausea and vomiting during anti-cancer treatment (chemotherapy) or after surgery. If you miss a dose of Grandem Syrup, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is not known whether it is safe to consume alcohol with Grandem Syrup. Please consult your doctor. Grandem Syrup is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Grandem Syrup is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Weakness | Headache | Constipation | Diarrhea | Insomnia (difficulty in sleeping) |

Uses: Composition:  Cefuroxime (1.5gm) Forcef 1.5gm Injection is an antibiotic medicine used to treat bacterial infections in your body. It is effective in infections of the lungs (e.g. pneumonia), ear, throat, nasal sinus, urinary tract, skin, soft tissues, bones, and joints. It is also used to prevent infections during surgery. Forcef 1.5gm Injection is given as a drip (intravenous infusion) or as an injection directly into a vein or a muscle under the supervision of a healthcare professional. Your doctor will decide the correct dose for you. Before using it, you should tell your doctor if you are allergic to any antibiotics, and if you have any liver or kidney problems. You should also let your doctor know all other medicines you are taking as they may affect, or be affected by this medicine. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should consult their doctor before using it. Treatment of Bacterial infections   Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Forcef 1.5gm Injection is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Do not receive FORCEF 1.5MG INJECTION if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Cefuroxime, cephalosporin, penicillin, monobactams, carbapenems or to any other ingredients of this medicine. The safety of FORCEF 1.5MG INJECTION during pregnancy has not been clearly established. The use of this medicine in pregnant women requires that the potential benefit from the drug be weighed against the possible risk to the mother and fetus. Consult your doctor before receiving the medicine. FORCEF 1.5MG INJECTION should be used with caution during breastfeeding as it may pass into the breast milk. Consult your doctor before receiving the medicine.

Uses: - Bacterial infections: It can be used for avoiding and treating several conditions caused by the bacteria. It is administered as prophylaxis for several infections as well as for treatment of bacterial infections such as : Urinary tract infections, Septicemia, Respiratory tract infections, etc. - Irritation at the injecting site. - Low urine output. - Nausea - Allergic Reactions It is administered by a healthcare professional under a healthcare setting. It works by disrupting the cell wall growth of bacteria which results in death of harmful bacterias. Alcohol consumption should be avoided during use of cefuroxime as it can cause various harsh side effects. Consultation with a Physician is very important before using Cefuroxime , If you are pregnant or breastfeeding. No, Oratil injection is only intended to be used parenterally. You can find various other formulations such as tablets, capsules, syrups to be used orally.

Treats various bacterial infections caused by susceptible organisms. It is effective in treating severe infections such as: Complicated intra-abdominal infections, respiratory tract infections, urinary tract infections, skin and soft tissue infections, and other serious bacterial infections. Common side effects may include gastrointestinal disturbances, skin rashes, and allergic reactions. If any severe or persistent side effects occur, seek medical attention promptly. It is usually administered by intravenous (IV) injection or infusion. The dosage, frequency, and duration of treatment will be determined by a healthcare professional based on the specific infection being treated and the patient's condition. Ceftriaxone is a broad-spectrum cephalosporin antibiotic that inhibits bacterial cell wall synthesis, leading to the destruction of susceptible bacteria. Sulbactam is a beta-lactamase inhibitor that protects ceftriaxone from being broken down by beta-lactamase enzymes produced by certain bacteria. This enhances the effectiveness of ceftriaxone against beta-lactamase-producing bacteria. KEFTRAGARD 1500 INJECTION should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before receiving KEFTRAGARD 1500 INJECTION. KEFTRAGARD 1500 INJECTION should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before receiving. Ceftriaxone+Sulbactam may interact with other medications, especially other antibiotics and drugs that affect the liver or kidney function. It's essential to inform your healthcare provider about all medications and supplements you are taking to avoid potential drug interactions.

Composition:  Ceftriaxone (1000mg) + Sulbactam (500mg) Monocef-SB 1g Injection is a combination medicine. It is prescribed to treat various types of bacterial infections. It fights against the microorganisms to prevent their growth and further spread of the infection. Monocef-SB 1g Injection should only be administered under the supervision of a healthcare professional. Before taking this medicine, you should tell your doctor if you are taking any medicines for any health condition. Pregnant or breastfeeding women should also consult with their doctor before taking it. Bacterial infections Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Monocef-SB 1g Injection is a combination of two medicines: Ceftriaxone and Sulbactam. Ceftriaxone is an antibiotic. It works by preventing the formation of the bacterial protective covering which is essential for the survival of bacteria. Sulbactam is a beta-lactamase inhibitor which reduces resistance and enhances the activity of Ceftriaxone against bacteria. Do not receive MONOCEF SB 1GM INJECTION if you are allergic to ceftriaxone, sulbactam or to penicillin or similar antibiotics like carbapenems or monobactams or lidocaine or to any of the other ingredients of this medicine. MONOCEF SB 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before receiving MONOCEF SB 1GM INJECTION. MONOCEF SB 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before receiving.
Side Effects: Increased white blood cell count (eosinophils) | Decreased white blood cell count (lymphocytes) | Low blood platelets | Rash | Diarrhea | Increased liver enzymes | Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness) |

Uses: Composition: Ceftriaxone (1000mg) + Sulbactam (500mg) GRAMOCEF S 1.5GM INJECTION is a combination of Ceftriaxone and Sulbactam which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used in the treatment of infections of the brain (meningitis), lungs, middle ear, abdomen and abdominal wall (peritonitis), urinary tract and kidneys, bones and joints, skin or soft tissues, blood, and heart. GRAMOCEF S 1.5GM INJECTION can also be used to treat specific sexually transmitted infections (gonorrhoea and syphilis), patients with low white blood cell counts (neutropenia) who have fever due to bacterial infection, Lyme disease (caused by tick bites) and to prevent infections during surgery Bacterial infections Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Gramocef-S Injection is a combination of two medicines: Ceftriaxone and Sulbactam. Ceftriaxone is an antibiotic. It works by preventing the formation of the bacterial protective covering which is essential for the survival of bacteria. Sulbactam is a beta-lactamase inhibitor which reduces resistance and enhances the activity of Ceftriaxone against bacteria. Consuming alcohol with Gramocef-S Injection does not cause any harmful side effects. Gramocef-S Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Gramocef-S Injection should be used with caution during breastfeeding. Breastfeeding should be held until the treatment of the mother is completed and the drug is eliminated from her body.
Side Effects: Increased white blood cell count (eosinophils) | Decreased white blood cell count (lymphocytes) | Low blood platelets | Rash | Diarrhea | Increased liver enzymes | Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness) |

Uses: Composition: Ampicillin (500mg) + Cloxacillin (500mg) MEGAPEN 1GM INJECTION is a combination of Ampicillin and Cloxacillin which belongs to the group of medicines called Penicillin Antibiotics. It is used to treat respiratory tract infections, bacterial meningitis, septicaemia, endocarditis, urinary tract infections, pelvic infections, skin and soft tissue infections, gastrointestinal infections, infected wounds or lung infections after surgery, puerperal fever, ear, nose and throat infections in moderately severe and severe infections and for patients who are unable to take the oral forms. Before receiving MEGAPEN 1GM INJECTION inform your doctor if you have liver or kidney disease. MEGAPEN 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in pregnant women. Contact your doctor before receiving. MEGAPEN 1GM INJECTION is generally not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through the breast milk. Contact your doctor before receiving. Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Megapen 1 gm Injection is a combination of two antibiotics: Ampicillin and Cloxacillin. These antibiotics work by preventing the formation of the bacterial protective covering which is essential for the survival of bacteria. Together, they treat your infection effectively. Consuming alcohol with Megapen 1 gm Injection does not cause any harmful side effects. Megapen 1 gm Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Megapen 1 gm Injection is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Uses: Composition: Aztreonam (1gm) AZENAM 1GM INJECTION contains Aztreonam which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used to treat serious bacterial infections such as urinary tract infections (including pyelonephritis and cystitis and asymptomatic bacteriuria), lower respiratory tract infections (including pneumonia and bronchitis), bacteraemia/septicemia, bone and joint infections, skin and skin-structure infections (including those associated with postoperative wounds, ulcers and burns). AZENAM 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in patients with liver, kidney disease and fits. AZENAM 1GM INJECTION is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women unless it is considered clearly necessary. It is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before receiving it. AZENAM 1GM INJECTION should be used with caution in new born older than one week and in elderly patients. Consult your doctor before receiving AZENAM 1GM INJECTION.     Severe bacterial infections Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Azenam 1gm Injection is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Consuming alcohol with Azenam 1gm Injection does not cause any harmful side effects. Azenam 1gm Injection is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Azenam 1gm Injection is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.
Side Effects: Rash | Injection site reactions (pain, swelling, redness) | Vomiting | Nausea | Diarrhea |

Uses: Composition: Amoxicillin 125mg Amoxicillin is indicated in the treatment of infections due to susceptible ß-lactamase negative strains of microorganisms. These infections include ear, nose and throat infections (i.e. otitis media, sinusitis, tonsillitis, pharyngitis, laryngitis),lower respiratory tract infections (i.e. pneumonia, acute and chronic bronchitis lung abscess, empyema, bronchiectasis)skin and soft tissue infections (i.e. cellulitis, carbuncles, furunculosis, infected wounds, abscess), genito-urinary tract infections (i.e. pyelonephritis, cystitis and urethritis). It is also indicated in combination with Clarithromycin and Lansoprazole (as triple therapy), for the treatment of patients with H. pylori infection and duodenal ulcer disease and to reduce the risk of duodenal ulcer recurrence.   Common side effects: Amoxicillin is a broad spectrum penicillin. It is effective against a wide range of Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria. It acts through the inhibition of biosynthesis of cell wall. Amoxicillin is stable in the presence of gastric acid and is rapidly absorbed after oral administration. After an oral dose, peak plasma concentration of Amoxicillin is reached within 1 to 2 hours. Amoxicillin is widely distributed at varying concentration in body tissues and fluids.  Drinking alcohol when you are taking Amoxicillin does not affect the way this medicine works. However, you should avoid drinking large quantities of alcohol while taking this medicine, as alcohol may worsen the side effects and impair your recovery from the infection. There is limited information about the safety of this medicine in pregnancy. Your doctor will prescribe you this medicine only if considered essential after assessing the benefits over risks. Amoxicillin passes into breast milk in small amounts and can harm your baby.Caution is advised incase you are breastfeeding
Side Effects: Ear, nose and throat infections (i.e. otitis media, sinusitis, tonsillitis, pharyngitis, laryngitis) | Lower respiratory tract infections (i.e. pneumonia, acute and chronic bronchitis lung abscess, empyema, bronchiectasis) | Skin and soft tissue infections (i.e. cellulitis, carbuncles, furunculosis, infected wounds, abscess) | Genito-urinary tract infections (i.e. pyelonephritis, cystitis and urethritis) | Venereal disease (i.e. acute uncomplicated gonorrhoea) | In dental abscess, it is used as short-term therapy. | It is also indicated in combination with Clarithromycin and Lansoprazole (as triple therapy), for the treatment of patients with H. pylori infection and duodenal ulcer disease and to reduce the risk of duodenal ulcer recurrence. | Diarrhoea | Indigestion | Occasionally rash. | Pseudo-membranous colitis has been reported rarely. |

Uses: Composition: Tobramycin (80mg)  Tobacin 80mg Injection is an antibiotic used to prevent or treat a wide variety of bacterial infections. This may include infections of the urinary tract, bones and joints, lungs (e.g., pneumonia), brain (e.g., meningitis), blood, abdominal organs, and some others. Tobacin 80mg Injection may also be used in hospitalized patients to prevent infections. It works by stopping the growth of bacteria. It is given as a drip (intravenous infusion) or as an injection directly into a vein or a muscle under the supervision of a healthcare professional. Your doctor may monitor you with regular kidney function tests, hearing tests, and urine tests during treatment. Consult your doctor if any of the side effects bother you or if your condition does not improve. This medication is not recommended for use during pregnancy. Inform your doctor if you are pregnant, planning to conceive, or breastfeeding. Treatment of Bacterial eye infections  Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Tobacin 80mg Injection is an antibiotic. It stops bacterial growth by preventing synthesis of essential proteins required by bacteria to carry out vital functions. Do not receive TOBACIN if you are allergic to Tobramycin or any other ingredients of this medicine. TOBACIN is not recommended for use in pregnant woman or women planning to have a baby unless recommended by the doctor as it can harm the unborn baby. Consult your doctor before receiving TOBACIN. TOBACIN is not recommended for use in breastfeeding woman as it passes into the breastmilk. Consult your doctor before receiving TOBACIN.
Side Effects: Upset stomach | Eye irritation | Burning sensation | Eye redness | Eye itching |

Due to this a sufficient amount of the nutrients will be received by the organs and tissues.

Uses: Composition:  Cefotaxime (500mg) OMNICEF 500MG INJECTION contains Cefotaxime which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used to treat serious bacterial infections such as blood stream (septicemia), bones (osteomyelitis), heart valves (endocarditis), membranes covering the brain (meningitis) and lining of the abdomen (peritonitis), lungs (pneumonia), skin and soft tissue, urinary tract, genitals (including gonorrhea), blood (bacteremia), Lyme disease (borreliosis), an infection primarily caused by tick bites and also to prevent and treat infections following surgical operations. Before receiving this OMNICEF 500MG INJECTION, inform your doctor if you have liver, kidney problems or high blood pressure. Consult your doctor for advice. It kills the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Do not receive OMNICEF 500MG INJECTION if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Cefotaxime or any other ingredients of this medicine. OMNICEF 500MG INJECTION should be used with caution in pregnant women unless considered necessary. Consult your doctor before receiving this medicine. OMNICEF 500MG INJECTION is not recommended for use in breast feeding women. Consult your doctor before receiving this medicine.

Uses: Composition: Liposomal Amphotericin B (50mg)  PHOSOME 50MG INJECTION contains Amphotericin B which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-fungal agents. PHOSOME 50MG INJECTION is used to treat invasive fungal infections in patients who are resistant/intolerant to conventional Amphotericin B therapy. Phosome 50mg Injection is an antifungal medication. It is used in the treatment of severe fungal infections and leishmaniasis. It kills fungi by destroying the fungal cell membrane. This way it helps treat the condition.  Phosome 50mg Injection is generally administered by a doctor or a nurse. You should not self-administer this medicine at home. The dose and duration of the treatment will depend on the severity of your condition. You should get the injection as long as your doctor has prescribed it.  Common side effects: Decreased potassium level in blood Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Phosome 50mg Injection is an antifungal medication. It kills fungi by destroying the fungal cell membrane. Do not receive PHOSOME 50MG INJECTION if you are allergic to Amphotericin B, and/or any other ingredients of this medicine. PHOSOME 50MG INJECTION should be administered with caution in pregnant women only if it is clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before receiving the medicine. PHOSOME 50MG INJECTION should be administered with caution in breastfeeding women only if it is clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before receiving the medicine.
Side Effects: Treatment of Severe fungal infections | Treatment of Leishmaniasis. | Nausea | Vomiting | Chills | Fever |

Uses:
Composition:  Fluticasone Propionate (125mcg)  Flohale 125mcg Inhaler belongs to a group of medicines called steroids. It is used to prevent and treat asthma. It prevents the cells in the lungs and breathing passages from releasing substances that cause inflammation of the airways. This widens the airways and makes breathing easier.  Flohale 125mcg Inhaler should be taken in the dose and duration as directed by your doctor. The effect of this medicine may be noticeable after a few days but will only reach its maximum after a few weeks. This medicine must be used regularly to be effective, so you should continue taking it even if you do not have any symptoms. If you stop taking it, your asthma may get worse. Common side effects: Check the label for directions before use. Shake the inhaler. While you are breathing in from mouth, press down on the inhaler one time to release the medication and hold your breath for 10 seconds. Repeat until you have inhaled the number of puffs as suggested by the doctor.Afterwards, rinse your mouth thoroughly with water and spit it out.  Flohale 125mcg Inhaler is a steroid. It prevents the cells in the lungs and breathing passages from releasing chemical messengers that cause inflammation (swelling) of the airways. This widens the airways and makes breathing easier. Interaction with alcohol is unknown. It is advisable to consult your doctor before consumption. Flohale 125mcg Inhaler may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.
warnings Flohale 125mcg Inhaler is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Severe allergic reactions | Treatment of Skin conditions with inflammation & itching | Upper respiratory tract infection | Sinus infection | Throat irritation | Bronchitis (inflammation of the airways) | Voice change |

Uses: Composition: Levosalbutamol (50mcg) + Beclometasone (50mcg)  AEROCORT INHALER is a combination of Beclomethasone and Levosalbutamol which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-asthmatic drugs. It is used to treat and prevent asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It relieves wheezing, shortness of breath, coughing and chest tightness caused due to narrowing of airways. Before using AEROCORT INHALER inform your doctor if you have any lung infections, liver problems, kidney problems or heart problems. You must also inform your doctor if you have diabetes, hypertension, fits, thyroid problems or currently taking or recently took any other steroid medication as a precaution. Asthma Common side effects: Hoarseness of voiceHeadacheDizzinessPharyngitisVomitingBronchitis (inflammation of the airways)Dryness in mouthCough Check the label for directions before use. Shake the inhaler. While you are breathing in from mouth, press down on the inhaler one time to release the medication and hold your breath for 10 seconds. Repeat until you have inhaled the number of puffs as suggested by the doctor.Afterwards, rinse your mouth thoroughly with water and spit it out. Aerocort Inhaler is a combination of two medicines: Levosalbutamol and Beclometasone. Levosalbutamol is a bronchodilator which works by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widens the airways. Beclometasone is a steroid medicine. It acts by stopping the release of certain natural substances in body that cause inflammation (swelling) of the airways. Together, they make breathing easier. Aerocort Inhaler may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Aerocort Inhaler is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby. Do not use AEROCORT INHALER if you are allergic to levosalbutamol or beclomethasone dipropionate.
Side Effects: Application site irritation | Nausea | Gastrointestinal motility disorder | Thrush | Throat irritation |

Uses: Composition: Tibolone (2.5mg)  Tibofem Tablet is a female sex hormone (estrogen). This is a type of hormone replacement therapy (HRT) that is used to treat symptoms associated with menopause (hot flushes, vaginal dryness, and itching), estrogen deficiency, and thinning of bones (osteoporosis). Tibofem Tablet can be taken with or without food, but better to take it at a fixed time each day for better efficacy. It should be swallowed whole with water. The dose and duration will be decided by your doctor so that you get the right amount to control your symptoms. If you have missed a dose, take it as soon as you remember it. Do not skip any dose and finish the full course of treatment. The treatment should not be stopped abruptly without consulting your doctor as this may affect the potency of this medicine. Common side effects:  Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Tibofem Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Tibofem Tablet is a hormonal medication. It has effects similar to estrogen, progesterone and androgen. It substitutes for the loss of estrogen production in postmenopausal women and treats menopausal symptoms such as hot flashes, night sweats and vaginal problems. It also prevents bone loss following menopause. TIBOFEM TABLET is not recommended for use during pregnancy and in women planning for pregnancy since it is intended to be used only in postmenopausal women. Consult your doctor before taking the medicine and stop the medicine immediately if you become pregnant or think you may be pregnan TIBOFEM TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it is intended to be used only in postmenopausal women. Consult your doctor before taking TIBOFEM TABLET. Do not take TIBOFEM TABLET if you are allergic to Tibolone, and/or any other ingredients of this medicine.
Side Effects: Hormone replacement therapy | Post menopausal osteoporosis | Breast pain | Vaginal bleeding | Weight gain | Abnormal hair growth | Breast tenderness | Cervical thickening | Endometrial hyperplasia | Genital itching | Lower abdominal pain | Pelvic pain | Vaginal discharge |

Uses: Composition: Piroxicam (0.5% w/w)  Pirox Gel is a pain relieving medicine. It is applied topically to treat moderate to severe pain. It helps relieve pain and swelling or various joints and muscles. Pirox Gel is only meant for external use and should be used strictly as advised by your doctor. A thin layer of the medicine should be massaged into the affected areas with clean and dry hands. Avoid getting in contact with your eyes, nose, or mouth. In case of accidental contact, you should rinse it thoroughly with plenty of water.  Before using the medicine, it is important to tell your doctor if you are using or have recently used any other medicines for the same disease or other diseases. To make sure the medicine is safe, pregnant and breastfeeding women should consult their doctor before using the medicine. Pain relief Common side effects: No common side effects seen This medicine is for external use only. Use it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Clean and dry the affected area and apply the gel. Wash your hands after applying, unless hands are the affected area. Pirox Gel is a non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID). It works by blocking the release of certain chemical messengers that are responsible for inflammation (pain and swelling). Do not take PIROX GEL if you are allergic to Piroxicam. Pirox Gel may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Uses: Composition: Oxybutynin (5mg)  Oxyspas 5 Tablet is used in the treatment of overactive bladder. It relieves urinary symptoms like frequent urination, urgent need to urinate, and inability to control urination. Oxyspas 5 Tablet is advised to take it in a dose and duration as per prescription. It should be taken on an empty stomach at least an hour before having a meal. Swallow the medicine as a whole without crushing or chewing it. You should not stop taking the medicine without consulting the doctor as it may lead to the worsening of your symptoms.  Before receiving the treatment, inform your doctor if you are on any medication for any other health condition. To make sure it is safe for you, let your doctor also know if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. Common side effects: Dryness in mouthConstipationDiarrhea Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Oxyspas 5 Tablet is to be taken empty stomach. Oxyspas 5 Tablet is an antimuscarinic. It works by relaxing muscles of the urinary bladder and prevents frequent, urgent or uncontrolled urination. If you miss a dose of Oxyspas 5 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Oxyspas 5 Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Oxyspas 5 Tablet is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Oxyspas 5 Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Treatment of Overactive bladder (OAB) symptoms | Blurred vision | Dry skin | Dizziness | Headache | Sleepiness |

Uses: Composition:  Mifepristone (200mg)  MT Pill Tablet is an anti-progestational steroid class of drug used for medical termination of pregnancy. It works by blocking the action of progesterone, an essential hormone for the development of pregnancy. Before taking this medicine, tell your doctor if you have ever had an ectopic pregnancy, or you are breastfeeding or using an intrauterine device. Your doctor should also know about all other medicines you are taking as many of these may make this medicine less effective or change the way it works. You must avoid strenuous activity like heavy exercise, running, and driving while abortion as it can affect the bleeding. Your doctor may perform an ultrasound or pelvic examination to check for abortion completion Medical abortion Common side effects: Nausea Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. MT Pill Tablet is to be taken with food. MT Pill Tablet blocks the effects of progesterone, a natural female hormone which is needed for the pregnancy to sustain. Without this hormone, the lining of the uterus (womb) breaks down as it does during a menstrual period and stops the growth of the pregnancy. MT Pill Tablet is highly unsafe to use during pregnancy. Seek your doctor's advice as studies on pregnant women and animals have shown significant harmful effects to the developing baby. MT Pill Tablet is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with MT Pill Tablet.
Side Effects: Vomiting | Uterine cramps | Diarrhea | Infection following abortion | Uterine bleeding |

Uses: Composition:  Mifepristone (200mg) + Misoprostol (200mcg)  Mtp Kit is a combination of two medicines, which is used for medical abortion (terminating a pregnancy). This medicine blocks the action of progesterone, a female hormone required to maintain pregnancy and induce contractions in the uterus, which further helps in abortion.  Before taking this medicine, tell your doctor if you have ever had an ectopic pregnancy, or you are breastfeeding or using an intrauterine device. Your doctor should also know about all other medicines you are taking as many of these may make this medicine less effective or change the way it works.  You must avoid strenuous activity like heavy exercise, running and driving while abortion as it can affect the bleeding. Your doctor may perform an ultrasound or pelvic examination to check for abortion completion.

Used to treat: Rheumatoid arthritis, a chronic inflammatory disorder that affects the joints. It helps reduce joint pain, swelling, and stiffness, and also slows down the progression of joint damage in rheumatoid arthritis. It is usually taken orally, once daily, with or without food. Your healthcare provider will determine the appropriate dosage and duration of treatment for your condition. Leflunomide helps in reducing the autoimmune response that causes inflammation and joint damage in rheumatoid arthritis. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it is close to the time of your next scheduled dose. In that case, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. It's best to avoid alcohol consumption while taking Leflunomide. Alcohol can increase the risk of liver side effects, and since Leflunomide can also affect the liver, combining the two may exacerbate liver problems. Leflunomide is not recommended during pregnancy, as it may harm the unborn baby. If you are planning to become pregnant or suspect you may be pregnant, inform your healthcare provider immediately. Inform all healthcare providers involved in your care that you are taking Leflunomide. Be vigilant about any signs of infection and report them promptly to your healthcare provider. Wash your hands regularly and avoid close contact with individuals who have infections, as Leflunomide may weaken the immune system. Hair loss is a possible side effect of Leflunomide. If you experience significant hair loss or any concerning side effects, inform your healthcare provider.
Side Effects: -Diarrhea | -Nausea | -Headache | -Hair loss |

Uses:
Lefrais an immunosuppressive disease-modifying antirheumatic drug, used in active moderate-to-severe rheumatoid arthritis and psoriatic arthritis. It is a pyrimidine synthesis inhibitor that works by inhibiting dihydroorotate dehydrogenase. Using this medicine may cause some common side effects such as nausea, headache, dyspepsia, rash, diarrhea, increased liver enzymes, and respiratory tract infection. Consult with your doctor if any of these side effects do not go away with time or get worse. Your doctor may help with ways to reduce or prevent these symptoms   Lefra is primarily used for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis, an autoimmune condition that causes joint inflammation, pain, and stiffness. The medication is specifically indicated for adults with active rheumatoid arthritis. It helps to alleviate the signs and symptoms of the disease and improve overall joint function and quality of life. Some common symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis that Lefra can help address include: Joint pain: Lefra can help reduce joint pain, making movement and daily activities more comfortable. Joint swelling: Lefra can help reduce inflammation in the joints, leading to a decrease in joint swelling. Morning stiffness: Rheumatoid arthritis often causes morning stiffness, making it difficult to move the joints after waking up. Lefra can help alleviate morning stiffness, allowing for easier movement. Joint damage prevention: By reducing inflammation and suppressing the immune response, Lefra can help slow down the progression of joint damage associated with rheumatoid arthritis. It is important to note that Lefra is used specifically for rheumatoid arthritis and is not indicated for other forms of arthritis or conditions. The use of Lefra should be under the supervision and guidance of a healthcare professional who will determine the appropriate dosage and duration of treatment based on individual needs and response. The use of Lefra (Leflunomide) for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis offers several benefits. Here are some of the key benefits associated with Lefra: Reduction of Joint Inflammation: Lefra helps to reduce joint inflammation, which is a hallmark symptom of rheumatoid arthritis. By suppressing the immune response that causes inflammation, Lefra can alleviate pain, swelling, and stiffness in the affected joints. Improved Joint Function: With reduced inflammation, Lefra can help improve joint function and mobility. It allows individuals with rheumatoid arthritis to engage in daily activities more comfortably and with less pain. Disease Modification: Lefra is classified as a disease-modifying antirheumatic drug (DMARD). It has the potential to slow down the progression of rheumatoid arthritis and prevent further joint damage. By inhibiting the activity of immune cells involved in the inflammatory process, Lefra can help protect the joints from ongoing damage. Improved Quality of Life: Rheumatoid arthritis can significantly impact an individual's quality of life due to chronic pain, limited mobility, and functional impairment. Lefra's ability to reduce inflammation, relieve pain, and improve joint function can enhance overall well-being and quality of life for individuals with rheumatoid arthritis. Combination Therapy: Lefra can be used in combination with other medications for rheumatoid arthritis, such as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) or corticosteroids. This combination approach may provide enhanced symptom relief and disease management. It is important to note that the specific benefits and outcomes can vary among individuals, and the effectiveness of Lefra may depend on various factors, including the severity of the disease and individual response. It is crucial to consult with a healthcare professional who can assess your condition and guide you on the most appropriate treatment options for your specific needs. Lefra (Leflunomide) may cause several side effects, although not everyone experiences them. Common side effects of Lefra include: Gastrointestinal Issues: These can include diarrhea, nausea, vomiting, stomach pain, and indigestion. Taking Lefra with food or dividing the daily dose can help reduce these symptoms. Hair Loss: Some individuals may experience hair thinning or hair loss while taking Lefra. This side effect is usually reversible once the medication is discontinued. Skin Reactions: Skin rash, itching, and dryness are possible side effects. Severe skin reactions, although rare, can occur. It is important to promptly inform your healthcare professional if you develop any skin-related issues. Elevated Liver Enzymes: Lefra can affect liver function and lead to increased liver enzymes in some individuals. Regular monitoring of liver function is typically recommended during treatment. Respiratory Issues: Lefra may cause respiratory symptoms such as coughing, difficulty breathing, or lung inflammation in rare cases. If you experience any respiratory issues, it is important to seek medical attention. Headache and Dizziness: Some individuals may experience headaches or dizziness while taking Lefra. Hypertension (High Blood Pressure): Lefra can sometimes lead to an increase in blood pressure. Regular monitoring of blood pressure is advisable during treatment. Blood Disorders: Rarely, Lefra may cause a decrease in the number of certain blood cells, such as white blood cells or platelets. Regular blood tests may be recommended to monitor for these potential effects. It is important to discuss any potential side effects with your healthcare professional before starting Lefra. They can provide personalized information based on your medical history and assess the benefits versus risks of the medication. If you experience severe or persistent side effects while taking Lefra, it is important to seek medical advice promptly. he main mechanism of action of Lefra is its ability to suppress the activity of the immune system. It works by inhibiting the proliferation of certain immune cells, particularly T cells, which are involved in the inflammatory process seen in rheumatoid arthritis. By reducing the activity of these cells, Lefra helps to alleviate joint inflammation and associated symptoms. If you forget to take a dose of Lefra (Leflunomide), it is generally recommended to take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, it is better to skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. It is important to maintain consistent use of Lefra for optimal effectiveness. If you frequently forget to take your medication or have difficulty remembering, consider using reminder tools such as setting alarms, using pill organizers, or incorporating it into your daily routine. If you are uncertain about what to do when you miss a dose or have concerns about your dosing schedule, it is best to consult your healthcare professional for guidance. They can provide specific instructions based on your individual circumstances and advise you on the best course of action. Regular monitoring of blood tests, including liver function tests and complete blood counts, may be required while taking Lefra to ensure its safe use and detect any potential side effects Pregnancy and Contraception: Lefra can cause harm to an unborn baby, so it is important to avoid pregnancy while taking Lefra and for a certain period after stopping the medication. Effective contraception methods should be used during treatment and for a recommended duration afterwards. Consult your healthcare professional for specific guidance. Liver Function Monitoring: Lefra can affect liver function, so regular monitoring of liver enzymes is typically recommended during treatment. Inform your healthcare professional if you experience any symptoms of liver problems, such as jaundice (yellowing of the skin or eyes), dark urine, or persistent abdominal pain.

Taking the medication with food or dividing the dose throughout the day may help alleviate these symptoms. Skin reactions: Skin rash, itching, and hair loss (alopecia) are possible side effects of Lefra 10. These reactions are usually mild and reversible upon discontinuation of the medication. The specific dosage and instructions for using Lefra 10 (Leflunomide) should be provided by your healthcare professional, as they will consider factors such as your medical condition and individual needs 2 / 2 Lefra 10 (Leflunomide) works by modulating the immune system to reduce inflammation and suppress the overactive immune response associated with autoimmune conditions, particularly rheumatoid arthritis. It exerts its effects through several mechanisms: Inhibition of dihydroorotate dehydrogenase (DHODH): Lefra 10 inhibits the activity of DHODH, an enzyme involved in the synthesis of pyrimidines, which are essential for the replication of immune cells. By interfering with this process, Lefra 10 helps to reduce the proliferation of activated immune cells, thereby dampening the inflammatory response. Suppression of T-cell activation: Lefra 10 inhibits the activation and maturation of T-cells, which play a key role in the immune response. By suppressing T-cell activity, Lefra 10 helps to reduce the production of inflammatory cytokines and other mediators involved in the autoimmune process. Modulation of immune cell function: Lefra 10 affects the function of various immune cells, including B-cells and natural killer cells, which are involved in the immune response and autoimmune processes. It helps to decrease the production of autoantibodies and reduce the attack on healthy tissues. By targeting these immune-related processes, Lefra 10 helps to alleviate the symptoms of autoimmune conditions such as rheumatoid arthritis and psoriatic arthritis, including joint pain, swelling, and stiffness. It also helps to slow down the progression of joint damage and preserve joint function. It's important to note that the exact mechanism of action of Lefra 10 is not fully understood, and its effects on the immune system may involve additional pathways. It is recommended to consult with a healthcare professional for a comprehensive understanding of how Lefra 10 works and its specific implications for your condition. If you forget to take a dose of Lefra 10 (Leflunomide), it's important to take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, it is generally recommended to skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a missed one. It's important to note that consistency in taking Lefra 10 is crucial for maintaining its effectiveness. Missing doses or irregular dosing may impact the medication's ability to control your symptoms and manage your condition effectively. If you find it difficult to remember to take your medication, consider setting reminders or using pill organizers to help you stay on track. If you frequently forget to take your medication or have concerns about missed doses, it is recommended to discuss this with your healthcare professional. They can provide guidance and discuss potential strategies to ensure consistent and effective use of Lefra 10 for your specific condition. Contraception: Lefra 10 can potentially cause harm to an unborn baby. If you are a woman of childbearing potential, effective contraception is necessary before, during, and after treatment with Lefra 10. It is generally recommended to avoid or limit alcohol intake while on this medication. Regular monitoring: Regular monitoring of liver function is typically recommended during treatment with Lefra 10. This may involve periodic blood tests to check liver enzymes and other liver function markers. It's important to attend these monitoring appointments as advised by your healthcare professional.
