Composition:  Fluorometholone (0.1% w/v)  Flomex Eye Drop belongs to a group of medicines called steroids. It is used to treat redness and swelling in the eyes that may be due to infection or allergy. It reduces swelling, itching, and soreness after any eye injuries or eye surgery. Flomex Eye Drop should be used in the dose and duration as directed by your doctor. Never use it if the seal is broken before you use it for the first time. Wash your hands thoroughly before applying the medicine. Make sure you remove contact lenses if you wear them and wait for at least 15 minutes before putting them back. Continue using it regularly to get the most benefit from it.       Common side effects: This medicine is for external use only. Use it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Hold the dropper close to the eye without touching it. Gently squeeze the dropper and place the medicine inside the lower eyelid. Wipe off the extra liquid. Flomex Eye Drop is a steroid. It works by blocking the release of certain chemical messengers (prostaglandins) that cause redness and swelling in the eye. Do not use FLOMEX if you are allergic to Fluorometholone or benzalkonium chloride or any of the other ingredients of this medicine. Flomex Eye Drop may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Flomex Eye Drop is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
To reduce the amount of Flomex Eye Drop that reaches the breastmilk, place pressure over the corner of the eye for 1 minute or more, then remove the excess solution with an absorbent tissue.
Side Effects: Redness and swelling in the eye | Eye irritation | Burning sensation | Watery eyes |

Uses: Composition: Flutamide (250mg)  CYTOMID 250MG TABLET contains Flutamide which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-androgens. CYTOMID 250MG TABLET is used in the treatment of prostate cancer, which is a type of cancer that occurs in the gland cells of prostate gland (male reproductive organ). CYTOMID 250MG TABLET is also used after surgical castration in affected individuals.  Before taking CYTOMID 250MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you are at a risk of developing osteoporosis (condition marked by brittle bones) or have a family history of osteoporosis, suffering from diabetes, any blood vessel condition, and/or have intolerance to certain sugars (such as lactose.), heart problems (such as heart rhythm disorders), liver and kidney problems. Prostate cancer Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Cytomid 250 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Cytomid 250 Tablet blocks the effect of the natural male hormones on the growth of prostate cells. Cytomid 250 Tablet also blocks the undesired effects of androgens in females such as excessive hair growth and acne. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking CYTOMID 250MG TABLET as it may alter the effect of the medicine. Do not take CYTOMID 250MG TABLET if you are allergic to Flutamide, and/or any other ingredients of this medicine.
Side Effects: Breast enlargement in male | Sleepiness | Nausea | Abdominal pain | Anemia (low number of red blood cells) | Breast tenderness | Constipation | Decreased appetite | Decreased libido | Depression | Dizziness | Indigestion | Flatulence | Hot flashes | Increased liver enzymes | Rash | Weakness | Weight gain | Vomiting |

Uses: Composition: Sodium Cromoglycate (2% w/v)  Cromal Eye Drops 5 ml belongs to a class of medicines called ‘anti-inflammatory or anti-allergic drugs’ used to treat eye redness, itchy and watery eyes caused by allergies such as hay fever, per hair and house dust mites. An allergy is an immune system response to foreign elements typically not harmful to your body. Eye allergy is when the eye becomes red and swollen, leading to inflammation, discomfort, and pain.  Cromal Eye Drops 5 ml contains Sodium cromoglycate that works by stabilising mast cells (immune cells) and prevents the release of histamine, a substance responsible for causing allergic reactions. Thus, it prevents allergic response and reduces allergic symptoms. Cromal Eye Drops 5 ml is only for ophthalmic use (eyes). You are advised to use Cromal Eye Drops 5 ml for as long as your doctor has prescribed it for you based on your medical condition.   Treatment of Allergic eye disease Common side effects: This medicine is for external use only. Take it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Hold the dropper close to the eye without touching it. Gently squeeze the dropper and place the medicine inside the lower eyelid. Wipe off extra liquid. Cromal Eye Drop is a mast cell stabilizer. It works on certain cells in the body (mast cells) to prevent them from releasing substances that cause allergic symptoms such as red, itchy and watery eyes.  Do not use if you are allergic to Sodium Cromoglycate  or any of the other ingredients of this medicine. Cromal Eye Drop is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies. Limited information is available. Therefore, please consult your doctor before using Cromal Eye Drops 5 ml if you are breastfeeding.
Side Effects: Stinging or burning in the eyes | Blurred vision | Eye irritation |

Uses: Composition: Latanoprost (0.005% w/v)  9 PM EYE DROPS contains Latanoprost which belongs to the group of medicines called Prostaglandin analogs. It is used to treat open angle glaucoma and ocular hypertension (both linked to increased pressure in the eye). Glaucoma is a group of diseases characterized by gradual damage to the optic nerve (nerves that carry visual messages), that may result in loss of vision. Prior to the treatment, your doctor may want you to take certain eye tests to understand your existing condition.  9 PM Eye Drop is suitable for adults and children and can be used by itself or in combination with other eye medicines to reduce pressure. Follow the instructions given by your doctor and use this medicine regularly to get the most benefit  GlaucomaOcular hypertension Common side effects:  This medicine is for external use only. Use it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Hold the dropper close to the eye without touching it. Gently squeeze the dropper and place the medicine inside the lower eyelid. Wipe off the extra liquid. 9 PM Eye Drop is a prostaglandin analogue. It works by increasing the outflow of aqueous humor, thereby lowering the increased eye pressure. Do not use 9 PM EYE DROPS if you are allergic to Latanoprost or any other ingredients of this medicine. 9 PM Eye Drop may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. 9 PM Eye Drop should be used with caution during breastfeeding. Breastfeeding should be held until the treatment of the mother is completed and the drug is eliminated from her body.
Side Effects: Eyelash changes | Eye pain | Increased sensitivity to light | Burning sensation in eye | Eye itching | Foreign body sensation | Itching | Stinging in the eyes | Conjunctival hyperemia |

Uses: Composition: Amlodipine (2.5mg) S-Amlong 2.5 Tablet belongs to a class of medicines known as calcium channel blockers. It is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and prevent angina (heart-related chest pain). It lowers blood pressure and reduces the heart's workload, which helps prevent heart attacks and strokes. S-Amlong 2.5 Tablet may be prescribed alone or along with other medicines. The dose depends on what you are taking it for and the severity of your condition. You can take it at any time of the day, with or without food, but it is best to take it at about the same time each day. You should take this medicine for as long as it is prescribed for you. Even if you feel well, do not stop this medicine on your own because high blood pressure often has no symptoms. If you stop taking it, your condition may get worse. Keeping yourself active with regular exercise, managing your weight, and eating a healthy diet will also help control your blood pressure. Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. S-Amlong 2.5 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. S-Amlong 2.5 Tablet is a calcium channel blocker. In high blood pressure, it normalizes the blood pressure by relaxing the blood vessels to reduce the pressure on them, thereby improving the blood flow in the body. In heart-related chest pain (angina), the enhanced blood flow in the body relaxes the heart muscles by reducing the workload on the heart. It also improves the oxygen flow in the body, thereby, preventing any heart-related chest pain. If you miss a dose of S-Amlong 2.5 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Caution is advised when consuming alcohol with S-Amlong 2.5 Tablet. Please consult your doctor. S-Amlong 2.5 Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. S-Amlong 2.5 Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Treatment of Hypertension (high blood pressure) | Prevention of Angina (heart-related chest pain) | Headache | Fatigue | Nausea | Abdominal pain | Sleepiness |

Uses: Composition:  Trimetazidine (20mg)  TRIVEDON 20MG TABLET contains Trimetazidine which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-anginal agents. It is used in adult patients for the management of angina pectoris (chest pain caused by a heart disease) along with other medicines. It protects the heart cells from the effects of a reduced oxygen supply during an episode of angina.  Trivedon 20 Tablet should be taken regularly as advised by the doctor. You should take it with or without food and at a fixed time. Your doctor will decide how often you should take this medicine. TRIVEDON 20MG TABLET is not recommended for use if you have parkinson disease (a brain disorder that affects movement (trembling, rigid posture, slow movements and a shuffling, unbalanced walk) or severe kidney problems.  Treatment of Angina (heart-related chest pain) Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Trivedon 20 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Trivedon 20 Tablet is an anti-anginal medication. It decreases the oxygen requirement of the heart by shifting its metabolism from fats to glucose. As a result, the heart works more efficiently If you miss a dose of Trivedon 20 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Trivedon 20 Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. TRIVEDON 20MG TABLET should not be taken during pregnancy unless clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before taking. TRIVEDON 20MG TABLET is not recommended in breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before taking.
Side Effects: Dizziness | Headache | Nausea | Vomiting | Weakness | Rash | Abdominal pain | Indigestion | Itching | Diarrhea | Hives |

Uses: Composition: Trimetazidine HCl 20mg Trimetazidine is indicated in adults as add-on therapy for the symptomatic treatment of patients with stable angina pectoris who are inadequately controlled by or intolerant to first-line antianginal therapies.  It is used : Common side effects: Always take this medicine exactly as your doctor has told you If you forget to take this medicine. If you forget to take one or more doses, do not take a double dose to make up for a forgotten dose If you stop taking this medicine. Trimetazidine HCl improves the energy metabolism of heart cells by shifting their energy source from fatty acids to glucose. By doing so, it enhances the efficiency of energy production in the heart muscle, particularly during periods of reduced blood flow. This helps protect the heart from damage and is beneficial in the treatment of angina pectoris and certain heart conditions. Inform your healthcare provider about your complete medical history, including any existing heart conditions, kidney or liver problems, or any other significant medical conditions. This information will help your doctor determine if Trimetazidine HCl is suitable for you. If you have known allergies or sensitivities to Trimetazidine HCl or any other medications, inform your healthcare provider before starting this medication. If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, discuss the risks and benefits of Trimetazidine HCl with your doctor before using it. The safety of this medication during pregnancy and breastfeeding is not well-established.
Side Effects: For the symptomatic treatment of patients with stable angina pectoris who are inadequately controlled by or intolerant to first-line antianginal therapies | Dizziness, Headache | Abdominal pain, Diarrhoea, Dyspepsia, Nausea and Vomiting | Rash, Pruritus, Urticarial | Asthenia |

Uses: Composition: Trimetazidine (20mg)  Carvidon 20 Tablet is an anti-anginal medicine used for treating heart-related chest pain (angina). It prevents new attacks of angina but does not stop an acute attack once it has started. It can be used alone or in combination with some other medicines. Carvidon 20 Tablet should be taken regularly as advised by the doctor. You should take it with or without food and at a fixed time. Your doctor will decide how often you should take this medicine. This may change from time to time depending on how well it is working. You should take this medicine regularly to get the most benefit, even if you feel fine. Treatment of Angina (heart-related chest pain) Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Carvidon 20 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Carvidon 20 Tablet is an anti-anginal medication. It decreases the oxygen requirement of the heart by shifting its metabolism from fats to glucose. As a result, the heart works more efficiently. Carvidon 20 Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Information regarding the use of Carvidon 20 Tablet during pregnancy is not available. Please consult your doctor. Information regarding the use of Carvidon 20 Tablet during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor.
Side Effects: Dizziness | Headache | Nausea | Vomiting | Weakness | Rash | Abdominal pain | Indigestion | Itching | Diarrhea | Hives |

Uses: For sensitive teeth Ingredients: Clove, Potassium nitrate Clove (Lavanga) contains an anesthetic chemical compound called eugenol, which numbs nerves and stops pain. The essential oil of clove is also an antiseptic, which helps eliminate oral bacteria. Potassium nitrate (Suryakshara) inhibits pain in hypersensitive teeth through its desensitizing effect on dentinal nerves. Indications:- Dentinal hypersensitivity/ Sensitive teeth- Halitosis Directions for Use:Take 15 ml of mouthwash. Rinse mouth thoroughly for 30 seconds and expel. Use twice daily.

Ingredients: Belleric Myrobalan, Betel, Meswak Belleric Myrobalan (Bibhitaki) is an antimicrobial and antifungal agent that keeps infections at bay. Betel (Nagavalli) leaf effectively tackles halitosis, and its mild stimulating properties are beneficial for toothaches. Meswak (Salvadora Persica) tree twigs, known as meswak, are popular teeth-cleaning agents. Pilu prevents tooth decay and eliminates toothache and bad breath. Indications:- Plaque control- Gingivitis- Halitosis Directions for Use:Take 15 ml of mouthwash. Rinse mouth thoroughly for 30 seconds and expel. Use twice daily.

Ingredients: Honey, Damask Rose Honey effectively eliminates a host of microorganisms. It is an anti-inflammatory agent which soothes the eyes and heals wounds quickly. Damask Rose is well-known for its cooling property, when applied to the eyes. It provides relief from eyestrain and computer vision syndrome and exhibits antibacterial activity. Relieves eye strain, redness and dryness. Directions for Use:Please consult your physician to prescribe the dosage that best suits the condition.Available as drops.

Composition: Cefuroxime (750mg) FORCEF 750MG INJECTION contains Cefuroxime which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used to treat bacterial infections such as lower respiratory tract infections, meningitis, septicemia, abdominal infections, urinary tract infections, skin and soft tissue infections, ear, nose and throat infections, obstetric and gynecological infections, bone, joint infections and gonorrhea. FORCEF 750MG INJECTION is also used to prevent infections, before and after surgery.  Tell your doctor before receiving FORCEF 750MG INJECTION if you have or had a history of kidney or liver diseases, fungal diseases or diarrhoea. If you are pregnant or breastfeeding, inform your doctor before receiving FORCEF 750MG INJECTION. Inform your doctor if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to cephalosporins, penicillin or any antibiotics before receiving the medicine. Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Forcef 750mg Injection is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Do not receive FORCEF 750MG INJECTION if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Cefuroxime, cephalosporin, penicillin, monobactams, carbapenems or to any other ingredients of this medicine. The safety of FORCEF 750MG INJECTION during pregnancy has not been clearly established. The use of this medicine in pregnant women requires that the potential benefit from the drug be weighed against the possible risk to the mother and fetus. Consult your doctor before receiving. FORCEF 750MG INJECTION should be used with caution as it may pass into the breast milk. Consult your doctor before receiving.
Side Effects: Respiratory tract infections | Urinary tract infections | Ear, nose, throat infections | Soft tissue infections | Pain (injection site), swelling and redness along a vein | Increase in liver enzyme | Changes in white blood cells (neutropenia or eosinophilia) | High temperature | Sore throat |

Uses:
Composition: Cefuroxime (750mg) Pulmocef 750mg Injection is an antibiotic medicine used to treat bacterial infections in your body. It is effective in infections of the lungs (e.g. pneumonia), ear, throat, nasal sinus, urinary tract, skin, soft tissues, bones, and joints. It is also used to prevent infections during surgery. Before using it, you should tell your doctor if you are allergic to any antibiotics, and if you have any liver or kidney problems. You should also let your doctor know all other medicines you are taking as they may affect, or be affected by this medicine. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should consult their doctor before using it.  Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Pulmocef 750mg Injection is an antibiotic. It kills bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Pulmocef 750 MG Injection may be safe in pregnancy to treat bacterial infections. It is not known to harm your foetus. However, your doctor may prescribe this injection if the benefits for you outweigh the risks to your foetus Pulmocef 750mg Injection is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.
Avoid prolonged use of Pulmocef 750mg Injection, since it may have possible effects such as rash and diarrhea.
Side Effects: Rash | Vomiting | Allergic reaction | Increased liver enzymes | Nausea | Injection site reaction | Diarrhea |

Uses: Composition: Ketoconazole Phytoral 200 MG Tablet is an anti-fungal medicine that contains ketoconazole as an active ingredient. It is used in the treatment of various fungal infections. This medicine is used mainly for the treatment of infections of the skin and in some cases of the lungs caused by fungi. It damages the cell membrane of the fungus which kills it and prevents the further spread of fungal infections.  Common side effects: Take PHYTORAL TABLET as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow PHYTORAL TABLET as whole with a glass of water. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy for you according to your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking PHYTORAL TABLET unless your doctor advises you to stop. PHYTORAL TABLET works by blocking the synthesis of ergosterol (a key component of the fungal cell membrane) thus weakening the structure and function of the fungal cell membrane. Do not consume alcohol while taking PHYTORAL TABLET as it can lead to disulfiram-like reaction (a very uncomfortable reaction characterized by severe flushing). Consult your doctor for advice. PHYTORAL TABLET should be used during pregnancy only if the potential benefit justifies the potential risk to the baby. Consult your doctor before taking it. PHYTORAL TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it can pass into the breastmilk. Consult your doctor before taking it.
Side Effects: Systemic fungal infections | Candidiasis (chronic mucocutaneous and vaginal) | Oral rush candiduric | Nausea, diarrhoea, stomach pain | Headache | Abnormal liver function tests |

Uses: Ketoconazole cream is primarily used to treat various fungal skin infections. Such as: Common side effects of ketoconazole cream may include mild skin irritation, redness, itching, or a burning sensation at the application site. Clean and dry the affected area before applying a thin layer of ketoconazole cream. Gently rub the cream into the skin and the surrounding area. Wash your hands after application, unless the hands are the affected area. Ketoconazole is an antifungal agent that works by inhibiting the growth and spread of fungal cells. It interferes with the synthesis of ergosterol, a key component of the fungal cell membrane, weakening the cell and ultimately leading to its death. Pregnant or breastfeeding individuals should consult with a healthcare professional before using ketoconazole cream to assess potential risks and benefits. Ketoconazole is available in other formulations like shampoo for the treatment of scalp conditions like dandruff or seborrheic dermatitis. Ketoconazole cream is specifically designed for use on the skin and should not be applied to the scalp. Avoid using ketoconazole cream on the face or near the eyes unless specifically instructed by a healthcare professional. It is essential to use the cream only on the affected skin areas. Ketoconazole cream is generally safe for use in children, but the appropriate dosage and duration of treatment should be determined by a healthcare professional.
Side Effects: SEBORRHEIC DERMATITIS | RINGWORM | ATHLETE'S FOOT | PTYRIASIS VERSICOLOR |

Uses: Composition: KETOCONAZOLE-2%W/W Phytoral Ointment 30 gm belongs to a class of drugs called 'antifungal' primarily used to treat fungal infections of the skin like ringworm, jock itch, athlete’s foot, seborrheic dermatitis (dry, flaky skin on the face, scalp, chest, upper back or ears) and pityriasis (a type of skin rash that causes scaly, discoloured patches on chest, back, legs and arms). Fungal infection is a skin disease in which a fungus attacks the tissue and causes infection. Fungal infections may be contagious (spread from one person to another). Fungal skin infections Common side effects: Apply PHYTORAL OINTMENT as advised by your physician. It is for external use only. Wash the infected area and dry it well.  Apply it to the affected and immediate surrounding area with clean fingers. Unless the affected skin is on your hands, wash your hands with soap and water after using PHYTORAL OINTMENT in order to stop you from spreading the infection to other parts of your body or to other people. PHYTORAL OINTMENT reduces fungal infection by inhibiting the growth of the fungus by weakening the structure and function of the fungal cell membrane. Do not apply PHYTORAL OINTMENT if you are allergic to Ketoconazole or any of the other ingredients of this medicine.
Side Effects: Dry skin | Itching | Redness | Burning sensation at the application site |

Uses: Composition: Ceftriaxone (2gm) MONOCEF 2GM INJECTION contains Ceftriaxone which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used to treat bacterial infections such as urinary tract infections, lower respiratory tract infections, bacteremia, septicaemia, meningitis, abdominal infections and infections caused by pseudomonas species. MONOCEF 2GM INJECTION is also used to prevent infections, before and after surgery. Tell your doctor before receiving MONOCEF 2GM INJECTION if you have or had a history of kidney or liver diseases, fungal diseases, gastrointestinal disease or diarrhoea. If you are pregnant or breastfeeding, inform your doctor before receiving MONOCEF 2GM INJECTION. Inform your doctor if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to cephalosporins, penicillin or any antibiotics before receiving the medicine. Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Monocef 2gm Injection is an antibiotic. It kills the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. Do not receive MONOCEF 2GM INJECTION if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Ceftriaxone or to any other ingredients of this medicine. MONOCEF 2GM INJECTION should be used during pregnancy only if clearly needed. Consult your doctor before receiving this medicine. MONOCEF 2GM INJECTION should be used with caution during breastfeeding as it may pass into the breast milk. Consult your doctor before receiving this medicine.
Side Effects: Diarrhea | Abnormal liver function tests | Rash |

Uses: Composition:Oxymetazoline Hydrochloride Decon Nasal Drops contains Oxymetazoline Hydrochloride. It is used for the temporary relief of nasal congestion or stuffiness caused by hay fever or other allergies, colds, or sinus trouble in adults. Store the medicine in a closed container at room temperature, away from heat, moisture, and direct light. Keep out of the reach of children.  Used for the temporary relief of nasal congestion or stuffiness caused by hay fever or other allergies, colds, or sinus trouble in adults. Common side effects: For nasal congestion or stuffiness: This medication is used for temporary relief of congestion in the nose caused by various conditions including the common cold, sinusitis, hay fever, and allergies. It works by narrowing the blood vessels in the nose area, reducing swelling and congestion. Contraindicated in patients who have a known hypersensitivity to it.
Side Effects: Burning or stinging, Sneezing, Dryness of mouth and throat | Prolonged or frequent use may cause rebound congestion. | Adults and children 6 years of age and older – Use 2 or 3 drops of 0.05% solution in each nostril every ten to twelve hours. Do not use more than two times in twenty four hours. |

Uses: Composition: Thiamine HCl 2.5 mg + Riboflavine-5 + Phosphate Sodium 2.5 mg/5ml + Pyridoxine HCl 1 mg/5ml + Nicotinamide 25 mg/5ml + D-Panthenol 5 mg/5ml + Cyanocobalamin 5 mcg/5ml + Inositol 10 mg/5ml + Choline Chloride 25 mg/5ml Vital syrup is used for Prophylaxis & treatment of Vitamin B deficiency, adjunct to antibiotic & anti-tubercular therapy, malabsorption syndrome, in illness.Store at room temperature Keep it out of the reach of children . Composition: Piracetam (200mg) Neurocetam 200mg Injection is used in the treatment of Alzheimer's disease, stroke, and memory loss in Parkinson's disease. It can also be used to treat age-related memory loss and head injury. It works by improving communication between the nerve cells and protects the brain. Neurocetam 200mg Injection is administered as an injection under the supervision of a healthcare professional and should not be self-administered. Uses:
ELDOPER CAPSULE contains Loperamide which belongs to the group of medicines called Antidiarrheals. It is used to treat acute attacks of diarrhea (in adults and children over 12 years of age) and acute episodes of diarrhea associated with irritable bowel syndrome (group of symptoms that affects the digestive system such as abdominal cramps, gas, bloating and diarrhea) (in adults aged 18 years and over). Take ELDOPER CAPSULE as advised by your doctor. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. ELDOPER CAPSULE acts by decreasing the muscle contraction and fluid secretion, resulting in longer stomach and intestinal transit time and increased absorption of fluids and electrolytes from the gastrointestinal tract. Thus, helps to treat diarrhoea by slowing down the overactive bowel. ELDOPER CAPSULE is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult with your doctor before taking ELDOPER CAPSULE if you are pregnant or planning to have a baby.
ELDOPER CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as small amount of this medicine may pass into the breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking ELDOPER CAPSULE. ELDOPER CAPSULE should be used with caution in patients with liver disease. Consult your doctor before taking ELDOPER CAPSULE. Do not drive or use machines while taking ELDOPER CAPSULE as it may cause dizziness, tiredness, drowsiness, reduced alertness, fainting or passing out. Consult your doctor for advice before taking ELDOPER CAPSULE.
Side Effects: To treat acute attacks of diarrhea (in adults and children over 12 years of age) | Treat acute episodes of diarrhea associated with irritable bowel syndrome (in adults aged 18 years and over) | Constipation | Nausea | Flatulence | Headache | Dizziness, drowsiness | Stomach pain or discomfort | Dry mouth | Vomiting | Indigestion | Rash |

Uses: Dextrose IV solutions are used to provide a quick source of energy, hydration, and calories to patients who may be unable to eat or drink due to medical conditions, surgery, or other factors. -Energy Source:Dextrose monohydrate is rapidly absorbed by the body and can provide a quick source of energy for patients who may have increased energy needs due to various medical conditions or procedures. -Hydration:Dextrose IV solutions are often used to provide hydration to patients who are unable to take fluids orally or require additional fluid intake. -Hypoglycemia Treatment:Dextrose IV solutions can be used to rapidly raise blood sugar levels in patients with hypoglycemia (low blood sugar), which can occur in individuals with diabetes or other medical conditions. -Nutritional Support:Dextrose IV solutions may be used as part of total parenteral nutrition (TPN) to provide essential nutrients, including calories and carbohydrates, to patients who are unable to consume food orally. -Electrolyte Balance:In some cases, dextrose IV solutions may be combined with electrolytes to help restore electrolyte balance in patients with certain medical conditions or after surgical procedures. While Dextrose IV Solutions are generally safe when administered under medical supervision, rapid changes in blood sugar levels and the risk of infection, fluid overload, and other complications can occur. Dextrose IV solutions are administered by healthcare professionals through a vein (intravenous route). The dosage and rate of administration depend on the patient's medical condition and needs. Dextrose monohydrate is rapidly absorbed by the body and can provide a quick source of energy for patients who may have increased energy needs. Dextrose IV Solutions can be used in pediatric patients, but the dosage and administration should be carefully determined by a healthcare professional. Dextrose IV Solutions may be used under medical guidance during pregnancy or breastfeeding if needed. Consult a healthcare provider for advice. The dosage is determined based on factors such as the patient's medical condition, age, weight, and other health considerations. Yes, Dextrose IV Solutions can be combined with other medications or fluids when medically necessary. Healthcare professionals will determine the appropriate combinations.

Ingredients: Honey, Lavanga Honey (Madhu) is traditionally used to treat cough, due to its antitussive and anti-inflammatory properties, which soothe the respiratory tract. Composition: Piperacillin (4000 mg) + Tazobactam (500 mg) Durataz 4.5 g Injection is a combination of Piperacillin and Tazobactam. It is used for the treatment of bacterial infections that affect the lungs, urinary tract, skin, etc. This medication is effective only for the treatment of infections caused by bacteria and not viruses. Durataz 4.5 g Injection is effective against a large number of bacteria. Piperacillin works by preventing the formation of bacterial cell walls and killing the infection-causing bacteria. Tazobactam protects Piperacillin and ensures extended anti-bacterial activity. Durataz 4.5 g Injection is not recommended if you are allergic to it. This medicine is not advisable for children below 2 years of age. Inform your doctor if you have any kidney/liver problems or a history of seizures (fits) before starting treatment with this medicine. Consult your doctor if you are pregnant or are breastfeeding. Common side effects:  DURATAZ 4.5GM INJECTION will be administered into the vein (intravenously) by your doctor or nurse. Your doctor will administer the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. DURATAZ 4.5GM INJECTION works by destroying the bacterial growth responsible for causing infections. Piperacillin works by interrupting the cell wall formation by binding with the enzymes responsible for cell wall synthesis. This binding causes defects in the cell wall leading to cell death causing death of the organism. Tazobactam is responsible for the irreversible termination of enzymes (beta- lactamases) that protect the organism from antibiotics and produces less anti-bacterial actions when given alone so it’s always used in combination with other antibiotics. Thus, both the substances works by preventing cell growth and function inhibiting bacterial growth. Interaction with alcohol is unknown. It is advisable to consult your doctor before consumption Due to a lack of safety and efficacy studies in pregnant women, the risk to your developing foetus is not known. If you are pregnant, take Durataz 4.5 g Injection only if prescribed by your doctor. Durataz 4.5 g Injection passes into breast milk in very low quantities and may cause diarrhoea in your breastfed infant. If you are breastfeeding, consult your doctor.

It is used to treat uneven heartbeats (arrhythmias) and heart attacks (myocardial infarction).  Metolar 1mg Injection is given under the supervision of a doctor. The dose and frequency depend on what you are taking it for and the severity of your condition. It is given along with continuous monitoring of blood pressure and heart rate. If affected by dizziness, rise slowly while standing from lying or sitting position   Treatment of Hypertensive emergencyTreatment of Hypertension (high blood pressure)Treatment of Angina (heart-related chest pain)Treatment of Arrhythmia Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Metolar 1mg Injection is a short-acting beta blocker that works specifically on the heart. It works by slowing down the heart rate and makes the heart more efficient at pumping blood around the body. Avoid alcohol while using METOLAR INJECTION as it may lead to unwanted effects. METOLAR INJECTION is not recommended for use in pregnant women unless it is considered necessary as it may cause harm to the unborn baby and early labour. Contact your doctor before receiving METOLAR INJECTION METOLAR INJECTION is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it may pass through breast milk unless it is considered necessary. Contact your doctor before receiving METOLAR INJECTION.
Side Effects: Orthostatic hypotension (sudden lowering of blood pressure on standing) | Slow heart rate | Headache | Dizziness | Tiredness | Nausea | Stomach pain | Breathlessness |

Uses: Composition:  Fluticasone Propionate (50mcg) Flohale 50mcg Inhaler belongs to a group of medicines called steroids. It is used to prevent and treat asthma. It prevents the cells in the lungs and breathing passages from releasing substances that cause inflammation of the airways. This widens the airways and makes breathing easier.  Flohale 50mcg Inhaler should be taken in the dose and duration as directed by your doctor. The effect of this medicine may be noticeable after a few days but will only reach its maximum after a few weeks.   Common side effects: Hold the inhaler with the mouthpiece downwards. Put the mouthpiece between your teeth and seal the lips around it. Then, press down the inhaler once to release the medication. Breathe in slowly and hold your breath for 5 to 10 seconds. Breathe out slowly. Repeat the process until you have inhaled the number of puffs prescribed by the doctor. Flohale 50mcg Inhaler is a steroid. It prevents the cells in the lungs and breathing passages from releasing chemical messengers that cause inflammation (swelling) of the airways. This widens the airways and makes breathing easier. It is not known if alcohol affects Flohale 50 Inhaler 200 MDI. Please consult your doctor if you have any concerns. Flohale 50mcg Inhaler may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. It is unknown whether Flohale 50 Inhaler 200 MDI is excreted in human milk. It is given to breastfeeding mothers only if the doctor thinks the benefits are greater than the risks.
Side Effects: Severe allergic reactions | Treatment of Skin conditions with inflammation & itching | Upper respiratory tract infection | Sinus infection | Throat irritation | Bronchitis (inflammation of the airways) | Voice change |

Uses: EPILEX ORAL SOLUTIONcontains Sodium valproate, which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-convulsant. It is used in the treatment of epilepsy (fits). Epilepsy is a central nervous system (neurological) disorder in which brain activity becomes abnormal, causing seizures or periods of unusual behavior, sensations and sometimes loss of awareness. Symptoms include temporary confusion, staring spells, stiff muscles, uncontrollable jerking movements of the arms and legs, loss of consciousness or awareness, fear, anxiety, or déjà vu. Take EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION as advised by your physician. Take the medicine by mouth, dilute it only if your doctor tells you to. Measure the suggested dose using the measuring cup and take it with or after food. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration depending on your age, body weight and disease condition. EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION increases concentrations of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) which reduces neuronal excitability by inhibiting nerve transmission in the brain, probably due to inhibition of the enzymes responsible for the breakdown of GABA. If you forget to take a dose of EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is nearly time for the next dose, skip the missed dose. Do not take a double dose of EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION. EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION is not recommended for use in pregnant women or if you are planning to have a baby as it can cause birth defects and behavioral/learning problems in the baby. Consult your doctor before taking EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION. Inform your doctor if you are breastfeeding before taking EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION as very little medicine might pass through the breastmilk. Consult your doctor if you can breastfeed or not take the medicine during the treatment. Do not consume alcohol while taking EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION as it can worsen the side effects. Do not drive or use machines while taking EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION as it can make you sleepy and weaken your ability to drive. Consult your doctor for more information. EPILEX ORAL SOLUTIONshould be used with caution in patients with kidney disease. The dose will be adjusted by your doctor. Consult your doctor before taking EPILEX ORAL SOLUTION.
Side Effects: Treats epilepsy (fits) | Stomach pain, feeling or being sick | Diarrhea | Dry or sore mouth, or swollen gums | Shakes (tremors) in a part of your body, or unusual eye movements | Feeling tired or sleepy | Headache | Weight gain | Thinning hair, or changes to the color or texture of your hair | Irregular or delayed periods |

Uses: Duphalac is a brand name for a medication that contains lactulose as its active ingredient. Lactulose is a synthetic sugar that is used as a laxative to treat constipation and other bowel-related conditions. If you are using Duphalac to manage hepatic encephalopathy, it's important to avoid alcohol as it can worsen this condition. Duphalac is typically used for short-term relief of constipation. If you need to use it for an extended period, consult your healthcare provider for guidance. Duphalac may be available OTC in some regions, but it is often prescribed by a healthcare provider. Consult your healthcare provider or pharmacist for guidance. Yes, Duphalac is available in pediatric formulations, and the dosage should be based on the child's age and weight. Follow your healthcare provider's recommendations. Consult your healthcare provider before using Duphalac if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding.
Side Effects: Constipation: Duphalac is primarily used to relieve constipation by softening the stool and promoting regular bowel movements. | Hepatic Encephalopathy: It can also be prescribed to manage hepatic encephalopathy, a condition where the liver is unable to remove toxins from the blood, leading to neurological symptoms. | Relieves Constipation: Duphalac helps alleviate constipation by softening the stool and promoting bowel regularity. | Manages Hepatic Encephalopathy: In cases of hepatic encephalopathy, it can help reduce the buildup of toxins in the blood, improving cognitive and neurological symptoms. | Gas | Bloating | Diarrhea (if used excessively) | Stomach cramps | Follow the dosage instructions provided by your healthcare provider. | Duphalac is typically taken orally, either with or without food. | Measure the liquid medication using the provided measuring device. | It may take a couple of days for Duphalac to produce its full effects, so be patient. | Duphalac contains lactulose, a synthetic sugar. | Lactulose draws water into the colon, softening the stool. | It also promotes the growth of beneficial bacteria in the colon. | This combination helps to ease constipation and reduce toxin buildup in hepatic encephalopathy. | If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. | If it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose. | Do not double the dose to make up for a missed one. | Consult your healthcare provider if you have concerns about missed doses or if you are unsure about what to do. |

Uses: Duphalac syrup is a laxative used to treat constipation. This syrup works by increasing the amount of water in the stool, making the stool softer and easier to pass. Moreover, it is also used to prevent the effect of liver failure on the brain by removing certain toxic chemicals from the blood.  It should be taken as recommended by a doctor. Normally this syrup is taken once a day at night after meal, sometimes twice a day according to the condition of a patient. The most common side effects like nausea and vomiting may occur. Stop medication and consult with your doctor doctor if severe diarrhea occur. Lactulose is primarily used to treat constipation. It can also be prescribed to treat or prevent hepatic encephalopathy, a condition characterized by impaired brain function due to liver disease Common side effects of lactulose include bloating, flatulence (gas), abdominal cramps, and diarrhea. These side effects are usually mild and resolve on their own. It's important to drink plenty of fluids while taking lactulose to prevent dehydration. Lactulose is usually taken orally, typically in liquid form. It is important to follow the dosage instructions provided by your healthcare provider. The liquid can be taken on its own or mixed with water, fruit juice, or milk to improve its taste. Lactulose works by increasing the water content and volume of stool, which helps to soften it and promote bowel movements. In the case of hepatic encephalopathy, lactulose helps reduce the levels of ammonia in the blood by trapping it in the intestine and promoting its elimination through bowel movements. Yes, lactulose can be used in children. The dosage and administration may vary depending on the child's age and condition. It's important to follow the doctor's instructions and use the appropriate pediatric formulation if available. Lactulose is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy and breastfeeding. However, it's always best to consult with your doctor before taking any medications or laxatives during pregnancy or while breastfeeding. The duration of lactulose treatment can vary depending on the condition being treated. For constipation, lactulose is typically used for a short period until regular bowel movements are achieved. In the case of hepatic encephalopathy, lactulose may be used long-term to manage the condition. It's important to follow your doctor's guidance regarding the duration of treatment. Lactulose is not known to have significant drug interactions. However, it's still important to inform your doctor or pharmacist about all the medications and supplements you are taking to avoid any potential interactions.

Uses: Composition: Ambroxol (30mg/5ml)  AMBRODIL SYRUP contains Ambroxol, which belongs to the group of medicines called Secretolytic agents. It is used to treat acute respiratory diseases such as acute or recurrent bronchitis, laryngitis, tracheitis, and chronic respiratory diseases (such as chronic bronchitis, and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease). AMBRODIL SYRUP is not recommended for use if you are allergic to ambroxol hydrochloride. Before taking AMBRODIL SYRUP, inform your doctor if you have chronic cough, peptic/duodenal ulcers, hereditary fructose intolerance (inability of the body to break down fructose), lung problems (such as asthma), and/or kidney & liver problems. AMBRODIL SYRUP is not recommended for use in pregnant women (especially during the first three months of pregnancy) and is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women. It should be used with caution in children and adolescents (below 18 years). Consult your doctor before taking the medicine  Treatment of Respiratory tract disorders associated with viscid mucus Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Measure it with a measuring cup and take it by mouth. Shake well before use. Ambrodil Syrup is to be taken with food. Ambrodil Syrup is a mucolytic medication. It thins and loosens mucus (phlegm) in the nose, windpipe and lungs making it easier to cough out. If you miss a dose of Ambrodil Syrup, skip it and continue with your normal schedule. Do not double the dose. Do not take AMBRODIL SYRUP if you are allergic to ambroxol hydrochloride, and/or any other ingredients of this medicine. AMBRODIL SYRUP is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women, especially during the first 3 months of pregnancy). Consult and inform your doctor before taking the medicine. AMBRODIL SYRUP is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it may get excreted in breast milk. Consult and inform your doctor before taking the medicine.
Side Effects: Vomiting | Nausea | Upset stomach |

Uses: Composition: Ambroxol (30mg) AMBRODIL 30MG TABLET contains Ambroxol, which belongs to a group of medicines called Respiratory system agents. It is used to loosen phlegm in case of productive cough accompanying lung and bronchial illness in affected individuals. Phlegm is a thickened mucus secreted by the glands of respiratory passages and lungs, which generally occurs due to illness/irritation in affected individuals. AMBRODIL 30MG TABLET is not recommended for use if you are allergic to ambroxol hydrochloride. Before taking AMBRODIL 30MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you have a predilection for the development of peptic ulcers, intolerance to certain sugars, lung problems (such as bronchial motor activity disorder), kidney problems (such as an impaired renal function), and/or severe liver disease. Treatment of Respiratory tract disorders associated with viscid mucus Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Ambrodil Tablet is to be taken with food AMBRODIL 30MG TABLET works by facilitating the expectoration of mucus by breaking down acid mucopolysaccharide fibers (sugar molecules responsible for mucus production) and stimulates surfactant (an anti-glue agent) that prevents adhesion of mucus to the bronchial wall thus preventing its accumulation and providing clearance in the airway due to acute and chronic respiratory diseases in affected individuals. If you miss a dose of Ambrodil Tablet, skip it and continue with your normal schedule. Do not double the dose. Do not take AMBRODIL 30MG TABLET if you are allergic to ambroxol hydrochloride, and/or any other ingredients of this medicine. Ambrodil Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor AMBRODIL 30MG TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it may get excreted in breast milk. Consult and inform your doctor before taking the medicine.
Side Effects: Taste disturbance | Numbness in the throat | Nausea | Numbness in the mouth |

Uses: Composition: Fluvoxamine (100mg) Voxamin 100 Tablet is a type of antidepressant belonging to the selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) group of medicines. It is prescribed to treat depression, where it helps to make you feel better. This medicine is also used to treat people with obsessive-compulsive disorder. Voxamin 100 Tablet can be taken with or without food. The dose and how often you need it will be decided by your doctor so that you get the right amount to control your symptoms. Your doctor may start you on a lower dose and increase it gradually. Do not change the dose or stop taking it without talking to your doctor, even if you feel well. Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Voxamin 100 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Voxamin 100 Tablet is a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) antidepressant. It works by increasing the levels of serotonin, a chemical messenger in the brain. This improves mood and physical symptoms of depression and also relieves symptoms of obsessive-compulsive disorders. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Voxamin 100 Tablet. Voxamin 100 Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.
Side Effects: Depression | Obsessive-compulsive disorder | Delayed ejaculation | Drowsiness | Erectile dysfunction | Low sexual desire | Nausea | Vomiting | Dryness in mouth | Fatigue | Increased sweating | Indigestion |

Uses: Composition: Ciprofloxacin (0.3% w/v) + Dexamethasone (0.1% w/v) Microflox DX Eye Drop is a medicine used to treat eye infections with inflammation. It kills and prevents the growth of infection-causing bacteria. This way it relieves the inflammatory symptoms such as redness, itching, and swelling and speeds up the healing process. Microflox DX Eye Drop is to be used only in the affected eye. Read the label carefully for instruction before you use the medicine. Use it in the exact dose and duration as advised by the doctor or as instructed in the label. Wash your hands before using this medicine. Complete your dose even if you feel better. Stopping the medicine too early may bring back the infection. Treatment of Eye infection with inflammation Common side effects: This medicine is for external use only. Use it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Hold the dropper close to the eye without touching it. Gently squeeze the dropper and place the medicine inside the lower eyelid. Wipe off the extra liquid. Microflox DX Eye Drop is a combination of two medicines: Ciprofloxacin and Dexamethasone. Ciprofloxacin is an antibiotic which prevents bacterial cells from dividing and repairing, thereby killing the bacteria. This treats your eye infection. Dexamethasone is a steroid which blocks the production of certain chemical messengers (prostaglandins) that make the eye red, swollen and itchy. Tell your doctor if you are allergic (hypersensitive) to Ciprofloxacin.
Side Effects: Eye discomfort | Corneal deposits | Ocular hyperemia | Taste change | Ear discomfort | Ear pain |

Uses: Composition:  Ciprofloxacin (0.3% w/v)  CIPLOX EYE/EAR DROPS contains ciprofloxacin, which belongs to the group of medicines called fluoroquinolone antibiotics. It is used to treat bacterial infection of the eye or the ear in conditions such as corneal ulcers, chronic Suppurative otitis media, external otitis, malignant otitis externa, etc. Symptoms of an eye or ear infection may include red, watery eyes and bloodshot eyes, severe eye pain, pus or discharge and in severe cases can also lead to vision loss and blindness.  CIPLOX EYE/EAR DROPS is also used for the topical treatment of inflammatory ear infections such as Chronic Suppurative otitis media, external otitis, malignant otitis externa and perioperatively in chronic otitis media. This medicine is indicated for use in adults and children above 1 year. Common side effects: This medicine is for external use only.Take it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Hold the dropper close to the eye/ear without touching it. Gently squeeze the dropper and place the medicine inside the lower eyelid or ear. Wipe off extra liquid. Ciplox Eye/Ear Drops is an antibiotic. It treats bacterial eye/ear infections by preventing the bacteria from dividing and repairing. It does so stopping the action of a bacterial enzyme called DNA-gyrase. If you miss a dose of Ciplox Eye/Ear Drops, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. CIPLOX EYE/EAR DROPS should be used during pregnancy only if the potential benefit justifies the potential risk to the developing baby. Consult your doctor before using CIPLOX EYE/EAR DROPS. CIPLOX EYE/EAR DROPS should be used with caution in breastfeeding mothers due to the lack of safety data in topical use. Consult your doctor before using CIPLOX EYE/EAR DROPS. Do not use CIPLOX EYE/EAR DROPS if you are allergic to ciprofloxacin or other quinolone antibiotics or any other ingredients of this medicine.
Side Effects: Treatment of Bacterial eye / ear infections | Treatment of Bacterial infections | Corneal deposits | Eye discomfort | Ocular hyperemia | Taste change |

Uses: Composition: Norethisterone (5mg) Norgest Tablet is used to treat various menstrual problems including painful, heavy, or irregular periods, premenstrual syndrome (PMS), and a condition called endometriosis. It is a man-made version of the natural female sex hormone progesterone. Norgest Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at the same time each day. The dose and how often you take it depends on what you are taking it for. Your doctor will decide how much you need so as to improve your symptoms. Swallow the tablets whole with a drink of water. You should take this medicine for as long as it is prescribed to you. Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Norgest Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Norgest Tablet is a synthetic progestin. It works by mimicking the effects of natural progesterone (female hormone). It helps in regulating the growth and shedding of the womb lining, thereby treating menstrual irregularities. Interaction with alcohol is unknown. It is advisable to consult your doctor before consumption. Norgest Tablet is highly unsafe to use during pregnancy. Seek your doctor's advice as studies on pregnant women and animals have shown significant harmful effects to the developing baby.
Side Effects: Treatment of Heavy menstrual bleeding | Treatment of Pain during menstruation | Treatment of Endometriosis | Treatment of Premenstrual syndrome (PMS) | Headache | Dizziness | Breast tenderness | Nausea | Vaginal spotting | Vomiting | Abdominal cramp |

Uses: GESTIN 5MG TABLET contains Allylestrenol which belongs to group of medicines called Progestogens. It is used to treat intrauterine growth retardation (growth of the foetus is lesser than its normal growth rate), threatened abortion (vaginal bleeding at less than 20 weeks of gestation), and threatened premature delivery (onset of labor between 24 and 37 weeks of pregnancy) in affected women. Treats, Take GESTIN 5MG TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition GESTIN 5MG TABLETworks by promoting the attachment of embryo to the lining of the womb which also improves blood flow to the placenta thus relaxing the uterus muscles and preventing the occurrence of premature labor in affected women. In case of a missed dose, take GESTIN 5MG TABLET as soon as you remember. You should not take a double dose to make up for the missed dose. Ask for your doctor’s advice. GESTIN 5MG TABLET is generally recommended for use in pregnant women and should be discontinued after delivery. Consult your doctor before taking it. GESTIN 5MG TABLET should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it may affect the child. Consult your doctor before taking it. GESTIN 5MG TABLET should be used with caution in such patients specially, if a patient suffers from breathing disorders such as asthma, emphysema (shortness of breath), chronic bronchitis (inflammation and irritation of bronchial tube) or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease. Consult your doctor before taking GESTIN 5MG TABLET. No. Do not stop taking GESTIN 5MG TABLET until and unless your doctor asks you to. It is suggested to maintain a regular dosing schedule. This will ensure that you remember taking your medicine. Ask for your doctor’s advice if you wish to discontinue taking GESTIN 5MG TABLET.
Side Effects: Intrauterine growth retardation | Threatened abortion | Habitual abortion | Threatened premature delivery | Nausea | Vomiting | Stomach discomfort |

Uses: Levofloxacin 750mg Tablets are prescribed for the treatment of the following bacterial infections: -Respiratory Tract Infections:Such as pneumonia, bronchitis, and sinusitis. -Urinary Tract Infections:Including complicated and uncomplicated urinary tract infections. -Skin and Soft Tissue Infections:Such as cellulitis and abscesses. -Prostate Infections:Known as bacterial prostatitis. -Acute Pyelonephritis:A severe kidney infection. Common side effects of Levofloxacin may include nausea, diarrhea, headache, dizziness, or sleep disturbances. Take Levofloxacin 750mg Tablets with a glass of water as prescribed by your healthcare provider. Follow the recommended dosage and duration of treatment. Levofloxacin effectively stops the reproduction of the bacteria responsible for causing infections, helping the body's immune system to clear the infection and promote recovery. It is generally advisable to avoid alcohol while taking Levofloxacin, as it may increase the risk of side effects and decrease the effectiveness of the medication. In some cases, Levofloxacin may be associated with tendon problems, including tendonitis or tendon rupture. If you experience any tendon pain or swelling, contact your healthcare provider immediately. Levofloxacin may interact with certain medications, including antacids, sucralfate, and drugs that affect heart rhythm. Inform your doctor about all the medications you are taking to avoid potential drug interactions. Levofloxacin is an antibiotic effective against bacterial infections, but it does not work against viral infections such as the common cold or flu.
Side Effects: -Respiratory Tract Infections:Such as pneumonia, bronchitis, and sinusitis. | -Urinary Tract Infections:Including complicated and uncomplicated urinary tract infections. | -Skin and Soft Tissue Infections:Such as cellulitis and abscesses. | -Prostate Infections:Known as bacterial prostatitis. | -Acute Pyelonephritis:A severe kidney infection. |

Uses: Oxetol-150mg Tablet is prescribed for the management of epilepsy and is effective in both treating and preventing seizures. However, it's important to understand that while the medication can help control seizures, it does not offer a cure for epilepsy. Continuous use of Oxetol-150mg Tablet is necessary to maintain seizure prevention. It is essential to follow your doctor's instructions regarding dosage and duration of treatment to effectively manage your epilepsy condition. If you have any concerns or questions about the medication or your epilepsy management, it is advisable to consult with your healthcare provider for personalized guidance. Epilepsy/Seizures Oxetol-150mg Tablet is an anticonvulsant medication that helps reduce seizures by decreasing abnormal nerve impulses. By regulating the frequency of seizures, it enables individuals to confidently carry out their daily activities. This medication effectively alleviates symptoms such as confusion, uncontrolled movements, loss of consciousness, and feelings of anxiety or fear that are associated with seizures. It is important to note that Oxetol-150mg Tablet does not cause physical or psychological dependence or addiction. However, it is essential to follow the prescribed dosage and not abruptly discontinue the medication. Consistent and regular use is necessary for its effectiveness. Missing doses may increase the risk of experiencing a seizure. HeadacheNauseaVomitingFatigueDizzinessNystagmus (unintentional eye movement)TremorsVertigoDrowsinessVoluntary movement abnormalityAtypical gaitDisturbance of vision Take Oxetol-150mg Tablet exactly as prescribed by your doctor. Do not alter the dosage unless instructed to do so.Take the tablet at the same time(s) each day to maintain a consistent level of medication in your body. This helps ensure its effectiveness. Swallow the tablet whole with a glass of water. Do not crush, break, or chew the tablet unless your doctor specifically advises you to do so. You can take Oxetol-150mg Tablet with or without food. However, it may be helpful to take it with food if you experience any stomach upset. It's important to take Oxetol-150mg Tablet regularly and without skipping doses. Skipping doses can decrease the effectiveness of the medication and increase the risk of seizures. Your doctor may provide specific instructions based on your individual needs. It's essential to follow their guidance and address any concerns or questions you may have. Oxetol-150mg Tablet contains the active ingredient oxcarbazepine, which is an anticonvulsant medication. It works by stabilizing the electrical activity in the brain, specifically by blocking voltage-gated sodium channels.By controlling and stabilizing the electrical activity in the brain, Oxetol-150mg Tablet helps to prevent or reduce the occurrence of seizures in people with epilepsy. If you remember shortly after the missed dose, you can take it right away. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, it is generally advised to skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Taking a double dose to make up for the missed dose is not recommended, as it can increase the risk of side effects. Consuming alcohol while taking Oxetol-150mg Tablet can intensify the drowsiness caused by the medication. Oxetol-150mg Tablet can cause side effects such as drowsiness, dizziness, blurred vision, and reduced muscle coordination, which may affect your ability to drive safely. If you experience any of these side effects, it is advised to avoid driving until you feel fully alert and capable of operating a vehicle without impairment. Oxetol-150mg Tablet is not recommended for use during pregnancy due to limited human studies and potential harmful effects observed in animal studies. It is essential to consult with your doctor for personalized advice and guidance before taking Oxetol-150mg Tablet if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. Oxetol-150mg Tablet is not recommended while breastfeeding. Limited data from human studies suggests that the medication can pass into breast milk and potentially harm the baby. It is important to exercise caution and consult with your doctor before taking Oxetol-150mg Tablet if you are breastfeeding. Monitoring the baby for signs of excessive sleepiness and weight gain is advised. In patients with kidney disease, it is important to use Oxetol-150mg Tablet with caution. Dose adjustment of the medication may be necessary to ensure its safe and effective use. Patients with severe liver disease should exercise caution when using Oxetol-150mg Tablet. Dose adjustment of the medication may be necessary in these cases, and it is important to consult with your doctor for guidance. Oxetol-150mg Tablet is used for the treatment and prevention of seizures in individuals with epilepsy. It helps in reducing the frequency and severity of seizures. No, Oxetol-150mg Tablet does not cure epilepsy. It is a long-term medication that helps in managing and controlling seizures. It needs to be taken regularly as prescribed by a doctor to maintain its effectiveness. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. The use of Oxetol-150mg Tablet during pregnancy and breastfeeding should be discussed with a doctor. The potential risks and benefits will be evaluated to determine the appropriate course of action.

Treatment and Management of: -Myoclonic Seizures -Epilepsy The sustained release form of these tablets helps in safe and sustained release of this medication. Common side effects of Levetiracetam may include dizziness, drowsiness, headache, and weakness. Take the tablet with a glass of water without crushing or chewing as directed by the physician. Levetiracetam works by inhibiting excessive neuronal activity, thereby reducing the occurrence of seizures. Consult with your physician for the next dose. Drinking alcohol while on this medication can be unsafe. Pregnant or breastfeeding women should consult their healthcare provider before using Levetiracetam to assess its safety for their specific situation. Some individuals may experience mood changes or behavior problems while taking Levetiracetam. Uses: Digene Mint Tablet 15's is indeed an antacid medication used to treat various digestive issues such as acidity, heartburn, indigestion, gastritis, and stomach upset. It contains a combination of four drugs: Aluminium hydroxide, Magnesium hydroxide, Magnesium silicate, and Simethicone. The primary role of Aluminium hydroxide, magnesium hydroxide, and magnesium silicate in this medication is to neutralize excess stomach acid. These drugs work by raising the pH level in the stomach, reducing the acidity and providing relief from symptoms like heartburn and indigestion. By neutralizing the acid, they help protect the stomach lining and promote healing of any inflammation or irritation. Simethicone, on the other hand, is an anti-flatulent agent. It works by reducing the surface tension of gas bubbles in the gastrointestinal tract. This action allows the gas bubbles to combine and be expelled more easily through belching (burping) or passing flatus (flatulence). Simethicone helps relieve symptoms of bloating and gas associated with indigestion. Overall, the combination of these four drugs in Digene Mint Tablet 15's provides a comprehensive approach to address acidity, heartburn, indigestion, and related digestive discomforts. It helps neutralize excess stomach acid and alleviate symptoms like gas and bloating, offering relief to individuals experiencing these issues.

Divalproex, also known as sodium valproate or valproic acid, is a medication that is used for the treatment of various conditions. Divalproex is commonly prescribed for the management of epilepsy/seizure disorders, bipolar disorder, and migraine headaches. It is used to help prevent or reduce the frequency of seizures, stabilize mood in bipolar disorder, and prevent or reduce the occurrence of migraines. Common side effects of divalproex may include drowsiness, dizziness, tremor, weight gain, gastrointestinal symptoms (such as nausea or vomiting), hair loss, and changes in liver function tests. In rare cases, it can cause more serious side effects, such as liver toxicity or pancreatitis. It's important to discuss any concerning or persistent side effects with your healthcare professional. It is to be taken with water as directed by the physician. It is believed to work by increasing the levels of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA), a neurotransmitter that inhibits the activity of nerve cells in the brain. By increasing GABA levels, divalproex helps to control excessive electrical activity in the brain, which is associated with seizures and mood disorders. Consult with your physician for next dose. Divalproex has been associated with an increased risk of birth defects when used during pregnancy. It should be avoided, if possible, in pregnant women or those planning to become pregnant. It can also pass into breast milk and may have adverse effects on the nursing infant. Discuss the risks and benefits with your healthcare professional if you are pregnant or breastfeeding. Alcohol drinking is unsafe when taking this medication. Divalproex may interact with certain medications, including other antiepileptic drugs, psychiatric medications, and drugs that affect liver metabolism. It's important to inform your healthcare professional about all the medications, supplements, or herbal products you are taking to prevent potential interactions.

Clonidine does not typically come in a dosage of 100mg. Clonidine is a medication that is available in much lower doses, usually in the form of tablets or patches. The most common doses of clonidine are 0.1mg (100 micrograms), 0.2mg (200 micrograms), and 0.3mg (300 micrograms). These doses are used to treat conditions such as high blood pressure (hypertension) and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder (ADHD). Hypertension (High Blood Pressure):Clonidine is commonly used to treat high blood pressure. It works by reducing the sympathetic nerve impulses that cause the blood vessels to constrict, thereby lowering blood pressure.  Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD):Clonidine may be prescribed as part of the treatment for ADHD, particularly when stimulant medications are not effective or not preferred. It can help manage symptoms such as hyperactivity, impulsivity, and inattention.  Tourette Syndrome:Clonidine is sometimes used to manage tics and other symptoms associated with Tourette syndrome, a neurological disorder characterized by repetitive, involuntary movements and vocalizations.  Withdrawal Symptoms:Clonidine can help alleviate withdrawal symptoms associated with the cessation of opioids or certain other drugs. It is often used in drug addiction treatment programs.  Anxiety Disorders:In some cases, clonidine may be prescribed for the management of certain anxiety disorders, including generalized anxiety disorder (GAD) and panic disorder.  Hot Flashes:Clonidine has been used to reduce the frequency and severity of hot flashes in menopausal women.  Smoking Cessation:It can also be used as an aid in smoking cessation programs to help reduce withdrawal symptoms.  Pain Management:In certain situations, clonidine may be used as part of a pain management regimen, especially for neuropathic pain or as an adjunct to opioid therapy. Blood Pressure Control:Clonidine is highly effective at lowering blood pressure. It's often used to manage hypertension when other medications are not sufficient or have intolerable side effects.  ADHD Symptom Management:In individuals with ADHD, clonidine can help reduce symptoms like hyperactivity, impulsivity, and inattention, especially when other treatments are not effective or preferred.  Tourette Syndrome:Clonidine can help manage tics and other symptoms associated with Tourette syndrome, improving the quality of life for individuals with this condition.  Opioid Withdrawal:It is used to alleviate withdrawal symptoms when individuals are discontinuing opioid use as part of addiction treatment.  Anxiety Reduction:In some cases, clonidine may help reduce anxiety symptoms associated with certain anxiety disorders.  Hot Flash Relief:Clonidine can reduce the frequency and severity of hot flashes in menopausal women, providing relief from this common symptom. Common side effects of clonidine can include: Less common but more severe side effects may include: Follow your healthcare provider's instructions precisely, including the dosage and frequency of clonidine. Clonidine works by stimulating alpha-2 adrenergic receptors in the brain. These receptors inhibit the release of norepinephrine, a neurotransmitter that plays a role in the "fight or flight" response. By reducing the release of norepinephrine, clonidine leads to various effects: Clonidine's mechanism of action can also lead to some of its side effects, such as drowsiness and low blood pressure. The specific benefits and actions of clonidine can vary depending on the medical condition being treated If you remember that you missed a dose and it's not too close to your next scheduled dose, take it as soon as you recall. : Familiarize yourself with the potential side effects of clonidine, and contact your healthcare provider if you experience any unusual or severe side effects. Avoid or limit alcohol consumption while taking clonidine, as it can enhance drowsiness and low blood pressure. Inform your healthcare provider about all medications and supplements you are taking to check for potential interactions. Clonidine can cause low blood pressure, which may lead to dizziness or fainting when you stand up. To minimize this risk, rise slowly from a seated or lying position. Do not stop taking clonidine suddenly, as this can lead to a sudden increase in blood pressure. If your healthcare provider decides to discontinue the medication, they will provide guidance on how to taper the dose gradually. The onset of action can vary, but you may start to see blood pressure reductions within hours to days after starting clonidine. It may take several weeks for the full antihypertensive effect to be achieved. Clonidine can cause drowsiness and dizziness in some individuals. If you experience these side effects, it may impair your ability to drive safely. It's advisable to assess how the medication affects you before operating machinery or driving. Clonidine is not considered to be addictive, but it should be used under the guidance of a healthcare provider. Abrupt discontinuation can lead to withdrawal symptoms, so it should be tapered gradually if it needs to be stopped. You should discuss the use of clonidine during pregnancy or breastfeeding with your healthcare provider. The benefits and risks will be evaluated based on your specific situation.
