Uses: Envas H is a combination medication that contains two active ingredients: Enalapril and Hydrochlorothiazide. Enalapril is an ACE (angiotensin-converting enzyme) inhibitor that relaxes blood vessels and lowers blood pressure. Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that helps the body to get rid of excess salt and water, thus reducing fluid retention and also lowering blood pressure. The combination of these two medications in Envas H helps to control hypertension (high blood pressure). Envaa-H tablet is used for the treatment of high blood pressure (hypertension). It is a combination medication that contains two active ingredients, Enalapril and Hydrochlorothiazide, which work together to lower blood pressure. Enalapril is an angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE) inhibitor that relaxes blood vessels, while hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that helps to remove excess salt and water from the body. Some of the common indications of Envas-H include: The main benefits of Envas H include: Lowering blood pressure: Envas H is primarily used to lower high blood pressure. By blocking the action of an enzyme called angiotensin-converting enzyme (ACE), Enalapril helps to relax blood vessels, making it easier for blood to flow through them. Hydrochlorothiazide, on the other hand, helps the body get rid of excess salt and water, which also helps to lower blood pressure. Treating heart failure: Envas H may also be used to treat heart failure. By lowering blood pressure, Envas H reduces the workload on the heart and can improve heart function. Preventing kidney damage: Envas H may also be used to prevent kidney damage in people with diabetes. High blood pressure can damage the kidneys over time, and Envas H can help to lower blood pressure and protect the kidneys. The main side effects of Envas H include: Dizziness or lightheadedness: Envas H can cause a drop in blood pressure, which may cause dizziness or lightheadedness. Dry cough: Enalapril, one of the active ingredients in Envas H, can cause a dry cough in some people. Increased urination: Hydrochlorothiazide, one of the active ingredients in Envas H, can cause an increase in urination. Electrolyte imbalances: Envas H can cause imbalances in the levels of electrolytes in the body, such as sodium, potassium, and magnesium. Allergic reactions: In rare cases, Envas H can cause allergic reactions, such as hives or difficulty breathing. It is important to follow the dosage and instructions given by your doctor when taking Envas H to avoid potential side effects. If you experience any unusual symptoms or side effects, you should contact your doctor immediately. Envas H is a prescription medicine and should be used as directed by a doctor. It is usually taken orally with or without food, once a day or as advised by the doctor. The dosage of Envas H may vary depending on the patient's medical condition, age, weight, and response to the treatment. The usual starting dose of Envas H is one tablet daily. The doctor may adjust the dose gradually to achieve the desired effect. It is important to take Envas H regularly and at the same time each day to get the most benefit from the medication. Do not stop taking this medicine without consulting the doctor, even if you feel better. If you have any questions or concerns about how to use Envas H, talk to your doctor or pharmacist. Envah H contains two active ingredients, Enalapril and Hydrochlorothiazide, which work together to lower blood pressure. Enalapril belongs to a class of drugs known as ACE inhibitors, which works by blocking the action of an enzyme in the body that produces a substance called angiotensin II. Angiotensin II causes blood vessels to narrow, leading to increased blood pressure. By blocking the production of this substance, enalapril causes blood vessels to relax and widen, which results in a decrease in blood pressure. Hydrochlorothiazide belongs to a class of drugs known as diuretics, which work by increasing the amount of urine produced by the kidneys. This helps to reduce the amount of excess fluid in the body, which also lowers blood pressure. If you forget to take a dose of Envas H, you should take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a missed one. If you have any concerns, consult your doctor or pharmacist. Envas H may interact with other medications, including non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), diuretics, or other blood pressure medications. Inform your healthcare provider about all the medications you are taking. Do not use Envas H if you are pregnant or breastfeeding unless advised by your healthcare provider. Envas H should be used only under the supervision of a healthcare provider. Inform your healthcare provider if you have any medical conditions, including liver or kidney disease, diabetes, or heart disease, before taking Envas H. Envas H may cause dizziness or lightheadedness. Avoid driving or operating heavy machinery until you know how the medication affects you. Do not take Envas H if you are allergic to any of its components. In case of an overdose, seek immediate medical attention or contact your healthcare provider. Store Envas H in a cool, dry place, away from direct sunlight and out of reach of children. Do not stop taking Envas H abruptly without consulting your healthcare provider. Envas H should be stored in a cool, dry place, away from direct sunlight and heat. Keep it out of reach of children and pets. No, Envas H should not be stopped suddenly without consulting your healthcare provider, as it may cause a sudden increase in blood pressure. Envas H may cause some side effects, including dizziness, headache, cough, nausea, and diarrhea. If you experience any side effects, inform your healthcare provider immediately. Envas H should not be given to children under the age of 18, unless directed by a healthcare provider.
Side Effects: Hypertension (high blood pressure) | Congestive heart failure | Kidney problems associated with diabetes | Left ventricular dysfunction | Cardiovascular risk reduction in patients with hypertension and left ventricular hypertrophy |

Uses: INTALITH 300MG TABLET contains Lithium which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-manic agents. It is used in the treatment of manic depression. INTALITH 300MG TABLET also used to manage or control hypomania (less severe form of mania) and aggressive or self-harming behaviour. Manic depression (bipolar disorder) is a serious mental illness associated with episodes of mood swings that includes emotional highs (mania) and lows (depression). Symptoms of mania includes pressure of speech, lack of sleep and aggressiveness, while symptoms of depression include low energy, feeling sad, suicidal thoughts, lack of sleep and concentration, restlessness, crying and fatigue. Prior to INTALITH 300MG TABLET treatment, your doctor may check on your kidneys, thyroid and heart to avoid any untoward side effects. Take INTALITH 300MG TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow this medicine, do not crush, or chew. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking INTALITH 300MG TABLET unless your doctor advises you to stop. INTALITH 300MG TABLET works by stabilising the levels of chemicals in your brain that influence your mood. Intalith 300 Tablet works by suppressing the abnormal and excessive activity of the nerve cells in the brain. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Intalith 300 Tablet. Intalith 300 Tablet may make you feel sleepy, tired or dizzy. Intalith 300 Tablet may also cause other effects that can make it dangerous to drive such as numbness, paralysis, weakness or fits (seizures). INTALITH 300MG TABLET is not recommended if you are pregnant or trying to become pregnant. Consult your doctor for advice. INTALITH 300MG TABLET is not recommended if you are breast-feeding. Consult your doctor for advice. Yes, Intalith 300 Tablet may cause kidney problems. Intalith 300 Tablet is not prescribed in patients who already have severe kidney impairment. The kidney problems may not be reversible and the symptoms include swollen ankles, passing a lot of urine and feeling thirsty. Before starting treatment with Intalith 300 Tablet, your doctor will get blood tests done to see if your kidney function is normal. During Intalith 300 Tablet therapy, any gradual or sudden changes in renal function, even within the normal range, may indicate the need for re-evaluation of treatment. Intalith 300 Tablet can cause both weight gain or weight loss. You should keep a check on your weight during Intalith 300 Tablet therapy. If you feel you are gaining or losing too much weight, consult your doctor who will assess whether the change in weight is due to Intalith 300 Tablet or some other reason. Intalith 300 Tablet therapy should only be started if adequate facilities for assessing Intalith 300 Tablet levels are available. This is because Intalith 300 Tablet toxicity is related to increased levels of Intalith 300 Tablet in blood. Intalith 300 Tablet toxicity can even occur at dose which is effective for treatment. Therefore, your doctor may closely monitor your Intalith 300 Tablet levels weekly until stabilization is achieved, then weekly for one month and then at monthly intervals thereafter.
Side Effects: Used to treat manic depression | Hand trembling | Excessive urination | Increased thirst | Nausea | General discomfort (beginning of treatment) | Dizziness | Rash | Difficulty walking | Decreased appetite | Vomiting | Blurred vision |

Uses: Haloperidol and benzhexol tablets are a combination medication that contains haloperidol and benzhexol (also known as trihexyphenidyl). These medications are used in the treatment of certain psychiatric disorders, primarily for managing symptoms associated with schizophrenia and other psychotic conditions. Haloperidol and benzhexol tablets are primarily used in the management of schizophrenia and other psychotic disorders. They help to control the symptoms of psychosis, reduce agitation, and minimize the occurrence of extrapyramidal side effects associated with antipsychotic treatment. They may cause side effects such as sedation, dizziness, dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, or urinary retention. It's important to inform your healthcare professional about any existing medical conditions, allergies, or medications you are taking before starting haloperidol and benzhexol tablets. The dosage of haloperidol and benzhexol tablets will depend on the individual's condition, symptoms, and the recommendation of their healthcare professional. It's important to follow the prescribed dosage and instructions provided by your healthcare professional or the medication packaging. Do not adjust the dosage or discontinue the medication without consulting your healthcare professional. Haloperidol is an antipsychotic medication that works by blocking certain receptors in the brain, including dopamine receptors. It helps to regulate the levels of dopamine, a neurotransmitter associated with psychosis. Benzhexol works by blocking the activity of acetylcholine, a neurotransmitter involved in muscle control. Unsafe to use with alcohol Yes, haloperidol can interact with certain medications, including other antipsychotic medications, medications that affect the heart rhythm, and certain antidepressants. It's important to inform your healthcare professional about all the medications you are taking, including over-the-counter drugs, supplements, and herbal products, to avoid potential interactions. No, haloperidol should not be stopped suddenly without consulting your healthcare professional. Abrupt discontinuation can lead to withdrawal symptoms or a recurrence of symptoms. It's important to follow your healthcare professional's instructions on how to gradually reduce the dosage and discontinue the medication if needed.

Composition: Carbamazepine (400mg) Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR is an anti-epileptic medicine used to treat epilepsy. It helps prevent certain types of seizures (fits). It is also prescribed for a painful condition of the face, head, and neck known as trigeminal neuralgia and diabetes-related nerve pain (diabetic neuropathy). Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR must be taken with or without food, but take it at the same time every day. The dose and how often you need to take it will be decided by your doctor so that you get the right amount to control your symptoms. Before taking Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR, tell your doctor if you have any heart problems, kidney or liver disease, difficulty in urinating, or any mental illness like depression. These conditions may affect your treatment. You may be advised some blood tests (eg. CBC) before starting treatment and then periodically thereafter, to monitor your progress.  Common side effects: Use it as advised by your doctor or check the label for directions before use. Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR is an antiepileptic medication. It controls seizures or fits by decreasing the abnormal and excessive activity of the nerve cells in the brain. If you miss a dose of Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Versitol Retard 400 Tablet PR is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.
Side Effects: Epilepsy/Seizures | Trigeminal neuralgia | Diabetic nerve pain | Dizziness | Nausea | Vomiting | Constipation | Sleepiness | Abnormality of voluntary movements |

Uses: Composition:  Secnidazole (1000mg)  ENTOSEC 1000MG TABLET contains Secnidazole which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiprotozoals. It is used to treat urethritis and vaginitis (urethral and vaginal inflammation) due to trichomonas vaginalis, intestinal and hepatic amebiasis (liver infection) and giardiasis (parasitic infection of the small intestine due to giardia parasite).  ENTOSEC 1000MG TABLET is not recommended for use if you have a history of blood dyscrasia (abnormal condition or disease of the blood) or wheat allergy (condition that is different from celiac disease). Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking ENTOSEC 1000MG TABLET as it may increase the risk of unwanted effects. Bacterial & parasitic infections Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Entosec 1000mg Tablet is to be taken with food. Entosec 1000mg Tablet is an antibiotic. It kills the bacteria and other microorganisms that cause infections by damaging their DNA. If you miss a dose of Entosec 1000mg Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Consuming alcohol while taking Entosec 1000mg Tablet may cause symptoms such as flushing, increased heart beat, nausea, thirst, chest pain and low blood pressure (Disulfiram reaction). Entosec 1000mg Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Entosec 1000mg Tablet should be used with caution during breastfeeding. Breastfeeding should be held until the treatment of the mother is completed and the drug is eliminated from her body.
Side Effects: Gastrointestinal disturbance | Nausea | Abdominal pain | Metallic taste | Glossitis (tongue inflammation) | Stomatitis (Inflammation of the mouth) |

Uses: Frisium (clobazam) is a medication used to treat certain types of seizures, particularly in individuals with epilepsy. It belongs to the class of drugs known as benzodiazepines, which are central nervous system depressants that can have a calming effect on the brain and nerves. Frisium is typically prescribed by a healthcare professional, and the dosage can vary depending on the patient's age, weight, and the specific type of seizures being treated. The standard dosage of Frisium 10mg is typically prescribed to adults and children over the age of 6. However, it's important to note that medication dosages should always be determined and monitored by a qualified healthcare provider. The dose may need to be adjusted based on the individual's response to the medication and any potential side effects. Epilepsy: Frisium is often prescribed as an adjunctive treatment for epilepsy, especially for certain seizure types, including complex partial seizures, myoclonic seizures, and Lennox-Gastaut syndrome (a severe form of childhood epilepsy). It can help reduce the frequency and severity of seizures in individuals with these conditions. Anxiety Disorders: While it's primarily an antiepileptic medication, clobazam may also be used in the treatment of anxiety disorders in some cases. However, it is typically not the first-line choice for anxiety treatment due to its potential for sedation and dependence. Seizure Control: Frisium can help reduce the frequency and severity of seizures in individuals with certain types of epilepsy, including complex partial seizures, myoclonic seizures, and Lennox-Gastaut syndrome. Anxiety Relief: In some cases, it may be prescribed to relieve symptoms of anxiety or panic disorders, although it is typically not the first-line treatment for these conditions due to its potential for sedation and dependence. Muscle Relaxation: Clobazam can have muscle relaxant properties, which can be useful in certain medical situations. Drowsiness: One of the most common side effects of Frisium is drowsiness or sedation. It can impair alertness and coordination, so individuals taking this medication should avoid activities that require mental alertness, such as driving or operating heavy machinery. Dizziness: Many people experience dizziness or lightheadedness while taking clobazam. Fatigue: Fatigue or tiredness is another common side effect. Increased Appetite and Weight Gain: Some individuals may experience increased appetite and weight gain while on Frisium. Gastrointestinal Effects: Nausea, vomiting, and constipation can occur in some cases. Cognitive and Behavioral Changes: In rare cases, clobazam can cause changes in mood, behavior, or cognitive function. It may exacerbate symptoms in individuals with a history of depression or other mood disorders. Tolerance and Dependence: Long-term use of Frisium can lead to the development of tolerance (where higher doses are needed for the same effect) and physical dependence (withdrawal symptoms upon discontinuation). It should not be abruptly stopped without medical supervision. Serious Side Effects: Although less common, some individuals may experience serious side effects, such as an allergic reaction, severe drowsiness, or unusual changes in mood or behavior. These should be reported to a healthcare provider immediately. Follow your healthcare provider's instructions regarding the dosage and frequency of Frisium. The typical starting dose for adults and children over 6 years of age is usually 10 mg to 20 mg per day, divided into two or three doses. Your doctor may adjust the dosage based on your individual needs and how you respond to the medication. Frisium contains the active ingredient clobazam, which belongs to the benzodiazepine class of drugs. Benzodiazepines work by enhancing the effects of a neurotransmitter called gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) in the brain. GABA is an inhibitory neurotransmitter that helps calm overexcited nerve signals. By increasing the activity of GABA, Frisium helps reduce abnormal electrical activity in the brain, which is often associated with seizures or anxiety. If you remember within a few hours of the missed dose, take it as soon as you remember. It's advisable to avoid alcohol while taking Frisium, as it can increase drowsiness and impair coordination. : Frisium can cause drowsiness and dizziness. Avoid activities like driving or operating heavy machinery until you are certain how the medication affects you. Be aware that clobazam can lead to tolerance and physical dependence if used for an extended period. Do not abruptly discontinue the medication; your doctor will provide guidance on how to taper off if necessary. : Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant, as well as if you are breastfeeding. Clobazam may have risks during pregnancy, and your doctor can help you make an informed decision about its use. It's best to avoid alcohol while taking Frisium, as it can enhance the sedative effects of the medication and increase the risk of drowsiness and impaired coordination. If you experience severe side effects, unusual changes in mood or behavior, or signs of an allergic reaction (such as difficulty breathing, rash, or swelling of the face, lips, or tongue), seek immediate medical attention. Inform your healthcare provider about all medications you are taking, including over-the-counter drugs, herbal supplements, and vitamins. Some medications may interact with Frisium, potentially affecting its effectiveness or increasing the risk of side effects.

Lobazam is a brand name for a medication called Clobazam. Clobazam is a prescription medication that belongs to a class of drugs known as benzodiazepines. It is used to treat various conditions, including epilepsy and certain types of seizures, such as Lennox-Gastaut syndrome, a severe form of childhood epilepsy. The usual starting dose of Lobazam (Clobazam) for adults is 5 to 10 milligrams (mg) per day, and the dosage may be adjusted by your healthcare provider based on your individual needs and response to the medication. It's essential to follow your doctor's instructions carefully when taking Clobazam, as misuse or abrupt discontinuation of benzodiazepines can lead to withdrawal symptoms and other adverse effects. Epilepsy:Clobazam is primarily used to manage certain types of seizures, particularly in patients with Lennox-Gastaut syndrome, a severe form of childhood epilepsy. It may also be used to treat other types of seizures when other medications have been ineffective. Seizure Control:Clobazam helps control and reduce the frequency and intensity of seizures in individuals with epilepsy, improving their quality of life. Drowsiness:One of the most common side effects of clobazam is drowsiness or sedation. This can affect your ability to operate machinery or drive safely.  Dizziness:Some individuals may experience dizziness, which can increase the risk of falls, especially in older adults.  Behavioral and Mood Changes:Clobazam may lead to changes in mood or behavior, including irritability, aggression, or restlessness, especially in children. Sleep Disturbances:It can cause sleep disturbances, such as difficulty falling asleep or staying asleep.  Gastrointestinal Symptoms:Nausea and vomiting can occur in some individuals. Changes in Appetite:Changes in appetite, including increased or decreased appetite, are possible.  Muscle Weakness:Some individuals may experience muscle weakness or coordination problems.  Allergic Reactions:While rare, some people may experience allergic reactions to clobazam, characterized by skin rash, itching, swelling, severe dizziness, or difficulty breathing.  Withdrawal Symptoms:Abruptly stopping clobazam can lead to withdrawal symptoms, including seizures, anxiety, and insomnia, so it's important to follow your healthcare provider's instructions for discontinuation if necessary. Always take clobazam exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. The dosage and frequency of the medication will depend on your specific condition and needs. Clobazam belongs to a class of medications called benzodiazepines. It works by enhancing the activity of a neurotransmitter in the brain called gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA). GABA is an inhibitory neurotransmitter that helps calm and regulate brain activity. By increasing the effects of GABA, clobazam helps reduce abnormal electrical activity in the brain, which can lead to seizures. This mechanism of action makes it effective in controlling seizures and reducing their frequency. If you remember shortly after you were supposed to take the dose, take it as soon as you remember. If it's close to the time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and take the next one as scheduled. : Inform your healthcare provider if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. The safety of clobazam during pregnancy and breastfeeding should be discussed with your doctor. : Your doctor will monitor your progress and may perform blood tests to check for any potential side effects or changes in your health. : Do not stop taking clobazam suddenly, as it can lead to withdrawal symptoms and an increase in seizures. If you and your doctor decide to discontinue the medication, it should be done gradually under medical supervision. Clobazam can cause drowsiness and dizziness. Avoid activities that require mental alertness, such as driving or operating heavy machinery, until you know how the medication affects you. It is not recommended to consume alcohol while taking clobazam, as it can increase the sedative effects of the medication and lead to drowsiness and impaired coordination. Clobazam is primarily indicated for the treatment of epilepsy and certain types of seizures. It is not typically prescribed for anxiety or insomnia. If you experience severe side effects, such as difficulty breathing, swelling of the face, lips, or tongue, or a severe rash, seek immediate medical attention. Report any adverse effects to your healthcare provider. The time it takes for clobazam to work can vary among individuals. It may start to reduce seizure frequency shortly after beginning treatment, but it can take several weeks to reach its full therapeutic effect.

Enoxaparin 60mg prefilled injection is used to prevent and treat blood clots in conditions such as deep vein thrombosis (DVT), pulmonary embolism (PE), and certain heart conditions like unstable angina or non-ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (NSTEMI). Common side effects of enoxaparin may include bruising, bleeding, pain or redness at the injection site, and low platelet count. Serious side effects may include severe bleeding or signs of an allergic reaction. Seek immediate medical attention if you experience any concerning side effects. Enoxaparin is usually administered by subcutaneous injection, meaning the medication is injected just under the skin. The injection is available as a prefilled syringe. Enoxaparin helps prevent the formation of blood clots and reduces the risk of their growth and extension. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember unless it is close to the time of your next scheduled dose. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. Consult your healthcare provider if you are unsure about what to do. It is generally best to avoid excessive alcohol consumption while taking enoxaparin, as alcohol can increase the risk of bleeding. Enoxaparin may be used during pregnancy if the benefits outweigh the risks. It is essential to discuss the potential risks and benefits with your healthcare provider if you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant. The dosing frequency of enoxaparin may vary based on the condition being treated and individual factors. It is typically administered once or twice daily. In some cases, individuals may be trained to self-administer enoxaparin injections at home. However, this should be done under the guidance of a healthcare professional who will provide instructions on the correct technique and dosage.

Common side effects of Enoxaparin may include bleeding, bruising, pain or redness at the injection site, and low platelet counts. In some cases, serious bleeding events may occur. If you experience any unusual bleeding or signs of a severe allergic reaction, seek immediate medical attention. The injection is administered subcutaneously (under the skin). The exact dosing instructions and duration of treatment should be prescribed by your healthcare provider. Enoxaparin works by enhancing the activity of antithrombin III, a natural anticoagulant in the body. This leads to the inhibition of various clotting factors, primarily factor Xa and factor IIa (thrombin), which are essential for the formation of blood clots. By inhibiting these factors, Enoxaparin helps prevent the formation and growth of blood clots. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it is almost time for your next scheduled dose. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. It is generally best to avoid excessive alcohol consumption while on Enoxaparin, as it may increase the risk of bleeding. If you experience any signs of an allergic reaction while using Enoxaparin, seek immediate medical attention. If you are known to be allergic to Enoxaparin or any other LMWH, your healthcare provider will avoid prescribing it and will consider alternative medications for your condition. The duration of Enoxaparin treatment depends on the specific indication and your healthcare provider's recommendations. Follow their instructions regarding the duration of treatment. Enoxaparin is commonly prescribed for individuals at risk of blood clot formation during hospitalization, after surgery, or in specific medical conditions where thromboprophylaxis is required.
Side Effects: -Prevention of Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) | -Treatment of DVT and Pulmonary Embolism (PE) | -Prophylaxis of Thromboembolic Events in Specific Medical Conditions |

Uses: Common side effects of Enoxaparin may include bruising or bleeding at the injection site. Serious side effects may include bleeding, signs of low blood platelets (such as easy bruising, nosebleeds, or petechiae), and allergic reactions. Seek medical attention immediately if you experience any concerning side effects. Enoxaparin 40mg prefilled injection is administered as a subcutaneous injection, meaning it is injected just beneath the skin. Enoxaparinworks by enhancing the activity of antithrombin III, a natural substance in the body that helps prevent blood clot formation. It inhibits certain clotting factors in the blood, particularly factor Xa and thrombin, which are involved in the clotting process. By inhibiting these factors, Enoxaparin reduces the risk of blood clot formation. If you miss a dose of Enoxaparin, take it as soon as you remember, unless it is close to the time of your next scheduled dose. In that case, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, discuss the risks and benefits of Enoxaparin therapy with your healthcare provider. Enoxaparin may be used during pregnancy if the benefits outweigh the risks, but this decision should be made by your healthcare provider. It's generally best to avoid excessive alcohol consumption while on Enoxaparin therapy, as alcohol can increase the risk of bleeding. Enoxaparin may interact with certain medications, including other anticoagulants and antiplatelet drugs. It's essential to inform your healthcare provider about all medications, supplements, or herbal products you are taking to avoid potential drug interactions.
Side Effects: -Prevention of Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT) | -Treatment of DVT | -Treatment of Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS) |

Uses: -Treatment of Deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and Pulmonary Embolism (PE) -Prophylaxis of Clotting in Specific Medical Conditions Common side effects of enoxaparin may include bruising or bleeding at the injection site. Serious side effects, such as bleeding, severe allergic reactions, or low platelet count, are rare but possible. Seek immediate medical attention if you experience any concerning symptoms. Enoxaparin 40mg prefilled injection is given as a subcutaneous injection (under the skin). It is usually injected into the fatty layer of the abdomen or the outer part of the upper arm. Enoxaparin works as an anticoagulant by inhibiting the activity of specific clotting factors in the blood, such as factor Xa and thrombin. By doing so, it helps prevent the formation and extension of blood clots, reducing the risk of potentially serious complications like DVT and PE. It is generally best to limit or avoid alcohol consumption while taking enoxaparin, as alcohol can increase the risk of bleeding. Enoxaparin may be prescribed to patients undergoing surgery or medical procedures with a risk of blood clot formation. It is also used in hospitalized patients at risk of clotting and those with certain medical conditions, such as unstable angina and non-Q-wave myocardial infarction. Discuss the use of enoxaparin during pregnancy or breastfeeding with your healthcare provider. They will assess the benefits and potential risks and determine if the medication is safe for you during these conditions.

Composition: Glimepiride (1mg) + Metformin (500mg) Diapride M1 Tablet PR belongs to a category of medicines known as anti-diabetic drugs. It is a combination of two medicines used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus in adults. It helps control blood sugar levels in people with diabetes. Diapride M1 Tablet PR should be taken with food. Take it regularly at the same time each day to get the most benefit. You should not take it if you have type 1 diabetes mellitus, if you have diabetic ketoacidosis (high levels of acid in your blood), or if you have severe kidney or liver disease. Before taking this medicine, tell your doctor if you have ever had heart disease. It may not be suitable. Pregnant or breastfeeding women should also consult their doctor before taking it. Your blood sugar levels should be checked regularly and your doctor may also advise blood tests to monitor your blood cell counts and liver function. Common side effects: Use it as advised by your doctor or check the label for directions before use. Diapride M1 Tablet PR is to be taken with food. Diapride M1 Tablet PR is a combination of two antidiabetic medicines: Glimepiride and Metformin.Glimepiride is a sulfonylurea which works by increasing the amount of insulin released by the pancreas in order to lower the blood glucose. Metformin is a biguanide which works by lowering glucose production in the liver, delaying glucose absorption from intestines and increasing the body's sensitivity to insulin. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Diapride M1 Tablet PR. Diapride M1 Tablet PR may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Diapride M1 Tablet PR is unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Data suggests that the drug may cause toxicity to the baby.
Side Effects: Treatment of Type 2 diabetes mellitus | Hypoglycemia (low blood glucose level) | Headache | Nausea | Diarrhea | Flatulence |

Uses: Composition: Linezolid (600mg) Linosept 600mg Tablet is an antibiotic medicine used in the treatment of severe bacterial infections. It is used to treat infections of the lungs (pneumonia), skin, and soft tissues. Linosept 600mg Tablet may be taken with or without food, preferably at a fixed time. You should take it regularly as per the schedule prescribed by your doctor. Taking it at the same time every day will help you to remember to take it. Before using it, you should tell your doctor if you are allergic to any antibiotics or have any kidney or liver problems. You should also let your doctor know all other medicines you are taking as they may affect, or be affected by this medicine. Pregnant and breastfeeding mothers should consult their doctor before using it.  Treatment of Severe bacterial infections Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Linosept 600mg Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time.Avoid Linosept 600mg Tablet with tyramine-rich food such as cheese, smoked fish, meats and some types of beer. Linosept 600mg Tablet is an antibiotic. It stops bacterial growth by preventing synthesis of essential proteins required by bacteria to carry out vital functions. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Linosept 600mg Tablet. Linosept 600mg Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Linosept 600mg Tablet is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.
Side Effects: Vomiting | Headache | Nausea | Decreased blood cells (red cells, white cells, and platelets) | Diarrhea |

Uses: Linezolid 600mg tablets are prescribed to treat the following bacterial infections: -Skin and Soft Tissue Infections:Including cellulitis, abscesses, and wound infections. -Pneumonia:Caused by certain bacterial strains. -Bacterial Bloodstream Infections:Such as vancomycin-resistant Enterococcus faecium infections or methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) infections. -Other Infections:Linezolid may be used in certain cases where other antibiotics have failed or are not suitable. Common side effects of Linezolid 600mg tablets may include headache, nausea, diarrhea, and skin rashes. Take tablets with a glass of water as directed by the Physician. The dosing frequency and duration of treatment may vary based on the type and severity of the infection. Always complete the full course of treatment, even if you feel better. Linezolid prevents bacteria from producing essential proteins, leading to bacteria inability to grow and spread. This action helps combat bacterial infections. It is generally recommended to avoid consuming alcohol while taking Linezolid, as alcohol may interact with the medication and cause unwanted side effects. If you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant, or if you are breastfeeding, discuss the use of Linezolid with your healthcare provider. The safety of Linezolid during pregnancy and breastfeeding needs to be assessed on a case-by-case basis. Linezolid is not known to cause drowsiness or impair alertness. However, individual responses may vary. If you experience dizziness or drowsiness, avoid driving or operating machinery until you feel well. Linezolid can cause serious side effects in some individuals, including allergic reactions, changes in blood cell counts, and lactic acidosis. Contact your healthcare provider immediately if you experience any severe or persistent side effects. Uses: Shelcal 250 is a calcium supplement that provides 250 mg of elemental calcium per tablet. It is commonly used to support calcium intake and maintain healthy bones and teeth. Here is some information about Shelcal 250: Uses: Shelcal 250 is primarily used to prevent or treat calcium deficiency. It is often prescribed to individuals who have low calcium levels due to dietary deficiencies, certain medical conditions, or as a supplement during pregnancy and lactation. Benefits: Shelcal 250 helps in maintaining optimal calcium levels in the body, which is essential for various functions. Adequate calcium intake supports the development and maintenance of strong bones and teeth, helps in muscle function, nerve transmission, blood clotting, and hormone regulation. Side Effects: Shelcal 250 is generally well-tolerated when taken as recommended. However, some individuals may experience side effects such as constipation, gas, bloating, or stomach discomfort. These effects are usually mild and temporary. How to Use: The dosage and duration of Shelcal 250 should be determined by your healthcare professional based on your individual needs and calcium levels. It is typically taken orally with water, usually after meals to enhance absorption. Follow the instructions provided by your healthcare professional or as mentioned on the product packaging. How it Works: Shelcal 250 works by providing the body with an additional source of calcium. Calcium is an essential mineral required for various physiological processes. It is absorbed in the intestines and utilized by the body for bone mineralization, muscle contraction, nerve signaling, and other functions. Safety Advice: Before taking Shelcal 250, it is important to consult with your healthcare professional, especially if you have underlying health conditions or are taking other medications. They can assess if Shelcal 250 is suitable for you and provide appropriate dosage instructions. FAQ: If you have any specific questions about Shelcal 250, it is recommended to consult with your healthcare professional or pharmacist. They can provide personalized information based on your health situation and specific needs. Remember, Shelcal 250 is a supplement and should not replace a balanced diet. It is important to maintain a healthy lifestyle, consume a varied diet rich in calcium-containing foods, and follow your healthcare professional's advice for optimal bone health.

Branton 500 is composed of Citicholine, also known as CDP-choline or cytidine diphosphate choline, is a dietary supplement that contains choline, a nutrient essential for brain health and function. Citicholine is a dietary supplement that contains choline, which is an essential nutrient for the brain. It is also known as CDP-choline or cytidine diphosphate choline. Choline is important for various processes in the body, including the synthesis of phospholipids, which are essential components of cell membranes, particularly in the brain. One of the main benefits of Citicholine is its potential to support cognitive function and brain health. It is believed to enhance memory, attention, focus, and overall cognitive performance. By providing a source of choline, Citicholine supports the production of phospholipids in the brain, which are crucial for proper brain cell function. In addition to cognitive support, Citicholine has been studied for its neuroprotective effects. It may help protect brain cells from damage and promote neuronal repair. This makes it an area of interest in research related to conditions such as stroke, traumatic brain injury, and neurodegenerative disorders.

Uses: Composition: Trihexyphenidyl (2mg) Parkin 2 Tablet  belongs to a group of medicines called anti-spasmodic agents used as an adjunct to treat Parkinson’s disease and extrapyramidal symptoms (drug-induced movement disorders). Parkin 2 Tablet  contains ‘Trihexyphenidyl’ which works by relaxing the muscles and nerve impulses that control muscle functioning. Parkin Tablet is an anticholinergic medication. It works by decreasing the activity of a chemical messenger (acetylcholine) in the brain. This improves muscle control and reduces stiffness in Parkinson's disease. It also improves movement disorder (restlessness, involuntary movements or muscle spasm) caused by certain other medicines. Parkin Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Parkin Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Uses: -Bacterial Infections:Ornidazole is used to treat infections caused by certain bacteria, particularly those that can lead to anaerobic infections, such as in the gastrointestinal tract, reproductive organs, and certain skin infections. -Protozoal Infections:Ornidazole is effective against certain protozoa, including amoebae and Giardia lamblia. It's used to treat infections like amoebic dysentery and giardiasis. Common side effects of ornidazole may include nausea, vomiting, headache, dizziness, and a metallic taste in the mouth. Ornidazole tablets are usually taken orally with water, and they can be taken with or without food. The dosage and duration of treatment will depend on the specific infection being treated and your healthcare provider's recommendations. It works by its ability to interfere with the DNA replication process in certain microorganisms, including bacteria and parasites which helps in inhibition of growth and kills the parasites. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. Do not double up on dose. Ornidazole is generally not recommended during pregnancy, especially in the first trimester, unless the potential benefits outweigh the risks. It's also not recommended while breastfeeding, as it can pass into breast milk. Avoid consuming alcohol while taking ornidazole, as it can lead to harsh reactions, which can cause nausea, vomiting, flushing, and other uncomfortable symptoms. Yes, it's important to complete the full course of ornidazole as prescribed by your healthcare provider, even if your symptoms improve. If you experience side effects, it's important to consult your healthcare provider before discontinuing the medication. Composition: Fluconazole 150 mg Capsules Fluconazole belongs to a class of drugs called azole antifungals which is used to prevent and treat a variety of fungal and yeast infections. It works by stopping the growth of certain types of fungus..  It is used to treat : Common side effects: Fluconazole is an antifungal medication that works by interfering with the synthesis of ergosterol, a vital component of fungal cell membranes. By inhibiting an enzyme called lanosterol 14-alpha-demethylase, fluconazole disrupts the production of ergosterol, weakening the fungal cells' membranes. This inhibits their growth and ability to spread, allowing the body's immune system to fight the infection. Consult with your doctor if you are allergic to fluconazole or to any of the other ingredients of this medicine. This medicine is not recommended if you are pregnant or planning to have a baby. Ask your doctor for advice before taking this medicine This medicine is not recommended if you are breast feedinng or planning to breast feed. Ask your doctor for advice before taking this medicine.

Bisoprolol fumarate is a medication commonly used to treat various cardiovascular conditions. Hypertension (High Blood Pressure):Bisoprolol helps lower blood pressure, reducing the workload on the heart and reducing the risk of heart-related complications. Heart Failure:It can be used in the management of chronic heart failure to improve heart function and symptoms. Angina Pectoris:Bisoprolol can relieve angina, a type of chest pain that occurs due to reduced blood flow to the heart. Atrial Fibrillation and Arrhythmias:In some cases, it is used to control irregular heart rhythms, particularly atrial fibrillation. Blood Pressure Control:One of the primary uses of Bisoprolol is to lower high blood pressure (hypertension). By reducing blood pressure, it helps decrease the risk of complications associated with hypertension, such as heart attacks, strokes, and kidney problems. Heart Rate Regulation:Bisoprolol helps regulate the heart rate. It can slow down a fast or irregular heartbeat, which is especially important in conditions like atrial fibrillation or arrhythmias. Improved Heart Function:For individuals with heart failure, Bisoprolol can improve the heart's ability to pump blood effectively. This can lead to better overall heart function and reduced symptoms of heart failure, such as shortness of breath and fatigue. Angina Relief:Bisoprolol can relieve chest pain (angina) by reducing the heart's oxygen demand, making it a valuable medication for individuals with this condition. Stabilizing Heart Rhythms:In addition to controlling heart rate, Bisoprolol can help stabilize irregular heart rhythms, particularly in cases of atrial fibrillation. Prevention of Migraines:In some cases, Bisoprolol has been used to prevent migraine headaches, as it can reduce the frequency and severity of migraines in certain individuals. Protection After Heart Attack:Beta-blockers like Bisoprolol are often prescribed after a heart attack to reduce the risk of subsequent cardiac events and to improve overall heart function. Safety in Heart Conditions:Bisoprolol is generally considered safe for use in people with certain heart conditions, including stable angina, heart failure with reduced ejection fraction, and specific types of arrhythmias. Reduction in Stress-Related Symptoms:For some individuals with anxiety or performance-related stress, beta-blockers like Bisoprolol can help manage physical symptoms of anxiety, such as a rapid heartbeat or tremors. Like all medications, Bisoprolol can cause side effects. Common side effects may include fatigue, dizziness, low blood pressure, slow heart rate, and cold extremities. It's essential to inform your healthcare provider if you experience any side effects, especially if they become severe or bothersome. Take as Directed: Bisoprolol fumarate blocks the action of adrenaline and similar stress hormones on the heart and blood vessels. By doing so, it reduces the heart rate and the force of heart contractions, which lowers blood pressure and reduces the heart's workload. This can help improve heart function and reduce symptoms in various cardiovascular conditions. Take the Missed Dose When You Remember:If you realize that you missed a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose. In that case, skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Don't Double Up:Do not take a double dose to make up for the missed one. Taking more medication than prescribed can lead to an increased risk of side effects and may not provide any additional benefit. Keep a Schedule:To help prevent missing doses in the future, consider using tools like pill organizers or setting alarms to remind you to take your medication at the prescribed times. Consult Your Doctor:If you frequently forget to take your medication or have difficulty sticking to your medication schedule, it's essential to discuss this with your healthcare provider. They can provide guidance and may explore alternative treatments or dosing regimens that are more manageable for you. :

They may want to monitor your blood pressure, heart rate, and overall health while you're taking Bisoprolol. Inform your doctor about all medications, supplements, and herbal products you are taking. Bisoprolol can interact with certain drugs, so your doctor can make necessary adjustments to prevent adverse interactions. - Bisoprolol is typically not used in children unless specifically prescribed by a pediatric cardiologist or specialist for certain heart conditions. The use of Bisoprolol during pregnancy and breastfeeding should be carefully evaluated based on individual circumstances. - In some cases, healthcare providers may prescribe beta-blockers like Bisoprolol to manage physical symptoms of anxiety or performance-related stress. Uses: Bisoprolol 2.5 mg is a medication that contains the active ingredient bisoprolol. It is commonly prescribed as a beta-blocker, and it is used for various cardiovascular conditions. Hypertension (High Blood Pressure):Bisoprolol is prescribed to lower elevated blood pressure levels, reducing the risk of heart-related complications. Angina Pectoris (Chest Pain):It is used to manage stable angina, a condition characterized by chest pain or discomfort due to reduced blood flow to the heart muscle. Heart Failure:Bisoprolol is part of the treatment regimen for chronic heart failure. It helps improve the heart's pumping ability and reduce the symptoms associated with heart failure. Arrhythmias:In some cases, it may be prescribed to manage certain types of arrhythmias (irregular heart rhythms). Blood Pressure Control:It helps lower high blood pressure, reducing the risk of heart attacks, strokes, and other cardiovascular problems. Angina Relief:For individuals with stable angina, Bisoprolol can alleviate chest pain and improve exercise tolerance. Heart Failure Management:In heart failure, Bisoprolol can improve heart function, reduce hospitalizations, and enhance overall quality of life for patients. Fatigue:Feeling tired or weak is a common side effect of beta-blockers like Bisoprolol. Dizziness:Some individuals may experience dizziness or lightheadedness, especially when standing up quickly. Slow Heartbeat (Bradycardia):Bisoprolol can lower the heart rate, and in some cases, it may slow the heart rate excessively. Cold Extremities:Cold hands or feet can occur due to reduced blood flow to the extremities. Sleep Disturbances:Trouble sleeping or vivid dreams may be reported by some individuals. Gastrointestinal Symptoms:Nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea can occur, though they are less common. Respiratory Symptoms:In rare cases, Bisoprolol may exacerbate respiratory conditions such as asthma. Take Bisoprolol 2.5 mg exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. The dosage and frequency will depend on your specific medical condition and their recommendations. Bisoprolol is a beta-blocker, and it works by affecting the beta receptors in the heart and blood vessels. Here's how it works: Heart Rate Reduction:Bisoprolol slows down the heart rate, which reduces the force of contraction of the heart muscle. This results in decreased cardiac output (the amount of blood pumped by the heart), which can help lower blood pressure and reduce the heart's workload. Blood Pressure Reduction:By reducing the heart rate and the force of contraction, Bisoprolol lowers blood pressure, making it easier for the heart to pump blood. Angina Relief:In the case of angina, Bisoprolol can decrease the heart's oxygen demand by reducing the heart rate and blood pressure, which can help alleviate chest pain. Take It as Soon as Possible:If you remember within a few hours of the missed dose, take it as soon as you remember. If you have a history of respiratory conditions, such as asthma or chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), inform your healthcare provider. Bisoprolol may not be suitable for individuals with certain respiratory conditions. If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, discuss the use of Bisoprolol with your healthcare provider. The risks and benefits should be considered. If you have diabetes, Bisoprolol may affect your blood sugar levels. Monitor your blood sugar regularly, and inform your healthcare provider if you notice any significant changes. Yes, exercise can be beneficial for cardiovascular health. However, if you are starting an exercise program or making significant changes to your physical activity, it's a good idea to discuss it with your healthcare provider, as they can provide guidance based on your specific condition. Yes, you can take Bisoprolol with or without food. However, taking it consistently with regard to meals is important to maintain steady blood levels. The onset of action of Bisoprolol can vary among individuals, but some people may start to notice a reduction in heart rate and blood pressure within a few hours to days of starting the medication. Full therapeutic effects may take a few weeks.

Uses: FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE contains Fluoxetine which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-depressants. It is used to treat major depressive episodes, obsessive-compulsive disorder (mental disorder) and bulimia nervosa (eating disorder). Major depressive disorder is a mental health disorder characterized by a persistent and intense feeling of sadness for an extended duration of time. It mainly impacts mood, behavior and other physical functions, such as sleep and appetite. Obsessive-compulsive disorder (OCD) is a mental disorder that is associated with repetitive thoughts (obsessions) and the urge to do things over and again (compulsions). Bulimia nervosa is a serious eating disorder that is characterized by binge eating followed by methods to avoid being overweight such as vomiting, severe exercise or fasting. Treats: Take FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your physician will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE without consulting your doctor. FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE works by increasing the levels of serotonin, a chemical messenger in the brain. This improves mood and physical symptoms of depression and relieves symptoms of panic and obsessive disorders. FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use especially in the last 3 months of pregnancy as it harms the unborn baby. It should be used with caution during late pregnancy or just before giving birth. Consult your doctor before taking FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE. FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE will be excreted through breast milk., hence it should be used with caution if it is clearly necessary. Your doctor will lower the dose accordingly. Consult your doctor before taking FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE. Consult your doctor before taking. Yes. FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE may cause increased pressure in the eye in patients having glaucoma. Consult your doctor before taking FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE. Yes. FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE should be used with caution in elderly patients (above 70 years of age). Consult your doctor before taking FLUZAK 20MG CAPSULE.
Side Effects: Major depressive episodes | Obsessive-compulsive disorder (mental disorder) | Bulimia nervosa (eating disorder) | Insomnia | Headache | Diarrhea | Nausea | Fatigue | Not feeling hungry, weight loss | Nervousness, anxiety | Poor concentration | Sleepiness, unusual dreams, tiredness | Dizziness | Change in taste | Uncontrollable shaking movements | Blurred vision | Rapid and irregular heartbeat sensation | Flushing | Yawning | Indigestion, vomiting | Dry mouth | Rash, urticaria, itching | Excessive sweating | Joint pain | Passing urine more frequently | Unexplained vaginal bleeding | Feeling shaky or chills |

Uses: Composition: Olmesartan Medoxomil (40mg)  OLMECIP 40MG TABLET contains Olmesartan which belongs to the group of medicines called Angiotensin II receptor antagonists. It is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) in adults, children and adolescents (from aged 6 years to less than 18 years). Olmecip 40 Tablet may be prescribed either alone or in combination with other medicines. It may be taken with or without food during the day or at night. However, try to take it at about the same time each day to get the maximum benefit. It is important to continue taking it regularly even if you feel well or if your blood pressure is controlled.  OLMECIP 40MG TABLET should be used with caution in patients with kidney, liver or heart problems. Your doctor may check your kidney function test, blood pressure and the amount of electrolytes (Ex. potassium) in your body prior to the treatment with OLMECIP 40MG TABLET or at regular intervals along with the treatment.  Your doctor may advice you to take regular exercise such as walking or swimming, low salt diet, giving up smoking and alcohol drinking, which helps to reduce blood pressure effectively during treatment with this medicine.  Hypertension (high blood pressure)Heart failurePrevention of heart attack and stroke Common side effects: CoughDiarrheaDizzinessFlu-like symptomsHeadache Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Olmecip 40 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Olmecip 40 Tablet is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). It relaxes the blood vessel by blocking the action of a chemical that usually makes blood vessels tighter. This lowers the blood pressure, allowing the blood to flow more smoothly to different organs and the heart to pump more efficiently. If you miss a dose of Olmecip 40 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Olmecip 40 Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Olmecip 40 Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Olmecip 40 Tablet is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.
Side Effects: Indigestion | Nausea | Runny nose | Sore throat | Stomach pain |

Uses: Composition: Olmesartan Medoxomil (40mg) Olmat 40 Tablet is a medicine used to treat high blood pressure and heart failure. Lowering blood pressure helps to prevent future heart attacks and stroke. This medicine is also effective in preserving kidney function in patients with diabetes. Olmat 40 Tablet may be prescribed either alone or in combination with other medicines. It may be taken with or without food during the day or at night. However, try to take it at about the same time each day to get the maximum benefit. Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Olmat 40 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Olmat 40 Tablet is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). It relaxes the blood vessel by blocking the action of a chemical that usually makes blood vessels tighter. This lowers the blood pressure, allowing the blood to flow more smoothly to different organs and the heart to pump more efficiently. Olmat 40 Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Olmat 40 Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Olmat 40 Tablet is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.
Side Effects: Hypertension (high blood pressure) | Heart failure | Prevention of heart attack and stroke | Cough | Diarrhea | Dizziness | Flu-like symptoms | Headache | Indigestion | Nausea | Runny nose | Sore throat | Stomach pain |

Uses: Olmesartan medoxomil is primarily used to treat hypertension (high blood pressure). It can be prescribed alone or in combination with other antihypertensive medications. Common side effects of olmesartan medoxomil may include dizziness, headache, diarrhea, nausea, fatigue, and back pain. Olmesartan medoxomil can be taken with or without food. It's important to take the medication at the same time each day to maintain consistent blood levels. Olmesartan medoxomil is an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB). Angiotensin II is a hormone that constricts blood vessels and increases blood pressure. By blocking the angiotensin II receptor, olmesartan prevents its effects, leading to vasodilation (relaxation of blood vessels) and a reduction in blood pressure. If you miss a dose of Olmesafe 10mg Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Pregnant & Breastfeeding women should avoid taking olmesartan medoxomil, as it can harm the developing fetus. If you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant, discuss alternative treatments with your doctor. Alcohol consumption should be avoided or limited during the treatment with olmesartan to avoid harsh side effects. Driving should be only done if dizziness is not felt by the patient after taking olmesartan. Such effects may vary with each person. You may notice a decrease in your blood pressure effectively within 1 weeks of starting Olmesafe 10mg Tablet. However, it may take about 2 weeks to see the full benefits of this medicine. NO, Olmesafe 10 Tablet does not have a diuretic. Olmesafe 10 Tablet is a medicine used to lower high blood pressure. It belongs to a group of medicines called angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). These medicines lower blood pressure by relaxing the blood vessels.

Hepa Merz Syrup contains L-ornithine-L-aspartate, Nicotinamide, and Riboflavin sodium phosphate.Role of active ingredients:L-ornithine L-aspartate is amino acids that reduces the accumulation of ammonia in patients with poor liver function and relieve symptoms of abnormal ammonia metabolism.Nicotinamide is a form of vitamin B3 (niacin) and is used to prevent and treat niacin deficiency.Riboflavin sodium phosphate involved in oxidation-reduction reactions in many metabolic pathways, and in energy production in the mitochondrial respiratory chain.Hepa Merz Syrup is a hepatoprotective which is used in:-Acute and chronic hepatitis,Jaundice,Fatty degeneration of liver Cirrhosis,Liver damage due to alcohol hepatotoxic drugs,Anorexia and indigestion.Use under medical supervision.

HEPAMERZ TABLET is a combination of L Ornithine L Aspartate and Pancreatin which belongs to the group of medicines called Hepatoprotectors. It is used to treat acute and chronic hepatitis (inflammation of liver), cirrhosis of liver (scarring of liver tissue), jaundice (yellowish discolouration of skin and whites of eye), fatty liver or alcoholic liver disease, Liver protection against drugs and alcohol, atonic constipation, and hepatic encephalopathy (brain disorder due to severe liver disease). It is also used in adjunct to hepatotoxic drugs. Treats: Take HEPAMERZ TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with water and do not crush or chew the medicine. Dose and duration will be decided by your physician depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. L Ornithine and L Aspartate present in HEPAMERZ TABLET works by increasing the levels of ornithine and aspartic acid in the body, these amino acids help to reduce levels of toxic chemical called ammonia in the blood. This helps to regenerate damaged liver cells which helps liver to carry out its functions smoothly and Pancreatin is a Digestive enzyme. Thus treating the liver disease and improves digestion. Yes, HEPAMERZ TABLET has hepatoprotective effects, works by increasing the levels of ornithine and aspartic acid in the body, these amino acids help to reduce levels of toxic chemical called ammonia in the blood. This helps to regenerate damaged liver cells which helps liver to carry out its functions smoothly and Pancreatin is a digestive enzyme. Thus treating the liver disease and improves digestion. Take HEPAMERZ TABLET every time after eating a meal or a snack. It is also important that you have to drink plenty of water with HEPAMERZ TABLET. Take your doses either immediately before, or at the same time as, or immediately after, eating your food. This is because acid in the stomach can stop HEPAMERZ TABLET from working. There is limited information available on the use of HEPAMERZ TABLET in pregnancy. Contact you are doctor before taking HEPAMERZ TABLET.
Side Effects: Acute and chronic hepatitis, | Cirrhosis of liver, | Jaundice, | Fatty liver or alcoholic liver disease | Hepatic encephalopathy | Liver protection against drugs and alcohol, | Atonic constipation | Nausea, stomach pain, diarrhea, bloating, constipation |

Uses: Hepacor Tabletis used for protecting the liver from harmful chemicals or damage by free radicals. It is also used to treat or relieve certain specific symptoms associated with liver diseases.Key Ingredients: Key Benefits: Directions for use: Safety Information:

Composition:  Alendronic Acid (10mg)  OSTEOFOS 10MG contains Alendronic acid which belongs to the group of medicines called Bisphosphonates. It is used to treat and prevent osteoporosis (weak or brittle bones) in Postmenopausal Women. It helps to improve bone mass density in patients with weak bones and can also be used to treat osteoporosis caused due to excessive use of corticosteroids (such as prednisone). It also helps in the treatment of Paget’s disease (abnormal bone growth due to disturbances in normal span of bone cells).  Osteofos 10mg Tablet is best taken without food. You should take it regularly at evenly spaced intervals as per the schedule prescribed by your doctor. Taking it at the same time every day will help you to remember to take it. Do not stop taking it until you have finished, even when you feel better. It may take several days to get the full benefit of this drug. Osteofos 10mg Tablet is only part of a program of treatment that may also include changes to your diet and taking calcium and vitamin supplements. Osteoporosis Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Osteofos 10mg Tablet is to be taken empty stomach. Osteofos 10mg Tablet is a bisphosphonate. It works by suppressing the activity of osteoclasts, cells that cause destruction of bone. This strengthens the bones and minimizes the risk of fractures. If you miss a dose of Osteofos 10mg Tablet, skip it and continue with your normal schedule. Do not double the dose. Do not take OSTEOFOS 10MG if you are allergic to Alendronic acid. OSTEOFOS 10MG is not recommended for use in pregenant women. Therefore, consult your doctor before taking it. OSTEOFOS 10MG is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women. Therefore, consult your doctor before taking it.
Side Effects: Diarrhea | Headache | Heartburn | Musculoskeletal (bone, muscle or joint) pain | Indigestion |

Uses: An antibiotic called Maclar 500 Tablet is used to treat a variety of infections. The majority of skin, ear, nose, throat, lungs, and respiratory tract infections can be treated with it. Additionally, it works well against the H. pylori bacterium, which is linked to peptic ulcer illness. Additionally, Maclar 500 Tablet works well against several illnesses that affect persons with lowered immunity, such as MAC or Mycobacterium avium complex. It prevents the bacteria from multiplying, easing your symptoms and curing your infection. This medication should be consumed orally, ideally one hour before or two hours after a meal. Within two hours of taking this medication, no antacids should be consumed. It should be utilized consistently at regular intervals of time, as directed by doctors.  Maclar 500 Tablet is an antibiotic medicine that can be used to treat many different infections caused by bacteria. These include infections of the respiratory tract, ear, nose, throat, lungs, and skin. It is also effective against a bacteria known as H. pylori, which is associated with peptic ulcer disease. It stops further growth of the bacteria causing the infection and helps treat your infection.This medicine usually makes you feel better quite quickly. However, you should continue taking it as long as it is prescribed even when you feel better, to make sure that all bacteria are killed and do not become resistant. Common side effects with this medicine include diarrhea, nausea, abnormal taste, indigestion, abdominal pain, headache, vomiting, and rash. These are usually temporary and subside with the completion of treatment. Consult your doctor if you find these side effects do not resolve or persist for a longer duration. Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Maclar 500 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time.Avoid Maclar 500 Tablet with tyramine-rich food such as cheese, smoked fish, meats and some types of beer. Maclar 500 Tablet is an antibiotic. It works by preventing synthesis of essential proteins required by bacteria to carry out vital functions. Thus, it stops the bacteria from growing, and prevents the infection from spreading. If you miss a dose of Maclar 500 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Maclar 500 Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur. Consuming alcohol with Maclar 500 Tablet does not cause any harmful side effects. If you miss a dose of Maclar 500 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. There is no firm evidence to suggest that the use of Maclar 500 Tablet will cause infertility in males or females. Usually, Maclar 500 Tablet starts working soon after taking it. However, it may take some days to kill all the harmful bacteria and make you feel better.

Composition: Clarithromycin (500mg) Clariwin 500 Tablet is an antibiotic used to treat various types of infections. It is effective in most infections of the respiratory tract, ear, nose, throat, lungs, and skin. It is also effective against a bacteria known as H. pylori, which is associated with peptic ulcer disease. Clariwin 500 Tablet is also effective against some infections (e.g., MAC or Mycobacterium avium complex) seen in people with reduced immunity. It stops the bacteria from growing, which helps to resolve your symptoms and cure your infection. This medicine is taken orally, preferably either one hour before or 2 hours after a meal. Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Clariwin 500 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time.Avoid Clariwin 500 Tablet with tyramine-rich food such as cheese, smoked fish, meats and some types of beer. Clariwin 500 Tablet is an antibiotic. It works by preventing synthesis of essential proteins required by bacteria to carry out vital functions. Thus, it stops the bacteria from growing, and prevents the infection from spreading. Clariwin 500 Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Clariwin 500 Tablet is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.
Side Effects: Abdominal pain | Diarrhea | Nausea | Vomiting | Headache | Rash | Injection site phlebitis | Insomnia (difficulty in sleeping) | Abnormal taste |

Uses: Clarith (Clarithromycin is an antibiotic medication that belongs to the macrolide class. It is commonly prescribed to treat various bacterial infections.) Clarithromycin is used to treat a wide range of bacterial infections, including respiratory tract infections (such as pneumonia, bronchitis, and sinusitis), skin and soft tissue infections, and certain gastrointestinal infections caused by Helicobacter pylori. It is also used in combination with other medications to treat certain types of ulcers. Common side effects may include gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain. In rare cases, clarithromycin may cause more serious side effects, such as liver problems or allergic reactions. If you experience any concerning symptoms, it's important to seek medical attention. The dosage of clarithromycin will depend on the specific infection being treated, the severity of the infection, and the recommendation of your healthcare professional. It is available in tablet form and is usually taken orally with or without food. It's important to follow the prescribed dosage and instructions provided by your healthcare professional or the medication packaging. Do not skip doses or stop taking the medication before completing the full prescribed course, even if you start feeling better. Clarithromycin works by inhibiting the growth and spread of bacteria. It does this by interfering with the protein synthesis process in bacterial cells, thus preventing them from multiplying and causing further infection. Clarithromycin is generally considered safe for use during pregnancy and breastfeeding when the benefits outweigh the potential risks.
