Angizem 60mg Tablet is used to treat angina (heart-related chest pain), high blood pressure, and some types of irregular heartbeats (arrhythmia). It is known as a calcium channel blocker. It works by relaxing blood vessels to lower blood pressure. This helps to reduce the workload of the heart.

HUMALOG MIX50 CARTRIDGE contains Biphasic Insulin Lispro which belongs to the group of medicines called Antidiabetic agents. It is used to treat diabetes mellitus (both type I and type II). Diabetes mellitus is a chronic disease characterized by abnormally high levels of glucose in the blood. It is caused either due to inadequate production of a hormone called insulin (produced by pancreas to metabolize glucose) in the body or due to inadequate sensitivity of body cells to the actions of insulin. Biphasic Insulin Lispro is a pre-mixed combination of Insulin Lispro and Isophane (NPH) insulin. It is a fast-acting medicine where it begins to lower blood sugar levels within 10-20 minutes after administration. Always inject this medicine into your thighs, buttocks, upper arm, or abdomen (i.e., subcutaneously). Do not administer this medicine into the vein or muscle directly. It should be administered at least 10 minutes before meals. Eat a meal or snack containing carbohydrates within 20 minutes of the injection to avoid low blood sugar. Before administration, roll the vial/cartridge between your hands until the liquid becomes uniformly white and cloudy. While injecting, keep the needle under the skin for at least 6 seconds to make sure that the entire dose is injected. Prior to the administration, visualize the cartridge/vial for any visible particulate matter and discoloration. Discard the needle and syringe after use and do not share your needles with others to avoid the risk of transmission of infections. Avoid repeatedly injecting the medicine at the same site to prevent skin damage. Instead, rotate the injection site. Make sure to consult your doctor before changing the injection site as a precaution. HUMALOG MIX50 CARTRIDGE should not be mixed with any other insulins before use. Do not stop therapy with HUMALOG MIX50 CARTRIDGE without consulting your doctor. Your doctor will decide correct dose and frequency of administration depending upon your age, body weight and health condition. HUMALOG MIX50 CARTRIDGE helps your body to make utilize of the circulating blood glucose. It helps in the transport of glucose from the blood into the muscles and fat tissues. It also stops the production of glucose by the liver. As a result, it controls blood sugar levels and improve glycemic control in patients with diabetes mellitus. MONITOR YOUR BLOOD GLUCOSE AND CONTACT YOUR PHYSICIAN. HUMALOG MIX50 CARTRIDGE can be used during pregnancy if prescribed by the physician. Therefore, consult your doctor before administration. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking this medicine as it could aggravate your existing disease condition. Yes. An unopened pack must be stored in the refrigerator (2°C – 8°C). During use or while carrying as a spare, keep it at room temperature to ensure uniform resuspension. HUMALOG MIX50 CARTRIDGE is a fast-acting medicine where it begins to lower blood sugar levels about 10 minutes post administration and its effect would last for about 24 hours. No, taking a higher dose of HUMALOG MIX50 CARTRIDGE will not be effective rather it can lead to toxicity. Always take the dose prescribed by your doctor. If the prescribed dose is not effective for you, consult your doctor for advice. Your doctor might increase the dose or suggest an alternative therapy.
Side Effects: Treats diabetes mellitus (both type I and type II) | Injection site reactions (such as pain, redness, itching or swelling) | Lipodystrophy (shrinkage of fat tissues beneath the skin) | Lumps under the skin | Weight gain, swelling of body parts | Hypoglycemia (Low blood sugar levels) | Diabetic retinopathy (eye diseases due to diabetes) | Swelling around the ankles and other joints |

Uses: HCQS 400MG TABLET contains Hydroxychloroquine which belongs to the group of medicines called Antimalarials or Disease-Modifying Anti-Rheumatic Drugs (DMARDs). It is used to prevent and treat malarial infections in adults and children. Malaria is a parasitic infection caused by the plasmodium parasite, which spreads in blood by the bite of an infectious mosquito. It is characterized by symptoms such as fever, chills, sweating, headache, nausea, vomiting, body pain and general discomfort. It is also used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, discoid and systemic lupus erythematosus in adults and to treat juvenile idiopathic arthritis in children. Also, it is used to treat skin problems (which are sensitivity to sunlight). Rheumatoid arthritis, discoid and systemic lupus erythematosus is an inflammatory autoimmune condition in which the immune system attacks its own body cells. It is generalized by symptoms such as painful swelling, stiffness, swelling, tenderness or weakness of bone joints, weakness, fever, skin rashes and anaemia, etc. Always take HCQS 400MG TABLET as directed by your physician. Swallow the medicine as a whole with a glass of water and do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose, duration and frequency for you depending on your age, body weight and disease conditions. HCQS 400MG TABLET works by increasing the potential of Hydrogen (pH) in a cell which disrupts the survival of infectious organisms and it also decreases the release of inflammatory enzymes. As a result, HCQS 400MG TABLET treats malarial infections in children and adults, it also treats rheumatoid arthritis and lupus erythematosus in adults. If you forget to take a dose of HCQS 400MG TABLET on time, take it as soon as you remember. However, skip the missing dose if it’s time for the next dose. Do not take a double dose to make up for a missed dose. HCQS 400MG TABLET should be used with caution in pregnant women if recommended by your doctor. Inform your doctor immediately if you become pregnant or think you may be pregnant while taking HCQS 400MG TABLET. HCQS 400MG TABLET should be used with caution in breastfeeding women only if recommended by your doctor as it can pass through the breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking HCQS 400MG TABLET. HCQS 400MG TABLET should be taken with caution in patients with heart disease (such as cardiomyopathy, abnormal heartbeat, long QT syndrome) or have a history of a heart attack. Consult your doctor before taking HCQS 400MG TABLET. HCQS 400MG TABLET should be used with caution in patients with diabetes. Inform your doctor if you have diabetes and taking medicines to treat the condition such as insulin, sulfonylureas such as glimepiride, meglitinide, thiazolidinediones such as pioglitazone, metformin, etc. HCQS 400MG TABLET can lower the blood sugar levels. Consult your doctor if the symptoms worsen or persist. Though the symptoms of your disease subside, do not stop taking HCQS 400MG TABLET unless your doctor recommends it as the disease and its symptoms may worsen again. Consult your doctor for advice.
Side Effects: Prevents and treats malarial infection in adults and children | Treats rheumatoid arthritis, discoid and systemic lupus erythematosus | Treats skin problems (which are sensitive to sunlight) | Treats juvenile idiopathic arthritis | Nausea, vomiting | Diarrhoea | Stomach pain | Headache | Loss of appetite | Skin rashes or itching | Mood swings with uncontrollable laughing or crying | Changes in the colour of the skin, nose, mouth or hair | Dizziness | Hair loss | Decreased reflexes | Vertigo (spinning sensation) | Ringing in the ears |

Uses:
HCQUIN 200MG TABLET contains Hydroxychloroquine which belongs to the group of medicines called Antimalarials or Disease-Modifying Anti-Rheumatic Drugs (DMARDs). It is used to prevent and treat malarial infections in adults and children. Malaria is a parasitic infection caused by the plasmodium parasite, which spreads in blood by the bite of an infectious mosquito. It is characterized by symptoms such as fever, chills, sweating, headache, nausea, vomiting, body pain and general discomfort. It is also used to treat rheumatoid arthritis, discoid and systemic lupus erythematosus in adults and to treat juvenile idiopathic arthritis in children. Also, it is used to treat skin problems (which are sensitivity to sunlight). Rheumatoid arthritis, discoid and systemic lupus erythematosus is an inflammatory autoimmune condition in which the immune system attacks its own body cells. It is generalized by symptoms such as painful swelling, stiffness, swelling, tenderness or weakness of bone joints, weakness, fever, skin rashes and anaemia, etc. Rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune condition where your body’s immune system (which usually fights bacteria and viruses) attacks your body’s own cells. Hcquin 200mg Tablet stops that from happening and can relieve the symptoms of this condition such as pain, swelling, and stiffness in your joints. It can also slow down joint damage, reduce disability, and enable you to be as active for as long as possible. It can take several weeks or months to notice the effect of the medicine. You should continue taking it until your doctor says it is okay to stop using the medicine. Systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is an autoimmune disease. In this disease, the immune system of the body mistakenly attacks healthy tissue. It can affect the skin, joints, kidneys, brain, and other organs. Hcquin 200mg Tablet prevents the release of substances in the body that cause inflammation. It can be used to treat a great many different inflammatory and allergic conditions. It lowers your immune system’s response to these conditions thereby reducing symptoms such as swelling, pain, itching and other allergic-type reactions.You should always take it as it has been prescribed for you. Do not stop taking it without your doctor’s advice. This can cause unpleasant withdrawal symptoms. Because this medicine weakens your immune system, you should avoid being near people who are ill or have infections. In addition to diet and exercise, Hcquin 200mg Tablet helps improve glycemic control and reduces glycated hemoglobin (HbA1c) levels in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.  Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Hcquin 200mg Tablet is to be taken with food.  Hcquin 200mg Tablet is a Disease Modifying Anti-Rheumatoid Drug (DMARD). It works by suppressing the overactivity of the immune system that causes inflammation (swelling) and pain in the joints. This slows the progression of the underlying disease. It has also been suggested that hydroxychloroquine may increase insulin sensitivity and improve beta-cell function, thereby improving glycemic control in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus.  If you miss a dose of Hcquin 200mg Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Caution is advised when consuming alcohol with Hcquin 200mg Tablet. Please consult your doctor. Hcquin 200mg Tablet is safe to use during pregnancy. Most studies have shown low or no risk to the developing baby. Hcquin 200mg Tablet is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby. Hcquin 200mg Tablet may cause side effects which could affect your ability to drive.
You may get eye problems while taking this medicine. This may affect your ability to drive. HCQUIN takes some time to show its effects. It may even take a few weeks or months before you see an improvement in your symptoms of rheumatoid arthritis or other autoimmune diseases. However, it is important that you be patient and keep taking this medication regularly. Your doctor may prescribe some additional medications in the interim for temporary relief from the symptoms. An eye test is required before your treatment with HCQUIN starts and should be repeated every 12 months. Also, your doctor may advise you to get your blood counts (CBC) and liver function test (LFT) checked regularly. Your doctor may discontinue HCQUIN if any abnormality is detected.
Side Effects: Prevents and treats malarial infection in adults and children | Treats rheumatoid arthritis, discoid and systemic lupus erythematosus | Treats skin problems (which are sensitive to sunlight) | Treats juvenile idiopathic arthritis | Blurred vision | Headache | Diarrhea | Abdominal pain | Vomiting | Nausea | Decreased appetite | Skin rash | Itching | Affect lability |

Uses: Composition: Isosorbide Mononitrate (60mg) Nitrofix SR 60 Tablet is used to prevent heart-related chest pain (angina). It works by relaxing and widening blood vessels so blood can flow more easily to the heart. This medicine will not treat an angina attack that has already begun. Nitrofix SR 60 Tablet should be taken empty stomach. Your doctor will decide the dose and how often you should take them. Before taking this medicine tell your doctor if you have low blood pressure, increased pressure in the eye (glaucoma), kidney disease, or heart failure. Also let your doctor know if you are taking any other medicines as some may affect, or be affected by, this medicine and some may be dangerous to take with it. Prevention of Angina (heart-related chest pain) Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Nitrofix SR 60 Tablet is to be taken empty stomach. Nitrofix SR 60 Tablet is a nitrate. It reduces the workload of the heart. As a result, the heart muscle does not need as much blood and oxygen supply. Consuming alcohol while taking Nitrofix SR 60 Tablet may cause symptoms such as flushing, increased heart beat, nausea, thirst, chest pain and low blood pressure (Disulfiram reaction). Nitrofix SR 60 Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Nitrofix SR 60 Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Headache | Dizziness | Flushing (sense of warmth in the face, ears, neck and trunk) | Orthostatic hypotension (sudden lowering of blood pressure on standing) |

Uses: Common side effects can include headaches, dizziness, lightheadedness, flushing, and a burning sensation at the application site. These side effects are often temporary and tend to improve over time. Nitroglycerin is a vasodilator, which means it relaxes and widens blood vessels. When applied topically as an ointment, it is absorbed through the skin and into the bloodstream. Nitroglycerin can interact with other medications, especially those used for erectile dysfunction (like sildenafil or tadalafil) or other medications that lower blood pressure. Always inform your doctor about all the medications you're taking. Avoid alcohol while using nitroglycerin, as it can enhance the blood pressure-lowering effects. Pregnant or breastfeeding individuals should consult their doctor before using nitroglycerin ointment. It's important not to stop using nitroglycerin suddenly, as this can lead to rebound angina or other adverse effects. If you're considering stopping the medication, consult your doctor for guidance. Nitroglycerin may not be suitable for individuals with certain medical conditions, such as hypotension (low blood pressure) or severe anemia.
Side Effects: -Moderate to severe pain associated with chronic anal fissure. | -Nitroglycerin ointment is applied topically to the skin, usually on the chest or upper arm. | -A small amount of ointment is applied using a special measuring paper or applicator provided with the medication. | -The ointment is typically applied in a thin layer, and the application site is rotated to prevent irritation. |

Uses: Duloxit 60 is likely a brand name for a medication containing the active ingredient duloxetine at a dosage strength of 60 milligrams (mg) per tablet or capsule. Duloxetine is a medication that belongs to a class of drugs known as serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors (SNRIs) Major Depressive Disorder (MDD): Duloxetine is FDA-approved for the treatment of major depressive disorder, a condition characterized by persistent feelings of sadness and a loss of interest in daily activities.  Generalized Anxiety Disorder (GAD): It is also approved for the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder, a condition marked by excessive and uncontrollable worry and anxiety.  Painful Diabetic Neuropathy: Duloxetine is used to manage the pain associated with diabetic neuropathy, a type of nerve damage that can cause pain, tingling, and numbness in the extremities.  Fibromyalgia: It is prescribed to treat fibromyalgia, a chronic condition characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, and tender points in the body.  Chronic Musculoskeletal Pain: Duloxetine may also be used for chronic musculoskeletal pain conditions, such as chronic lower back pain. Mood Improvement: Duloxetine can help improve mood and reduce symptoms of depression and anxiety.  Pain Relief: For conditions like diabetic neuropathy, fibromyalgia, and chronic pain, duloxetine can provide relief from pain and discomfort. Common side effects may include: Less common but potentially serious side effects can include: Always follow your healthcare provider's instructions for dosing and usage. How Duloxetine Works: Duloxetine, an antidepressant and anxiolytic medication, works by affecting the levels of certain neurotransmitters in the brain, particularly serotonin and norepinephrine. It is classified as a serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI). Here's how it works: Serotonin: Duloxetine increases the levels of serotonin in the brain by blocking its reuptake, which means that more serotonin is available to transmit messages between nerve cells. This can help improve mood and reduce symptoms of depression and anxiety. Norepinephrine: Duloxetine also affects norepinephrine levels in the brain. By increasing norepinephrine activity, it can contribute to the regulation of mood and alleviate symptoms of certain mood disorders. If you realize you missed a dose but it's not too close to the time for your next scheduled dose, take it as soon as you remember. Duloxetine is a prescription medication and should only be used under the supervision and guidance of a qualified healthcare provider. Duloxetine, like other antidepressants, may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts, especially in young adults and during the early stages of treatment. It's important to closely monitor for changes in mood and seek immediate medical attention if you experience worsening depression or suicidal thoughts. Alcohol can interact with Duloxetine and increase the risk of side effects, so it's best to avoid alcohol while taking this medication. : It may take several weeks for Duloxetine to fully take effect. It's important to continue taking it as prescribed even if you don't see immediate improvement. Weight changes, including both weight gain and weight loss, have been reported as potential side effects of Duloxetine. If you have concerns about this, discuss them with your healthcare provider. Yes, Duloxetine is sometimes prescribed for chronic pain conditions, such as diabetic neuropathy and fibromyalgia, even in the absence of depression or anxiety.
Side Effects: Mood Improvement: Duloxetine can help improve mood and reduce symptoms of depression and anxiety. |  | Pain Relief: For conditions like diabetic neuropathy, fibromyalgia, and chronic pain, duloxetine can provide relief from pain and discomfort. | Nausea | Dry mouth | Dizziness | Fatigue | Sweating | Constipation | Insomnia | Decreased appetite | Suicidal thoughts or behavior (especially in young adults) | Serotonin syndrome (symptoms may include agitation, hallucinations, rapid heart rate, fever, muscle stiffness) | Liver problems (yellowing of the skin/eyes, dark urine, abdominal pain) | Allergic reactions (rash, itching, swelling) |

Uses: NIMODOL(Nimesulide 100 mg) tablets are a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used for the treatment of pain, inflammation, and fever. It is commonly prescribed to manage conditions such as musculoskeletal pain, osteoarthritis, and acute pain. Nimesulide is used to relieve pain, inflammation, and swelling in various conditions, including musculoskeletal disorders like osteoarthritis, as well as acute pain such as dental pain or postoperative pain. Common side effects of Nimesulide can include gastrointestinal discomfort, indigestion, nausea, and headache. Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Nimodol 100mg Tablet is to be taken with food. Nimesulide works by inhibiting enzymes involved in the production of prostaglandins, which are substances that contribute to pain, inflammation, and fever. By reducing prostaglandin production, Nimesulide helps alleviate these symptoms. If you miss a dose of Nimodol 100mg Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Nimodol 100mg Tablet. Nimodol 100mg Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Information regarding the use of Nimodol 100mg Tablet during breastfeeding is not available. Please consult your doctor. Nimesulide is usually recommended for short-term use. Long-term use should be under the guidance of a healthcare provider due to the risk of side effects. Nimesulide should be used with caution in individuals with a history of gastrointestinal ulcers. Consult your healthcare provider before use.

Nimesulide is used to relieve pain, inflammation, and swelling in various conditions, including musculoskeletal disorders like osteoarthritis, as well as acute pain such as dental pain or postoperative pain. -Pain Relief:Nimesulide is effective in relieving pain associated with various conditions, including musculoskeletal pain, joint pain, and acute pain from injuries or surgeries. -Inflammation Reduction:Nimesulide can effectively reduce inflammation, which is often a hallmark of conditions like osteoarthritis and other inflammatory disorders. -Fever Reduction:Nimesulide can help lower fever, making it suitable for managing fever associated with various illnesses. -Quick Relief:Nimesulide is known for its relatively fast onset of action, providing relief from pain and discomfort within a short period after taking the medication. Common side effects of Nimesulide can include gastrointestinal discomfort, indigestion, nausea, and headache. Nimesulide tablets are typically taken orally with water. The dosage and frequency will be determined by your healthcare provider based on your condition. Nimesulide is an NSAID that inhibits the production of prostaglandins, which are chemicals in the body that cause pain, inflammation, and fever. Nimesulide is generally not recommended during pregnancy, especially in the third trimester. It may also be contraindicated while breastfeeding. It's advisable to avoid alcohol consumption while taking Nimesulide, as it can increase the risk of gastrointestinal side effects. If you experience signs of an allergic reaction, such as rash, itching, swelling, or difficulty breathing, discontinue use and seek medical attention. It's important to follow your healthcare provider's recommendations regarding the duration of treatment. Stopping prematurely can lead to recurrence of symptoms. Nimesulide is usually recommended for short-term use. Long-term use should be under the guidance of a healthcare provider due to the risk of side effects. Nimesulide should be used with caution in individuals with a history of gastrointestinal ulcers. Consult your healthcare provider before use.

Uses: Composition:  Entecavir (0.5mg)  ENTAVIR 0.5MG TABLET contains Entecavir which belongs to the group of medicines called Antiviral agents. It is used to treat chronic Hepatitis-B infection in adults, children, and adolescents (2-18 years old). Hepatitis B is a viral infection that attacks the liver and can cause both acute and chronic disease.  Entavir 0.5mg Tablet is not a cure for HIV or AIDS and only helps to decrease the amount of HIV in your body. This helps to lower your risk of getting HIV-related complications and improves your lifespan. It is prescribed in combination with other HIV medicines. Your doctor will recommend the best medicines for you and will decide the doses that you need. Follow carefully the instructions for all the medicines that you are given.  Prior to the treatment, your doctor may want you to take several blood tests to understand your existing condition. Before taking ENTAVIR 0.5MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you have any liver, kidney or heart disease, or HIV infection. ENTAVIR 0.5MG TABLET is not recommended for use in pregnant and breastfeeding women. Consult your doctor before taking it. ENTAVIR 0.5MG TABLET is not recommended for use in children (less than 2 years of age). Consult your doctor before taking it.  Chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Entavir 0.5mg Tablet is to be taken empty stomach. Entavir 0.5mg Tablet is an antiviral medication. It prevents the multiplication of virus in human cells. This stops the virus from producing new viruses and clears up your infection. If you miss a dose of Entavir 0.5mg Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is not known whether it is safe to consume alcohol with Entavir 0.5mg Tablet. Please consult your doctor. Entavir 0.5mg Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Entavir 0.5mg Tablet is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.

Uses: Entaliv 0.5 mg Tablet is a medication that contains the active ingredient "Entecavir." It is primarily prescribed for the treatment of chronic hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection in adults. Here is some information about Entaliv 0.5 mg Tablet.  Entaliv 0.5 mg Tablet is used to manage chronic hepatitis B virus infection in adults who have evidence of active viral replication and liver inflammation. It helps to reduce the amount of virus in the body and slow down the progression of liver damage associated with chronic hepatitis B. Common side effects: The dosage of Entaliv 0.5 mg Tablet may vary depending on the severity of the infection and individual patient factors. It is important to follow the dosage instructions provided by your healthcare professional. Do not adjust the dosage or duration of treatment without consulting your doctor. Entaliv belongs to a class of antiviral medications called nucleoside analogue reverse transcriptase inhibitors (NRTIs). It works by inhibiting the replication of the hepatitis B virus, preventing it from multiplying and spreading in the body.
Side Effects: Headache | Nausea | Rash | Vomiting | Fatigue | Stomach pain | Diarrhea |

Uses:
Mycofit 500mg is a medication that contains the active ingredient Mycophenolate Mofetil. It is used in the field of organ transplantation as an immunosuppressive drug. Mycophenolate Mofetil is commonly prescribed to prevent rejection of transplanted organs, such as kidney, heart, or liver, by suppressing the immune system's response to the new organ. This helps to ensure that the body does not attack and reject the transplanted organ. It is important to note that Mycofit 500mg should only be taken under the supervision and guidance of a qualified healthcare professional, as it can have various side effects and interactions with other medications. The dosage and duration of treatment will depend on the specific medical condition and the transplant recipient's individual needs. Patients should follow their doctor's instructions carefully and report any unusual or severe side effects. Common side effects of Mycofit 500mg may include gastrointestinal symptoms like nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain. It can also affect the blood cell count and increase the risk of infections. Regular monitoring of blood counts and overall health is typically required during treatment with this medication Immunosuppression in Organ Transplantation:Mycofit 500mg is commonly prescribed to transplant recipients as part of an immunosuppressive regimen. It helps prevent the recipient's immune system from attacking and rejecting the transplanted organ, such as a kidney, heart, liver, or lung. This is crucial to ensure the long-term success of the transplant. Treatment of Autoimmune Diseases:Mycophenolate Mofetil may also be used to manage certain autoimmune diseases where the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own tissues. Conditions such as systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE), lupus nephritis, and certain types of vasculitis may be treated with this medication. Treatment of Severe Psoriasis:In some cases, Mycofit may be prescribed off-label for the treatment of severe psoriasis, a chronic skin condition Prevention of Organ Rejection:Mycofit 500mg is a vital component of immunosuppressive therapy in organ transplantation. By suppressing the immune system's response, it reduces the risk of the recipient's body rejecting the transplanted organ, such as a kidney, heart, liver, or lung. This significantly improves the chances of long-term success for transplant recipients. Management of Autoimmune Diseases:In autoimmune diseases like systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and lupus nephritis, the immune system mistakenly attacks the body's own tissues. Mycofit can help control this immune response, reducing inflammation and symptom severity in these conditions. Reduction of Disease Flare-Ups:For patients with autoimmune diseases, Mycofit may help prevent or reduce the frequency and severity of disease flare-ups. This can lead to an improved quality of life and better disease management. Alternative to Other Immunosuppressants:Mycofit provides an alternative or adjunct to other immunosuppressive medications, allowing healthcare providers to tailor treatment regimens to the patient's specific needs and circumstances. Treatment of Severe Psoriasis (Off-Label):In some cases, Mycofit may be used off-label to treat severe psoriasis, a chronic skin condition. Its immunosuppressive effects can help reduce the excessive immune response that contributes to psoriasis symptoms Gastrointestinal Symptoms:These are among the most common side effects and can include nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain. Taking the medication with food or dividing the daily dose into smaller, more frequent doses may help reduce these symptoms. Infections:Mycofit suppresses the immune system, which can increase the risk of infections. This may include respiratory, urinary tract, or other infections. It's essential to report any signs of infection to your healthcare provider promptly. Bone Marrow Suppression:Mycofit can affect the bone marrow's ability to produce blood cells, leading to anemia (low red blood cell count), leukopenia (low white blood cell count), and thrombocytopenia (low platelet count). Regular blood tests are typically conducted to monitor these levels. Increased Susceptibility to Skin Cancer:Long-term use of Mycofit may increase the risk of developing skin cancer, particularly in patients with a history of high sun exposure. Sun protection measures, such as sunscreen and protective clothing, are recommended. Liver Function Abnormalities:Mycofit can affect liver function, leading to elevated liver enzymes. Regular liver function tests are typically conducted to monitor for any issues. Nervous System and Mood Changes:Some individuals may experience headaches, dizziness, or mood changes while taking Mycofit. Respiratory Symptoms:Coughing and difficulty breathing have been reported in some cases. Gastrointestinal Bleeding:Rarely, Mycofit may lead to gastrointestinal bleeding, which can present as dark, tarry stools or vomiting blood. Hypertension (High Blood Pressure):Elevated blood pressure may occur in some individuals. Birth Defects:Mycofit should not be used during pregnancy, as it can cause birth defects. Effective contraception should be used during treatment, and pregnancy should be avoided Dosage:The dosage of Mycofit 500mg can vary depending on the type of organ transplant or medical condition being treated. Your healthcare provider will determine the appropriate dose for you. Frequency:Mycofit is usually taken twice a day, approximately 12 hours apart. Follow your healthcare provider's specific instructions regarding the dosing schedule. Administration:Mycofit tablets should be swallowed whole with a full glass of water. Do not crush, chew, or break the tablets unless your healthcare provider instructs you to do so. Timing:It's important to take Mycofit consistently at the same times each day to maintain a steady level of the medication in your bloodstream. This helps ensure its effectiveness. Food Interaction:To reduce the likelihood of gastrointestinal side effects like nausea and vomiting, you can take Mycofit with food. Taking it with a meal or a light snack may help minimize these symptoms. Avoid Alcohol:It's advisable to avoid alcohol while taking Mycofit, as it can increase the risk of certain side effects and interactions. Contraception:If you are of childbearing potential and sexually active, you should use effective contraception methods while taking Mycofit, as this medication can cause birth defects. Discuss contraceptive options with your healthcare provider. Regular Monitoring:Your healthcare provider will schedule regular blood tests to monitor your blood cell counts, kidney function, liver function, and overall health during Mycofit treatment. This monitoring helps detect and manage potential side effects or complications. Follow Instructions:Always follow your healthcare provider's instructions regarding dosage adjustments, possible changes in medication, and any precautions or special considerations specific to your condition. Do Not Stop Abruptly:It's important not to stop taking Mycofit suddenly or change the dosage without consulting your healthcare provider. Abrupt discontinuation can increase the risk of organ rejection or exacerbate autoimmune disease symptoms. Communicate with Your Healthcare Provider:If you experience any unusual or severe side effects, have questions about your medication, or need to make any changes to your treatment plan, contact your healthcare provider promptly Inhibition of DNA Synthesis:Mycophenolate Mofetil primarily works by inhibiting the synthesis of DNA in rapidly dividing immune cells, particularly lymphocytes (a type of white blood cell). Lymphocytes are a key component of the immune system and play a crucial role in recognizing and attacking foreign substances, including transplanted organs or the body's own tissues in autoimmune diseases. Targeting T and B Lymphocytes:Mycophenolate Mofetil specifically targets T and B lymphocytes, which are responsible for initiating immune responses. These cells are involved in the production of antibodies and the coordination of immune reactions. By inhibiting their DNA synthesis, the drug reduces their ability to multiply and function effectively. Immune System Suppression:With reduced T and B cell activity, the overall immune response is dampened. This suppression is essential in organ transplantation because it prevents the immune system from recognizing the transplanted organ as foreign and mounting an attack (rejection). In autoimmune diseases, it helps to control the immune system's overactive response against the body's own tissues. Selective Action:Importantly, Mycophenolate Mofetil has a selective action on immune cells, primarily affecting those that are actively dividing. This allows for a degree of specificity in targeting the immune response without completely shutting down the immune system. Other cells in the body, which do not rely on rapid DNA synthesis, are less affected. Maintenance Therapy:Mycophenolate Mofetil is typically used as a long-term maintenance therapy to provide ongoing immune suppression. It is often part of a combination therapy with other immunosuppressive medications to achieve the desired level of immune control while minimizing side effects. Mycept 500 Tablet works by reducing the activity of the immune system, thereby decreasing the chances of it recognizing the transplanted organ as foreign and attacking it.  Mycept 500 Tablet is used primarily to prevent the rejection of transplanted organs, manage certain autoimmune diseases, and reduce inflammation in some cases. Uses: Composition:  Salbutamol (4mg)  ASTHALIN 4MG TABLET contains Salbutamol which belongs to the group of medicines called Bronchodilators. Uses: Composition: Ramipril (5mg) HOPACE 5MG TABLET contains Ramipril, which belongs to the group of medicines called Antihypertensives. Duvanta (Duloxetine) is a medication that belongs to a class of drugs known as selective serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors (SNRIs). It is primarily used as an antidepressant and also has FDA approval for the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder, fibromyalgia, and chronic musculoskeletal pain. Duloxetine is primarily used as an antidepressant to treat major depressive disorder. It is also approved for the treatment of generalized anxiety disorder, fibromyalgia, and chronic musculoskeletal pain. Common side effects of duloxetine include nausea, dry mouth, constipation, dizziness, drowsiness, and sweating. These side effects are usually mild and tend to improve over time. However, if you experience severe or persistent side effects, it's important to contact your doctor. It is taken with water as directed by the physician. Duloxetine is a selective serotonin and norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI). It works by increasing the levels of serotonin and norepinephrine in the brain, which can help regulate mood, reduce pain sensations, and alleviate anxiety symptoms. Consult with your physician for next dose. Duloxetine is generally not recommended during pregnancy unless the potential benefits outweigh the risks. It may pass into breast milk, so it's important to discuss the potential risks and benefits with your doctor if you are breastfeeding or planning to breastfeed. Duloxetine is not approved for use in children and adolescents under the age of 18. The safety and efficacy of duloxetine in this population have not been well-established. Suddenly stopping duloxetine or reducing the dosage too quickly can lead to withdrawal symptoms. These may include dizziness, headache, nausea, irritability, insomnia, and sensory disturbances. It's important to gradually taper off the medication under the guidance of a healthcare professional. Yes, duloxetine can interact with certain medications, including monoamine oxidase inhibitors (MAOIs), blood thinners, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), and certain psychiatric medications. It's important to inform your doctor about all the medications, supplements, and medical conditions you have to avoid potential interactions.

It is used to treat a variety of conditions, including inflammation, allergic reactions, autoimmune disorders, and certain types of cancers. It can also be used to manage conditions like asthma, arthritis, skin disorders, and more. -Inflammatory Conditions:Medrol is often used to treat various inflammatory conditions such as arthritis (rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis), inflammatory bowel disease (Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis), and dermatologic conditions (psoriasis, eczema). -Allergic Reactions:Medrol can be used to manage severe allergic reactions, including those caused by insect stings, certain foods, or medications. -Asthma:In some cases, Medrol may be prescribed as a short-term treatment to control asthma exacerbations or acute episodes. -Autoimmune Disorders:It can be used to manage autoimmune disorders like systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) and multiple sclerosis (MS). -Certain Skin Conditions:Medrol can help manage various skin conditions that involve inflammation, such as severe cases of hives or allergic dermatitis. -Organ Transplants:It is sometimes used to suppress the immune system and prevent rejection after an organ transplant. -Respiratory Conditions:In cases of severe respiratory conditions, such as chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), Medrol might be prescribed to reduce inflammation and improve breathing. Common side effects might include changes in appetite, weight gain, fluid retention, mood changes, difficulty sleeping, increased sweating, or changes in skin appearance. Medrol tablets are taken with food to help reduce stomach irritation. Medrol 4mg containsmethylprednisolone, which is a synthetic corticosteroid. Corticosteroids are known for their anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive effects. They work by suppressing the immune response and reducing inflammation in the body. Medrol 4mg tablets can cause dizziness and changes in mood, which might impair your ability to drive or operate machinery. If you experience these side effects, it's best to avoid such activities until you know how the medication affects you. The use of Medrol 4mg tablets during pregnancy or while breastfeeding should be discussed with your healthcare provider. In some cases, the benefits may outweigh the potential risks, but your doctor will need to carefully evaluate your situation. It's generally advisable to avoid excessive alcohol consumption while taking Medrol 4mg tablets, as alcohol can interact with the medication and potentially increase the risk of side effects. It's generally not advisable to abruptly stop taking Medrol 4mg tablets, especially if you've been on them for an extended period or at high doses. Sudden discontinuation can lead to withdrawal symptoms, including fatigue, muscle and joint pain, fever, and more. If you need to stop taking the medication, your healthcare provider will likely recommend a gradual tapering schedule to minimize these effects. While there aren't strict dietary restrictions with Medrol 4mg tablets, it's a good idea to follow a balanced diet and avoid excessive consumption of foods high in sodium, as corticosteroids can sometimes lead to fluid retention.

Uses: HILOC 150 TABLET contains Ranitidine which belongs to the group of medicines called H2 receptor antagonists. It is used in the treatment and prevention of intestinal, benign and post-operative ulcers. Peptic or intestinal ulcers are open sores that develop on the inside lining of your stomach and the upper part of your small intestine, causing stomach pain. HILOC 150 TABLET is also used to treat reflux oesophagitis (inflammation of lower food pipe due to backflow of acidic stomach contents) and Zollinger-Ellison Syndrome (small tumour in the first part of your intestine due to excessive gastrin secretion). Treats: Take HILOC 150 TABLET as advised by your physician. Do not crush or chew it. Swallow HILOC 150 TABLET as whole with a glass of water. Your doctor will decide the right dose and duration of therapy according to your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking HILOC 150 TABLET unless your doctor advises you to stop. HILOC 150 TABLET contains Ranitidine that works by reducing the amount of acid made by the stomach, which helps relieve pain and also allows healing of an ulcer or reflux disease. Doubling the dose of HILOC 150 TABLET to make up for a forgotten dose would not substitute the missing amount but increase the risk of overdosing. Continue the treatment according to the schedule. If there are any further questions on the use of this medicine, call your doctor. HILOC 150 TABLET is not recommended for use in pregnant women unless considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before taking it. HILOC 150 TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women unless considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before taking it. HILOC 150 TABLET should be taken with caution in patients with kidney problems. Consult your doctor before taking it. Certain acid reflux medicines (H2 blockers) can also affect histamine and cause erectile dysfunction. Whereas some medicines of this class have the highest risk for ED, HILOC 150 TABLET have a lower risk. Consult your doctor for further queries. Before undergoing any operation, inform your doctor if you are receiving HILOC 150 TABLET. This is because the doctor or surgeon can give you midazolam to make you fall asleep before operation and it can interact with HILOC 150 TABLET. Consult your doctor for further queries.
Side Effects: And prevents intestinal, benign and post-operative ulcers | Reflux oesophagitis | Zollinger-Ellison Syndrome | Stomach pain | Constipation | Nausea |

Uses: Composition: METHYLCOBALAMIN-1500MCG Meconerv 1500 Tablet 10's belongs to the class of 'vitamins', primarily used to treat vitamin b12 deficiency and peripheral neuropathy (nerve damage in the hands and feet). It is also used to prevent/treat megaloblastic anaemia (anaemia with unusually large red blood cells). Vitamin B12 deficiency occurs when the body has lower levels of vitamin B12 than normal. Symptoms include fatigue, breathlessness, numbness, poor balance, and memory trouble. Vitamin B12 deficiency and peripheral neuropathy. Common side effects; Take one tablet daily or as directed by the physician. Do not crush, chew or break it. Meconerv 1500 Tablet 10's contains Methylcobalamin, a form of Vitamin B12, which regulates body functions and helps rejuvenate and protect damaged nerve cells by producing a substance called myelin. It prevents nerve damage in peripheral neuropathy and treats symptoms of vitamin B12 deficiency. It promotes amino acid synthesis and plays an important role in protein formation. Meconerv 1500 Tablet 10's also treats and prevents megaloblastic anemia, a vitamin deficiency anemia caused by low vitamin b12 levels. Avoid consuming alcohol with Meconerv 1500 Tablet 10's to ensure maximum absorption of nutrients.
Side Effects: Nausea | Vomiting | Headache | Loss of appetite | Diarrhoea |

Uses: INFLAZYME-LS  TABLET contains Chymotrypsin- Trypsinwhich belongs to the group of medicines called Proteolytic enzymes. It is used to treat post-operative wounds, necrotic tissue, oedema (Ex. swelling of tooth and gums) and haematomas like auricular septal hematoma, nasal fractures, parapharyngeal abscess, prevention of inflammation of the surgical stitches, pelvic inflammatory disease, caesarean section, episiotomy, hysterectomy, tooth extraction, peri-apical abscess, ocular trauma include fluid build-up in the macula (macular oedema), hyphema (collection of blood in eye), black eye, inflammation of uveal tract (uveitis), broken blood vessels (subconjunctival haemorrhage), degenerative joint disorders like rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, spondylosis, spondylarthritis, pain management, maxillofacial surgery, post-traumatic oedema, soft tissue injury, fractures and dislocation, sports injuries, muscle and joint pain with swelling, sciatica, and sprains and strains. Take INFLAZYME-LS  TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicines with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your physician will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition. INFLAZYME-LS TABLET works by breaking down the proteins and helps to fight infection and hasten the repair of traumatic, surgical or orthopaedic injuries. It also breaks down the blood clots thus improving and restoring circulation and resolves oedema, hematoma and pain, promotes the removal of the debris and accelerates recovery. It also reduces swelling (oedema), and inflammation, by reducing the proinflammatory mediators and fastens the healing process. INFLAZYME-LS TABLET is not recommended for use during pregnancy unless considered necessary. Contact your doctor before taking it. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking INFLAZYME-LS TABLET as it may lead to unwanted effects. INFLAZYME-LS  TABLET should be used with caution in patients with lung diseases. Contact your doctor before taking it. Yes. INFLAZYME-LS may cause drowsiness. Avoid drinking alcohol and do not drive or operate any machines if you experience drowsiness, dizziness, hypotension or a headache after taking INFLAZYME-LS  TABLET. Yes. INFLAZYME-LS TABLET cause arrhythmias. Contact your doctor if you experience any unusual symptoms like a fast heartbeat, light-headedness or fainting.

Losartanis an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB), which helps relax and widen blood vessels by blocking the action of angiotensin II, a hormone that causes vasoconstriction.Amlodipineis a calcium channel blocker that relaxes and widens blood vessels by inhibiting the entry of calcium into smooth muscle cells of the blood vessels. Composition:  Losartan (50mg) + Hydrochlorothiazide (12.5mg)  ZAART H is a combination of Hydrochlorothiazide and Losartan which belongs to the group of medicines called Thiazide like diuretics and Angiotensin II receptor antagonists respectively. ZAART H is indicated for the treatment of essential hypertension. Essential hypertension (also known as high blood pressure) is a medical condition in which the force of the blood exerted against the walls of the artery remains very high, and as a result it may lead to severe damage to the blood vessels of several organs, thus causing heart attack, heart or kidney failure, stroke, or even blindness.   You can take Zaart H Tablet with or without food. The dose will depend on your condition and how you respond to the medicine. Try to take it at the same time each day. It is important to keep taking this medicine until your doctor tells you not to. Uses:
Depin Retard 20 is a medication that contains the active ingredient nifedipine. It is used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and angina (chest pain). Depin Retard 20 works by relaxing the blood vessels, which allows blood to flow more easily and reduces the workload on the heart. Depin Retard 20 is classified as a calcium channel blocker, which means it blocks the entry of calcium into the smooth muscles of the heart and blood vessels. This results in a decrease in the force of contraction of the heart muscle and dilation of the blood vessels, leading to a reduction in blood pressure and relief of angina symptoms. Depin Retard 20 is usually taken orally as a tablet once daily, or as directed by a healthcare provider. It is important to take Depin Retard 20 at the same time each day to maintain consistent blood levels of the medication. Common side effects of Depin Retard 20 include dizziness, headache, flushing, and nausea. It is important to tell your healthcare provider about any side effects you experience while taking Depin Retard 20. Depin Retard 20 should not be stopped abruptly, as this can lead to a rebound increase in blood pressure. If you need to stop taking Depin Retard 20, your healthcare provider will gradually decrease your dose over time. If you have any questions or concerns about using Depin Retard 20, you should talk to your healthcare provider. They can help you determine if this medication is right for you and provide guidance on how to use it safely and effectively. Depin Retard 20mg is primarily used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and angina (chest pain). It works by relaxing the blood vessels, which allows blood to flow more easily and reduces the workload on the heart. This can help to lower blood pressure and relieve the symptoms of angina, such as chest pain and shortness of breath. In addition to treating high blood pressure and angina, Depin Retard 20mg may also be used to treat other conditions, such as Raynaud's phenomenon (a condition in which the blood vessels in the fingers and toes spasm and narrow in response to cold or stress) and pulmonary hypertension (high blood pressure in the lungs). However, the use of Depin Retard 20mg for these conditions may be less common and should be determined by a healthcare provider. It is important to note that Depin Retard 20mg is not a cure for high blood pressure or angina, but rather a medication that can help to manage and control these conditions. It is important to continue taking Depin Retard 20mg as directed by a healthcare provider, even if you feel well and have no symptoms, in order to maintain consistent blood levels of the medication and effectively manage your condition. The benefits of Depin Retard 20mg include: Lowering blood pressure: Depin Retard 20mg is a calcium channel blocker that helps to relax the blood vessels, allowing blood to flow more easily. This can help to lower blood pressure, reducing the risk of complications associated with high blood pressure, such as heart attack, stroke, and kidney damage. Relieving chest pain: Depin Retard 20mg can also be used to relieve the symptoms of angina, such as chest pain and shortness of breath. By relaxing the blood vessels and improving blood flow to the heart, Depin Retard 20mg can help to reduce the workload on the heart and relieve the symptoms of angina. Treating other conditions: In addition to treating high blood pressure and angina, Depin Retard 20mg may also be used to treat other conditions, such as Raynaud's phenomenon and pulmonary hypertension. Long-lasting effect: Depin Retard 20mg is designed to release the medication slowly over time, providing a longer-lasting effect than other formulations of the medication. It is important to note that the benefits of Depin Retard 20mg may vary depending on the individual and their specific medical condition. The use of this medication should always be determined by a healthcare provider, who can weigh the potential benefits against the potential risks and side effects. Like all medications, Depin Retard 20mg can cause side effects in some people. Some of the possible side effects of Depin Retard 20mg include: Flushing (redness of the face) Headache Dizziness Swelling in the ankles or feet Nausea Constipation Fatigue Palpitations (irregular or rapid heartbeat) Low blood pressure Rash Rarely, liver problems (such as elevated liver enzymes or hepatitis) It is important to note that not everyone will experience these side effects, and some people may experience different side effects not listed here. If you experience any side effects while taking Depin Retard 20mg, you should inform your healthcare provider. In some cases, it may be necessary to adjust the dose of the medication or switch to a different medication to manage the side effects. Depin Retard 20mg is typically taken once per day, preferably in the morning with a glass of water, with or without food. The medication should be swallowed whole and not chewed or crushed. The dosage of Depin Retard 20mg will vary depending on the individual and their specific medical condition. It is important to follow the instructions of your healthcare provider regarding how to take this medication. They will determine the appropriate dosage based on your age, weight, medical history, and any other medications you are currently taking. It is important to continue taking Depin Retard 20mg even if you feel well. Do not stop taking this medication without first consulting your healthcare provider. Suddenly stopping the medication can cause a sudden increase in blood pressure, which can be dangerous. If you miss a dose of Depin Retard 20mg, take it as soon as you remember. If it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a missed dose. Depin Retard 20mg contains the active ingredient Nifedipine, which is a calcium channel blocker. It works by relaxing the blood vessels and reducing the workload on the heart. This leads to an increase in blood flow and a decrease in blood pressure. Specifically, Nifedipine blocks the entry of calcium ions into smooth muscle cells in the blood vessels and heart. This causes the smooth muscle cells to relax, resulting in dilation of the blood vessels and decreased resistance to blood flow. The decreased resistance to blood flow leads to a reduction in blood pressure, which can be helpful in treating hypertension (high blood pressure). Depin Retard 20mg is an extended-release medication, which means that it slowly releases the active ingredient over time, allowing for a steady and controlled effect on blood pressure throughout the day. If you forget to take a dose of Depin Retard 20mg, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is almost time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a missed dose, as this can increase the risk of side effects. It is important to take Depin Retard 20mg as prescribed by your healthcare provider, even if you feel well. Sudden discontinuation of the medication can cause a sudden increase in blood pressure, which can be dangerous. If you have any concerns or questions about missed doses or your medication schedule, it is important to speak with your healthcare provider. Composition:  Hydrochlorothiazide (12.5mg) Hydride 12.5mg Tablet is a diuretic (water pill) medicine used to treat hypertension (high blood pressure). This medicine reduces excess fluid levels in the body and treats edema (fluid overload) associated with heart, liver, kidney, or lung disease. Hydride 12.5mg Tablet makes you lose excess water through urine. It may be used alone or in combination with other medicines. This medicine should be taken only during day time to avoid frequent urination at night. Before taking this medicine, its better to let your doctor know if you are suffering from any kidney or liver disease. Also, pregnant women and breastfeeding mothers should consult doctor before taking it Treatment of Hypertension (high blood pressure)Treatment of Edema  Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Hydride 12.5mg Tablet is to be taken with food.  Hydride 12.5mg Tablet is a diuretic which lowers blood pressure by removing extra water and certain electrolytes from the body. Over time it also relaxes blood vessels and improves blood flow. Hydride 12.5 Tablet may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Hydride 12.5 Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Hydride 12.5 Tablet is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.

It may be taken with or without food but try taking it at about the same time each day. Uses: -Hypertension:Lipril is used to treat high blood pressure, reducing the risk of complications such as stroke, heart attack, and kidney problems. -Heart Failure:Lipril is used in the management of heart failure to improve heart function and reduce symptoms such as shortness of breath and fatigue. -Protection of Kidneys:Lipril may be used to protect the kidneys in patients with diabetes or other conditions that can affect kidney function. Common side effects of Lipril 10mg tablets may include dizziness, headache, cough, and gastrointestinal symptoms. Always take Lipril as directed by your healthcare provider. Swallow the tablet whole with a full glass of water, with or without food. It works by relaxing blood vessels, thereby lowering blood pressure and improving the heart's ability to pump blood effectively. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to catch up. Lipril should not be used during pregnancy as it may harm the developing fetus. If you are planning to become pregnant or suspect pregnancy, inform your healthcare provider . It is generally advisable to limit alcohol consumption while taking Lipril. Alcohol may interact with the medication and worsen certain side effects, such as dizziness. Lipril may cause more serious side effects such as angioedema (swelling of the face, lips, tongue, or throat) or allergic reactions. Contact your healthcare provider if you experience any severe or persistent side effects. A dry cough is a common side effect associated with ACE inhibitors like Lipril. If you experience a persistent, bothersome cough, inform your healthcare provider. Lipril may affect blood sugar levels in some individuals, especially those with diabetes. Regular blood sugar monitoring is advised in diabetic patients taking Lipril. Lipril can be taken with or without food. However, it's essential to take it consistently, either with meals or at the same time each day.

Common side effects of Lipril 2.5mg tablets may include dizziness, headache, cough, and gastrointestinal symptoms. Lipril can be taken at any time of the day, but it's best to take it at the same time each day to maintain consistent blood levels. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to catch up. Lipril may cause dizziness or lightheadedness, especially during the initial days of treatment or when standing up quickly. Uses: GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET is a combination of Metformin and Sitagliptin which belongs to the group of medicines called Antidiabetic agents. It is used to control blood sugar levels in patients with Type II diabetes mellitus along with proper diet and exercise. Type II diabetes mellitus is a chronic disease characterized by abnormally high levels of glucose in the blood. It is caused due to inadequate production of a hormone called insulin (produced by pancreas to metabolize glucose) in the body or due to inadequate sensitivity of body cells to the actions of insulin. Take GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET preferably after meals or as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET unless your doctor advice you to stop. GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET is an antidiabetic medicine. It contains two medicines namely metformin and sitagliptin. Metformin makes the body more sensitive to insulin (a hormone involved in glucose metabolism). This helps our body cells to utilize more amount of the circulating blood glucose. Additionally, it can stop glucose production by the liver and reduces its absoprtion in the body. Sitagliptin controls blood sugar levels by blocking the actions of an enzyme called dipeptidyl peptidase (DPP)-4 that reduces insulin secretion in the body. Collectively, GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET controls blood sugar levels and improve glycemic control in patients with type II diabetes. If you forgot to take a dose of GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next dose of GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET, skip the missed dose and take the next one regularly. Do not take a double dose of GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET to compensate the missed ones. GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Therefore, inform your doctor before taking GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET if you are pregnant, think you may be pregnant or planning to have a baby. GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women. However, consult your doctor before taking it. You need to take GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET as long as your doctor or physician prescribes you the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. No, taking a higher dose of GLIPTIN M 50/1GM TABLET will not be effective rather it can lead to toxicity. Always take the dose prescribed by your doctor. If the prescribed dose is not effective for you, consult your doctor for advice. Your doctor might increase the dose or suggest an alternative therapy.
Side Effects: Treats Type II diabetes mellitus | Hypogylcemia (low blood sugar) | Nausea, vomiting | Flatulence, diarrhea, constipation, stomach pain, loss of appetite | Swelling of hands and legs (edema) | Upper respiratory infections | Stuffy nose, sore throat | Joint pain, pain in arms or legs | Metallic taste |

Uses: Linagliptin 2.5mg tablets are prescribed to adults with type 2 diabetes to improve glycemic control. It is usually used along with diet and exercise and may be prescribed as monotherapy or in combination with other antidiabetic medications. Common side effects of LIGATIN 2.5mg tablets may include headache, upper respiratory tract infection, nasopharyngitis (common cold), and joint pain. Take LIGATIN 2.5mg tablet exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. The usual dose is one tablet per day, with or without food in most cases. LINAGLIPTIN increases insulin secretion and reduces glucagon production. This helps lower blood sugar levels after meals and throughout the day. If you miss a dose of Linagliptin 2.5mg tablets, take the missed dose as soon as you remember, unless it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose. In that case, skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for the missed one. It's generally best to avoid excessive alcohol consumption while taking antidiabetic medications, including Linagliptin, as it may affect blood sugar levels and increase the risk of side effects. Pregnant or breastfeeding women should consult their healthcare provider before using Linagliptin, as its safety during these periods may need to be evaluated on a case-by-case basis. Linagliptin alone is less likely to cause hypoglycemia, but it may occur if used in combination with other antidiabetic medications. It's essential to monitor your blood sugar levels regularly and inform your healthcare provider of any unusual symptoms.
