Before using it, wash the affected area with water. Apply a small amount of this medication as a thin layer and gently rub on the clean and dry affected area of the skin at night before going to bed.It is only for external use. If you are using this medication  on face, avoid contact with eyes as it may cause irritation. In case it comes in contact with eyes accidentally, rinse with water thoroughly. If you still have a problem with your eye or notice any vision problems, consult your doctor immediately. Klinda A Gel  is a combination of two drugs; namely, Adapalene and Clindamycin used to treat acne (pimples). Adapalene is a retinoid (human-made vitamin A) that loosens the cells in the skin’s surface and unblocks pores by reducing the production of oil in the skin. Thereby, decreases pimples, spots, whiteheads and blackheads. Also, Adapalene increases the production of new skin cells and helps in natural exfoliation (removal of dead skin cells) of outer layers of the skin. Clindamycin is a broad-spectrum antibiotic that acts against both aerobic (grow in the presence of oxygen) and anaerobic (grow in the absence of oxygen) gram-negative and gram-positive bacteria. Clindamycin inhibits the production of essential proteins that are necessary for bacteria to grow, multiply and increase in numbers. Together it stops or slows down the growth of bacteria, causing acne and heals the skin by reducing swelling and redness.
Side Effects: Skin peeling | Dry skin | Irritation, redness, itching or burning sensation at the site of application |

Uses: Composition:   Isotretinoin (10mg)  ISOTROIN 10MG CAPSULE contains Isotretinoin which belongs to the group of medicines called Retinoids. It is used in adults and children (older than 12 years of age) to treat severe form of acne (such as nodular acne, conglobate acne, and acne that is at risk of permanent scarring), which has not improved after other anti-acne treatments. Acne is an inflammatory skin condition which is characterized by spots, oily skin, nodular lesions etc. on face, back, and chest, which can be painful. Isotroin 10 Capsule may make you more sensitive to sunlight so you should limit your exposure to the sun. It may also make your skin more fragile. Avoid any waxing (hair removal), or laser treatments during treatment. Additionally, it may cause dryness of the mouth, lips, and eyes so drink plenty of water and use a moisturizer. This medicine may lead to birth defects, do consult your doctor if you are pregnant or planning pregnancy.   Treatment of Acne Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Isotroin 10 Capsule is to be taken with food. Isotroin 10 Capsule is a derivative of vitamin A. It acts on glands (sebaceous) to reduce the production of a natural substance (sebum) that causes acne. Also, the controlled sebum production kills acne-causing bacteria. It also works as an anti-inflammatory to decrease inflammation (redness and swelling). If you miss a dose of Isotroin 10 Capsule, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Do not take ISOTROIN 10MG CAPSULE if you are allergic to Isotretinoin, soya, peanuts or any of the other ingredients of this medicine. Isotroin 10 Capsule is highly unsafe to use during pregnancy. Seek your doctor's advice as studies on pregnant women and animals have shown significant harmful effects to the developing baby. ISOTROIN 10MG CAPSULE is not recommended for use in breast feeding women as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it.
Side Effects: Dry skin | Increased liver enzymes | Rash | Easy bruising, bleeding or clotting | Anaemia (weakness, dizziness, pale skin) |

Uses: Delisprin (Aspirin), also known as acetylsalicylic acid, is a medication commonly used for its analgesic (pain-relieving), antipyretic (fever-reducing), and anti-inflammatory properties. Pain Relief: Aspirin is often used to alleviate mild to moderate pain, such as headaches, toothaches, menstrual cramps, and muscle aches. Fever Reduction: Aspirin can help reduce fever by lowering body temperature. It is commonly used for this purpose in adults and children (under medical supervision) with certain conditions. Anti-inflammatory Effects: Aspirin is an anti-inflammatory agent and can help reduce inflammation in conditions such as arthritis, swelling, and certain autoimmune disorders. Blood Thinning: Aspirin has antiplatelet properties, meaning it can help prevent the formation of blood clots by inhibiting the aggregation of platelets. As a result, low-dose aspirin is often prescribed for individuals at risk of heart attack, stroke, or certain types of cardiovascular disease. Gastro intestinal Upset Bleeding Allergic reactions Swallow the aspirin tablet with a full glass of water. Avoid crushing, chewing, or breaking the tablet unless specifically instructed by your healthcare professional or the product label. Take with Food or Milk: Taking aspirin with food or milk can help reduce the risk of gastrointestinal irritation. However, if your healthcare professional has advised you to take aspirin on an empty stomach for a specific reason, follow their instructions. aspirin has an antiplatelet property. It irreversibly inhibits platelet aggregation by modifying platelet function and inhibiting the production of thromboxane A2, another type of prostaglandin. This antiplatelet effect of aspirin helps reduce the risk of blood clot formation, which is beneficial for individuals at risk of heart attacks, strokes, or certain cardiovascular conditions. aspirin should not be given to children or teenagers with viral infections, as it can increase the risk of developing Reye's syndrome. Reye's syndrome is a rare but serious condition that affects the liver and brain. No, Enteric-coated aspirin tablets are designed to pass through the stomach intact and dissolve in the intestines. Crushing or chewing these tablets can disrupt their protective coating and reduce their effectiveness.

Aspirin tablets are a common form of medication that contain the active ingredient acetylsalicylic acid. Aspirin belongs to a class of drugs known as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) and has various uses. Pain relief: Aspirin is used to relieve mild to moderate pain. It can be effective in alleviating headaches, toothaches, menstrual cramps, and general body aches. Anti-inflammatory properties: Aspirin has anti-inflammatory effects, which can help reduce inflammation and swelling associated with conditions like arthritis, sprains, and strains. Fever reduction: Aspirin can help lower fever, making it useful in managing fever associated with common illnesses such as colds and flu. Blood-thinning properties: Aspirin has an antiplatelet effect, which means it can help prevent blood clot formation. Low-dose aspirin is often prescribed for individuals at risk of heart attacks or strokes to reduce the likelihood of clot formation. Prevention of cardiovascular events: Aspirin may be prescribed for individuals who have had a heart attack, stroke, or certain heart conditions to reduce the risk of future cardiovascular events. Common side effects of aspirin may include stomach upset, heartburn, nausea, and increased risk of bleeding. Serious side effects are rare but can include severe allergic reactions, stomach ulcers, and ringing in the ears (tinnitus). If you experience any concerning or severe side effects, seek medical attention. It is to be taken with water after meals. The tablets are swallowed whole without breaking. COX inhibition:Aspirin irreversibly inhibits both COX-1 and COX-2 enzymes. COX-1 is involved in the production of prostaglandins that help regulate various physiological functions, such as maintaining the stomach lining and promoting platelet aggregation (clotting). COX-2 is primarily associated with the production of prostaglandins involved in inflammation. Prostaglandin reduction:By inhibiting COX enzymes, aspirin reduces the production of prostaglandins. This leads to a decrease in pain, inflammation, and fever associated with various conditions. Antiplatelet effect:Aspirin's irreversible inhibition of COX-1 in platelets results in a prolonged reduction in the production of thromboxane A2, which is responsible for platelet aggregation (clotting). This antiplatelet effect makes aspirin useful in reducing the risk of blood clot formation and preventing heart attacks and strokes in certain individuals. It should be avoided in individuals with certain conditions, such as active stomach ulcers, bleeding disorders, asthma, and allergy to aspirin or other NSAIDs. I shouldn't be used in children and teenagers due to the risk of Reye's syndrome. It's generally recommended to avoid aspirin during pregnancy, especially in the third trimester, as it may increase the risk of complications. Aspirin should also be used with caution during breastfeeding, as small amounts can pass into breast milk. Consult a healthcare professional for personalized advice if you are pregnant or breastfeeding.

Composition: Ceftriaxone (1gm) MONOCEF 1GM INJECTION contains Ceftriaxone which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. It is used to treat bacterial infections such as urinary tract infections, lower respiratory tract infections, bacteremia, septicaemia, meningitis, abdominal infections and infections caused by pseudomonas species. MONOCEF 1GM INJECTION is also used to prevent infections, before and after surgery. Tell your doctor before receiving MONOCEF 1GM INJECTION if you have or had a history of kidney or liver diseases, fungal diseases, gastrointestinal disease or diarrhoea. If you are pregnant or breastfeeding, inform your doctor before receiving MONOCEF 1GM INJECTION. Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. Monocef 1gm Injection is an antibiotic. It kills the bacteria by preventing them from forming the bacterial protective covering (cell wall) which is needed for them to survive. If you miss a dose of Monocef 1gm Injection, please consult your doctor. Consuming alcohol with Monocef 1gm Injection does not cause any harmful side effects. Monocef 1gm Injection is safe to use during pregnancy. Most studies have shown low or no risk to the developing baby. Monocef 1gm Injection should be used with caution during breastfeeding. Breastfeeding should be held until the treatment of the mother is completed and the drug is eliminated from her body.
Side Effects: Diarrhea | Abnormal liver function tests | Rash |

Uses: Composition: Levofloxacin (500mg)  QURE 500MG TABLET contains Levofloxacin which belongs to the group of medicines called Antibiotics. QURE 500MG TABLET is used to treat infections of acute sinusitis, lungs (such as long-term breathing problems/pneumonia), urinary tract (including kidney and bladder), prostate gland and skin & soft tissue (including muscles) in affected individuals. It is also used to reduce the chances of getting anthrax (pulmonary disease) or worsening of the disease after getting exposed to anthrax causing bacteria. Before taking QURE 500MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you have/had brain damage (due to stroke/other brain injury), diabetes, myasthenia gravis (long term neuromuscular junction disease), aneurysm (condition that occurs due to bulge or enlargement of large blood vessel), organ transplantation, heart problems (such as very slow heart rhythm, weak heart, myocardial infarction), kidney problems and/or liver problems. Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Qure 500 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Avoid Qure 500 Tablet with dairy products such as milk, cheese, curd, butter, paneer and ice cream. Qure 500 Tablet is an antibiotic. It works by stopping the action of a bacterial enzyme called DNA-gyrase. This prevents the bacterial cells from dividing and repairing, thereby killing them. If you miss a dose of Qure 500 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Consuming alcohol with Qure 500 Tablet does not cause any harmful side effects. Qure 500 Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Qure 500 Tablet is probably unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug may pass into the breastmilk and harm the baby.
Side Effects: Headache | Dizziness | Nausea | Constipation | Diarrhea |

Uses:
:Levofloxacin Tablet is an antibiotic, used in the treatment of bacterial infections. It is also used in treating infections of the urinary tract, nose, throat, skin and soft tissues and lungs (pneumonia). It also comes in an intravenous (IV) form that’s only given by a healthcare provider Levofloxacin (brand name Levaquin) is a type of antibiotic medication that is used to treat bacterial infections. It belongs to the class of fluoroquinolone antibiotics and is available in different strengths, including 500mg tablets. Levofloxacin works by inhibiting the bacterial DNA gyrase enzyme, which is essential for the replication, transcription, and repair of bacterial DNA. This results in the inhibition of bacterial growth and eventual death of the bacteria. If you experience any of these side effects or have any concerns about taking this medication, you should speak to your doctor. Levofloxacin 500mg tablets are used to treat bacterial infections caused by susceptible organisms. These infections can affect different parts of the body, including the respiratory tract, urinary tract, skin and soft tissues, bones and joints, and genital tract. Here are some specific uses of Levofloxacin: Respiratory tract infections: Levofloxacin can be used to treat respiratory tract infections such as pneumonia, acute bronchitis, and chronic bronchitis. It is effective against a wide range of bacteria that can cause these infections. Urinary tract infections: Levofloxacin can be used to treat urinary tract infections such as cystitis and pyelonephritis. It is effective against both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria that cause these infections. Skin and soft tissue infections: Levofloxacin can be used to treat skin and soft tissue infections such as cellulitis, wound infections, and abscesses. It is effective against many types of bacteria that can cause these infections. Bone and joint infections: Levofloxacin can be used to treat bone and joint infections such as osteomyelitis. It is effective against many types of bacteria that can cause these infections. Sexually transmitted infections: Levofloxacin can be used to treat sexually transmitted infections such as gonorrhea. It is effective against the bacteria that cause these infections. Levofloxacin is a prescription medication and should only be used under the guidance of a healthcare provider. It is important to take the medication exactly as prescribed and to complete the full course of treatment to ensure that the infection is fully treated and to prevent the development of antibiotic resistance. The main benefit of Levofloxacin 500mg tablets is their ability to treat bacterial infections effectively. By targeting and killing the bacteria responsible for the infection, Levofloxacin can help to relieve symptoms and prevent the infection from spreading or causing further complications. Some of the benefits of Levofloxacin include: Wide spectrum of activity: Levofloxacin is effective against a broad range of gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria, including many that are resistant to other antibiotics. This makes it a useful option for treating a variety of bacterial infections. Rapid action: Levofloxacin is absorbed quickly into the bloodstream and begins working soon after it is taken. This can help to provide fast relief of symptoms and prevent the infection from worsening. Convenient dosing: Levofloxacin is usually taken once a day for a set period of time, making it a convenient option for people who have difficulty remembering to take multiple doses of medication throughout the day. Oral administration: Levofloxacin is available in tablet form, which makes it easy to take and avoids the need for injections or hospitalization in many cases. Well-tolerated: Levofloxacin is generally well-tolerated by most people. While it can cause side effects in some cases, they are usually mild and temporary. It's important to note that antibiotics like Levofloxacin should only be used when necessary and as prescribed by a healthcare provider. Overuse or misuse of antibiotics can lead to antibiotic resistance, which can make future infections harder to treat. If you experience diarrhea or any other concerning symptoms while taking Levofloxacin, you should speak to your doctor.  Levofloxacin 500mg tablets should be taken exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. The usual dose for most bacterial infections is one tablet once a day, although your doctor may adjust the dose or duration of treatment based on the type and severity of your infection. Here are some general guidelines for using Levofloxacin 500mg tablets: Take Levofloxacin with a full glass of water, either with or without food. Do not take the tablets with dairy products or calcium-fortified juices, as these can interfere with the absorption of the medication. If you miss a dose of Levofloxacin, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it's close to the time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not stop taking Levofloxacin before completing the full course of treatment, even if you start feeling better. Stopping the medication too soon could allow the infection to come back or lead to antibiotic resistance. If you are taking Levofloxacin for a urinary tract infection, make sure to drink plenty of fluids to help flush the bacteria out of your system. If you have any questions or concerns about how to use Levofloxacin, talk to your healthcare provider or pharmacist. It's important to note that Levofloxacin is a prescription medication and should only be used under the guidance of a healthcare provider. It should not be shared with others, even if they have similar symptoms, as it may not be the appropriate treatment for their condition. Levofloxacin 500mg tablets belong to a class of antibiotics called fluoroquinolones. These antibiotics work by inhibiting the action of bacterial enzymes that are essential for the replication and growth of bacteria. Levofloxacin specifically targets DNA gyrase and topoisomerase IV, which are enzymes that are required for bacterial DNA synthesis and replication. By inhibiting these enzymes, Levofloxacin prevents the bacteria from replicating and spreading, which ultimately leads to their death. Levofloxacin has a broad spectrum of activity, which means it is effective against a wide range of bacteria, including both gram-positive and gram-negative bacteria. This makes it a useful option for treating many different types of bacterial infections, including respiratory infections, skin infections, and urinary tract infections. It's important to note that Levofloxacin should only be used to treat bacterial infections and is not effective against viral infections, such as the common cold or flu. Overuse or misuse of antibiotics like Levofloxacin can lead to antibiotic resistance, which can make future infections harder to treat. If you forget to take a dose of Levofloxacin 500mg tablets, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it's close to the time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a missed dose. If you miss a dose or do not complete the full course of Levofloxacin as prescribed by your healthcare provider, the medication may not be as effective in treating your infection. Incomplete treatment can also increase the risk of antibiotic resistance, which can make future infections more difficult to treat. If you frequently forget to take your medication, you may want to set a reminder on your phone or use a pill organizer to help you stay on track. If you have any concerns about how to take Levofloxacin or how to manage missed doses, talk to your healthcare provider or pharmacist for advice. Avoid exposure to sunlight or other sources of UV radiation, as Levofloxacin can make your skin more sensitive to light. Wear protective clothing and use sunscreen when going outside. Levofloxacin may not be appropriate for people with certain medical conditions, and your doctor may need to adjust your dose or monitor you more closely while you are taking the medication. Uses: GLIPSI 50MG TABLET contains Sitagliptin which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-diabetic drugs. GLIPSI 50MG TABLET is used in adults to treat type 2 diabetes alone or along with other anti-diabetic medicines, diet, and exercise. Type 2 diabetes is a condition in which your body does not make enough insulin (a hormone that helps control your blood sugar levels) or the insulin that is produced does not work well. When this happens, glucose levels rise in the blood and can lead to serious medical problems like heart, or kidney disease and blindness. It can show symptoms like increased thirst, urination and hunger, blurry vision, numbness in hands or feet, or tiredness. Take GLIPSI 50MG TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. GLIPSI 50MG TABLET works by slowing down the inactivation of gut hormones released after eating the meals. This kind of action increases the secretion of insulin and decrease glucagon release (hormone which raises blood glucose level), resulting in an overall increase in blood glucose control. If you miss a dose of GLIPSI 50MG TABLET, take it as soon as you remember. However, omit the missed dose if it is almost time for the next dose. Do not take the medicine twice to make up for the missed dose. GLIPSI 50MG TABLET is not recommended for use in pregnant women. Consult your doctor before taking it. GLIPSI 50MG TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it is not known if it passes into human breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking it. Before taking GLIPSI 50MG TABLET, inform your doctor if you have or had alcohol dependence. Heart failure is seen in patients treated with GLIPSI 50MG TABLET. You are at greater risk of heart failure if you previously had any heart disease like heart failure, or kidney disease. Symptoms include increased breathlessness or trouble breathing especially when you lie down, swelling or fluid retention especially in the feet, ankles or legs, an unusually rapid increase in weight, unusual tiredness. You must talk to your doctor immediately or go to the nearest hospital if this happens to you. Do not stop taking GLIPSI 50MG TABLET without consulting your doctor. Take it as long as advised by your doctor, to keep your sugar levels under control. If you have any more doubts regarding the use of GLIPSI 50MG TABLET, ask your doctor.
Side Effects: Treat type 2 diabetes in adults | Signs of low blood sugar (drowsiness, irritability, hunger, dizziness, confusion, sweating, weakness, and fast heartbeat) | Headache | Stuffy or runny nose, sore throat | Joint pain | Nausea, flatulence, vomiting | Stomach pain | Diarrhea | Constipation | Itching | Signs of reduced number of platelets (easy bleeding or bruising) |

Uses: FRUSELAC is a combination of Spironolactone and Frusemide which belongs to the group of medicines called Diuretics. It helps to reduce fluid build-up (edema) in the body. Edema is a type of swelling or puffiness of body parts caused due to excessive accumulation of fluid (water) in the body. These extra fluids can cause swollen ankles, shortness of breath and can make you feel more tired than usual. It can also put extra strain on your heart, blood vessels, lungs, kidneys, or liver. Take FRUSELAC as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. It is taken preferably with meals. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Avoid taking FRUSELAC at night as it could affect your sleep. Do not stop taking FRUSELAC unless your doctor tells you to stop. FRUSELAC acts by removing the excess water and certain electrolytes (sodium and chloride) from the body in the form of urine while simultaneously maintaining the levels of potassium in the body. FRUSELAC is generally not recommended for use in pregnant women. However, consult your doctor before taking it. FRUSELAC is generally not recommended for use in breastfeeding women. However, consult your doctor before taking it. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking FRUSELAC as it might make you feel more dizzy. Take FRUSELAC as advised by your physician. Your doctor will evaluate your health condition and suggests whether can you take FRUSELAC every day or not. It is advisable to take FRUSELAC in the morning preferably after meals. Avoid taking FRUSELAC at night as it may make urinate more at night which may affect your sleep. However, consult your doctor regarding the time of administration of FRUSELAC. Avoid foods rich in potassium such as bananas, dry fruits, lentils, dairy products, and salt substitutes containing potassium while taking FRUSELAC. It is because FRUSELAC can reabsorb potassium in the kidneys, and so additionally consumption of potassium rich foods or supplements may further increase the levels of potassium in the blood.
Side Effects: Treats edema (fluid retention) | Headache, dizziness | Nausea, vomiting | General weakness | Increased urination | Excessive thirst | Impotence, reduced sex drive | Breast enlargement in men | Sensation of tingling and numbness | Loss of bladder control | Loss of hearing | Leg cramps |

Uses: Composition: Omeprazole PROMISEC contains Omeprazole which belongs to the group of medicines called  Proton pump inhibitors. It is used in the treatment of gastro-oesophageal reflux disease (acid contents in the stomach flows back into the tube connecting your mouth and stomach causing heartburn, nausea, vomiting, bitter taste, discomfort in upper abdomen) in children (above 1 years of age) and adults. It is used in adults to treat gastric (stomach), duodenal ulcer (upper part of the intestine), ulcers infected with Helicobacter pylori bacteria in addition with antibiotics (including children) and ulcers due to the use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). PROMISEC effectively lowers the amount of acid produced in the stomach by irreversibly binding to and inhibiting the hydrogen-potassium ATPase pump that resides on the lining of the digestive tract. This kind of action helps to reduce vomiting, promote healing of damaged stomach tissue in ulcers. Interaction with alcohol is unknown. It is advisable to consult your doctor before consumption. PROMISEC can be used in pregnant women or women planning for pregnancy only if advised by the doctor. Therefore, consult your doctor for advice before taking PROMISEC. PROMISEC is recommended for use in breastfeeding women only if advised by the doctor. Therefore, consult your doctor for advice before taking PROMISEC.

Alcohol can exacerbate stomach issues, so it's generally recommended to avoid or limit alcohol consumption while taking medications that affect stomach acid production. If you're pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, consult your doctor before using Rabeprazole to discuss potential risks and benefits. Long-term use of PPIs like Rabeprazole may have certain risks. It's important to discuss your treatment plan with your doctor to balance the benefits and potential risks. There are no specific dietary restrictions, but you might want to avoid foods or habits that trigger acid reflux or worsen your stomach condition.

Uses: FLOPRESS 0.4 contains Tamsulosin which belongs to the group of medicines called Alpha blockers. It is used in men to treat the signs and symptoms of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH). Treats signs and symptoms of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia such as: Take FLOPRESS TABLET preferably before the first meal of the day (breakfast) or as directed by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking FLOPRESS TABLET without consulting your doctor. FLOPRESS TABLET is an alpha blocker. It blocks the activity of certain chemicals (noradrenaline) in the body that causes contraction of smooth muscles. As a result, it relaxes the smooth muscles surrounding the bladder and prostate gland. This action improves urine flow and reduces other urinary symptoms associated with BPH. FLOPRESS TABLET is not intended for use in women. Consumption of alcohol is not recommended during treatment with FLOPRESS TABLET. FLOPRESS TABLET helps to regulate the flow of urine by relaxing the smooth muscles surrounding the bladder and prostate. It improves urine flow and reduces pain or discomfort while passing urine. FLOPRESS TABLET may cause problems in sperm release (ejaculation) or decrease in sex drive. These side effects are usually temporary and disappears once therapy has been stopped. However, consult your doctor if they trouble you. FLOPRESS TABLET may cause problems in sperm release (ejaculation) or decrease in sex drive in men. Therefore, consult your doctor before taking FLOPRESS TABLET if you wish to father a child.

Uses: Composition: Azithromycin (250mg) AZIVENT 250MG TABLET contains Azithromycin which belongs to the group of medicines called Macrolide antibiotics. It is used to treat mild to moderate susceptible infections caused by bacteria and other micro-organisms which includes chest, throat, nasal infections such as bronchitis, pneumonia, tonsillitis, sore throat and sinusitis. It is also used to treat ear infections and skin & soft tissue infections (such as an abscess/boil) in affected individuals which is also indicated for use to treat sexually transmitted diseases such as cervicitis (caused by organisms such as Chlamydia trachomatis/ Neisseria gonorrhoea) in affected individuals. AZIVENT 250MG TABLET should be used with caution during pregnancy and in women planning for pregnancy only if it is clearly necessary. It is also advised to be used with caution in breast-feeding woman as it is unknown whether the medicine gets excreted in the breast milk. Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Azivent 250 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Azivent 250 Tablet is an antibiotic. It works by preventing synthesis of essential proteins required by bacteria to carry out vital functions. Thus, it stops the bacteria from growing, and prevents the infection from spreading. If you miss a dose of Azivent 250 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Azivent 250 Tablet. Azivent 250 Tablet is generally considered safe to use during pregnancy. Animal studies have shown low or no adverse effects to the developing baby; however, there are limited human studies Azivent 250 Tablet is safe to use during breastfeeding. Human studies suggest that the drug does not pass into the breastmilk in a significant amount and is not harmful to the baby.
Side Effects: Vomiting | Nausea | Abdominal pain | Diarrhea |

Pantop tab Tablet is a medicine that reduces the amount of acid produced in your stomach. It is used for treating acid-related diseases of the stomach and intestine such as heartburn, acid reflux, peptic ulcer disease, and some other stomach conditions associated with excessive acid production. Pantop 40mg refers to a medication called Pantoprazole 40mg. Here's some information about Pantoprazole 40mg: Uses: Pantoprazole is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that helps reduce the production of stomach acid. It is used to treat conditions such as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), erosive esophagitis (inflammation of the esophagus), and certain stomach and duodenal ulcers. It can also be prescribed as part of a combination therapy to eradicate Helicobacter pylori bacteria, which is associated with peptic ulcer disease. Mechanism of action: Pantoprazole works by selectively inhibiting the enzyme responsible for acid production in the stomach, known as the proton pump. By reducing the secretion of acid, it helps to relieve symptoms such as heartburn, acid reflux, and stomach ulcers. Dosage and administration: The recommended dose of Pantoprazole 40mg may vary depending on the condition being treated. It is typically taken once daily, usually before a meal. Follow the instructions provided by your healthcare professional regarding the dose and duration of treatment. Possible side effects: Common side effects of Pantoprazole 40mg may include headache, dizziness, nausea, stomach pain, diarrhea, and constipation. These side effects are usually mild and temporary. In rare cases, severe allergic reactions or serious side effects such as liver problems may occur. If you experience any concerning symptoms, seek medical attention. Precautions: Inform your healthcare professional about any medical conditions you have, especially if you have liver disease or are taking other medications. Pantoprazole may interact with certain drugs, so it's important to disclose all your medications, including prescription, over-the-counter, and herbal supplements. Pantoprazole 40mg is primarily used for the treatment of the following conditions: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD): Pantoprazole is commonly prescribed to manage GERD, a condition in which stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing symptoms like heartburn, regurgitation, and chest pain. Erosive Esophagitis: Pantoprazole is effective in healing and reducing inflammation in the esophagus caused by erosive esophagitis, which is characterized by the erosion of the lining of the esophagus. Peptic Ulcer Disease: Pantoprazole can be used to treat and prevent peptic ulcers, which are open sores that develop on the lining of the stomach or the upper part of the small intestine. Zollinger-Ellison Syndrome: Pantoprazole may be prescribed for the management of Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, a rare condition characterized by the overproduction of stomach acid, leading to severe ulcers in the digestive system. Helicobacter pylori Infection: Pantoprazole is often included as part of a combination therapy to eradicate Helicobacter pylori bacteria, which is associated with peptic ulcer disease. It is used in conjunction with antibiotics to effectively treat the infection.  Relief from Acid-related Conditions: Pantoprazole helps reduce the production of stomach acid, providing relief from conditions such as GERD, erosive esophagitis, and peptic ulcers. It helps alleviate symptoms like heartburn, regurgitation, chest pain, and stomach discomfort. Healing of Esophageal Inflammation: Pantoprazole promotes the healing of the esophagus by reducing inflammation caused by conditions like erosive esophagitis. This helps alleviate symptoms like difficulty swallowing and pain during swallowing. Prevention of Ulcer Recurrence: Pantoprazole can help prevent the recurrence of peptic ulcers, allowing the healing process to occur and reducing the risk of complications such as bleeding or perforation. Eradication of Helicobacter pylori Infection: When used as part of combination therapy, Pantoprazole aids in the eradication of Helicobacter pylori bacteria, which is associated with peptic ulcer disease. This helps in treating the infection and preventing ulcer recurrence. Improved Quality of Life: By reducing symptoms such as heartburn and acid reflux, Pantoprazole can significantly improve the quality of life for individuals suffering from acid-related conditions. It allows for better sleep, reduced pain and discomfort, and improved overall well-being. While Pantoprazole is generally well-tolerated, it may cause some side effects in certain individuals. Common side effects of Pantoprazole 40mg may include: These side effects are typically mild and temporary, and not everyone experiences them. If any of these side effects persist or worsen, it is advisable to consult a healthcare professional. In rare cases, Pantoprazole may cause more severe side effects. These can include:  Pantoprazole belongs to a class of medications known as proton pump inhibitors (PPIs). It works by reducing the production of stomach acid. In the stomach, there are special cells called parietal cells that produce acid to help with the digestion of food. Pantoprazole works by inhibiting an enzyme called H+/K+ ATPase, also known as the proton pump, which is responsible for the final step of acid production in the stomach. By blocking the proton pump, Pantoprazole reduces the amount of acid that is released into the stomach, thereby decreasing the acidity of the stomach contents. This helps in relieving symptoms associated with excessive stomach acid, such as heartburn, acid reflux, and stomach ulcers. Pantoprazole's action is not immediate, and it may take a few days to achieve the full effect. It is important to take Pantoprazole as prescribed and for the recommended duration to allow for proper healing of the underlying condition. If you forget to take a dose of Pantoprazole, here are some general guidelines: If you remember shortly after the missed dose: Take the missed dose as soon as you remember. If it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for the missed one. If you remember close to the time for your next scheduled dose: Skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Taking two doses close together can increase the risk of side effects. If you are unsure or have missed multiple doses: It is best to consult with your healthcare professional for guidance. They can provide specific advice based on your individual situation.

Sinex nasal sprays or nasal drops are applied directly into the nostrils for temporary relief of nasal congestion.Sinex Tablet is taken with or without food in a dose and duration as advised by the doctor. It is better to take it with food to avoid stomach upset. The dose you are given will depend on your condition and how you respond to the medicine. You should keep taking this medicine for as long as your doctor recommends. If you stop treatment too early your symptoms may come back and your condition may worsen. Let your doctor know about all other medications you are taking as some may affect, or be affected by this medicine. Sinex Tablet is a combination medicine that effectively relieves symptoms of the common cold, such as a blocked nose, runny nose, watery eyes, sneezing, and congestion or stuffiness. It helps loosen thick mucus, making it easier to cough out. It also shrinks the blood vessels and provides rapid relief that lasts for several hours. These actions make breathing easier.Sinex Tablet is safe and effective. It usually starts to work within a few minutes, and the effects can last up to several hours. Take it as prescribed by your doctor, and do not stop using it unless you are advised otherwise. Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Sinex Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Sinex Tablet is a combination of four medicines: Paracetamol, Phenylpropanolamine, Chlorpheniramine Maleate and Caffeine which relieve common cold symptoms. Paracetamol is a analgesic (pain reliever) and anti-pyretic (fever reducer) which works by blocking the release of certain chemical messengers that causes fever and pain. Phenylpropanolamine is a decongestant. It narrows blood vessels in the nose to relieve congestion. Chlorpheniramine Maleate is an antiallergic which relieves allergy symptoms like runny nose, watery eyes and sneezing. Caffeine increases the effectiveness of Paracetamol and decreases sleepiness due to Chlorpheniramine Maleate.
Side Effects: Treatment of Common cold | Nausea | Allergic reaction | Sleepiness | High blood pressure | Insomnia (difficulty in sleeping) | Palpitations | Restlessness |

Uses: Decon S Saline nasal solution, also known as saline nasal spray or nasal saline rinse, is a solution of salt and water that is used to irrigate and moisturize the nasal passages. It can provide relief from nasal congestion, dryness, and irritation. Nasal congestion relief:Saline nasal solution helps to moisturize the nasal passages, thin mucus, and flush out irritants, providing temporary relief from nasal congestion caused by allergies, colds, or sinus conditions. Nasal hygiene:Regular use of saline nasal solution can help maintain nasal hygiene by washing away allergens, dust, and pollutants, reducing the risk of infections and promoting healthy nasal passages. Postoperative care:Saline nasal solution is often used after nasal surgeries or procedures to keep the nasal passages clean and promote healing. Irritation Burning Sensation The solution is gently poured into each nostril while breathing in or tilted the head back, allowing the solution to flow through the nasal passages. Moisturization:Saline nasal solution works by moisturizing the nasal passages. When the solution is sprayed or poured into the nostrils, it helps hydrate the nasal mucosa, preventing dryness and reducing irritation. Mucus thinning:The salt content in the saline solution helps to thin out thick mucus in the nasal passages. This can be particularly helpful in cases of nasal congestion or thickened mucus due to allergies, colds, or sinus conditions. Nasal irrigation:Saline nasal solution can act as a nasal irrigation agent. It helps flush out allergens, dust, pollutants, and excess mucus from the nasal passages. This can relieve nasal congestion and reduce the presence of irritants that may contribute to nasal symptoms. Saline nasal solution is generally considered safe for most people, including pregnant women, breastfeeding mothers, and children. It has no known interactions with medications and can be used alongside other nasal medications. However, if you have specific medical conditions or concerns, it's always best to consult with a healthcare professional before using saline nasal solution. Yes, saline nasal solution can typically be used alongside other nasal medications. It can help improve the effectiveness of other nasal medications by moisturizing the nasal passages, thinning mucus, and clearing the nasal passages for better absorption. Saline nasal solution can be used on a long-term basis as part of regular nasal hygiene. It is generally safe and non-addictive. However, if you have specific concerns or if you experience any adverse effects, it's best to consult with a healthcare professional.
Side Effects: Nasal congestion relief:Saline nasal solution helps to moisturize the nasal passages, thin mucus, and flush out irritants, providing temporary relief from nasal congestion caused by allergies, colds, or sinus conditions. | Nasal hygiene:Regular use of saline nasal solution can help maintain nasal hygiene by washing away allergens, dust, and pollutants, reducing the risk of infections and promoting healthy nasal passages. | Postoperative care:Saline nasal solution is often used after nasal surgeries or procedures to keep the nasal passages clean and promote healing. |

Uses: Decon p Nasal Soln (nasal drops) is a medication used to relieve nasal congestion. They belong to a class of drugs called nasal decongestants. Oxymetazoline works by constricting the blood vessels in the nasal passages, reducing swelling and congestion. Oxymetazoline nasal drops are commonly used to provide temporary relief of nasal congestion caused by various conditions, such as the common cold, allergies, sinusitis, or hay fever. Common side effects of oxymetazoline nasal drops may include temporary stinging, burning, dryness, or sneezing. In some cases, it may cause mild nasal irritation or a temporary increase in nasal congestion. If you experience severe or persistent side effects, discontinue use and consult a healthcare professional. Oxymetazoline nasal drops are applied directly into the nostrils using a dropper. The effects of oxymetazoline nasal drops usually last for several hours, providing relief from nasal congestion. However, it is generally recommended to use them for a limited duration (typically 3 to 5 days) to avoid the risk of rebound congestion or dependency. Vasoconstriction:Oxymetazoline is a selective alpha-1 adrenergic receptor agonist. When applied topically to the nasal mucosa, it binds to alpha-1 adrenergic receptors on the blood vessels, causing vasoconstriction (narrowing of blood vessels) in the nasal passages. Reduced nasal congestion:The vasoconstriction induced by oxymetazoline leads to a decrease in blood flow to the nasal mucosa, resulting in reduced swelling and congestion. This helps to alleviate nasal congestion and improve airflow through the nasal passages. If you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant and need to use oxymetazoline nasal drops for nasal congestion, it is important to consult with your healthcare professional before using the medication. They can evaluate your specific situation, consider any other medications you are taking, and provide Non-pharmacological measures such as nasal saline rinses, steam inhalation, or using a humidifier may be recommended as first-line approaches to relieve nasal congestion during pregnancy. These options are generally considered safe and can provide some relief without the use of medications. It is advisable to discuss these alternatives with your healthcare professional.

Uses: Composition: Cetirizine Hydrochloride 10mg Cetirizine is an antihistamine medication commonly sold under the brand name CTZ. It is used to relieve symptoms associated with allergies, such as hay fever (allergic rhinitis), hives (urticaria), and allergic skin conditions.

Solay 5mg Tablet is a muscarinic antagonist that is used in the treatment of overactive bladder. It relieves urinary symptoms like frequent urination, urgent need to urinate and inability to control urination.SOLAYbelongs to a class of muscarinic receptor antagonist. It works by blocking the action of certain chemicals in the body to help decrease urination problems caused by overactive bladder. It treats major symptoms of overactive bladder, such as an urgent need to urinate, a need to urinate often, or leakage of urine. Solifenacin succinate is primarily used for the treatment of overactive bladder (OAB) and urinary incontinence. OAB is a condition characterized by symptoms such as a frequent urge to urinate, a sudden and uncontrollable need to urinate, and urinary incontinence (leakage of urine). Solifenacin helps to relax the muscles of the bladder, reducing the frequency of urination and the urge to urinate. The medication is commonly prescribed for adults who have symptoms of OAB, including urgency, urinary frequency, and urgency urinary incontinence (leakage accompanied by a strong urge to urinate). Solifenacin can help improve bladder control and decrease the number of episodes of urinary incontinence. It is important to note that Solifenacin succinate should only be used under the guidance and prescription of a healthcare professional. They will assess your specific condition and determine if Solifenacin is an appropriate treatment option for you. Solifenacin succinate provides several benefits for individuals with overactive bladder (OAB) and urinary incontinence: Reduced frequency of urination: Solifenacin helps to decrease the frequency of urination, reducing the number of trips to the restroom. This benefit can significantly improve the quality of life for individuals who experience frequent and disruptive urges to urinate. Improved bladder control: Solifenacin helps relax the muscles of the bladder, which can lead to better control over urinary urgency and incontinence. This can reduce embarrassing episodes of leakage and provide individuals with greater confidence and comfort. Decreased urinary incontinence episodes: Solifenacin is effective in reducing episodes of urinary incontinence, particularly those associated with a strong urge to urinate (urgency urinary incontinence). By blocking the action of certain nerve signals, Solifenacin can help prevent or minimize involuntary bladder contractions that lead to leakage. Increased functional capacity: With improved bladder control and reduced urinary symptoms, individuals taking Solifenacin may experience increased functional capacity. This means they can engage in activities without the constant interruption and worry caused by the urgency to urinate or potential leakage. Enhanced quality of life: OAB and urinary incontinence can have a significant impact on a person's quality of life, affecting their daily activities, social interactions, and emotional well-being. By managing the symptoms and improving bladder control, Solifenacin can help restore a sense of normalcy and improve overall quality of life. While Solifenacin succinate can be effective in treating overactive bladder (OAB) and urinary incontinence, it can also cause certain side effects. Not everyone will experience these side effects, and their severity can vary from person to person. Some of the common side effects associated with Solifenacin include: Dry mouth: This is the most common side effect of Solifenacin. It occurs due to decreased saliva production. It is advisable to stay hydrated and maintain good oral hygiene to manage this side effect. Constipation: Solifenacin can slow down the movement of the digestive system, leading to constipation. Drinking plenty of fluids and increasing fiber intake may help alleviate this side effect. If constipation persists or becomes severe, it is important to consult a healthcare professional. Blurred vision: Some individuals may experience blurred vision or difficulty focusing while taking Solifenacin. It is recommended to avoid activities such as driving or operating machinery if vision changes occur. Dry eyes: Solifenacin can reduce tear production, leading to dryness and discomfort in the eyes. Artificial tears or lubricating eye drops may provide relief. Inform an eye doctor about the medication use if this side effect persists. Difficulty urinating: In rare cases, Solifenacin can cause urinary retention or difficulty emptying the bladder. If you experience difficulty in passing urine, it is important to seek medical attention promptly. Other side effects: Less common side effects may include headache, dizziness, abdominal pain, indigestion, nausea, and allergic reactions. It is crucial to consult a healthcare professional if any unusual or severe side effects are experienced. Solifenacin succinate is typically available in the form of oral tablets or extended-release capsules. It is important to follow the instructions provided by your healthcare professional and the guidelines on the medication packaging. Here are some general guidelines on how to use Solifenacin: Dosage: Take Solifenacin exactly as prescribed by your healthcare professional. The dosage may vary depending on your specific condition and medical history. Do not adjust the dosage or stop taking the medication without consulting your doctor. Timing: Solifenacin is usually taken once a day, with or without food. It is important to take it at the same time each day to maintain a consistent level of the medication in your body. Swallowing: Take the tablet or capsule whole with a glass of water. Do not crush, chew, or break the tablet or capsule unless instructed to do so by your healthcare professional. Breaking or crushing the medication may interfere with its extended-release mechanism. Adherence: It is important to take Solifenacin regularly and as prescribed to get the maximum benefit from the medication. If you forget to take a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is close to the time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose to make up for a missed one. Duration of use: The duration of Solifenacin treatment will be determined by your healthcare professional based on your individual needs. Do not stop taking the medication abruptly without consulting your doctor, even if you start feeling better. They may need to gradually adjust the dosage or provide guidance on discontinuing the medication. Follow-up appointments: Regularly follow up with your healthcare professional to monitor your progress and discuss any concerns or side effects you may be experiencing. They may adjust the dosage or suggest alternative treatments if necessary. Solifenacin succinate works by blocking the action of a neurotransmitter called acetylcholine in the body. Acetylcholine plays a role in the contraction of various muscles, including those in the bladder. In individuals with overactive bladder (OAB), the muscles of the bladder contract too frequently and involuntarily, leading to symptoms such as a frequent urge to urinate, sudden urgency, and urinary incontinence. This excessive muscle activity is often caused by an overactive detrusor muscle, which is responsible for bladder contractions. Solifenacin is classified as an anticholinergic medication. It selectively binds to muscarinic receptors in the bladder, particularly the M3 subtype. By binding to these receptors, Solifenacin blocks the action of acetylcholine, reducing the signal for muscle contraction in the bladder. This leads to relaxation of the detrusor muscle and decreases the frequency of bladder contractions. By reducing the excessive contractions of the bladder muscle, Solifenacin helps to increase the bladder capacity, decrease the frequency of urination, and reduce episodes of urinary urgency and incontinence. It helps restore normal bladder function and provides relief from the symptoms associated with overactive bladder. If you forget to take a dose of Solifenacin succinate, follow these general guidelines: Timing: If you realize that you missed a dose and it is not close to the time for your next scheduled dose, take it as soon as you remember. Skip if necessary: However, if it is already close to the time for your next dose, it is advisable to skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Taking two doses close together may increase the risk of side effects. Do not double dose: Do not take a double dose to make up for the missed one. Taking more than the prescribed dose can lead to an overdose and increase the likelihood of experiencing side effects. Consult healthcare professional: If you have any concerns or questions about missed doses, it is recommended to consult your healthcare professional or pharmacist. They can provide specific guidance based on your individual circumstances.

Composition: Finasteride (5mg)  FINCAR 5MG TABLET contains Finasteride which belongs to a group of medicines called type II 5-Alpha reductase inhibitors. It is used to treat signs and symptoms of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH) in men. Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH; also known as enlarged prostate) is a non-cancerous growth of prostate gland, which is predominantly caused due to excessive production of a stress hormone called dihydrotestosterone (DHT) in the body. Symptoms of BPH includes urinary problems such as difficulty in passing urine, urinary incontinence (unintentional passing of urine), frequent urination at night, sexual dysfunction or painful ejaculation.  Before starting the treatment, it is important to tell your doctor if you are taking any medication for any health condition. This will ensure your safety. It is used to treat signs of benign prostatic hyperplasia (enlarged prostate). Treatment of Hair loss  Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Fincar Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Fincar Tablet is a 5-alpha reductase inhibitors. It blocks an enzyme which is necessary to change testosterone to another hormone that causes prostate to grow. As a result, it helps to shrink the prostate and relieve the symptoms like difficulty in passing urine. It is not known whether it is safe to consume alcohol with Fincar Tablet. Please consult your doctor. FINCAR 5MG TABLET is not intended for use in women. Women who are pregnant or think that they may be pregnant should not come into contact with this medicine, as it may affect the growing fetus. Women of childbearing potential should use a suitable contraceptive method (such as condom) to avoid seminal exposure from men taking FINCAR 5MG TABLET. FINCAR 5MG TABLET is not intended for use in women, and therefore it should not be used in breastfeeding women.
Side Effects: Problems in erection (impotence) | Decrease in sex drive | Problems with ejaculation |

Uses: Composition: Levosalbutamol (100mcg) + Beclometasone (100mcg)   AEROCORT FORTE ROTACAP is a combination of Beclomethasone and Levosalbutamol which belongs to the group of medicines called Anti-asthmatic drugs. It is used to treat and prevent asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). It relieves wheezing, shortness of breath, coughing and chest tightness caused due to narrowing of airways.  Use AEROCORT FORTE ROTACAP every day until your doctor tells you to stop. It is meant for inhalation use only. Do not stop using this medicine once your symptoms subside without consulting your doctor. It is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 4 years or above).  Ask your doctor whether it’s safe to take this medicine if you're pregnant or breastfeeding. Before taking it, you should tell your doctor if you have any kidney or liver diseases so that your doctor can prescribe a suitable dose for you.  Treats and prevents asthma and COPD.Relieves wheezing, shortness of breath, coughing and chest tightness caused due to narrowing of airways. Common side effects: Rotacaps must not be swallowed. Check the label for directions before use. Place the capsule at the base of rotahaler, not in the mouthpiece. Twist the mouthpiece completely until your hear a click and breathe in deeply through the mouthpiece. Hold your breath for up to 10 seconds. If some powder remains in the rotahaler repeat the process. Aerocort Rotacap is a combination of two medicines: Levosalbutamol and Beclometasone. Levosalbutamol is a bronchodilator which works by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widens the airways. Beclometasone is a steroid medicine. It acts by stopping the release of certain natural substances in body that cause inflammation (swelling) of the airways. Together, they make breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Aerocort Rotacap, use it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Aerocort Rotacap may cause excessive drowsiness with alcohol. Aerocort Rotacap may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Aerocort Rotacap is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Hoarseness of voice | Headache | Dizziness | Pharyngitis | Vomiting | Bronchitis (inflammation of the airways) | Dryness in mouth | Cough | Application site irritation | Nausea | Gastrointestinal motility disorder | Thrush | Throat irritation |

EBAST 20MG TABLET contains Ebastine which belongs to the group of medicines called Antihistamines. It is also used for the treatment of itching, and urticaria (hives) in adults over the age of 18 years. Take EBAST 20MG TABLET as advised by your physician. It can be taken with or without meals. For Tablet:Swallow EBAST 20MG TABLET with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. EBAST 20MG TABLET works by blocking the effect of histamine (a chemical messenger) which is responsible for allergic reactions in the body, thereby providing relief from allergic symptoms such as sneezing, runny nose, watery eyes and itchy skin rashes. Consult with your Physician or Pharmacist. EBAST 20MG TABLET should be used during pregnancy only if it is considered necessary. Consult your doctor before taking EBAST 20MG TABLET. EBAST 20MG TABLET is not recommended for use in breastfeeding women as it is not known whether this medicine passes into breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking EBAST 20MG TABLET. it is unsafe to take alcohol while on this medication. Yes, EBAST 20MG TABLET is also used for the treatment of cold urticaria, dermographic urticaria, atopic asthma, mosquito bites, and the common cold in combination with a medicine called pseudoephedrine. Consult your doctor before taking EBAST 20MG TABLET. EBAST 20MG TABLET is not recommended for use in patients with an allergic history to Ebastine, galactose intolerance (a condition marked by increased blood glucose levels), Lapp lactose deficiency (a rare hereditary disorder where the body is unable to digest lactose (a sugar found in dairy products), or glucose-galactose malabsorption (a rare hereditary disorder where the body is unable to absorb glucose and galactose). Consult your doctor before taking EBAST 20MG TABLET.

Uses: Amtas-AT is a combination medication used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and related conditions. It typically contains two active ingredients: Amlodipine: Amlodipine is a calcium channel blocker that helps relax blood vessels, making it easier for the heart to pump blood and reducing blood pressure. Atenolol: Atenolol is a beta-blocker that also helps lower blood pressure by reducing the heart rate and the force of heart contractions. Amtas-AT works through two active ingredients: amlodipine and atenolol. Amlodipine relaxes blood vessels, reducing resistance and improving blood flow. Atenolol slows the heart rate and reduces its force. Together, they lower blood pressure and relieve chest pain (angina), making it an effective treatment for hypertension and related cardiovascular conditions. Inform your healthcare provider about all medications, supplements, and herbal remedies you are taking, as there may be interactions that need to be managed. If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, discuss the risks and benefits of Amtas-AT with your healthcare provider. Inform your healthcare provider about all medications, supplements, or herbal remedies you are taking, as there may be interactions that need to be managed. Follow your healthcare provider's recommendations for blood pressure monitoring, typically at regular follow-up appointments.

The combination medication containing Lidocaine 3.0%w/w, Hydrocortisone Acetate 0.25% w/w, Zinc Oxide 5.0% w/w, and Allantoin 0% is used to provide relief from minor pain, itching, swelling, and discomfort associated with hemorrhoids and other anal area problems, such as anal fissures and itching. The different components of this medication work in the following ways: Lidocaine: Lidocaine is an anesthetic that temporarily numbs the area where it is applied. It helps to relieve pain and discomfort by blocking the transmission of pain signals from the affected area to the brain. Hydrocortisone Acetate: Hydrocortisone is a corticosteroid that has anti-inflammatory properties. It helps to reduce redness, itching, and swelling in the affected area by suppressing the immune response and inflammation. Zinc Oxide: Zinc oxide is a skin protectant that forms a barrier on the skin's surface. It helps to soothe and protect the affected area, providing a barrier against irritants and moisture. Allantoin: Allantoin is a compound that has moisturizing and soothing properties. It helps to promote healing, reduce irritation, and alleviate dryness or roughness in the affected area. By combining these ingredients, this medication provides a multi-faceted approach to address the symptoms associated with hemorrhoids and anal area problems. It helps to alleviate pain, reduce inflammation, protect the skin, and promote healing. However, it's important to follow the instructions provided by your healthcare professional or the product label and consult a healthcare professional if you have any specific concerns or questions.

Uses: Megaderm Cream is a topical medication that plays a crucial role in the treatment of various skin conditions. This combination cream, comprised of three active ingredients – beclomethasone, clotrimazole, and neomycin – addresses a range of issues, including itching, allergies, redness, inflammation, as well as suspected bacterial or fungal infections. It is especially effective in combatting common skin problems like ringworm infections, athlete's foot, and tinea infections. To ensure its effectiveness, it's essential to apply Megaderm Cream precisely as directed by your doctor. Consistent and regular use is key to achieving the desired results in managing your skin condition.

"FRUSIX 40" is a brand name for a medication containing the active ingredient furosemide. Furosemide is a loop diuretic that is used to treat conditions such as edema (fluid retention) and high blood pressure (hypertension). It works by increasing the production of urine, which helps to remove excess fluid and salt from the body. Edema: Furosemide is often prescribed to treat edema, which is the abnormal accumulation of fluid in the body's tissues. Edema can be caused by conditions such as congestive heart failure, kidney problems, liver disease, and certain medications. Furosemide helps the body remove excess fluid and reduce swelling.  Hypertension: Furosemide can be used in the management of high blood pressure (hypertension) when other medications are not sufficient. It helps lower blood pressure by promoting diuresis (increased urine production) and reducing the volume of circulating blood.  Congestive Heart Failure: Furosemide is commonly prescribed for individuals with congestive heart failure to alleviate symptoms such as fluid buildup in the lungs and extremities. By reducing fluid retention, it can help improve breathing and overall heart function.  Kidney Disorders: Furosemide may be used in the treatment of certain kidney disorders, including acute kidney injury and chronic kidney disease. It helps remove excess salt and fluid from the body, which can reduce the strain on the kidneys. Liver Disease: In cases of liver disease, where fluid retention is a common complication, furosemide can be prescribed to help manage ascites (abdominal fluid buildup) and reduce pressure on the liver.  Other Conditions: Furosemide may also be used in other medical situations as determined by a healthcare provider, as it can be helpful in conditions where reducing fluid volume is beneficial. Fluid Retention Reduction:Furosemide is a diuretic that helps the body eliminate excess salt and water, reducing fluid retention and swelling (edema).  Blood Pressure Control:Furosemide can lower blood pressure by reducing the volume of circulating blood. This can be beneficial for individuals with hypertension.  Symptom Relief:It can alleviate symptoms associated with conditions like congestive heart failure, making it easier to breathe and reducing the strain on the heart.  Management of Certain Kidney Disorders:Furosemide may be used to manage fluid balance in individuals with kidney problems.  Treatment of Edema:It can help treat edema resulting from various causes, including heart, kidney, or liver issues. Dehydration:Excessive diuresis can lead to dehydration, so it's important to monitor fluid intake and replenish lost fluids.  Electrolyte Imbalances:Furosemide can cause imbalances in electrolytes like potassium, sodium, and magnesium. Healthcare providers may monitor these levels and prescribe supplements if necessary.  Low Blood Pressure:Rapid reduction in blood volume can lead to low blood pressure (hypotension), which may result in dizziness or fainting. Kidney Function:Furosemide affects kidney function and may worsen kidney problems in some cases.  Gastrointestinal Symptoms:Common side effects can include upset stomach, diarrhea, or constipation.  Hearing Loss (Rare):In rare cases, high doses of furosemide can lead to reversible hearing loss, especially if administered too quickly.  Take the medication as prescribed, usually once or twice a day. It's often recommended to take it in the morning to prevent nighttime urination. FRUSIX 40 contains the active ingredient furosemide, which is a loop diuretic. It works by affecting the kidneys and their ability to reabsorb sodium (salt) and water from the urine. Here's how it works: Inhibition of Sodium Reabsorption:Furosemide inhibits the reabsorption of sodium in the loop of Henle, a part of the kidney's tubules. This prevents the kidneys from reabsorbing as much sodium back into the bloodstream.  Increased Urine Production:By interfering with sodium reabsorption, furosemide causes more sodium and water to be excreted in the urine. This results in increased urine production (diuresis).  Reduced Fluid Retention:The increased urine production helps to reduce the volume of fluid in the bloodstream and body tissues, which can be beneficial for conditions characterized by fluid retention or edema. If you remember within a few hours of the missed dose, take it as soon as you remember. Be cautious when standing up quickly, especially if you experience dizziness or lightheadedness, as furosemide can lower blood pressure. If you experience signs of an allergic reaction, such as rash, swelling, or difficulty breathing, seek immediate medical attention. Discuss with your healthcare provider if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, as there may be specific considerations. - Do not stop taking FRUSIX 40 abruptly without consulting your healthcare provider. Sudden discontinuation may lead to a rebound effect of fluid retention or worsening of your condition. Your healthcare provider can provide guidance on how to taper off the medication if necessary. FRUSIX 40 is typically available by prescription only, and it should be used under the supervision and guidance of a healthcare provider.
10. Can I stop taking FRUSIX 40 abruptly?
- Do not stop taking FRUSIX 40 abruptly without consulting your healthcare provider. Sudden discontinuation may lead to a rebound effect of fluid retention or worsening of your condition. Your healthcare provider can provide guidance on how to taper off the medication if necessary. It's generally advisable to limit or avoid alcohol while taking FRUSIX 40, as alcohol can increase the risk of dehydration and may exacerbate certain side effects.

Triad 10 mg is a medication containing Amitriptyline Hydrochloride at a strength of 10mg. It works by affecting neurotransmitters in the brain and has a sedative effect. This medication is prescribed to help manage mood disorders and alleviate symptoms of these conditions.

This medication is a synthetic antiandrogen, prescribed for benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), prostate cancer, and hair loss. It prevents testosterone conversion in to dihydrotestosterone (DHT) in the body.Finasteride is a 5α-reductase inhibitor and therefore an antiandrogen.[9] It works by decreasing the production of dihydrotestosterone (DHT) by about 70%, including in the prostate gland and the scalp.   . Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH):Finasteride is prescribed to help reduce the size of the prostate gland in men with BPH. By inhibiting the conversion of testosterone to dihydrotestosterone (DHT), it can relieve urinary symptoms associated with an enlarged prostate. 2. Prostate Cancer:In some cases, finasteride may be used as part of the treatment plan for prostate cancer, particularly in certain types of the disease. 3. Hair Loss (Androgenetic Alopecia):Finasteride is also used to treat male pattern baldness (androgenetic alopecia) by slowing hair loss and, in some cases, promoting hair regrowth. . FLUR EYE DROPS is a combination of Flurbiprofen and Hydroxypropyl methylcellulose (HPMC) which belongs to the group of medicines called NSAIDs and Eye lubricants. Turn the bottle upside down and squeeze it to release drop into the affected eye and close your eye for 30 seconds. Do not touch tip of container to any surface to avoid contamination. Flurbiprofen present in the FLUR EYE DROPSworks by stopping the pupil (inner part of the eye) from narrowing. While Hydroxypropyl methylcellulose is an Eye lubricant used to reduce dryness and soreness irritation. It also helps to prevent damage to the eye in certain eye diseases. Uses: Salsa 10 contains Salicylic acid 10% which  is a common organic compound that belongs to the class of chemicals known as beta-hydroxy acids (BHAs). Here are a few key points about salicylic acid: Acne treatment: Salicylic acid is widely used in skincare products, particularly those targeted at treating acne. It helps to exfoliate the skin, unclog pores, and reduce inflammation, making it effective for treating acne breakouts. Exfoliation: Salicylic acid has the ability to penetrate the pores and dissolve excess oil and dead skin cells. This property makes it useful in exfoliating products, helping to improve skin texture and remove dullness. Wart and callus removal: Salicylic acid is also used in over-the-counter treatments for the removal of warts and calluses. It works by softening the hardened skin and promoting its gradual shedding. Anti-inflammatory properties: Salicylic acid possesses anti-inflammatory properties, which can help reduce redness, swelling, and irritation associated with various skin conditions, including acne, psoriasis, and dermatitis.

Sitagliptin 50 mg + Metformin hydrochloride 850 mg is a combination medication used in the treatment of type 2 diabetes. This combination medication contains two active ingredients: Sitagliptin: It is a dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitor. DPP-4 inhibitors help regulate blood sugar levels by increasing the levels of certain natural substances that lower blood sugar when it is too high. Metformin hydrochloride: Metformin is a biguanide medication that helps improve insulin sensitivity, reduce the amount of sugar produced by the liver, and decrease the absorption of sugar from the intestines. It is one of the most commonly prescribed medications for type 2 diabetes Sitagliptin 50 mg + Metformin hydrochloride 850 mg is primarily used to treat type 2 diabetes. It helps lower blood sugar levels in people with this condition by improving insulin sensitivity, reducing sugar production by the liver, and decreasing sugar absorption from the intestines Common side effects of Sitagliptin 50 mg + Metformin hydrochloride 850 mg may include: Less common but more serious side effects may occur, so it's essential to report any unusual symptoms to your healthcare provider. Follow your healthcare provider's dosing instructions precisely. Typically, this medication is taken orally with meals to reduce stomach upset. The dosage and frequency will depend on your specific medical condition and response to treatment. Sitagliptin (DPP-4 Inhibitor): Inhibition of DPP-4:Sitagliptin is a dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitor. DPP-4 is an enzyme that breaks down incretin hormones, such as glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) and glucose-dependent insulinotropic polypeptide (GIP). Increased Incretin Hormones:By inhibiting DPP-4, Sitagliptin allows incretin hormones, particularly GLP-1, to remain active in the body for a longer time. These hormones stimulate the pancreas to release insulin in response to elevated blood sugar levels. Enhanced Insulin Release:Increased levels of GLP-1 and GIP lead to greater insulin secretion, especially after meals when blood sugar levels rise. This helps control blood sugar levels by promoting the uptake of glucose into cells. Metformin (Biguanide): Improved Insulin Sensitivity:Metformin primarily works by improving insulin sensitivity in the body's cells. It makes cells more receptive to the effects of insulin, allowing glucose to enter cells more efficiently. Reduced Liver Sugar Production:Metformin also decreases the liver's production of glucose. In individuals with type 2 diabetes, the liver can produce excess glucose, contributing to elevated blood sugar levels. Metformin helps lower this production. Decreased Intestinal Glucose Absorption:Metformin can reduce the absorption of glucose from the intestines into the bloodstream, further contributing to lower blood sugar levels. Combined Action:The combination of Sitagliptin and Metformin offers a complementary approach to managing blood sugar in individuals with type 2 diabetes: If you forget to take a dose, take it as soon as you remember, but do not take it if it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose. Never double up on doses to make up for a missed one. Follow your regular dosing schedule. Always take the medication exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. Do not change the dosage or frequency without consulting your healthcare provider first. Your healthcare provider will likely recommend regular blood sugar monitoring to ensure the medication is effectively controlling your diabetes. Follow their recommendations for monitoring and keep a log of your results. Continue to follow a healthy diet and exercise plan as prescribed by your healthcare provider. These lifestyle changes are essential in managing diabetes and can complement the medication's effects - Discuss the risks and benefits of this medication with your healthcare provider if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding Yes, maintaining a healthy diet and regular exercise routine is important in managing type 2 diabetes and can complement the medication's effects It's best to limit or avoid alcohol, as it can affect blood sugar levels and increase the risk of hypoglycemia. Monitor your blood sugar regularly, carry a source of glucose for emergencies, and be aware of hypoglycemia symptoms such as sweating, shaking, confusion, and dizziness.
