Diabin (Voglibose) is an oral medication that belongs to the class of drugs known as alpha-glucosidase inhibitors. It is primarily used in the management of type 2 diabetes mellitus. Voglibose helps control blood sugar levels in individuals with type 2 diabetes by reducing the increase in blood glucose after meals. It is often used as an adjunct to diet and exercise or in combination with other diabetes medications, Common side effects of voglibose may include gastrointestinal symptoms such as flatulence, diarrhea, abdominal discomfort, and bloating. These side effects are typically mild and transient. If you experience severe or persistent side effects, it's important to consult your healthcare professional. Voglibose is usually taken orally with meals. The dosage and frequency of administration will depend on various factors, including the individual's blood sugar levels, response to treatment, and other medications being taken. It's important to follow the instructions provided by your healthcare professional Voglibose works by inhibiting the enzyme alpha-glucosidase in the small intestine. This enzyme is responsible for breaking down complex carbohydrates into simple sugars, which are then absorbed into the bloodstream. By inhibiting alpha-glucosidase, voglibose delays the digestion and absorption of carbohydrates, resulting in lower post-meal blood sugar levels. Monitor your blood Glucose level and consult with your Physician. Voglibose does not typically cause hypoglycemia (low blood sugar) when used as a monotherapy. However, when used in combination with other diabetes medications that can cause hypoglycemia, there is a potential risk. It's important to monitor blood sugar levels regularly and consult your healthcare professional if you experience symptoms of hypoglycemia. No, voglibose is not a substitute for a healthy diet and regular exercise. It is typically used as an adjunct to diet and exercise to help control blood sugar levels in individuals with type 2 diabetes. Voglibose is not recommended during pregnancy or breastfeeding due to limited safety data. If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, it's important to discuss your options with your healthcare professional.

Atopic dermatitis, often known as eczema, is treated with Tacroz Ointment. It functions by reducing the activity of specific immune cells that lead to skin inflammation (redness and swelling). In atopic dermatitis, this reduces itching and helps rashes. The Tacroz Ointment is applied externally. It should be applied to the affected area 2-4 times per day, or as directed by a doctor. It should be rubbed into the skin after being applied gradually and uniformly. It shouldn't be used too frequently, and the treated region shouldn't be covered with a bandage or plaster. If the skin grows worse or if there is no improvement even after two weeks of treatment, you must tell your doctor. Preventing organ rejection in recipients of transplantsThe drug Tacroz Ointment is categorized as an immunosuppressant. When your immune system perceives the new organ as an alien and attacks it, organ rejection occurs. This medication lessens the likelihood that your body will attack the donated organ by weakening your immune system, which often fights infection. Combining it with other medications increases the likelihood that your transplant operation will be successful. Until your doctor instructs you otherwise, you should keep taking the medication. This medicine is for external use only. Use it in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Clean and dry the affected area and gently massage the ointment Tacroz Ointment is an immunosuppressant. It works by suppressing the activity of certain immune cells that cause inflammation (redness and swelling) of the skin. This relieves itching and improves rashes in atopic dermatitis. If you miss a dose of Tacroz Ointment, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose.

Uses: Nucoxia 90mg is a brand name for a medicine called Etoricoxib, which belongs to a class of drugs known as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). It is commonly used to treat pain and inflammation caused by various conditions such as osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and gouty arthritis. Nucoxia 90mg works by blocking the action of a specific enzyme called cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2), which plays a crucial role in producing prostaglandins. Prostaglandins are chemicals produced in response to an injury or inflammation, and they cause pain, swelling, and fever. By blocking COX-2, Nucoxia 90mg reduces the production of prostaglandins and thus reduces pain, inflammation, and fever.

Nucoxia 60 mg is a brand name for a medication called Etoricoxib. It is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to relieve pain, inflammation, and stiffness caused by various conditions such as osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and gout. Nucoxia 60 mg works by blocking the production of a chemical in the body called prostaglandin. This chemical is responsible for causing pain, inflammation, and swelling. By blocking its production, Nucoxia 60 mg helps to reduce these symptoms. It is important to note that Nucoxia 60 mg should be used under the guidance of a doctor, as it may not be suitable for everyone. It should not be taken by people who are allergic to Etoricoxib or other NSAIDs, have a history of stomach ulcers or bleeding, have severe liver or kidney problems, or are pregnant or breastfeeding. Additionally, Nucoxia 60 mg should be taken at the lowest effective dose for the shortest possible duration, as it may increase the risk of heart attack, stroke, or other serious cardiovascular problems if used for a long period of time Nucoxia 60 mg (Etoricoxib) is primarily used to relieve pain, inflammation, and stiffness caused by various conditions such as: Osteoarthritis: This is a degenerative joint disease that causes the breakdown of cartilage, resulting in pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility. Rheumatoid arthritis: This is an autoimmune disease that causes joint inflammation, pain, and swelling. Ankylosing spondylitis: This is a chronic inflammatory disease that primarily affects the spine, causing pain, stiffness, and reduced mobility. Gout: This is a type of arthritis caused by a buildup of uric acid crystals in the joints, causing pain, swelling, and inflammation. In addition to these conditions, Nucoxia 60 mg may also be used for the treatment of other types of pain, such as postoperative pain or menstrual cramps. Nucoxia 60 mg (Etoricoxib) belongs to a class of drugs called nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). It works by blocking the action of an enzyme called cyclooxygenase-2 (COX-2), which is responsible for the production of prostaglandins in the body. Prostaglandins are chemicals that are released in response to injury or inflammation and contribute to pain, swelling, and fever. By blocking the production of prostaglandins, Nucoxia 60 mg reduces inflammation, pain, and fever associated with various conditions such as osteoarthritis, rheumatoid arthritis, ankylosing spondylitis, and gout. Nucoxia 60 mg also has an effect on COX-1, another enzyme that is involved in the production of prostaglandins. By blocking COX-1, Nucoxia 60 mg reduces the risk of gastrointestinal side effects such as stomach ulcers and bleeding that are associated with some other NSAIDs. It is important to note that while Nucoxia 60 mg can provide effective pain relief, it should be used at the lowest effective dose for the shortest possible duration, due to the risk of side effects such as cardiovascular events and gastrointestinal bleeding. It should also be used under the guidance of a doctor, who can monitor its effectiveness and adjust the dose as needed. Acute otitis mediaSinusitisLung infectionsSkin and soft tissue infectionsCystitisGonorrhoeaPeptic UlcerDental AbcessBacterial EndocarditisPharyngitis/TonsilitisTyphoid fever Common side effects: Aristomox 500 MG Capsule is used orally for treating bacterial infections and it is proven to be safe and effective.  Take Aristomox 500 MG Capsule with or without food. Uses: Ecosprin 75 Tablet is a commonly used medication for protecting the heart. It is an antiplatelet medicine that helps prevent heart attacks, strokes, and angina (chest pain) by reducing the formation of blood clots in the blood vessels. The active ingredient in Ecosprin 75 is acetylsalicylic acid, also known as aspirin. Ecosprin 75, as an antiplatelet medication, helps prevent the formation of blood clots that can block the blood vessels supplying the heart. By reducing clot formation, it lowers the risk of a heart attack. Ecosprin 75 can alleviate the symptoms of angina, such as chest pain or discomfort, by improving blood flow to the heart.
Side Effects: Prevention of heart attacks | Prevention of strokes | Management of angina | Prevention of blood clot formation | Gastrointestinal effects; indigestion, heartburn, stomach ulcers, and gastrointestinal bleeding. | dizziness | headache | nausea | vomiting | Tinnitus | Allergic reactions |

Uses: Pregabalin, marketed under the brand name Lyrica among others, is an anticonvulsant and anxiolytic medication used to treat epilepsy, neuropathic pain, fibromyalgia, restless leg syndrome, and generalized anxiety disorder. Its use in epilepsy is as an add-on therapy for partial seizures.

Uses: Composition: Levofloxacin (750mg) Qure 750mg Tablet is an antibiotic, used in the treatment of bacterial infections. It is also used in treating infections of the urinary tract, nose, throat, skin and lungs (pneumonia). It cures the infection by stopping the further growth of the causative microorganisms. Qure 750mg Tablet should be used in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. It may be taken with or without food, preferably at a fixed time. Avoid skipping any doses and finish the full course of treatment even if you feel better. Do not take a double dose to make up for a missed dose. Simply take the next dose as planned. Treatment of Bacterial infections Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Qure 750mg Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time.Avoid Qure 750mg Tablet with dairy products such as milk, cheese, curd, butter, paneer and ice cream. Qure 750mg Tablet is an antibiotic. It works by stopping the action of a bacterial enzyme called DNA-gyrase. Qure 750mg Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. Uses: Amoxicillin and potassium clavulanate suspension is a combination medication that contains two active ingredients: amoxicillin and potassium clavulanate. It is commonly prescribed to treat various bacterial infections. Amoxicillin and potassium clavulanate suspension is used to treat a wide range of bacterial infections, including respiratory tract infections (such as sinusitis, bronchitis, and pneumonia), ear infections, urinary tract infections, skin and soft tissue infections, and certain dental infections. It is effective against certain bacteria that may be resistant to amoxicillin alone. Common side effects may include gastrointestinal symptoms such as nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal discomfort. The suspension should be shaken well before each use, and the prescribed dosage should be administered using the provided measuring device. It's important to follow the prescribed dosage and instructions provided by your healthcare professional or the medication packaging. Do not skip doses or stop taking the medication before completing the full prescribed course, even if you start feeling better. Amoxicillin is a penicillin-type antibiotic that works by inhibiting the growth and spread of bacteria. It does this by interfering with the synthesis of bacterial cell walls, leading to the destruction of the bacteria. Potassium clavulanate is a beta-lactamase inhibitor that helps to protect amoxicillin from being broken down by beta-lactamase enzymes produced by some bacteria. This enhances the effectiveness of amoxicillin against a broader range of bacteria. Amoxicillin is generally considered safe for use during pregnancy and breastfeeding. It is commonly prescribed in these situations when the benefits outweigh the potential risks. However, it's important to consult with your healthcare professional if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. No, amoxicillin is only effective against bacterial infections. It does not work against viral infections such as the common cold or the flu. It is important to use antibiotics only when prescribed by a healthcare professional and for the appropriate bacterial infections. Amoxicillin may interact with certain medications, so it's important to inform your healthcare professional about all the medications you are taking, including over-the-counter drugs and herbal supplements. Amoxicillin may reduce the effectiveness of certain contraceptive medications, so it's important to use alternative methods of contraception if necessary.

Aziwok-500 Tablet 5's belongs to a group of medicines known as macrolide antibiotics. It is used to treat various respiratory system bacterial infections (like pneumonia, bronchitis, tonsillitis, pharyngitis and sinusitis), skin infections (like acne and rosacea), ear infections, and sexually transmitted infections. A bacterial infection is a condition in which bacteria grow in the body and cause infection. It can target any body part and multiple very quickly. Aziwok-500 Tablet 5's slows the growth or sometimes kills the harmful bacteria by preventing the production of proteins required by the bacteria for its survival. Aziwok-500 Tablet 5's does not treat a viral infection like flu or a common cold.

Prednisolone is a medication classified as a corticosteroid, which is a synthetic form of the hormone cortisol. It has anti-inflammatory and immunosuppressive properties. Prednisolone is commonly prescribed to treat a variety of medical conditions.

Compostion: Pantoprazole (40mg) PAN IV Injection is a medicine that reduces the amount of acid produced in your stomach. It is used for treating acid-related diseases of the stomach and intestine such as acid reflux, indigestion, peptic ulcer disease, and some other stomach conditions associated with excessive acid production. PAN IV Injection is also used to prevent stress ulcers in seriously ill patients and is administered before anesthetic medication to help prevent aspiration-related complications. It belongs to a class of medicines known as proton pump inhibitors (PPIs).     Common side effects: Your doctor or nurse will give you this medicine. Kindly do not self administer. PAN IV Injection is a proton pump inhibitor (PPI). It works by reducing the amount of acid in the stomach which in turn relieves acid-related indigestion and heartburn. Caution is advised when consuming alcohol with PAN IV Injection. Please consult your doctor. PAN IV Injection may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor.
Side Effects: Treatment of Heartburn | Treatment of Gastroesophageal reflux disease (Acid reflux) | Treatment of Peptic ulcer disease | Diarrhea | Flatulence | Headache | Joint pain | Nausea | Stomach pain |

Uses: Composition:  Ipratropium (250mcg)  IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION contains Ipratropium which belongs to the group of medicines called Bronchodilators. It is used to treat breathing problems like chronic asthma (airflow obstruction and repetitive episodes of wheezing, breathlessness, chest tightness, and coughing) and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) and help patients breathe more easily.  IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION should be used with caution in pregnant and breastfeeding women. Your doctor will prescribe the right dose of IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION for your child depending on age, body weight and health condition. The most common side effects of using IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION are headache, dizziness, dry mouth, nausea, constipation, diarrhoea. Contact your doctor if any of the side effects worsen.  It is used to treat breathing problems like chronic asthma and chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) Common side effects: Use IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION as advised by your physician. It is for inhalation use only. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop using IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION unless your doctor advises you to stop. IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION helps you breathe easily by blocking cholinergic receptors, which leads to decrease in the production of a chemical in the lung airways, and reduced contraction of the smooth muscles. Caution is advised when consuming alcohol with Ipravent Respirator Solution. Please consult your doctor. IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION should be used with caution in pregnant women or women planning to have a baby as safety data has not been established yet. Consult your doctor before using it. IPRAVENT RESPIRATORY SOLUTION should be used with caution in breastfeeding women as it is not known if the medicine passes through the breast milk. Consult your doctor before using it.

Uses: lindamycin Capsules contain clindamycin which is an antibiotic used in the treatment of severe bacterial infections.This medication contains clindamycin HCL as a active ingredient.This antibiotic treats only bacterial infections. Composition: Salbutamol (5mg)  ASTHALIN RESPIRATORY SOLUTION contains Salbutamol which belongs to the group of medicines called Bronchodilators. It is used to treat severe asthma attacks. It can also be used in the management of chronic bronchospasm (long-term breathing difficulties caused due to narrowing of airways) unresponsive to conventional therapies.  Asthma is a long-term respiratory disease in which your airways become inflamed, swollen and narrowed. It also causes excessive mucous secretion in the airways which makes it difficult for the air to pass through, leading to unpleasant symptoms like wheezing, difficulty in breathing, chest pain and/or cough.  ASTHALIN RESPIRATORY SOLUTION is suitable for use both in adults and in children (aged 4 years or above). Before using ASTHALIN RESPIRATORY SOLUTION inform your doctor if you have diabetes, overactive thyroid functions, low blood potassium levels, high blood pressure or any heart problems (such as angina or irregular heartbeat) as a precaution. Treatment of Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) Common side effects: Use it as advised by your doctor or check the label for directions before use. Asthalin Respirator Solution is a bronchodilator. It works by relaxing the muscles in the airways and widens airways. This makes breathing easier. If you miss a dose of Asthalin Respirator Solution, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Do not use ASTHALIN RESPIRATORY SOLUTION if you are allergic to Salbutamol. ASTHALIN RESPIRATORY SOLUTION should be used in pregnant women only if it is considered necessary by the doctor. Therefore, inform your doctor before using it. ASTHALIN RESPIRATORY SOLUTION should be used in breastfeeding women only if it is considered necessary by the doctor. Therefore, consult your doctor for advice before using it.
Side Effects: Tachycardia | Tremors | Headache | Palpitations | Increased heart rate | Muscle cramp |

Uses: Azithromycin is an antibiotic. It's widely used to treat chest infections such as pneumonia, infections of the nose and throat such as sinus infection (sinusitis), skin infections, Lyme disease, and some sexually transmitted infections.AzithAzithromycin alone and in combination with other medications is currently being studied for the treatment of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19). Currently, azithromycin has been used with hydroxychloroquine to treat certain patients with COVID-19. However, there are mixed reports of effectiveness when azithromycin was used along with other medications to treat other viral respiratory infections. Azithromycin also has been used to treat bacterial infections in hospitalized patients with COVID-19. More information is needed before any conclusions can be made regarding the possible benefits and risks of using azithromycin either alone or in combination with hydroxychloroquine in patients with COVID-19.   Respiratory Tract Infections: 2. Skin and Soft Tissue Infections: 3. Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs): 4. Ear and Throat Infections: 5. Preventive Use: 6. Traveler's Diarrhea: Effective Against Bacterial Infections: Azithral 500mg is an antibiotic that is effective against a wide range of bacterial infections. It helps to eliminate the bacteria responsible for infections and can relieve symptoms.  Treatment of Respiratory Infections: It can be used to treat respiratory infections such as bronchitis, pneumonia, and certain types of sinusitis, which can cause symptoms like cough, fever, and difficulty breathing.  Management of Skin and Soft Tissue Infections: Azithral 500mg is used to treat skin and soft tissue infections, including cellulitis, impetigo, and erysipelas. It can help reduce inflammation and promote healing.  Treatment of Sexually Transmitted Infections: It is effective against certain sexually transmitted infections, such as chlamydia and gonorrhea. Treating these infections can prevent complications and reduce the spread of the disease.  Management of Ear and Throat Infections: Azithromycin can be prescribed for ear infections (otitis media) and throat infections (pharyngitis or tonsillitis) caused by susceptible bacteria.  Preventive Use: In some cases, Azithral 500mg is used as prophylaxis to prevent infections, particularly in individuals with weakened immune systems. Gastrointestinal Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and abdominal pain are common side effects. Taking the medication with food can help reduce these symptoms.  Headache: Some individuals may experience headaches.  Allergic Reactions: Allergic reactions, although rare, can occur and may include rash, itching, swelling of the face, lips, or tongue, and difficulty breathing. Seek medical attention if you experience these symptoms.  Liver Enzyme Abnormalities: In some cases, azithromycin can affect liver enzymes. Your healthcare provider may monitor your liver function with blood tests. Azithral 500mg tablets are typically taken orally (by mouth) with or without food, as directed by your healthcare provider. Azithromycin, the active ingredient in Azithral 500mg, is an antibiotic that belongs to the macrolide class.It works by inhibiting the growth and replication of bacteria. Azithromycin binds to the bacterial ribosomes, interfering with protein synthesis, and ultimately leading to the death of the bacteria. If you forget to take a dose of Azithral 500mg, take it as soon as you remember, unless it's close to the time for your next dose. In that case, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Inform your healthcare provider if you are allergic to azithromycin or any other antibiotics in the macrolide class. Allergic reactions can be severe and require immediate medical attention. If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, discuss the use of azithromycin with your healthcare provider. They will weigh the potential risks and benefits. It is generally safe to consume moderate amounts of alcohol while taking azithromycin. However, excessive alcohol use should be avoided as it can increase the risk of side effects and potentially impact liver function. No, Azithral 500mg is an antibiotic effective against bacterial infections. It does not treat viral infections such as the common cold or flu. Azithromycin can be taken with or without food. Taking it with food may help reduce gastrointestinal side effects such as nausea and vomiting.

Uses:
Losartan potassium/Hydrochlorothiazide is a combination of an angiotensin II receptor antagonist (losartan) and a diuretic (hydrochlorothiazide). Angiotensin II is a substance produced in the body which binds to receptors in blood vessels, causing them to tighten. This results in an increase in blood
pressure. Losartan prevents the binding of angiotensin II to these receptors, causing the blood vessels to relax which in turn lowers the blood pressure. Hydrochlorothiazide works by making the kidneys pass more water and salt. This also helps to reduce blood pressure. Hypertension (High Blood Pressure): The primary use of Repace-H is to lower and control high blood pressure. Losartan, an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB), relaxes blood vessels, while hydrochlorothiazide, a diuretic, helps remove excess salt and water from the body. This combination helps reduce blood pressure. Reduction of Stroke Risk: Controlling high blood pressure with medications like Repace-H can lower the risk of strokes, which can be a complication of uncontrolled hypertension. Heart Failure: In some cases, Repace-H may be prescribed to manage heart failure. By reducing blood pressure and the workload on the heart, it can help improve heart function in certain individuals. Kidney Protection: Repace-H may also be used to protect the kidneys in people with diabetes and high blood pressure. It can help slow the progression of kidney disease in these individuals. Reduction of Cardiovascular Events: Lowering blood pressure with medications like Repace-H can reduce the risk of various cardiovascular events, including heart attacks and heart-related deaths. Blood Pressure Control:Repace-H effectively lowers and controls high blood pressure, reducing the risk of complications associated with hypertension. Stroke Prevention:By lowering blood pressure, Repace-H helps reduce the risk of strokes, which can occur when blood pressure is uncontrolled. Heart Failure Management:In some cases, Repace-H is used to manage heart failure, as it can improve heart function by reducing the heart's workload. Kidney Protection:It can slow the progression of kidney disease in individuals with diabetes and high blood pressure, offering kidney protection. Cardiovascular Risk Reduction:Repace-H can help lower the risk of various cardiovascular events, including heart attacks and heart-related deaths, in individuals with hypertension. Dizziness: Some people may experience dizziness, especially when standing up quickly. This is often due to the blood pressure-lowering effect of the medication. Lightheadedness: Lightheadedness can occur, particularly during the initial days of treatment or when the dose is increased. Dry Cough: A dry cough is a less common but possible side effect of losartan, one of the components of Repace-H. Increased Urination: Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic, and it can lead to increased urination. Dosage: Take Repace-H exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. The typical starting dose is one tablet containing losartan 50mg and hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg daily. However, your healthcare provider may adjust the dosage based on your individual needs. Timing: Repace-H can be taken with or without food. It's usually taken once a day, preferably at the same time each day, to help you remember to take it consistently. Swallow Whole: Swallow the tablet whole with a glass of water. Do not crush, chew, or break the tablet, as it's formulated for controlled release. Follow-Up: Attend regular follow-up appointments with your healthcare provider to monitor your blood pressure and any potential side effects. Your doctor may adjust your dosage as needed. Lifestyle Modifications: In addition to taking Repace-H, follow any lifestyle modifications recommended by your healthcare provider, such as maintaining a heart-healthy diet, engaging in regular exercise, reducing salt intake, and managing stress Losartan (ARB): Losartan is an angiotensin II receptor blocker (ARB). It works by blocking the action of a hormone called angiotensin II, which narrows blood vessels and increases blood pressure. By blocking this hormone, losartan helps relax blood vessels, reducing resistance to blood flow and lowering blood pressure. Hydrochlorothiazide (Diuretic): Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic, which means it increases the excretion of salt and water from the body through the urine. This reduces the volume of blood in the circulatory system, which leads to a decrease in blood pressure. Additionally, the removal of excess salt helps the body manage fluid balance and reduce blood pressure. If you remember within a few hours of the missed dose, take it right away. If it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and take your next dose at the regular time. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. Take Repace-H exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. Do not alter the dosage or frequency without consulting them.    Repace-H is primarily used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension). It can also be prescribed to manage certain cases of heart failure and provide kidney protection in individuals with diabetes and hypertension Repace-H contains losartan (an angiotensin II receptor blocker) and hydrochlorothiazide (a diuretic). Losartan relaxes blood vessels, while hydrochlorothiazide reduces blood volume, collectively lowering blood pressure If you forget a dose, take it as soon as you remember. If it's close to your next scheduled dose, skip the missed one and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose It's advisable to limit or avoid alcohol while taking Repace-H, as alcohol can interact with the medication and affect blood pressure

Losartan potassium/Hydrochlorothiazide is a combination of an angiotensin II receptor antagonist (losartan) and a diuretic (hydrochlorothiazide). Angiotensin II is a substance produced in the body which binds to receptors in blood vessels, causing them to tighten. This results in an increase in blood pressure. Losartan prevents the binding of angiotensin II to these receptors, causing the blood vessels to relax which in turn lowers the blood pressure. Hydrochlorothiazide works by making the kidneys pass more water and salt. This also helps to reduce blood pressure. Losartan Potassium 50 mg + Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg is a combination medication primarily prescribed for the treatment of high blood pressure, also known as hypertension. It is used when your healthcare provider determines that the combination of losartan and hydrochlorothiazide is an appropriate treatment for your condition. Common side effects may include: Take this medication exactly as prescribed by your healthcare provider. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. : Attend regular follow-up appointments with your healthcare provider to monitor blood pressure and overall health. Discuss the use of this medication with your doctor if you are pregnant, planning pregnancy, or breastfeeding. Limit or avoid alcohol consumption, as it can interact with the medication. Follow dietary recommendations, particularly regarding salt intake, as advised by your doctor. It is prescribed based on your specific condition and your doctor's assessment. Not everyone with high blood pressure requires this combination medication. Do not stop taking it without consulting your doctor. Stopping medication abruptly can lead to a rise in blood pressure. Follow your doctor's dietary recommendations, particularly regarding salt intake, as high-sodium diets can affect blood pressure.
Side Effects: Dizziness | Low blood pressure | Increased urination | Electrolyte imbalances (e.g., low potassium levels) | Elevated blood glucose levels | Losartan (an angiotensin II receptor blocker) relaxes blood vessels, reducing resistance and lowering blood pressure.Hydrochlorothiazide (a thiazide diuretic) increases urine production, which helps the body remove excess fluid and salt, further lowering blood pressure. |

Composition: Losartan Potassium 50mg + Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5mg Treatment of Hypertension (high blood pressure) Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Lotan H Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Lotan H Tablet is a combination of two medicines: Losartan and Hydrochlorothiazide, which lowers the blood pressure effectively. Losartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). It works by blocking the hormone angiotensin thereby relaxing blood vessels. This allows the blood to flow more smoothly and the heart to pump more efficiently. Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that removes extra water and certain electrolytes from the body. Over time it also relaxes blood vessels and improves blood flow. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Lotan H Tablet. Lotan H Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Yes, the use of Lotan H Tablet can make you feel dizzy. This may occur when you suddenly rise up from lying or sitting position. To lower the chance of feeling dizzy or passing out, rise slowly if you have been sitting or lying down.
Side Effects: Nausea | Taste change | Upset stomach | Diarrhea | Headache | Dizziness | Electrolyte imbalance |

Uses: This combination medication is used to treat essential hypertension (high blood pressure) in patients whose blood pressure is not adequately controlled by either Losartan or Hydrochlorothiazide alone. Common side effects of Losartan + Hydrochlorothiazide may include dizziness, headache, fatigue, increased urination, and electrolyte imbalances (such as low potassium levels). It is taken orally, with or without food with a glass of water. Losartan and Hydrochlorothiazide work together to lower blood pressure through different mechanisms. Losartan blocks the action of angiotensin II, causing blood vessels to relax and widen, while Hydrochlorothiazide increases urine production, reducing the volume of fluid in the blood vessels. This medication is not recommended during pregnancy, especially during the second and third trimesters, as it may harm the unborn baby. If you are pregnant or planning to become pregnant, inform your doctor, and they may prescribe an alternative medication. Losartan and Hydrochlorothiazide may also pass into breast milk, so their use is generally not recommended while breastfeeding. Avoid excessive alcohol consumption while taking LOTACE H, as alcohol may further lower blood pressure and increase the risk of side effects. Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic, which means it can increase urine output and lead to dehydration if not enough fluids are consumed. It's important to stay adequately hydrated while taking this medication, especially in hot weather or during strenuous activities. This combination medication is typically not recommended for use in children. It is primarily intended for adults with hypertension.

Composition: Losartan (50mg) + Hydrochlorothiazide (12.5mg) ALSARTAN H is a combination of Hydrochlorothiazide and Losartan which belongs to the group of medicines called Thiazide like diuretics and Angiotensin II receptor antagonists respectively. ALSARTAN H is indicated for the treatment of essential hypertension. Essential hypertension (also known as high blood pressure) is a medical condition in which the force of the blood exerted against the walls of the artery remains very high, and as a result it may lead to severe damage to the blood vessels of several organs, thus causing heart attack, heart or kidney failure, stroke, or even blindness. This medicine is not recommended during pregnancy and you should ask your doctor before taking it if you have kidney or liver disease, heart trouble or diabetes. Drinking alcohol can further lower your blood pressure and may cause side effects. Treatment of Hypertension (high blood pressure)  Common side effects: Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Alsartan-H Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time. Alsartan-H Tablet is a combination of two medicines: Losartan and Hydrochlorothiazide, which lowers the blood pressure effectively. Losartan is an angiotensin receptor blocker (ARB). It works by blocking the hormone angiotensin thereby relaxing blood vessels. This allows the blood to flow more smoothly and the heart to pump more efficiently. Hydrochlorothiazide is a diuretic that removes extra water and certain electrolytes from the body. Over time it also relaxes blood vessels and improves blood flow. If you miss a dose of Alsartan-H Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Alsartan-H Tablet. Alsartan-H Tablet is unsafe to use during pregnancy as there is definite evidence of risk to the developing baby. However, the doctor may rarely prescribe it in some life-threatening situations if the benefits are more than the potential risks. Please consult your doctor. Alsartan-H Tablet is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Nausea | Taste change | Upset stomach | Diarrhea | Headache | Dizziness | Weakness | Decreased blood pressure | Increased blood uric acid | Increased blood lipid level | Glucose intolerance | Electrolyte imbalance |

Uses: This medicine is called esomeprazole. This belongs to a group of medicines called ‘proton pump inhibitors’. They work by reducing the amount of acid that your stomach produces.

-Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD):Esomeprazole is commonly used to treat GERD, a condition where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing symptoms like heartburn and acid regurgitation. -Peptic Ulcers:Esomeprazole can be used to heal and prevent ulcers in the stomach (gastric ulcers) and the first part of the small intestine (duodenal ulcers). -Erosive Esophagitis:This condition involves inflammation and damage to the lining of the esophagus due to stomach acid. Esomeprazole can help heal this damage. -Helicobacter pylori Eradication:Esomeprazole is sometimes used in combination with antibiotics to treat Helicobacter pylori infections, which can lead to peptic ulcers. Common side effects of esomeprazole may include headache, stomach pain, diarrhea, and nausea. Esomeprazole tablets are usually taken orally, typically once daily before a meal. It works by inhibiting the proton pumps in the stomach lining, reducing the production of gastric acid. Take it as soon as you remember before a meal or on an empty stomach. Do not double up on dose. Alcohol consumption should be avoided while using esomeprazole as it can worsen the condition. Consult with your Physician if you are pregnant or breastfeeding regarding the use of esomeprazole. Esomeprazole can interact with certain medications, including blood thinners, antifungal drugs, and some anti-seizure medications. It's important to inform your healthcare provider about all the medications and supplements you're taking. Esomeprazole is not intended for immediate relief of heartburn. It's designed for long-term management of conditions related to excess stomach acid. For immediate relief, antacids or other short-acting medications may be more suitable. Esomeprazole should be taken before meal. But if you have already had a meal then you can take the medication after 2 hours of having any meal, to let the medication absorbed properly.

Esomeprazole can help heal this damage. | -Helicobacter pylori Eradication:Esomeprazole is sometimes used in combination with antibiotics to treat Helicobacter pylori infections, which can lead to peptic ulcers. |

The use of Nexpro Fast 20mg (esomeprazole) can provide several benefits for individuals with conditions related to excessive stomach acid production. Some of the key benefits include: Reduction of Acid-related Symptoms: Nexpro Fast 20mg helps reduce the production of stomach acid, which can provide relief from symptoms such as heartburn, regurgitation, chest discomfort, and stomach pain. By decreasing the acidity in the stomach, it helps alleviate the discomfort associated with conditions like gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) and gastritis. Healing of Ulcers: Nexpro Fast 20mg promotes the healing of peptic ulcers, which are open sores that develop on the lining of the stomach or the upper part of the small intestine. By reducing stomach acid production, it creates an environment that allows the ulcers to heal and prevents their recurrence. Prevention of Complications: By effectively managing excessive stomach acid production, Nexpro Fast 20mg helps prevent complications associated with conditions like GERD and peptic ulcers. It reduces the risk of esophageal damage, bleeding from ulcers, and other complications that can arise from untreated or poorly controlled acid-related conditions. Improved Quality of Life: By relieving symptoms such as heartburn, chest discomfort, and stomach pain, Nexpro Fast 20mg can improve the overall quality of life for individuals with acid-related conditions. It helps individuals to eat and sleep more comfortably and reduces the impact of these symptoms on daily activities. Long-Term Management: For individuals with chronic conditions like GERD or Zollinger-Ellison Syndrome, Nexpro Fast 20mg provides long-term management by controlling excessive stomach acid production. It can help individuals maintain symptom relief and prevent the recurrence of ulcers or complications. Nexpro Fast 20mg (esomeprazole) may cause side effects in some individuals. The dosage will depend on your specific condition and the severity of your symptoms. Do not change the dosage or duration of treatment without consulting your healthcare provider. Timing: Nexpro Fast 20mg is usually taken once daily, preferably in the morning. It is commonly recommended to take it at least one hour before a meal for optimal absorption. Nexpro Fast 20mg contains the active ingredient esomeprazole, which belongs to a class of medications called proton pump inhibitors (PPIs). It works by reducing the production of stomach acid. Stomach acid is produced by specialized cells in the stomach lining called parietal cells. These cells release acid into the stomach to help with the digestion of food. However, in certain conditions such as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), peptic ulcers, or gastritis, there can be an excess production of stomach acid, leading to symptoms and complications. Esomeprazole works by selectively inhibiting the enzyme called H+/K+ ATPase, which is responsible for the final step of acid production in parietal cells. By inhibiting this enzyme, esomeprazole reduces the secretion of acid into the stomach, resulting in a decrease in the overall acidity. By lowering stomach acid levels, Nexpro Fast 20mg provides relief from symptoms associated with excessive acid production. It helps alleviate symptoms like heartburn, regurgitation, stomach pain, and promotes the healing of ulcers. It's important to note that Nexpro Fast 20mg is not for immediate relief of symptoms. It is a maintenance medication that needs to be taken regularly as prescribed by your healthcare provider to effectively control acid production and manage your condition. If you have further questions about how Nexpro Fast 20mg works or its specific mechanism of action, it is recommended to consult your healthcare provider or pharmacist for more detailed information. If you forget to take a dose of Nexpro Fast 20mg, here's what you should do: If you remember within a few hours: Take the missed dose as soon as you remember. If it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. If it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose: Skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Taking two doses too close together can increase the risk of side effects. Pregnancy and Breastfeeding: If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, discuss the risks and benefits of using Nexpro Fast 20mg with your healthcare provider. They will evaluate the potential risks to you and your baby and provide appropriate guidance.

This includes prescription medications, over-the-counter drugs, and any other substances you are using. Lifestyle Modifications: In addition to taking Nexpro Fast 20mg, your doctor may recommend lifestyle modifications to help manage your condition. This may include dietary changes, weight management, avoiding trigger foods, and adopting healthy eating habits. Allergic Reactions: If you experience signs of an allergic reaction, such as hives, swelling, difficulty breathing, or rash, seek immediate medical attention. Regular Monitoring: Your healthcare provider may monitor your condition and perform periodic tests, such as blood tests, to check for any changes or potential side effects associated with Nexpro Fast 20mg. Bone Health: Long-term use of Nexpro Fast 20mg may be associated with a slightly increased risk of fractures, especially in older adults or those who take high doses for an extended period. Inform your doctor if you have a history of osteoporosis or bone fractures. What is Nexpro Fast 20mg used for?

Promotes Healing: By lowering acid levels, Nexpro Fast 40 supports the healing process of existing peptic ulcers by allowing the damaged stomach lining to recover. It also helps prevent the formation of new ulcers and aids in the prevention of their recurrence. Flatulence: Increased gas production and the sensation of bloating or passing gas may occur. Dry Mouth: A dry or parched feeling in the mouth can be experienced by some individuals. To use Nexpro 40, it is important to follow the instructions provided by your healthcare provider. Here are some general guidelines on how to use Nexpro 40: Dosage: Take Nexpro 40 exactly as prescribed by your doctor. The dosage and duration of treatment will depend on your specific condition. Do not change the dose or stop taking the medication without consulting your healthcare provider. Timing: Nexpro 40 is usually taken once daily. It is recommended to take it in the morning, at least one hour before a meal. Swallow the tablet whole with a glass of water. Do not crush, chew, or break the tablet. Follow Dietary Instructions: It is generally recommended to take Nexpro 40 on an empty stomach for optimal absorption. Avoid taking it with food, especially if the label or your doctor advises taking it before meals. Duration of Treatment: The duration of treatment with Nexpro 40 will be determined by your healthcare provider based on your condition. It is important to continue taking the medication for the prescribed duration, even if your symptoms improve. Do not stop taking Nexpro 40 without consulting your doctor. Other Medications: Inform your healthcare provider about all other medications you are taking, including prescription drugs, over-the-counter medications, and herbal supplements. Some medications may interact with Nexpro 40 and affect its effectiveness or increase the risk of side effects. Regular Check-ups: Your doctor may schedule regular check-ups to monitor your condition and adjust the treatment plan as needed. Follow up with your healthcare provider as recommended. Nexpro 40 contains the active ingredient esomeprazole, which belongs to a class of medications called proton pump inhibitors (PPIs). It works by reducing the production of acid in the stomach. The cells in the lining of the stomach contain tiny structures called proton pumps, which are responsible for producing stomach acid. Esomeprazole works by inhibiting these proton pumps, thus reducing the amount of acid produced. It does this by binding to the proton pumps and blocking the final step of acid secretion. By decreasing stomach acid production, Nexpro 40 helps in the management of conditions such as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), peptic ulcers, and gastritis. Excessive stomach acid can lead to symptoms like heartburn, regurgitation, stomach pain, and inflammation of the stomach lining. By reducing acid levels, Nexpro 40 helps alleviate these symptoms and promotes healing of ulcers. Nexpro 40 provides long-lasting suppression of acid production, with effects lasting up to 24 hours. It is important to note that Nexpro 40 is not intended for immediate relief of heartburn symptoms but rather for long-term management of acid-related conditions. It's important to use Nexpro 40 as directed by your healthcare provider and to follow the recommended dosage and duration of treatment. If you have any questions about how Nexpro 40 works or its specific application to your condition, it is best to consult with your healthcare provider for personalized information and guidance. If you forget to take a dose of Nexpro 40, here are some general guidelines to follow: If it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose: Skip the missed dose and take your next dose as scheduled. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. If you remember within a few hours of the missed dose: Take the missed dose as soon as you remember. However, if it is close to the time for your next scheduled dose, it is generally recommended to skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not take a double dose: Taking a double dose to make up for the missed one can increase the risk of side effects and may not provide any additional benefit. Bone Fracture Risk: Long-term use of Nexpro 40, especially at high doses or for extended periods, may increase the risk of fractures, particularly in the wrist, spine, or hip. Discuss with your doctor about your individual risk factors for fractures and appropriate preventive measures.

Magnesium Levels: Prolonged use of Nexpro 40 may lead to low levels of magnesium in the body. Your doctor may monitor your magnesium levels through periodic blood tests. Inform your doctor if you experience symptoms such as muscle spasms, abnormal heart rhythm, or seizures. Pregnancy and Breastfeeding: Inform your doctor if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. The use of Nexpro 40 during pregnancy or breastfeeding should be determined based on a careful assessment of the risks and benefits. Driving and Operating Machinery: Nexpro 40 is not known to impair the ability to drive or operate machinery. However, individual responses may vary. If you experience dizziness or other adverse effects that may affect your ability to perform such tasks, use caution. Clostridium difficile Infection: Nexpro 40 may increase the risk of developing a bacterial infection called Clostridium difficile-associated diarrhea. Inform your doctor if you experience persistent diarrhea during or after treatment with Nexpro 40. Nexpro 40 is used to reduce the production of stomach acid and is prescribed to treat conditions such as gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), peptic ulcers, gastritis, and Zollinger-Ellison syndrome. It helps relieve symptoms like heartburn, regurgitation, and stomach pain. Nexpro 40 may interact with certain medications, including anticoagulants, antiplatelet drugs, certain antifungal medications, and certain HIV medications, among others. Inform your healthcare provider about all the medications you are taking to ensure there are no potential interactions. It is always best to consult with your doctor or pharmacist before starting any new medication while taking Nexpro 40. Nexpro 40 is usually taken on an empty stomach, at least one hour before a meal. This helps optimize its absorption and effectiveness. However, follow the specific instructions provided by your healthcare provider or the instructions on the medication label. How long does it take for Nexpro 40 to work?
The onset of action of Nexpro 40 can vary depending on the individual and the condition being treated. However, many people experience relief from symptoms within a few days of starting treatment. It is important to continue taking Nexpro 40 as prescribed, even if you start feeling better.

Nexpro 20 is a medication that contains the active ingredient esomeprazole, which belongs to a class of drugs known as proton pump inhibitors (PPIs). It is primarily used to treat conditions related to excessive stomach acid production. Here are some common uses of Nexpro 20: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD): Nexpro 20 is often prescribed to manage the symptoms of GERD, a condition where stomach acid flows back into the esophagus, causing heartburn, regurgitation, and discomfort. It helps reduce the production of stomach acid and provides relief from GERD symptoms. Peptic Ulcers: Nexpro 20 is used to treat peptic ulcers, which are open sores that develop on the lining of the stomach or the upper part of the small intestine. It helps in healing the ulcers and preventing their recurrence by reducing the acid levels in the stomach. Erosive Esophagitis: Erosive esophagitis is a condition characterized by inflammation and damage to the lining of the esophagus due to repeated exposure to stomach acid. Nexpro 20 is effective in reducing the acid production, allowing the esophagus to heal and relieving symptoms such as difficulty swallowing and chest pain. Zollinger-Ellison Syndrome: Nexpro 20 is also used to manage Zollinger-Ellison syndrome, a rare condition where the stomach produces excessive amounts of acid. By inhibiting acid production, Nexpro 20 helps alleviate symptoms such as abdominal pain, acid reflux, and diarrhea associated with this syndrome. Other Acid-Related Conditions: Nexpro 20 may be prescribed to manage other conditions caused by excessive stomach acid, such as gastritis (inflammation of the stomach lining), dyspepsia (indigestion), and acid-related damage caused by non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs). It's important to note that Nexpro 20 should be used as prescribed by your healthcare provider, and the specific dosage and duration of treatment may vary depending on the severity of your condition. Always consult with your doctor for a proper diagnosis and to determine the most suitable treatment plan for your individual needs. Nexpro 20 provides several benefits for individuals who require treatment for conditions related to excessive stomach acid production. Some of the key benefits of Nexpro 20 include: Relief from Heartburn and Acid Reflux: Nexpro 20 helps reduce the production of stomach acid, providing relief from symptoms such as heartburn, acid reflux, and regurgitation. It helps alleviate the discomfort and burning sensation caused by the backward flow of acid into the esophagus. Healing of Peptic Ulcers: Peptic ulcers, which are open sores that develop in the stomach or upper part of the small intestine, can be painful and lead to complications if left untreated. Composition: Chlorpheniramine+ Ammonium Chloride +Sodium Citrate Nepex Ped Syrup is a combination medication used to relieve cough, congestion, and mucus production associated with respiratory conditions. Before taking this syrup, inform your healthcare provider about any existing medical conditions you have and disclose all the medications you are currently taking to avoid potential interactions.           Common side effects: Take the prescribed dosage as instructed by your healthcare provider. The dosage may vary depending on your age, the severity of your symptoms, and other factors. Follow the recommended dosage schedule. Take the syrup orally, either by swallowing it directly or by mixing it with a small amount of water or juice if preferred. Swallow the mixture without chewing. Chlorpheniramine blocks the effects of histamine, reducing symptoms like sneezing, itching, and runny nose. Ammonium Chloride thins and loosens mucus in the airways, making it easier to cough up and relieving congestion. Sodium Citrate reduces the acidity of mucus, soothing the airways and helping to alleviate coughing. Consult your healthcare provider before using this syrup if you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding. Uses: Composition:  Fluticasone Propionate (0.005% w/v)  FLOMIST NASAL SPRAY contains Fluticasone which belongs to the group of medicines called Corticosteroids (glucocorticoids). It is used to treat symptoms of allergic rhinitis such as stuffy, runny, or itchy nose, sneezing, itchy, red, or watery eyes in adults and children above 6 years of age.  Allergic rhinitis may be defined as an inflammatory disease of the nasal mucosa caused due to allergies caused form certain things such as pollen from grass or trees, animals (cats and dogs), house-dust mites, or moulds. Before using FLOMIST NASAL SPRAY tell your doctor if you have severe liver disease, any history of eye conditions such as glaucoma (increase in pressure in the eye) or cataracts (clouding of the lens of the eye), or had nose surgery, or got an infection in your nose.  Treatment of Sneezing and runny nose due to allergies. Common side effects: Use this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Check the label for directions before use. Insert the bottle tip into one nostril and close the other nostril. Direct the spray towards the sides of your nostril, away from the cartilage dividing the two sides of your nose. As you spray, breath gently and keep the head upright. Repeat the same process for the other nostrils. Flomist Nasal Spray is a steroid medicine. It works by blocking the production of certain chemical messengers that make the skin red, swollen and itchy due to skin conditions such as atopic eczema, allergic contact dermatitis, and psoriasis. Do not use FLOMIST NASAL SPRAY if you are allergic to Fluticasone or any of the other ingredients of this medicine. FLOMIST NASAL SPRAY should not be used in pregnant women, unless advised clearly necessary by the doctor. Contact your doctor before using. FLOMIST NASAL SPRAY should not be used in breastfeeding women, unless advised clearly necessary by the doctor. Contact your doctor before using.

Angina: It helps relieve angina symptoms by dilating blood vessels and reducing the heart's oxygen demand. It's typically taken orally once or twice daily, with or without food. Follow your doctor's prescribed dosing instructions. Isosorbide mononitrate is converted into nitric oxide in the body, which then relaxes and widens blood vessels. This dilation improves blood flow and reduces the pressure on the heart. As a result, the heart's oxygen demand is lowered, and angina symptoms are alleviated. Inform your healthcare provider about all medications, including over-the-counter drugs and supplements, that you are taking. Isosorbide Mononitrate can interact with certain medications, including erectile dysfunction drugs. It's generally advisable to limit alcohol consumption while taking Isosorbide Mononitrate. Alcohol can interact with the medication and increase the risk of side effects, including dizziness and low blood pressure. Consult your healthcare provider before taking Isosorbide Mononitrate during pregnancy or while breastfeeding. They will assess the benefits and risks and provide guidance based on your specific situation. Isosorbide Mononitrate tablets should not be crushed, chewed, or split unless advised by your doctor. Altering the tablet's form can affect its intended release mechanism. No, do not abruptly stop taking Isosorbide Mononitrate without consulting your doctor. Suddenly stopping the medication can lead to a rebound increase in angina symptoms. Always follow your doctor's instructions for discontinuation. Isosorbide Mononitrate is not intended for immediate relief of acute angina attacks. It is used for preventive management of angina symptoms over the long term. Nitroglycerin or other fast-acting medications are typically used for acute angina attacks.
Side Effects: -Headache | -Dizziness | -Flushing (redness of the skin) | -Lightheadedness | -Nausea | -Upset stomach |

Uses: Isosorbide Mononitrate is primarily used to treat and prevent angina, a condition characterized by chest pain or discomfort due to reduced blood flow to the heart muscle. Isosorbide Mononitrate is typically taken orally once or twice daily, as prescribed by your doctor. It can be taken with or without food. Isosorbide Mononitrate is converted into nitric oxide in the body, which relaxes blood vessels, improves blood flow, and reduces the heart's oxygen demand. This helps alleviate angina symptoms. If you miss a dose, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it's close to the time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and resume your regular dosing schedule. Do not double up on doses. It's generally advisable to limit alcohol consumption while taking Isosorbide Mononitrate. Alcohol can interact with the medication and increase the risk of side effects, including dizziness and low blood pressure. Consult your healthcare provider before taking Isosorbide Mononitrate during pregnancy or while breastfeeding. They will assess the benefits and risks and provide guidance based on your specific situation. Isosorbide mononitrate should not be taken with medications containing sildenafil , tadalafil , or vardenafil , as their combination can lead to a severe drop in blood pressure. Isosorbide Mononitrate is primarily indicated for angina. It is not typically used for other heart conditions. Consult your doctor for appropriate treatment options based on your specific condition. Isosorbide Mononitrate starts working within a few hours after taking it. Its effects last for several hours, making it suitable for once- or twice-daily dosing. Grapefruit juice can interact with Isosorbide Mononitrate and increase the risk of side effects. It's advisable to avoid consuming grapefruit or grapefruit juice while taking this medication.
Side Effects: -Headache | -Dizziness | -Flushing (redness of the skin) | -Lightheadedness | -Nausea | -Upset stomach |

Uses: Isotrate 20 Tablet is used to prevent heart-related chest pain (angina). It works by relaxing and widening blood vessels so blood can flow more easily to the heart. This medicine will not treat an angina attack that has already begun. Isotrate 20 Tablet reduces your risk of getting heart-related chest pain (angina attack). It does not treat an angina attack that has already begun and should not be used for this purpose. It works by relaxing and widening blood vessels in the heart. This makes it easier for blood to flow to the heart, so it gets more oxygen. This medicine thus helps to increase your ability to exercise and go about your daily life more easily and confidently. It should be taken regularly to be effective.  Take this medicine in the dose and duration as advised by your doctor. Swallow it as a whole. Do not chew, crush or break it. Isotrate 20 Tablet may be taken with or without food, but it is better to take it at a fixed time.  Isotrate 20 Tablet is a nitrate. It dilates peripheral arteries and veins. Dilation of the veins promotes peripheral pooling of blood and decreases venous return to the heart, thereby reducing workload of heart. As a result, the heart muscle does not need as much blood and oxygen supply.  If you miss a dose of Isotrate 20 Tablet, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. Consuming alcohol while taking Isotrate 20 Tablet may cause symptoms such as flushing, increased heart beat, nausea, thirst, chest pain and low blood pressure (Disulfiram reaction). Isotrate 20 Tablet may decrease alertness, affect your vision or make you feel sleepy and dizzy. Do not drive if these symptoms occur. Isotrate 20 Tablet may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. No, do not stop taking this medicine without talking to your doctor. Stopping it suddenly may increase your chances of having an anginal attack. If you have any concerns regarding Isotrate 20 Tablet consult your doctor. Taking more than the recommended dose of Isotrate 20 Tablet may cause throbbing headache, reddening of the skin, chills along with sweating, nausea, vomiting, and a fast heartbeat. Seek emergency help and consult your doctor immediately if you take more than the recommended dose of this medicine. No, you should not take sildenafil along with Isotrate 20 Tablet. Both these medicines lower blood pressure and belong to the same class. Taking these two medicines together may cause a severe decrease in blood pressure, fainting, and even a heart attack. Along with this, also avoid taking other medicines belonging to similar classes such as vardenafil and tadalafil.
Side Effects: Treats Angina Pectoris (chest pain) | Treats heart failure | Headache | Flushing (sense of warmth in the face, ears, neck and trunk) | Upper respiratory tract infection | Abdominal pain | Allergic reaction | Chest pain | Diarrhea |

Uses: ISOTRATE 10 TABLET contains Isosorbide Mononitrate which belongs to the group of medicines called Nitrate vasodilators. It is used to treat angina pectoris and heart failure (when your heart cannot pump enough blood around the body). Angina pectoris is a type of chest pain caused when your heart muscle does not get enough blood supply. The pain is severe and crushing and it is characterized by feeling of pressure and suffocation, behind the breastbone.  Take ISOTRATE 10 TABLET as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of ISOTRATE 10 TABLET for you depending on your age, body weight and disease condition. ISOTRATE 10 TABLET helps to relax the blood vessels and muscles of the heart, which causes the space inside the blood vessels to widen. This helps to ease the flow of blood in the blood vessels of the heart and provides relief from the pain associated with blockage of vessels as seen in angina. ISOTRATE 10 TABLET should be used with caution in pregnant women and who are planning for pregnancy unless considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before taking ISOTRATE 10 TABLET. ISOTRATE 10 TABLET should be used with caution in breast-feeding women unless considered clearly necessary. Consult your doctor before taking ISOTRATE 10 TABLET. Avoid consumption of alcohol while taking ISOTRATE 10 TABLET because it might increase the risk of dizziness and fainting due to reduction in blood pressure. Yes, ISOTRATE 10 TABLET should be used with caution in elderly patients. Your doctor may adjust the dose of ISOTRATE 10 TABLET due to increased risk of side effects in elderly individuals. Consult your doctor before taking it. Do not drive or operate any machines if you experience blurred vision, dizziness or light-headedness after standing up or moving suddenly. Consult your doctor before taking this medicine.
Side Effects: Treats Angina Pectoris (chest pain) | Treats heart failure | Headache | Nausea, vomiting | Decreased blood pressure (hypotension) | Drop in blood pressure when standing up or moving suddenly (postural hypotension). accompanied by a fast heartbeat, dizziness or feeling weak |

Uses: Composition: Isosorbide Mononitrate (60mg) IMDUR 60MG TABLET contains Isosorbide Mononitrate which belongs to the group of medicines called Nitrate vasodilators. It is used to treat angina pectoris, which is a type of chest pain caused when your heart muscle does not get enough blood supply. The pain is severe and crushing and it is characterized by feeling of pressure and suffocation, behind breastbone. Your doctor may advise you to follow lifestyle changes such as diet changes (taking foods low in fat, salt or sugar) and do regular mild exercises to achieve better results during treatment with this medicine. IMDUR 60MG TABLET is not recommended for use in patients with heart problems such as constrictive pericarditis, cardiac tamponade, heart attack, aortic stenosis, mitral stenosis, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy, very low blood pressure and close angle glaucoma.  Prevention of Angina (heart-related chest pain) Common side effects: Use it as advised by your doctor or check the label for directions before use. Imdur 60mg Tablet PR is to be taken empty stomach. Imdur 60mg Tablet PR is a nitrate. It reduces the workload of the heart. As a result, the heart muscle does not need as much blood and oxygen supply. Consuming alcohol while taking Imdur 60mg Tablet PR may cause symptoms such as flushing, increased heart beat, nausea, thirst, chest pain and low blood pressure (Disulfiram reaction). Imdur 60mg Tablet PR may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Imdur 60mg Tablet PR is probably safe to use during breastfeeding. Limited human data suggests that the drug does not represent any significant risk to the baby.
Side Effects: Headache | Dizziness | Flushing (sense of warmth in the face, ears, neck and trunk) | Orthostatic hypotension (sudden lowering of blood pressure on standing) |

As a result, the heart muscle does not need as much blood and oxygen supply.
