Uses: lINAMET 1GM tablets are a combination medication used for the management of type 2 diabetes mellitus. This combination tablet contains two active ingredients: Linagliptin and Metformin.

Used to improve blood sugar control in adults with type 2 diabetes The tablets are usually taken orally with meals to reduce the risk of stomach upset associated with Metformin. This medicine stimulates insulin release and reduce glucagon secretion and also decreases liver glucose production and increases insulin sensitivity in peripheral tissues, such as muscles and fat. If you remember that you missed your dose and it is not close to the time of your next scheduled dose, take the missed dose as soon as you remember. If it is almost time for your next scheduled dose, skip the missed dose and continue with your regular dosing schedule. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. LINAMET should be used with caution in individuals with a history of pancreatitis, as it may be associated with an increased risk of this condition. It's generally best to avoid excessive alcohol consumption when taking diabetes medications, including Linagliptin + Metformin, as it can affect blood sugar levels. The combination of Linagliptin and Metformin is associated with a low risk of hypoglycemia when used alone. However, if taken with other medications that can cause hypoglycemia (such as insulin or sulfonylureas), the risk of low blood sugar may increase. There is a potential risk of vitamin B12 deficiency with long-term use of Metformin. Regular monitoring of vitamin B12 levels and supplementation, if necessary, may be advised by your healthcare provider.
Side Effects: -Gastrointestinal disturbances | -Nausea | -Diarrhea | -Stomach upset |

Uses: Lipta M is an antideabetic medicine  that is combination of linsgliptin and metformin used to treat TYPE 2 diabeties in adult patient.

LIPTA M 850mg tablets are prescribed to manage type 2 diabetes mellitus. This combination therapy is used to help lower blood sugar levels in individuals who have not achieved adequate glycemic control with diet, exercise, and metformin monotherapy or for those already on linagliptin and metformin as separate tablets. Common side effects may include headache, gastrointestinal discomfort, and upper respiratory tract infection. Serious side effects are rare but may include lactic acidosis (a rare but potentially life-threatening condition associated with metformin use). If you experience any concerning side effects, seek medical attention promptly. LIPTA M 850mg tablets are taken orally, once or twice daily, with meals.Swallow the tablet whole with a glass of water. Do not crush, break, or chew the tablet unless instructed to do so by your healthcare provider. Linagliptinis a dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitor that increases the levels of incretin hormones, leading to enhanced insulin secretion and reduced glucagon secretion.Metforminworks by reducing hepatic glucose production and improving insulin sensitivity in muscle cells, leading to decreased glucose release by the liver and increased glucose uptake by muscle cells. If you forget to take a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it is close to the time of your next scheduled dose. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. Limit or avoid alcohol consumption while taking this medication, as alcohol can affect blood sugar levels and increase the risk of lactic acidosis (a rare but serious side effect associated with metformin use). Be aware of the signs and symptoms of low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), especially if you are taking other medications that can cause hypoglycemia. Carry a source of sugar (e.g., glucose tablets) with you in case of an emergency. Seek immediate medical attention if you experience symptoms of lactic acidosis, such as muscle pain, difficulty breathing, abdominal discomfort, or dizziness. Lactic acidosis is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition associated with metformin use. LIPTA M 850mg tablets can be used in combination with other antidiabetic medications, as prescribed by your healthcare professional. However, it's essential to inform your healthcare provider about all medications you are taking to avoid potential drug interactions. If you are pregnant, planning to become pregnant, or breastfeeding, consult your healthcare provider before taking this combination medication. They will assess the benefits and risks and determine the appropriate treatment plan for you.

MANAGEMENT OF TYPE II DIABETES -HEADACHE -GASTRO INTESTINAL PROBLEMS -DIZZINESS Take tablets as prescribed after meals with glass of water. Linagliptinis a dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitor that increases the levels of incretin hormones, leading to enhanced insulin secretion and reduced glucagon secretion.Metforminworks by reducing hepatic glucose production and improving insulin sensitivity in muscle cells, leading to decreased glucose release by the liver and increased glucose uptake by muscle cells. If you forget to take a dose, take it as soon as you remember, unless it is close to the time of your next scheduled dose. Do not double the dose to make up for the missed one. Limit or avoid alcohol consumption while taking this medication, as alcohol can affect blood sugar levels and increase the risk of lactic acidosis (a rare but serious side effect associated with metformin use). Be aware of the signs and symptoms of low blood sugar (hypoglycemia), especially if you are taking other medications that can cause hypoglycemia. Carry a source of sugar (e.g., glucose tablets) with you in case of an emergency. Do not stop taking LIPTA M 500mg tablets or change your dosage without consulting your healthcare professional. Stopping the medication abruptly can lead to uncontrolled blood sugar levels. The combination of Linagliptin and Metformin is prescribed for individuals who have not achieved adequate glycemic control with diet, exercise, and metformin monotherapy or for those already on linagliptin and metformin as separate tablets. It is not typically used as a first-line treatment option.

INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET is a combination of Metformin and Linagliptin which belongs to the group of medicines called Antidiabetic agents. It is used to treat Type II diabetes mellitus among adult patients when diet, exercise and treatment with other conventional medicines does not result in adequate sugar control. It is used as an adjunct therapy along with proper diet and exercise to achieve better results. Type II diabetes mellitus is a chronic disease characterized by abnormally high levels of glucose in the blood. It is caused either due to inadequate production of a hormone called insulin (produced by pancreas to metabolize glucose) in the body or due to inadequate sensitivity of body cells to the actions of insulin. Take INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET preferably after meals or as advised by your physician. Swallow the medicine with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET unless your doctor advice you to stop. INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET is an antidiabetic medicine. It contains two medicines namely metformin and Linagliptin. Metformin makes the body more sensitive to insulin (a hormone involved in glucose metabolism). This helps our body cells to utilize more amount of the circulating blood glucose. Additionally, it can stop glucose production by the liver and reduces its absoprtion in the body. Linagliptin controls blood sugar levels by blocking the actions of an enzyme called dipeptidyl peptidase (DPP)-4 that reduces insulin secretion in the body. Collectively, INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET controls blood sugar levels and improve glycemic control in patients with type II diabetes. If you forgot to take a dose of INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET, take it as soon as you remember. However, if it is time for the next dose of INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET, skip the missed dose and take the next one regularly. Do not take a double dose of INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET to compensate the missed ones. It is not known whether the use of INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET could affect the unborn baby. Therefore, it should not be used during pregnancy unless recommended by your doctor. It is not known whether the use of INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET could pass through the breast milk. Therefore, it should be used in breastfeeding only if considered necessary by the physician. You need to take INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET as long as your doctor prescribes you the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration of therapy for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition Before taking INCRET M2.5/500MG TABLET inform your doctor if you have any liver, kidney or heart problems. You must also inform your doctor if you have severe systemic infections or are severely dehydrated due to excessive vomiting or diarrhea recently. Along with the therapy, follow the diet and lifestyle changes advised by your doctor to achieve better results. Consult your doctor before taking INCRET M 2.5/500MG TABLET if you are pregnant or breastfeeding.
Side Effects: Treats Type II diabetes mellitus in adults | Nausea | Diarrhea, stomach pain | Changes in taste (metallic taste) | Increased lipase levels in blood | Inflamed nose or throat, cough | Constipation, loss of appetite | Vomiting | Increased amylase levels in blood | Skin itchiness |

Uses: Composition:  Glimepiride & Metformin GLIMIPREX is a combination of Glimepiride and Metformin which belongs to a group of medicines called Antidiabetic agents. GLIMIPREX is used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus when diet, exercise and the single agent does not result in adequate glycemic control. Type 2 diabetes is a chronic medical condition in which the body does not make enough insulin, or the produced insulin does not work well. Symptoms include excessive urination, excessive thirst, hunger, fatigue, and blurred vision. Glimepiride lowers blood sugar by causing the pancreas to produce more insulin and helps the body use insulin efficiently. Metformin is a biguanide which effectively reduces the total amount of sugar released into the blood by the liver. Along treatment with GLIMIPREX follow regular exercise and diet plan as advised by your doctor to achieve better results. Treats type 2 diabetes mellitus (when diet, exercise and the single agent does not result in adequate glycemic control) Common side effects: Take GLIMIPREX as advised by your physician. Swallow GLIMIPREX with a glass of water. Do not crush or chew the medicine. Your doctor will decide the correct dose and duration for you depending upon your age, body weight and disease condition. Do not stop taking GLIMIPREX without informing your doctor. GLIMIPREX controls blood glucose levels, where glimepiride works by increasing the amount of insulin released by the pancreas in order to lower the blood glucose. Metformin works by lowering glucose production in the liver, delaying glucose absorption from intestine, and increasing the body's sensitivity to insulin. Avoid consumption of alcohol during treatment with GLIMIPREX as it may increase or decrease the blood sugar lowering action of GLIMIPREX and increases the risk of lactic acidosis. Consult your doctor for advice before taking GLIMIPREX. GLIMIPREX should not be taken during pregnancy. Consult your doctor before taking GLIMIPREX if you are planning to become pregnant. GLIMIPREX should not be taken during breastfeeding as it may pass through breast milk. Consult your doctor before taking GLIMIPREX for advice.
Side Effects: Taste disturbance | Nausea | Diarrhea | Vomiting | Stomach pain | Loss of appetite |

Uses: Composition: Glimepiride (1mg) + Metformin (1000mg) GLIMIPREX MF FORTE 1 TABLET is a combination of Glimepiride and Metformin which belongs to a group of medicines called Antidiabetic agents. GLIMIPREX MF FORTE 1 TABLET is used to treat type 2 diabetes mellitus when diet, exercise and the single agent does not result in adequate glycemic control. Type 2 diabetes is a chronic medical condition in which the body does not make enough insulin, or the produced insulin does not work well. Symptoms include excessive urination, excessive thirst, hunger, fatigue and blurred vision. Before taking GLIMIPREX MF FORTE 1 TABLET inform your doctor if you have type 1 diabetes mellitus, diabetic ketoacidosis, severe liver or kidney disease, acute heart problems. Inform your doctor if you are pregnant or breastfeeding. It is not suitable for use in children and adolescents under 18 years of age. Avoid consumption of alcohol during treatment with GLIMIPREX MF FORTE 1 TABLET as it may increase or decrease the blood sugar lowering action of GLIMIPREX MF FORTE 1 TABLET and increases the risk of lactic acidosis. Treatment of Type 2 diabetes mellitus Common side effects: Use it as advised by your doctor or check the label for directions before use. Glimiprex MF Forte 1 Tablet PR is to be taken with food. Glimiprex MF Forte 1 Tablet PR is a combination of two antidiabetic medicines: Glimepiride and Metformin.Glimepiride is a sulfonylurea which works by increasing the amount of insulin released by the pancreas in order to lower the blood glucose. Metformin is a biguanide which works by lowering glucose production in the liver, delaying glucose absorption from intestines and increasing the body's sensitivity to insulin. If you miss a dose of Glimiprex MF Forte 1 Tablet PR, take it as soon as possible. However, if it is almost time for your next dose, skip the missed dose and go back to your regular schedule. Do not double the dose. It is unsafe to consume alcohol with Glimiprex MF Forte 1 Tablet PR. Glimiprex MF Forte 1 Tablet PR may be unsafe to use during pregnancy. Although there are limited studies in humans, animal studies have shown harmful effects on the developing baby. Your doctor will weigh the benefits and any potential risks before prescribing it to you. Please consult your doctor. Glimiprex MF Forte 1 Tablet PR is unsafe to use during breastfeeding. Data suggests that the drug may cause toxicity to the baby.
Side Effects: Hypoglycemia (low blood glucose level) | Headache | Nausea | Diarrhea | Flatulence |
